loans.name: Pon

texts.en: Mrs. Pon P. makes a living by raising pigs in a pigpen behind her house. She raises them both for their offspring and for slaughter. Mrs. Pon P. has raised a lot of piglets, which she sells to buyers four months after she begins raising them. Mrs. Pon P. is married to Mr. Phor Lorm, a 39-year-old construction worker. The couple is blessed with six children, none of whom are married. In order to earn extra profit and to improve her standard of living, Mrs. Pon P. will use the loan to buy more pigs to sell. She will also use a portion of the funds to make a cage for feeding the pigs.

loans.use: To buy more pigs to sell and to make a cage for feeding pigs

loans.name: Marichu

texts.en:
Marichu L. is from the town of Trinidad. She is 22 years old. Marichu owns and operates a general store, selling a variety of different products in the local community. Marichu is also an AVON dealer. She started selling to her friends and is now expanding her customer base.

Marichu joined CEVI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Marichu is requesting a new loan of 4,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This will be the first loan taken out by Marichu from CEVI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve it.

loans.use: to purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Nguyễn

texts.en:
H. Nguyễn Thị (20201020016) is a 53 year-old female living in the town of huyện Yên Phong - Bắc Ninh. She is married and has 3 adult children. To making a living, H. owns & operates food stall, selling rice products in the local community. H. has been engaged in this business for over 14 years and earns approximately 3.600.000 VND a month from these activities.

In 2007, H. joined SEDA to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. H. has successfully repaid a previous loan of 6,048,000 VND from SEDA. This previous loan was used to purchase additional inventory & working capital.  H. is now requesting a new loan of 8,288,000 VND which will be used to purchase additional inventory & working capital. This will be the 5th loan taken out by H. from SEDA. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business.

About SEDA:
The mission of SEDA (Center of Small Enterprise Development Assistance) is to provide microfinance services to the low income and disadvantaged people in rural areas of Hanoi and the Northern provinces of Vietnam.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in Vietnamese while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

H. Nguyễn Thị (20201020016) là 53 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy sống ở thành phố huyện Yên Phong - Bắc Ninh.  Cô ấy đã lập gia đình và có 3 trẻ ở độ tuổi trưởng thành.  Để kiếm sống, H. Sở hữu và thực hiện hoạt động kinh doanh.  Công việc kinh doanh hoạt động tại lĩnh vực thực phẩm.  Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là buôn bán quầy thực phẩm.  Trong khi không phải chỉ có các phương thức tạo nên thu nhập, mà nguồn thu nhập chính của công việc kinh doanh chủ yếu từ buôn bán các sản phẩm từ gạo trong cộng đồng địa phương.  H. thực hiện công việc kinh doanh này trong hơn 14 năm.  Từ các hoạt động này, H. kiếm được khoảng 3.600.000 VND một tháng.

Vào 2007, H. đã tham gia SEDA để có thể tiếp cận với các dịch vụ tài chính giúp cải thiện  sinh hoạt và khả năng tham gia vào các hoạt động kinh doanh của cô ấy/ anh ấy.  H. đề nghị khoản vay lần đầu tiên từ SEDA.  Khoản vay trước đây được sử dụng mua thêm hàng hóa tồn kho & vốn lưu động.  Cô ấy hiện đang đề nghị một khoản vay mới là 8.288.000 VND.  Khoản vay hiện tại sẽ được sử dụng để mua thêm hàng hóa tồn kho & vốn lưu động.  Khoản vay sẽ là 5th khoản vay của người vay từ SEDA.  H. dự định sẽ sử dụng nguồn thu nhập bổ sung từ công việc kinh doanh  cải thiện/ mở rộng công việc kinh doanh của người vay.

Về SEDA:
Nhiệm vụ của SEDA (Trung Tâm hỗ Trợ Phát Triển các Doanh Nghiệp Nhỏ) là cung cấp các dịch vụ tài chính vi mô cho những người có thu nhập thấp và kém may mắn trong các vùng nông thôn tại Hà Nội và các tỉnh phía Bắc Việt Nam

*Lưu ý: Để phát huy tối đa hiệu quả & giảm chi phí, khoản vay này đã được thông báo bằng biểu mẫu để có thể được Kiva tự động biên dịch. .  Do việc biên dịch thủ công các danh mục rất tốn kém, nên Kiva đã tạo biểu mẫu này cho phần Field Partner (Trường Đối Tác) cho phép họ tiếp tục thông báo các khoản vay bằng  Vietnamese trong khi cung cấp thông tin có chất lượng & chính xác cho người cho vay Kiva.

loans.use: To purchase additional inventory & working capital.

loans.name: Benjie

texts.en:
Benjie is a farmer from the town of Banga, Agusan Del Sur. He is 27 years old and married. He has a one-year-old child whom he loves very much. Benjie plants and harvests rice crops that he sells at the market. He also owns a sari-sari store that his wife manages. They sell products like coffee, sugar and others. Benjie does his part to provide for his family's needs. 

Benjie joined CEVI to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Benjie has successfully repaid a previous loan from CEVI. Benjie is requesting a new loan of 8,000 PHP, which will be used to buy farm inputs and additional merchandise to sell. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to support his family financially.

loans.use: To buy farm inputs and additional merchandise to sell

loans.name: Maxima

texts.es: La Sra. Máxima vive en la comunidad de junta pirai, del municipio de  el Torno, distante a unos 7 km del centro del pueblo, su actividad es la  crianza de cerdos los cría desde pequeños los alimenta y los vende por peso, también vende crías,  su esposo se dedica a extraer áridos del rio espejos, pertenecen a la asociación de ripieros de la junta pirai, , el destino del crédito es para la compra de alimentos balanceado, para cerdos, hace unos 30 años que se vino a vivir a la zona desde el departamento de Chuquisaca por motivos de trabajo, es una persona muy trabajadora y esta agradecido con la institución por el apoyo brindado.
texts.en:
Máxima lives in Junta Pirai community, in the municipality of El Torno, 7km from the center of town.  Her business activity is raising pigs.  She raises them from a young age, feeds them and then sells them by weight.  She also sells piglets.  Máxima's husband works extracting gravel and stone from the Espejos River.  He belongs to the "Gravel Extractors' Association of Junta Pirai".

Máxima will use her loan to buy balanced feed for her pigs.  She came to live in this area from Chuquisaca department 30 years ago, for work reasons.  She is a very hard-working person and is grateful to the institution for the support they have offered her.

loans.use: To buy balanced feed

loans.name: Di

texts.en: Di M., 32 years old, owns a small shop located in her village where she sells soft drinks, food, candy, and other cooking ingredients. She typically makes around US$ 3 in profit each day to help her family live a proper life. Her husband is a fisherman. She is married with one child who still lives with her. Di M. is running her business smoothly because she has skills in public relations, which she uses with her customers. Currently, she also faces a problem: her house is too old, a few parts are broken, and it is not comfortable for her and her family. To solve an obstacle, Di M. would like to request a loan to be used to buy wood to repair the broken parts of her house.

loans.use: To buy wood to repair the broken parts of her house.

loans.name: Alicia

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal” KANTUS”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Cusco, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Alicia; ella tiene 44 años de edad, separada  y tiene 1 hijo; La socia alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio de compra y venta de frutas y verduras ,la socia compra para luego distribuirlo en la ciudad de Puerto Maldonado ella viaja semanalmente ,la socia viaja para las ferias del sadado y domingo ,a la vez la socia tiene su puesto en el cementerio de huancaro en Cusco ella vende los días que se encuentra en Cusco , de esta forma la socia saca a su familia adelante.

La socia solicita el préstamo para la compra de más fruta, verdura y flores para sus negocios.

La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
The member is part of the communal bank “KANTUS”. The bank is located in the district of Cusco, which is part of the province of Cusco and the department of Cusco.

The member is Alicia. She is 44 years old, separated and has one child. She alternates her daily activities with her business selling fruits and vegetables. She buys them to later distribute them in the city of Puerto Maldonado. She travels weekly. She travels for the Saturday and Sunday markets. She also has her stand in the Huancaro cementary in Cusco.  She sells on the days she is in Cusco. This is how she gets her family ahead.

She is requesting the loan to buy more fruit, vegetables and flowers for her business.

She is happy for the loan and commits to making her payments.

loans.use: to buy more fruit, vegetables and flowers for her businesses

loans.name: Rocio

texts.es: Rocío es una joven de 19 años que vive al lado de sus padres y sus hermanos en una casa alquilada. Desde hace 2 años decidió emprender su propio negocio de venta de animales (carneros) que realiza en las ferias ganaderas de su localidad, en un inicio recibió el apoyo de sus padres para aprender todo lo referido a este negocio y garantizar la rentabilidad de la misma pero ahora en la actualidad  ya conoce bien y puede caminar sola en este negocio. Cada fin de semana compra carneros al por mayor, para luego venderlas a un mayor precio, y al termino del día logra vender casi todos. Le agrada desarrollar este negocio porque le permite ayudar en la economía de su hogar, a su vez le permite estudiar, es por esta razón que desea incrementar su capital de trabajo. Es su primer crédito que tiene con MFP, esta muy contenta de saber que tiene un apoyo financiero que la ayudara a incrementar sus ingresos, promete ser puntual en sus pagos y agradece  a aquellas personas que serán gestoras del préstamo que solicita ya que le será  muy útil en el progreso de su negocio. Con el crédito que solicita, lo invertirá en la compra de más carneros e incrementar su capital de trabajo.
texts.en:
Rocío is a 19 year old young woman living with her parents and siblings in a rented house. Two years ago she decided to start her own business selling animals (sheep) in the local livestock fairs.  At the beginning her parents helped her learn everything related to this business so that it would be profitable.  Now, she is well versed in it and can continue on her own.  

Every week she buys sheep at wholesale for subsequent resale at retail at a higher price; at the end of the day she’s managed to sell almost all of them.  She enjoys developing this business because it allows her to help her home’s economy as well as continue with her schooling.  Because of this she wants to increase her working capital.

This is her first loan with MFP.  She is very happy to know that she has financial support that will help her increase her income.  She promises to be punctual with her payments and thanks all those people who will fund the loan she’s asking for because it will be very useful for her business’ progress.  She will use the requested loan to buy more sheep and increase her working capital.

loans.use: To buy more sheep.

loans.name: Evalyne

texts.en: Evalyne is a forty two year old divorced woman with three children living in her own house in Kasese Uganda. She has been dealing in secondhand clothes for the last ten years in which she started with a capital of 100,000 shillings and his current working capital is 2,000,000 shillings. Her hardship is high transport costs and her vision is wholesale business and a peaceful home.Evalyne needs the loan to buy second hand clothes for sell.

loans.use: Buying second hand clothes

loans.name: Rosie

texts.en:
Rosie B. is from the village of Hinigdaan, El Salvador City, Misamis Oriental. She is 35 years old. Rosie is married and has 3 infant children. To make a living, Rosie owns and operates a specialized retail store. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from buying and selling tobacco in the local community. In the picture is Rosie and her husband providing motorela or habal-habal services. Rosie has been engaged in her business for over 5 years and earns approximately 5,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2011, Rosie joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Rosie is requesting a new loan of 3,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional tobacco. This loan will be the first loan taken out by Rosie from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional tobacco

loans.name: María Elizabeth

texts.es:
EL Banco Comunal Los Tres Ángeles se reúne cada quince días en el Cantón Montecristi, conocido por su rica cultura pre colonial y por su artesanía, que es reconocida a nivel nacional e internacional. Lugar de los famosos sombreros de paja toquilla.

En este lugar conocimos a la señora María, tiene 21 años de edad, está casada y de esta relación tienen un bebé de 10 meses. Su esposo es maestro en aluminio y vidrio. Este año ella va a empezar a estudiar en un instituto superior para ser licenciada en educación.

Ella tiene una tienda de víveres de consumo en su casa en la cual vende todo tipo de productos como arroz, azúcar, aceites, detergentes, etc. En ella  trabaja todos los días desde las 6h00 hasta las 20h00 y a veces hasta más tarde, además de estos productos también vende productos Avon (artículos de belleza, cosméticos perfumería y accesorios para damas) los mismo que vende en su local y a veces recorre la ciudad. Nos cuenta que lleva tres años con su tienda y que empezó con el primer crédito que recibió de la institución.

Este crédito lo va a emplear en surtir mas su tienda, va a comprar arroz, azúcar, aceite, detergentes, embutidos y otros productos de primera necesidad. Está en el Banco Comunal desde el inicio y le gusta por el hecho de que con su primer crédito puso su negocio.
 
Su meta es algún dia tener su casa propia.
texts.en:
The Banco Comunal Los Tres Ángeles (The Three Agels Communal Bank) meets every fortnight in the Montecristi Canton, a place renowned for its rich pre-colonial culture and for its arts and crafts, celebrated both at national and international level. It is also the homeland of the famous Toquilla straw hats.

This place is where we meet Maria, aged 21, who is married and has a 10-months-old child. Her husband is a craftsman working with aluminum and glass. Later this year, she will start attending classes in an institute to get a diploma in education.

She has set a general store in her house where she sells every kind of product such as rice, sugar, oils, detergents and so on. She works there every day form 6 am to 8 pm, even until later sometimes. On top of the aforementioned products she also ells Avon products (beauty items, cosmetics, perfumes and accessories for women): she sells them in her shop and sometimes she also sells them door to door. She told us she has been running her shop for three years and that she started thanks to the first loan she received from the institution.

She will use the amount of this loan to supply her shop by buying rice, sugar, oil, detergents, sausages and other basic necessities. She has been a member of the Communal Bank since the beginning, and she likes it because thanks to the first loan she was able to open her shop.

She wishes to have a house of her own someday.

loans.use: To buy rice, sugar, oil, detergents and other basic necessities to sell in her shop.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase a greater quantity and variety of fish to smoke and offer for sale

loans.name: Maksuda's Group

texts.en:
Maksuda K., 59, is the leader of this group. She is a widow and resides in the small town of Toktogul on her own. Three of her kids are already grown and live separately. The business story of this lady started in 2005, when she received a loan of 60 000 soms from a local bank and bought 11 head of livestock. That became a turning point in her family budget. 

Gradually she learnt more and more about care of livestock and efficient ways of selling her animals. Soon the profit helped her purchase more head of livestock. Now Maksuda’s herd is one of the largest ones in the neighborhood. A monthly income of 2 000 soms helped her repay the loan successfully. Since she has experience in taking out loans she is sure to repay the loan from Kiva, too. She requests the loan for the purchase of more head of cattle. Her biggest wish is to help her son financially in finishing the construction of his house. 

         --- Where Did This Loan Come From? ---

This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance (MBF), a young, ambitious and socially-focused Microfinance Institution in Kyrgyzstan. 

MBF is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development and upholds the triple bottom line – People (building human capital and taking care of its customers as well as society), Planet (keeping environmentally friendly) and Profit (earning revenue to expand autonomously). MBF is the only Microfinance Institute in Kyrgyzstan that delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about MBF and view a Video presentation about the organization, please visit: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135 
								
If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and microfinance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan – Mol Bulak Finance at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and from the MBF staff.

loans.use: to purchase cattle.

loans.name: Edwin

texts.en:
Edwin is 29 years old and married, with one three year-old child who attends school. He is a farmer from Kitale town in western Kenya. He has been in the farming business for 8 years and employs two farmhands. He sells his produce of milk, maize and chickens at a local market. He depends on the income from his farm for the basic needs of his family.

Edwin has made a loan request of 30,000 Kes through Juhudi Kilimo to expand his poultry farm by purchasing additional stock of chickens and chicken feed. The proceeds from this loan will enable him to build a decent house for his family and improve their living standard. He faces the challenge of poultry diseases, fluctuating market prices for farm produce, and lack of enough feed for his poultry and dairy cows. He hopes to have expanded his farming activities in the next 5 years.

loans.use: to purchase chickens and chicken feed.

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.en: This Kiva borrower is a 23-year-old single man from Lebanon. He lives with his parents and four siblings, some of whom are still attending school. He has worked in a local supermarket since 2009. As is common for Lebanese young men, he is working and pursuing his education at same time. Today, he is requesting to borrow $1,100 from Kiva partner, Ameen s.a.l., to pay his education fees. His only purposes are to help his father to pay his education fees and avoid having financial problems with the campus management. He has lots of future plans in his mind; one of them is to become a manager in a large company where he can earn a good income and live satisfactorily.

loans.use: to pay his education fees.

loans.name: Nusrat's Group

texts.en:
Nusrat is 41 years of age and involved in sewing clothes. She does this work to share the financial burden with her husband. She receives orders from her neighboring clients and earns well after completing the orders.  

Her husband is a professional driver. He drives a taxi and provides transport services to his passengers.  Nusrat is the mother of four children. Her elder two daughters left their education after completing the 8th class. They help their mother in completing the clients' sewing orders on time. 

Nusrat has applied for a loan from Kiva partner Asasah for her husband who wants to repair his taxi. This will help him save his business asset and also enable him to continue providing better quality transport services to his passengers. He has been operating his business for the past 30 years and Nusrat hopes that an investment will help her husband to increase his profits and also improve the condition of his car by repairing it. 

Note: In the photo, the lady with a blue booklet (an Asasah passbook) is Nusrat.

loans.use: To repair a taxi.

loans.name: Maria De Jesus

texts.es: Doña María de Jesús es viuda y tiene una hija de nombre Maria la cual estudia la preparatoria de su localidad llamada Melchor Ocampo, ella tiene un negocio de antojitos mexicanos y vende jugos y licuados, ella vende quesadillas, sopes, pambazos, tacos dorados y vende jugos de naranja, zanahoria, betabel, apio, toronja y licuados de plátano, papaya, fresa, chocolate y mas. Ella tiene con este negocio aproximadamente 25 años ya que muy joven enviudo y tubo que sacar adelante a sus hijos. Doña Jesús esta pidiendo un préstamo a la financiera para la compra de frutas, legumbres, carnes y gas para la elaboración de sus alimentos que vende de lunes a viernes en un local que renta cerca del centro de su localidad. Ella cada 8 días se surte en la central de abastos de la población de Zitacuaro, Doña Jesús dice que el sueño que ella tiene es tener un local propio donde no gaste en renta, ella esta agradecida con la Fundación por el crédito que le están otorgando por que así su negocio crece y da buenas ganancias.
texts.en:
Doña María de Jesús is a widow.  She has a daughter named Maria who attends a high school in their town called Melchor Ocampo.  She has a business selling Mexican snacks, juices and smoothies.  She sells quesadillas, soups, pambazos [Mexican white bread filled with potatoes and chorizo and dipped in guajillo sauce], and fried tacos as well as orange, carrot, beet, celery and grapefruit juice and banana, papaya, strawberry and chocolate smoothies.   She has been running this business for approximately 25 years as she was widowed when she was very young and had to provide for her children.  

Doña Jesús is requesting a loan to purchase fruits, vegetables, meats and gas to prepare her foods.  She sells Monday through Friday in a rented space near the center of town.  Every 8 days she stocks up at the supply center in the town of Zitacuaro.  Doña Jesús says that her dream is to have her own local where she doesn't have to pay rent.  She is grateful to Fundación for the loan that they are giving her because it will help to grow her business and increase her earnings.

loans.use: purchase food supplies to make her traditional snacks, juices and smoothies.

loans.name: Sonia

texts.es:
Sonia  es socia del  Banco Comunal “Medalla Milagrosa”, ubicado en el distrito de Pomata, provincia de Chucuito, departamento de Puno, tiene 30 años de edad, es soltera y no tiene hijos.  Tiene educación secundaria.
Su préstamo anterior, que fue por S/  300.00 nuevo soles, incremento al capital de su negocio de venta de comidas.  Trabaja con Movimiento Manuela Ramos desde hace cinco años.
Con éste nuevo préstamo de  S/ 1000.00 nuevo soles, comprará papa, chuño, habas occa (tubérculo), pescado, queso, etc, para la preparación de sus comidas.
Ella trabaja tres veces a la semana.  En el negocio trabaja sola aunque a veces le ayuda su hermana.
Su sueño es tener un restaurant donde pueda atender a más clientela y generar más ingresos.
Le gusta la puntualidad y la responsabilidad.
texts.en:
Sonia is a member of the “Medalla Milagrosa” communal bank, located in the Pomata district, Chucuito province, and Puno department.  She is 30 years old, single, has no children, and has a junior high school education.

She used the money from her previous loan of 300 PEN to increase her food business’ working capital.  She has been working with the “Movimiento Manuela Ramos” for five years.  She will use the money from this new loan of 1,000 PEN ($375) to buy potatoes, occa beans, fish, cheese, etc. to prepare her dishes.

She works three times a week and works alone, but sometimes her sister helps her.  Her dream is to open a restaurant where she can serve more customers and generate greater income.  She enjoys punctuality and responsibility.

loans.use: to buy ingredients

loans.name: Ali

texts.en: Ali is a 26-year-old Lebanese single man living with his parents and four siblings. He has more than 10 years of experience working as a blacksmith. In 2006, he started to work autonomously sticking with multiple projects. In addition to his private work, he helps his uncle from time to time who also works as a blacksmith. Today, he is requesting to borrow $1,000 from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l. to purchase a cutter machine and additional necessary tools.  He is certain that with the loan help, his business income will increase. In the future, he is hoping to make the needed savings to be able to open his own shop.

loans.use: to purchase a cutting machine and other necessary tools

loans.name: Gai

texts.en:
Gai is a 51-year-old married woman with four children, two sons and two daughters. Her husband is a taxi driver. Gai lives with her family in Ho Chi Minh City. 

Gai supports her family by earning an income raising and selling pigs, frogs, chickens and ducklings. She has done this since 2000. She would like to take out a loan to buy animal feed and more animals to increase the size of her business. She hopes that this will enable her to earn a higher income, improve her family's living conditions, and cover the education costs of her children.

loans.use: to buy animal feed, chickens, ducklings, pigs and frogs for raising and selling

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase an additional computer

loans.name: Jurabek

texts.ru:
Джурабек умный, целеустремленный и добросовестный муж. С детства он хотел иметь свой бизнес и получить от него много прибыли. Более 6 лет он занимается выращиванием сельскохозяйственных культур а также скотоводством. В данном бизнесе помогает ему его жена, и они вместе дружно работает. Он выращивает фрукты и овощи и когда они вырастут, он продает их на местном рынке.  Джурабек мечтает о том, что когда- то он получит большую прибыль от своего бизнеса, и он хочет, построит красивый дом для своей семьи. С этой целью, он работает усердно день за днем. Джурабек хотел бы получит кредит в размере 10600 Сомони для покупки минеральных удобрений и семена.

More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj
texts.en: Jurabek is a smart, goal-oriented and conscientious husband.  He has been wanting to have his own business and make a lot of profit from it since childhood.  He has been involved in growing agricultural crops and in animal husbandry for over 6 years.  His wife helps him in this business, and they work well together.  He grows fruits and vegetables, and sells them at the local market once they are ripened.  Jurabek dreams of getting a large profit from his business and wants to build a beautiful home for his family.  He works very diligently day after day to achieve this goal.  Jurabek wants to obtain a loan in the sum of 10600 Somoni to buy mineral fertilizers and seeds.

loans.use: to buy mineral fertilizers and seeds

loans.name: Chhem

texts.en:
Mrs. Chhem is a 45-year-old married woman who has three children: two of them are married and live independently and another child is single. She is a hardworking woman and provides her family with a good living situation.

Presently she is working as a sewing factory worker in Phnom Penh city where she can earn enough salary for each month. For an upgrade to their standard of living, she needs to request some funds from donors. The purpose of her loan is to purchase a cow. She hopes that this business will help her family gain additional profit.

She is very thankful to all kind lenders that help her family. In the future she is expecting to open a grocery store in front of her house, and to have a comfortable house.

loans.use: to purchase a cow

loans.name: Bathsheba

texts.en: Bathsheba is married with three children, all of whom attend school. For the last one year, she has been managing a greengrocer to support the family. She has employed one person to assist her in her tasks. In the next 5 years, she wants to expand her business. She is requesting a loan of 20,000 Kenya shillings to buy fruits and vegetables to increase her income.

loans.use: To buy fruits and vegetables

loans.name: Julia Mercedes

texts.es: Julia Mercedes tiene 48 es una persona muy luchadora. Ella se dedica a la venta de granos básicos, desde hace más de 10 años que tiene este medio de vida. Este negocio lo inicio en su vivienda, pues con la ayuda de su esposo ya que él trabaja en una empresa y ella ofrece sus productos a estos trabajadores y obtiene el pago cada quincena, que ella misma se encarga de recoger. El motivo del crédito es para la compra de arroz, frijoles, aceite, pinol entre otros.
texts.en:
Julia Mercedes, 48, is a real fighter.  She has been making a living selling basic crops for more than ten years.  She started this business in her home with the help of her husband.  He works in a business and she offers her products to these workers, and picks up the payment for her goods every two weeks. 

The purpose of the loan is to buy rice, beans, oil, "pinol" (toasted corn flour and a drink made from it), and other products.

loans.use: to buy rice, beans, oil, "pinol," and other products.

loans.name: Hoa

texts.en: Hoa is 48 years old and has 3 children who attend school. She is living in Anninh village, a place busy with business activities. Hoa herself is a business women managing a shop that sells fresh fruits. Everyday, she gets 200,000 VND of profit from this activity. Her business developed more when she decided to use loans from SEDA's credit program to improve her shop in 2008 by buying more kinds of fruits from the southern province of Vietnam to sell. Currently, she requires a loan of 9,184,000 VND to buy a motorbike that will be used for fruit deliveries to outer areas.

loans.use: to buy a motorbike for deliveries

loans.name: Salceda

texts.en:
Salceda is 54 years old, married with ten children and lives in the Philippines.
Salceda is a farmer and grows corn to earn a living. She has been doing this for three years. She has requested a loan to purchase farm supplies, like fertilizers and pesticide, and pay for the labor.
Salceda has been a member of PMPC for three years. In the future, Salceda hopes to improve their living conditions.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizers and pesticide

loans.name: Nguyet

texts.en:
Nguyet is 35 years old and married. She lives with her husband and two children in Ho Chi Minh City. Her husband works as a driver for hire. 

Nguyet earns a living running a general store, which she has done for 4 years. Nguyet would like to take out a loan to buy a greater variety and quantity of basic goods, such as snack foods and confectionery, to stock her general store. She hopes this will enable her to better meet the needs of her existing customers and attract additional customers. She also hopes that through the loan her business will generate a higher income and will help her to improve her family's living conditions and enable her to save money for her children's education.

loans.use: To buy a greater variety and quantity of basic goods, such as snack foods and confectionery, to stock her general store.

loans.name: Alasseni

texts.fr:
Monsieur ALASSENI est né en 1974 à KADIOLO. Père de cinq enfants vivant dans une famille traditionnelle à Kaï, préfecture de Kadiolo.
 Il mène cette activité de commercialisation de céréales depuis 4 ans. Son expérience dans ce domaine, lui a valu une bonne réputation et reçoit des commandes de céréales, notamment du maïs. Ainsi pour avoir les ressources nécessaires afin de satisfaire ces clients, il collabore avec l’Institution de Micro Finance Soro Yiriwaso, il ya 5 cycles maintenant, les prêts passés ont été correctement dénoués.  
Ce prêt lui permettra d’acheter 2 tonnes de maïs et 1/2 tonne de mil. Il s’approvisionne dans les villages avoisinants de Kaï. Les céréales sont stockés dans son magasin. Il  les revend au comptant à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes venant de SIKASSO et de BAMAKO. 
Avec ce prêt, il envisage réaliser un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 80 000 FCFA. Ce bénéfice lui permettra de payer les intérêts de son prêt et investir le reste dans son activité.
 Il compte devenir un grossiste de bonne renommé à fin de satisfaire ses nombreux clients qui ne cessent de croitre
texts.en:
Mr. Alasseni was born in 1974 in Kadiolo. He is the father of five children all living in a traditional family in Kai, part of the Kadiolo prefecture.

He has been trading in cereals for four years. His experience in this area has earned him a good reputation and he is getting orders for cereals, especially maize.

To ensure he has the necessary resources to satisfy his clients, he has been working with the Soro Yiriwaso micro-finance institution, where he has already completed five loan cycles, all of which were properly settled.

This loan will enable him to buy two tons of maize and a half-ton of millet. He gets his supplies from villages in the vicinity of Kai. The grain is kept in his storeroom, and then resold for cash to both men and women customers coming from Sikasso and Bamako.

He expects this loan will produce average monthly profits of 80,000 FCFA. The profits will enable him to pay off loan interests and invest the remainder into his business activity.

He intends to become a renowned wholesaler to satisfy an increasing number of customers.

loans.use: Buy cereals

loans.name: Sidi

texts.en: Sidi lives in Malindi, Kenya. She is a married mother of 6 school-going children. She owns a ration stall which has been in operation for two years. Besides this business, Sidi also supplies building blocks to construction sites. She is applying for a loan of 25,000 KES to purchase retail stock such as sugar, flour, cooking oil, etc.. Her main challenge is the lack of working capital to purchase more stock. Sidi would like to diversify to other areas in the future, like selling clothes. She will use the extra income obtained from this loan to meet the family’s basic needs.

loans.use: to purchase retail stock such as sugar, flour, cooking oil

loans.name: Samson

texts.en:
Samson is a 58-year-old man from western Kenya. He is married to Esther and they have 12 children.

Samson operates a cattle-selling business. He has been doing this for the last 16 years and makes a monthly income of KES 16,000. This is his first loan from KADET LTD, and he will use it to buy more goats and sheep to rear and later sell for a profit. He will use the anticipated profits to pay back the KADET loan.

His dream is to become a livestock supplier in his town, as well as to educate his children.

loans.use: To buy more goats and sheep to sell.

loans.name: Bok Jom Group

texts.fr: Le groupe " BOK JAM" est constitué de six femmes habitantes du même quartier.Elles sont toutes mariées et ont des enfants.Elles ont formé leur groupe pour s'appuyer mutuellement dans leurs activités de vente de denrées alimentaires.Elles achètent en gros des sacs de légumes, de produits céréaliers et se les partagent en fonction de la participation de chaque femme.Elles parviennent à générer des bénéfices modestes qui leur permettent de subvenir à leurs besoins et de participer à la prise en charge des dépenses alimentaires et sanitaires de leurs enfants. Le chef de groupe (qui porte des lunettes) est mère de sept enfants dont les trois vont à l'école.Elle a installé une table devant son domicile sur laquelle elle propose à ses clientes des légumes, du mil, de l'arachide et d'autres condiments qui entrent dans la préparation des repas quotidiens. Elle prend en charge avec ses bénéfices, les frais de scolarité de ses enfants et participe chaque jour à la dépense alimentaire. Le groupe, pour améliorer ses revenus , sollicite auprès de l'UIMCEC un pret de 600000f pour acheter des sacs de légumes, de mil, d'arachide et d'autres condiments divers.
texts.en:
The Bok Jam group is made up of six women living in the same neighborhood. They are all married and have children. They formed their group to mutually help each other in their businesses selling food. They buy bags of vegetables and cereal products wholesale and share them with each other based on the participation of each woman. They manage to generate modest profits which allow them to meet their needs and to participate in taking care of the food and health expenses of their children. 

The leader of the group (who is wearing glasses) is mother to seven children of whom three go to school. She setup a table in front of her home from which she sells vegetables, mil [African cereal], ground nuts and other spices that are used in the preparation of daily meals to her customers. With her profits she takes care of her children's school fees and contributes every day to food expenses. 

The group, in order to improve their income, is requesting from the UIMCEC a loan of 600,000f to buy bags of vegetables, mil [African cereal], ground nuts and various other spices.

loans.use: to buy bags of vegetables, mil [African cereal], ground nuts and various other spices.

loans.name: Lillian

texts.en: Lillian is a 28 year old single woman.  She has no children yet. She describes herself as ambitious. She runs a restaurant where she sells tea, food, sodas etc. She has been involved in this business for two years. She has both repeat and new customers. She describes her biggest business challenge as being inadequate funds for improving the business. She will use the KES 20,000 loan to buy flour, baking powder and pay new employees. Her business goal is to expand her restaurant by having many customers within five years.

loans.use: To buy more flour and baking powder, and pay new employees.

loans.name: Karen Melissa

texts.en:
I have been selling candy for five years. This is a family tradition. My grandmother taught me how to make candies and now I sell them to general stores, markets and neighbors who like to eat my chocoate candies. Thanks to my sales, I am able to help my husband with family expenses and the cost of educating our children.

Loan Use: Buy milk, cocoa, sugar, cinnamon

Tengo mi venta de dulces desde hace cinco años, esta es una tradicion familiar, mi abuela me enseño a preparar los dulces y ahora me dedico a venderlos en pulperias, mercaditos y vecinos quienes les gusta comer mis dulces de coco. Gracias a mis ventas puedo ayudar a mi esposo con los gastos de la famiia y el estudio de mis hijos.

loans.use: Compra de leche, coco, canela, azucar.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Joyce would like to buy 8 steers

loans.name: Francisca

texts.en:
Ms Francisca is a 43-year-old native of Monterrey, New Leon, and she has, along with her husband, dedicated herself for 20 years to the daily production and sale of bread. Her bakery business, which also employs her husband and daughter, is the only source of income for her family. It was more than 20 years ago when Francisca recognized the necessity to generate an income to support her children; she decided to start selling bread. She first began production in small quantity. Then, little by little she acquired her gas ovens, which allowed her to increase her production and to convert her business into a supplier of bread to grocery stores. She also produces cakes for children’s parties, fifteenth birthday celebrations, and weddings. With the help of her van she also sells bread on the streets of the community.

Right now she seeks a loan of 1,100 dollars with the aim of buying a higher-capacity mixer, facilitating an increase in production and, hence, growth. She intends to pay back this loan within 3 to 6 months. The family greatly appreciates your support in the growth of this business and the wellbeing of this family.

Translated from Spanish by Marco Alves, Kiva Volunteer.

Doña Francisca es originaria de Monterrey, Nuevo León, tiene 43 años y tiene 20 años de dedicarse junto con su esposo a la elaboración de pan para su venta diaria. Tiene un negocio de panadería que trabaja junto con su esposo y su hija, logrando hacer de este la única fuente de ingresos para la familia. Hace más de 20 años cuando se vio en la necesidad generar ingresos para el sustento de sus hijos, decidió comenzar a vender pan primero en pequeñas cantidades y poco a poco adquirió sus hornos de gas, que le permitieron comenzar a producir más para así convertirse en proveedora de tiendas de abarrotes y elaborar pasteles para fiestas infantiles, XV años y bodas., además, con ayuda de su camioneta también vende pan por las calles de la colonia.

Actualmente necesita un crédito por $ 1,100 dólares con la finalidad de comprar una batidora con más capacidad que le permita tener facilidad de incrementar la producción y así seguir creciendo como lo ha hecho hasta ahora, ella ofrece devolver esta cantidad en un plazo de 3 a 6 meses. Contribuye al crecimiento de este negocio y al bienestar de esta familia, ellos agradecen sinceramente tu apoyo.

loans.use: To purchase cooking implements

loans.name: Heang

texts.en:
Heang is a widow with 3 children. She started silk production  15 years ago. She is currently living with her daughter and son-in-law. Her daughter is also making silk at home.

She is requesting a loan of $1,000 which will be used buy silk materials and one new motorbike.

loans.use: Purchasing silk materials and a motorbike.

loans.name: Ake

texts.en: Married with 8 children, at the age of 40, Ake is a very hardworking woman.  Due to the demand, she has to make enough packets of chips.  Most times, it is an early rise for her, to get things ready and good to go.  She joined SPBD in May 2007 and is quite thankful for the assistance they have given.  She is planning to build a proper place where she could cook and pack her chips.

loans.use: To start up with her chips business

loans.name: Fredy

texts.es:
This is the story of Fredy who, at the young age of 24, has managed to make a path for himself, working the lands he inherited from his parents, with great effort but, above all, with great love, as the lands constitute his patrimony. In spite of being already independent and not having responsibilities towards others, he wishes to increase his production, so that, when he decides to start a family, he’ll be able to offer them financial stability and a cozy place where to share many happy moments. He saves everyday toward this end, and remains a good son to his mother, helping her out financially whenever necessary and providing a little extra money for his younger brothers’ well-being. In this way, Fredy helps his loved ones and works to ensure a promising future for himself. In order for his dreams and wishes to come true, he needs the support of your generous heart. With it, he’ll be able to improve his products and increase his income and savings to then start his family. With your collaboration he’ll be able to crystallize his dreams in a short time.

Translated from Spanish by Leticia Britos, Kiva Volunteer.

Esta es la historia de Fredy, un joven de tan solo 24 años que, a su corta edad, ha podido abrirse paso en la vida trabajando las tierras que le heredaron sus padres, con mucho empeño pero más que nada con mucho cariño, por ser parte de su patrimonio.A pesar de ser ya independiente y de no tener responsabilidades con otras personas, el desea hacer crecer su producción para que, cuando decida conformar su familia, pueda ofrecerles estabilidad económica y un lugar acogedor para compartir muchas alegrías. Es por ello que ahorra diariamente y no deja de ser un buen hijo para con su madre, ayudándola económicamente todas las veces que sea necesario y aportando un dinerito extra para el bienestar de sus hermanos menores. De esta manera, Fredy ayuda a sus seres queridos y trabaja para forjarse un futuro prometedor. Para que sus sueños y anhelos se hagan realidad requiere del apoyo de su generoso corazón. Con él podrá mejorar sus productos e incrementar sus ingresos y ahorros para luego conformar su familia.Con su colaboración podrá cristalizar en poco tiempo sus anhelos.

loans.use: Purchase of seeds to increase production.

loans.name: Mich

texts.en: Mrs. Mich M., 54, is married and lives with her husband (who is pictured because Mrs. Mich M. was unavailable) and five children in Kampong Cham province, Cambodia.  She works with her husband on their rice paddy growing rice crops, earning collectively around $2/day.  Three of her children work at a garment factory, earning together $150/month.  Another one is unemployed and the other is a student.  Mrs. Mich M. hopes to use this loan to purchase a motor-bike for one of her children to operate a motor-taxi business.  With the help of the loan, her family will have another source of income.

loans.use: To purchase a motorcycle for one of her children to operate a motor-taxi.

loans.name: Identity

texts.en:
This entrepreneur is 37 years old and he has 3 children who are studying in school. His wife was injured in a terrorist attack two months ago. He has a small carpentry shop in Kirkuk. He has applied to get $1200 to purchase new wood and raw materials, to paint the shop, and do some advertising in order to increase his income and develop his business.

This entrepreneur is from a volatile region and repayment risk may be higher. Lenders should consider this when making this loan.

To protect his identity, this entrepreneur's name has been modified and his face has been obscured in the photo.

loans.use: Purchase new wood

loans.name: Noemi's Group

texts.en:
Victoria, Noemí, and Bertha have been part of the community bank “Universo” for the past 2, 1, and 1 years respectively. In that time they have learned to be responsible and punctual, and to use their loans effectively.

Victoria is 50 years old. She is separated from her husband and has five children. Victoria buys grains in bulk in the town of Huanta and sells them in the markets of Ayacucho.

Noemí is 33 years old and has three children. She has had a tailor shop for six years. Her shop is located on the central street of Ayacucho.

Meanwhile, Bertha is 30 years old and lives with her partner and four children. Berta sells a variety of beverages from a cart in the Nery Garcia market.

Victoria, Noemí, and Bertha need loans of 600, 600, and 400 soles (3 soles = $1), which they will invest in buying corn, beans, fabric, thread, and sugar. A key aspect of the community bank is the interest earning savings account each associate has. Victoria, Noemí, and Bertha plan to use their savings in the case of an emergency, to continue expanding their businesses, and to build a home. Their dreams are to educate their children, open a store, and to buy more sewing machines.

loans.use: Victoria, Noemí, and Berta need loans of 600, 600, and 400 soles (3 soles = $1), which they will invest in buying corn, beans, fabric, thread, and sugar.

loans.name: Rahimjon

texts.en: U. Rahimjon is 48 years old, and he is married and has 5 children. Mr.U. applied to MicroInvest for his first loan in 2008. He asked for a business development loan that helped him to buy a pedigreed milk cow. Mr. U. has a rather large herd, so he trades in bovine animals and his wife makes yoghurt. Now Mr. U. Rahimjon is requesting a loan of 2100 STJ for 8 months to open a trade outlet for selling fresh meat.

loans.use: To open a trade out for selling fresh meat

loans.name: Teresa

texts.es:
Teresa is the mother of two small children. Due to matters of fate, she ended up staying alone and has brought up her children herself. She was in need of her own income to cover her household’s expenses and some medical expenses for her children. It was then that a friend introduced her to the footwear business and provided her with catalogs. This occurred 4 years ago, and to date she has obtained very good earnings.

Teresa requires capital to purchase footwear and resell it being that she has very loyal customers that continue to buy from her since she started the business. For this reason, she is requesting a loan for US $375, which she will repay in 3 months. With your support, Teresa will be able to offer her children a higher quality of life.

Translated from Spanish by Evelyn Garcia, Kiva Volunteer.

Teresa es madre de 2 niños por circunstancias del destino ella se quedo sola y ha sacado adelante a sus hijos. Ella necesitaba de ingresos propios para poder costear los gastos de su casa y algunos gastos médicos de sus hijos. Fue entonces cuando una amiga la inicio en la venta de zapatos por catalogo proporcionándole libros de calzado, hace ya 4 años, a la fecha ha obteniendo buenos ingresos.

Ella requiere de capital para comprar zapatos y revenderlos ya que tiene clientes muy fieles que le siguen comprando desde que se inicio en este negocio, por esto solicita un crédito por US $375 que pagara en 3 meses.Con tu apoyo Tere podrá darles mejor calidad de vida a sus pequeños.

loans.use: Purchase more footwear to resell.

loans.name: Celso

texts.en:
Despite of being quite old, Celso Martinez (65) has the energy of a young boy and works very hard every day. Celso is married to Lidia Godoy and the couple has four sons, each one of them married living with his own family.

Since 1999, Celso has run his own business. He owns a Despensa (grocery store), where he sells everything from food and drinks to cleaning products for the house. Despensas are considered a very profitable investment in Paraguay, since it is like a tradition to buy things from a Despensa.

The Despensa gave Celso the money to invest in his sons’ education. From his point of view, education is the main tool to reaching prosperity.

Nowadays, Celso’s sons are older and each one of them is on his own way. So Celso works very hard for himself; he loves to feel active and do not want to depend on his son’s income. Celso says that he deserves a good quality of life.

The money provided by KIVA will be used for the purchase of products for Celso’s Despensa. Products include: sugar, oil, rice, pasta, cereals, and flour.

loans.use: Purchase of sugar, flour, oil, rice, pasta, and cereals.

loans.name: Dina

texts.es:
We find Dina in the company of her neighbors, zealously knitting lovely items such as sweaters, chullos (traditional Peruvian hat) and caps. This young 24-year old woman is an expert at this beautiful art. Since she was a child, she demonstrated an affinity for this craft and for this reason she currently counts on numerous orders. She has been able to become independent and dream for her future. However, she has a problem in that she does not have enough raw materials (yarn) to continue her wonderful work. Dina’s wish is to obtain a loan to purchase a greater quantity of raw material.

Translated from Spanish by Mary Lynn, Kiva Volunteer.

Encontramos a Dina en compañía de sus vecinas, tejiendo afanosamente sus hermosas prendas de vestir (chompas, chullos y gorras), esta joven de 24 años de edad es una experta en este bello arte. Desde muy niña demostró tener cualidad para el tejido, es por ello que actualmente cuenta con innumerables solicitudes, que le permitieron independizarse y velar por su futuro, pero tiene un problema no posee suficiente materia prima (lana) para seguir elaborando sus bellos trabajos.El deseo de Dina es obtener un préstamo para adquirir mayor cantidad de materia prima.

loans.use: Increase in capital to acquire a greater quantity of raw material.

loans.name: Ihsan

texts.en: Ihsan is 22 years old and lives in Beirut, where he is well known for his gentleness, empathy and kindness. Everyone who knows him likes him, and the ice cream shop he runs is always full of customers. Like many people his age, Ihsan would love to buy his own car. He intended to apply for a loan to make this possible, but his mother has recently been diagnosed with cancer. This makes it urgent that he come up with the money to pay for her treatment. He has applied for a loan for $1,000, his first from Al Majmoua, to make her treatment possible.

loans.use: To cover the cost of chemotherapy for his mother

loans.name: Juvino

texts.es:
Juvino is a single parent dedicated to carpentry and fine woodworking, he is 63 years old, and has dedicated himself to this activity for a long time. He lives with his two children, his sister Lucero who supports him immensely, even in his job. He feels proud of having a united family that supports each other in everything. Due to his efficient work in door, window, and furniture reconstruction, among others, he is highly solicited. However, he does not have a well equipped workshop and he is always renting some tools, which results costly. This is why now he has promised himself to refurbish and equip his workshop, and for this he is in need of a loan. With your support he will be able to fulfill his purpose.

Translated into English by Patricia Yanez, Kiva Volunteer.

Juvino es un padre de familia soltero dedicado a la carpintería y ebanistería, tiene 63 años, se dedica a esta actividad desde hace mucho tiempo, vive con sus 2 hijos y su hermana Lucero, quien lo apoya mucho, incluso con su trabajo. Él se siente orgulloso de tener una familia unida que confraternizan en todo. Por su eficiente trabajo en la reconstrucción de puertas, ventanas, muebles, entre otros, es muy solicitado. Sin embargo, no cuenta con un taller bien implementado, siempre tiene que estar alquilando algunas herramientas, lo que no le sale a cuenta, es por eso que ahora se prometió implementar y arreglar su taller y para ello estima de un préstamo y con su apoyo podrá realizar su propósito.

loans.use: Workshop refurbishment and purchase of carpentry tools.

loans.name: Carmelo

texts.es:
Carmelo has a small bakery business he runs with his children. He makes traditional bread of the Laja region (a province of The Andes) which has no fat and no yeast. His daughter sells the product to travelers between the city of El Alto and Desaguadero. Carmelo owns his house.

The loan will be used to purchase flour, so he can have a stock that will last him a while. Especially because at the present time there is a shortage of flour en Bolivia.

This is his first loan with Impro. The evaluation completed approves his request.

Translated from Spanish by Libertad Leal, Kiva volunteer.

Carmelo tiene un pequeño horno que atiende junto a sus hijos. Elabora pan tradicional de Laja (provincia Los Andes), el cual no tiene manteca ni levadura. El producto es comercializado por su hija a todos los viajeros entre la Ciudad de El Alto y Desaguadero. Carmelo tiene vivienda propia. El crédito será usado para comprar materia prima (harina) para poder tener un stock que le dure por un determinado tiempo ya que hay escasez en Bolivia. Es su primer crédito con Impro, el trabajo de evaluación realizado nos permite aprobar su solicitud

loans.use: Purchase of raw material ( flour).

loans.name: Mr. Seing He Village Bank Group

texts.en: TH. village bank, located in Trapeang Srang Village in tH. Takeo Province, consists of ten people who each plan to use tH. loan for different purposes. Mr. Sieng H. is tH. village bank president who was elected by its members. H. sells lottery tickets and makes less than $2 a day, a low income to support his family. His wife, Mrs. Mork Srey Touch, owns a small grocery store in tH. local market. Since her business is going well, sH. wants to expand it. So, her husband, Mr. Sieng H., decided to ask for a loan to buy more grocery product for her inventory. Mrs. Sieng H. is 44 years old and tH. mother of five children three of whom are attending tH. local school and two of whom are too young to work or study.

loans.use: To ask for a loan to buy more grocery product for his inventory.

loans.name: Fatma's Group

texts.en:
Fatma has a small business in Zanzibar. She works every day from 7:00 am to 8:00 pm. She is able to earn a monthly profit of approximately $85.

Fatma is looking forward to taking out her first loan through BRAC Tanzania so that she can increase her inventory and expand her business. She will be sharing this loan with her fellow group member, also named Fatma.

loans.use: To buy more inventory to expand her business.

loans.name: Sherifatu

texts.en:
Sherifatu sells wrappers (sarongs). She has been in this business for the past five years. Wrappers are used by Nigerian women to carry babies on the back, and they can also be tied around the waist or tailored in different native styles as skirts and blouses to suit one's taste. Sherifatu carries her wares on her head from place to place and fails to meet the demands of her customer as she can only move around with what she can carry on her head. She needs the loan amount of 70,000 to purchase more sarongs to sell and also pay for the rent of a store. This, she said, would enable her meet the demands of her customers and also help her make more profit.

Sherifatu is 45 years old and married and with three children. She says thank you to all who made this loan possible.

loans.use: To purchase more sarongs and pay for store

loans.name: Maria Del Rosario

texts.es:
En el municipio de Chichigalpa de la ciudad de Chinandega la señora María del Rosario G. se dedica a laborar vendiendo turrones ambulantemente por las calles de su municipio.

Se ha destacado por ser esforzada en su negocio y debido a que es madre soltera y con un hijo que mantener, busca la forma de cómo brindarle las condiciones necesarias para su crecimiento y desarrollo de este hijo. Es importante destacar que la actividad a la que ella se dedica requiere de muchísimo esfuerzo y dedicación y por este motivo ha acudido a Ceprodel para obtener un crédito para la compra del trigo y del dulce para elaborar los deliciosos turrones que comercializa día a día en su sector.
texts.en:
In the municipality of Chichigalpa in the city of Chinandega, Mrs. Maria del Rosario Gomez works selling turrones (a candy traditionally eaten at Christmas) walking through the streets of the town. She stands out for working very hard at her business and does so because she is a single with a son to take care of. She works to offer him the best possible conditions to grow and develop. It is important to highlight that her job requires a lot of effort and dedication which is why she has come to Ceprodel to obtain a loan to purchase wheat and sugar in order to make the delicious candies that she sells everyday in her neighborhood.

Translated from Spanish by Scott Crandall, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of wheat and sugar

loans.name: Mrs. Vanny Arn Village Bank Group

texts.en:
Nine people who live in Kuy Village in Kampong Chhnang Province comprise this village bank loan group. 

Mrs. Vanny A., the village bank president, is a farmer. She grows rice on a two-hectare field to eA. a living. Her husband, Mr. Choeun Rat, is a taxi driver who earns a small income to support the family. Although they work hard, they still cannot provide a better life for their family. 

To improve their living conditions, Mrs. Vanny A. has decided to ask for a loan, which she will use with her savings, to build a new house for the family to live. Mrs. Vanny A. is 27 years old and the mother three children. Two of her children are enrolled in the local school. The youngest is just three years old. 

All the members in this village bank loan are end-of-term loans so they are not required to pay any principal on the loan until the very end of the loan term. End-of-term (EoT) loans are AMK’s main product because it is the most beneficial to Cambodia’s poor. It allows them to repay portions of the principal whenever they are financially able to. Most clients start to make payments many months before the end of the loan term. Almost all of AMK’s clients make their payments on time. AMK has a delinquency rate of only 0.09% and AMK has a default rate of 0% on Kiva.

loans.use: To build a new house for the family

loans.name: Benkadi Group

texts.fr:
Les membres du groupe  Benkadi  de l’association Dèmè sont  au nombre de quatre (04)  et ont en moyenne 39 ans et 4 enfants. Toutes mariées elles vivent dans des grandes familles polygamiques dans le quartier Hamdallaye de la ville de Ségou(quatrième région administrative de la république du Mali). 
Les membres du groupe se sont connus à travers les activités de petit commerce des condiments alimentaires qu’elles mènent au marché château de Ségou.
Dans le but de satisfaire le besoin croissant de la clientèle elles ont décidés d’intégrer le programme crédit de l’institution Soro Yiriwaso depuis maintenant 3 ans. Elles sont à leur 4ème prêt, après avoir correctement remboursé les prêts précédents. 
Ce prêt  sera  utilisé pour acheter, 3 bidons de 20litres d’huile, 1 carton de cubes maggie, 3 cartons de laye, 1 carton de soumbala (condiment préparé à base de noix de néré ou du fruit de soja) et 40kgs de poissons fumés. Elles s’approvisionnent en condiments à Bamako généralement et en poisson fumé au grand marché de Ségou. Elles revendent leurs produits au marché château de Ségou au comptant et à crédit à une clientèle composée majoritairement de femmes. 
Elles réalisent un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 42 900 FCFA qui sera utilisé pour  rembourser le prêt, payer les tontines et le savon. Leur ambition est de  devenir des commerçantes grossistes.
texts.en:
The members of this Benkadi group, belonging to the Dèmè association, are four women who have an average age of 39 and, on average, 4 children. They are all married and live in big polygamous families in the Hamdallaye district of the town of Ségou (fourth administrative region of the Republic of Mali).

The members of this group came to know each other because they are all petty traders selling condiments in the "Château" market of Ségou. With the goal of satisfying the ever-growing needs of their clientele, they decided to join the loan program of the micro-finance institution Soro Yiriwaso 3 years ago. They are on their 4th loan, after having correctly reimbursed the preceding loans.

This loan will be used to buy 3 jerry cans of 20 liters of oil, 1 case of Maggi cubes, 3 cases of garlic, 1 case of "soumbala" (a condiment prepared using "néré" tree seeds or soya) and 40 kg of smoked fish. They generally buy their condiments in Bamako and their smoked fish at the big open-air market of Ségou. They sell their products at the "Château" marketplace in Ségou, for cash or on credit, to a clientele composed mostly of women.

They expect to make an average monthly profit of 42,900 F CFA which will be used to reimburse the loan, make payments to their association's savings program, and buy soap. Their ambition is to become wholesalers.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: purchase of condiments and smoked fish for re-sale

loans.name: Lucio

texts.es:
Lucio  inició el negocio porqué no tuvo oportunidad de estudiar por la situación económica de su familia y como este ha sido un negocio familiar y desde niño conocía el negocio  ya tenía experiencia de vendedor entonces quizo probar suerte en esta actividad.
Comenzó el negocio en Febrero de 1984 por herencia de su abuelo y de su mamá, ya que ellos se dedicaron toda su vida a este negocio y el aprovecho sus conocimientos y experiencia para continuar haciendo lo mismo.  

 Ha progresado mucho ya que cada vez tiene más clientes y  ha podido contratar tres vendedores para que vendan en distintos puntos de la ciudad, además de vender en la calle tiene muchos clientes que le hacen pedidos para adornar sus fiestas infantiles, por lo cual no se arrepiento de haberse dedicado a esta actividad. 

El necesita un prestamo por MXN $12,000 que pagara en 12 catorcenas. 
Con este crédito va a comprar globos, gas, hilo, plástico, etc. Para estar preparado y bien surtido para las fiestas del día del niño que en México se celebra el día 30 de Abril.
texts.en:
Lucio started a business because he did not have the opportunity to study due to his family's economic situation. He has been part of a similar business before. Since he was a child, he has had experience as a salesman, so he wanted to test his luck in this work. He began the business in February 1984 from an inheritance from his grandfather and from his mother. Since they dedicated their entire lives to this business, he took advantage of their relationships and experience to continue doing the same thing. He has progressed a lot since each time he has more customers and he has been able to hire three salesmen who sell in different parts of the city. In addition to selling in the streets, he has many customers who make orders to decorate their children's parties, so he doesn't regret dedicating himself to this activity. He needs a loan of $12,000 MXN that he will repay in 12 installments. With this credit, he is going to buy balloons, gas, thread, plastic, etc. so he will be prepared and well-stocked for Children's Day which is celebrated on April 30 in Mexico.

Translated from Spanish by Josh Wilcox, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase materials

loans.name: Alfredo

texts.en: Alfredo H. makes a living growing rice. He is 46 years old and has two children. He started his business 19 years ago, and is happy because it is going well and allows him to provide for needs of his family. He is applying for this loan to buy more fertliizer for his farm. Alfredo believes that this purchase will allow him to increase the size and quality of his crop, and further increase his income.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer

loans.name: No

texts.en: No S., 61, has been selling fresh fish for more than four years. He usually sells fish that he buys from fisherman. He uses his old motorcycle to transport the fish. He can generate an income of approximately $5 per day to feed his family. He is married to Mrs. Yan, 56, who helps support the family by growing rice. This couple has four children; three are married, and two are employed; one is a construction worker and the other is a mobile phone repairer in Phnom Penh. Recently, Mr. S.'s income has been decreasing, because his old motorcycle has broken frequently. Therefore, he is asking for a loan to add to his saving to buy a new motorcycle, so he can use it to make transportation easier. The family lives in the rural area of Banteay Meanchey Province.

loans.use: To buy a new motorcycle

loans.name: Fasilat

texts.en:
Fasilat is 25 years old and married with three children. She sells engine oil in retail to her customers.

Fasilat hopes for the loan of N100,000 to purchase more engine oil to sell. She says thanks to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more engine oil to sell

loans.name: Mavjuda

texts.ru: Султоназарова Мавжуда- женщина 32 лет. Мать 2-х детей. Мавжуда занимается откорм скота. Мавжуда также занимается переработкой молоко. Ей помогает муж и дети. Она дополнительно каждую неделю в субботу торгует детской и женской одеждой на рынке Аппон Аштского района. На полученный займ хочет купить корм для скота сена и жмых  и купить ещё одного теленка . Мавжуда очень рада с нами сотрудничать и она надеется что сотрудничество принесет свои плоды.
texts.en:
Mavjuda S. is a 32 year old woman. She is the mother of 2 children. Mavjuda fattens livestock. Mavjuda also processes milk. Her husband and her children help her. She also sells children’s and women’s clothing weekly on Saturdays at the market in the Appon Asht region. She would like to use the loan to purchase feed for the livestock, hay and oilcake, and to purchase one more calf. Mavjuda is very happy to work with us and she hopes that our collaboration will bear fruit.

Translated from Russian by Sabina Holzman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Livestock feed and a calf

loans.name: Afia

texts.en:
Afia A. is thirty-eight years of age. She is married and has given birth to two children, one daughter and one son. Both of her children are in the primary school. She lives with her husband and children in a rented apartment in a very busy commercial town called Goaso in the Brong Ahafo Region of Ghana.

Afia is a trader. She sells maize. She buys bags of maize from nearby farming communities and sells in the community market. She supplies maize to the food vendors in her community and also treks to other towns to sell.

Afia has been in business for over twenty years. She wants a loan to buy bags of maize in bulk. She hopes to expand her business and increase her profit margin. It is Afia’s desire to sponsor her children to high levels in school.

loans.use: To buy maize in bulk

loans.name: Dilafruz

texts.ru: Жабборова  Дилафруз- молодая женщина 31 года, вдова, имеет двоих детей.Она одна воспитывает своих  детей и ей  приходится  много работать. Более пяти лет она торгует  на центральном рынке Джаббор-Расуловского района . Она продает метражные ткани разных  видов. В  настоящее  время  её  ткани   среди  покупателей  пользуются  хорошим  спросом,  так  как  она  всегда  привозит  хороший  и  качественный  товар. Дилафруз  нравится  с  нами  работать,  так  как  полученный  кредит  помог  ей  расширить  свой  ассортимент.
texts.en:
Dilafruz J. is a young 31-year-old woman. She is a widow and has two children. Because she is raising her children by herself, Dilafruz has to work a lot. She has been selling various types of fabrics at a market in the Jabbor-Rasulov district for over five years. Currently, her fabrics are in high demand among customers since Dilafruz sells good and quality merchandise. Dilafruz likes to work with us because this loan helps her expand her merchandise assortment.

Translated from Russian by Anna Sorokina-Hailey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of seasonal fabrics

loans.name: Susana

texts.es:
La socia Susana, ella es natural de la provincia de Kosñipata, del distrito de Patria, perteneciente al departamento de Cusco, ubicado a 8 horas de la ciudad, y situado en la entrada al parque natural del Manu.

Nuestra socia alterna sus actividades del hogar con el cultivo de yuca, arroz, coca, plátanos, según la época, ella es conviviente, tiene 33 años y 5 hijos de (14,9, 6,4, 3 meses). Ella solicita el préstamo en razón de que necesita limpiar sus tierras para una nueva cosecha.

Nuestra socia agradece y valora el apoyo brindado mediante este medio y se compromete a cumplir en el pago de su deuda.
texts.en:
Susana is from the province of Kosñipata in the district of Patria, which belongs to the department of Cusco. The province is located 8 hours from the city near the entrance to the Manu National Park.

Susana splits her time between household tasks and the seasonal cultivation of yucca, rice, coca, and bananas. She is 33 years old, lives with her partner, and has 5 children (14, 9, 6, 4 years, and 3 months old). She is asking for a loan because she needs to clear her lands for the next harvest.

Susana is grateful for and values the support given to her by these institutions and is committed to paying off her debt.

Translated from Spanish by Kathleen O'Connell, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy seeds to plant yucca, rice, and coca.

loans.name: Ludmila

texts.en:
Ludmila is married with two grown up children. She owns a retail business and sells various things - dishes, small home products, even car oil! Ludmila has been in this business for thirteen years. Her approach to choosing inventories is simple - if people buy it, I should sell it!

Ludmila would like to borrow 3,050 UAH to increase her assortment. She enjoys her business. It enables her to bring a stable income to her family as well as making her feel independent.

loans.use: To increase her assortment

loans.name: Pauai

texts.en: Pauai T. (0) is a 30-year-old woman living in the town of Malae-Faga. She is married and has two school-aged children. Pauai owns and operates a business raising crops, primarily planting and harvesting taro for sale. She has been engaged in this business for over three years and earns approximately 400 WST a month. In 2008, Pauai joined SPBD to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 750 WST from SPBD. This previous loan was used to purchase general farm supplies and equipment. Pauai is now requesting a new loan of 750 WST which will again be used to purchase general farm supplies and equipment. The loan will be her 2nd from SPBD. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to make improvements to her house. About SPBD: SPBD's mission is to improve the quality of life of people living in poverty in the poor island nations of the South Pacific. SPBD's philosophy of lending is based on a respect for each individual's innate human ingenuity, drive and self-esteem. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase general farm supplies and equipment

loans.name: Shavkat

texts.en:
H. Shavkat is married and has two children. He runs a small business selling coal in the market. His place is located on the main market aisle where there are many customers every day. Shavkat has been in business for over 10 years. Shavkat is a high achiever and a consistent entrepreneur who is very knowledgeable about the market environment. His professional skills and perseverance have helped to ensure rapid growth and success of his business. Shavkat is requesting a loan for 5000 Somoni ($1150 USD) to increase the assortment of his inventory. He is hoping that this loan will help his venture grow and generate extra profits. We believe that Shavkat's ability to identify tasks critical to business success and set up a system for accomplishing them will allow him to continue growing in the sphere of private entrepreneurship. 


More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: Purchasing coal for selling.

loans.name: Silvia

texts.es: La señora Silvia, pertenece al Banco Comunal “Tesoro Escondido”, Distrito de Juanjui, Provincia de Mariscal Cáceres, Departamento de San Martín. Es Casada, tiene 58 años y 05 hijos ya independientes.Silvia, es una mujer trabajadora y luchadora, se siente capaz de seguir a delante y trabajar con muchas ganas y así hacer profesionales a sus hijos, esta muy contenta con el trabajo que realiza, ya que se dedica a la venta de frutas de la Región y fabricación de cajas de madera para el envío de frutas y verduras a otras partes del departamento y del país.
