Nos cuenta que sus ventas le salen muy bien ya que es muy conocida por sus clientes. Lleva 08 años dedicada al negocio y actualmente continúa con el mismo negocio, y esta muy contenta con lo que hace.Con este préstamo de S/ 2,500.00, comprará sacos de naranjas, mandarinas, coconas, limones cidras, taperibas y frutas en diferentes variedades propias de la región y de otras partes del país para dar una mejor atención a sus clientes y así encuentren lo que necesiten. Parte del dinero también lo invertirá comprando madera, clavos y pegamento.Silvia, expresa haber cumplido algunas de sus metas que tiene trazada en su vida. Agradece al Movimiento Manuela Ramos por ayudarla a implementar su negocio y a desarrollarse como Mujer y Empresaria.

loans.use: Comprará frutas, en diferentes variedades.

loans.name: Ruben

texts.en:
Ruben T. is from the village of Mambuaya, Cagayan De Oro City. He is 31 years old. Ruben is married and has 1 infant-aged child. To make a living, Ruben owns & operates a business venture in the retail sector running a sari-sari (variety) retail shop. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from selling both food & daily use products in the local community. Ruben has been engaged in his business for over 15 years and earns approximately 3,500 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Ruben joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Ruben is requesting a loan of 5000 PHP which will be used to purchase new items to expand product offering. This loan will be the 1st loan taken out by Ruben from HSPFI. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand the borrower's business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase new items to expand product offering

location.town: Mambuaya, Cagayan de Oro, Misamis Oriental

loans.name: Fe

texts.en:
Fe B. is from Brgy. Santiago, Iligan City. She is 35 years old and married with four school-age children. To make a living, Fe owns and operates a business selling scrap metal and other used products in the local community. Fe has been engaged in her business for over eight years and earns approximately $75 a month from these activities.

In 2009, Fe joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Fe is requesting a loan of 5000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This will be her first loan from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement the family income. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

location.town: Santiago, Iligan City, Lanao del Norte

loans.name: Esterlita

texts.en:
Esterlita is 51 years old. She is married and has three children.

Fishing is her livelihood. She also manages to engage in seaweed farming to cope with her family’s increasing needs. She applied to CEVI and is now requesting a loan of Php10,000. She will use this loan to purchase nets and other fishing necessities. Hopefully, Esterlita will succeed in her business.

loans.use: To purchase nets and other fishing necessities

loans.name: Kiwamirembe Of Mukono Group

texts.en: M. Margaret is a 52-year-old lady who is married with 5 children aged 34 – 23 years, with only 1 child still at the University level. Margaret also helps to take care of her siblings, some of whom are in school. She is a business lady with a hardware shop in Wantoni and her main biggest challenge is having bad debtors that affect her business cash flow. Margaret is able to make 300,000 UGS as profits, and this is attributed to the good customer care and the available stock due to the use of loans. She has a dream of building rentals and educating her last child and her siblings to the highest level. She needs a loan to restock her hardware shop with more materials.

loans.use: Restocking her retail shop with more goods.

loans.name: Consolacion

texts.en:
Consolacion P. is a 58 year-old married woman with one adult child who is now helping her in their business. Consolacion and her family live in Prk. Pag-asa, Poblacion 2, Sagay City, Negros Occidental. In spite of her advancing years, Consolacion works hard so that she can continue to earn a good living for her family, not only for their immediate needs, but also for when she and her husband are old and no longer able to work for a living. Consolacion also hopes that by sustaining a stable business now, her child will be able to continue with the business in the future.

Consolacion started her RTW (ready-to-wear clothes) business in 1975 to have a stable source of income for their small family. This was her only source of income for many years, then at some point, she had to shift to another business venture because the RTW business was not doing as well. So she invested in a food vending business making specialty rice-cakes called "bibingka", made with rice flour, coconut, and sugar, and cooked on a top-fired oven.  When RTW became in demand again, Consolacion shifted back to her RTW business, selling clothes from a rented stall in the Sagay City Central Market.

In 1999, she again experienced some financial difficulties as some of her capital had to be spent on the tuition fees of her child who was at the time attending college. But her cash flow problem was solved when she joined NWTF-Project Dungganon where she was able to borrow the necessary capital to sustain her business operations, and, as the years passed, has allowed her to expand her product lines with access to bigger loans because of her good credit record. Consolacion earns an average of PHP 30,000 monthly from her RTW business, and she saves a majority of this amount towards her "retirement fund" so that she and her husband will not be a burden to their child in later years.

Consolacion's previous loan of PHP 19,000 was used to buy new stock for their business and she was able to pay that loan as usual without any problems. Now for her 11th loan cycle, she is borrowing the same amount so that she can continue to restock her store with new fashions for her customers.

About NWTF:
In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF) is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means Honorable). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress out of earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed to a member of a community who has earned the respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work.

loans.use: To obtain additional working capital for her RTW (ready-to-wear clothing) business.

loans.name: Hoàng's Group

texts.en:
K. Hoàng Thị (10102090016) is a 34 year-old woman who lives in the town of Đông Anh - Hà nội. K. is the leader of a 4-member loan group sponsored by SEDA. Although each member of the group receives an individual loan, they all are responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults.  The official name of this borrowing group is Xóm Mít (4).

K. is married and has 2 school-aged children.  To make a living, K. works in a manufacturing business that is owned by someone else. The business makes and sells manufactured products to local businesses and community members.  K. has been engaged in this business for over 5 years and earns approximately 2.000.000 VND a month from these activities.

In 2005, K. joined SEDA to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities.  K. has successfully repaid a previous loan of 1.972.000 VND from SEDA. She used her previous loan to purchase machinery to expand the business.  She is now requesting a new loan of 5.014.000 VND to purchase machinery to expand the business. This will be the K.'s 4th loan from SEDA.  K. plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve her family's living conditions.

About the Other Borrowers in the Group:

1.  Nguyễn Thị Khơ (10102090020) is a 50 year-old woman who is requesting a 6.322.000 VND loan to support her livestock business.

2.  Nguyễn Thị S. (10102090018) is a 53 year-old woman who is requesting a 5.886.000 VND loan to support her livestock business.

3.  Nguyễn Thị N. (10102090015) is a 27 year-old woman who is requesting a 6.578.000 VND loan to support her business making & selling food.


About SEDA:

The mission of SEDA (Center of Small Enterprise Development Assistance) is to provide microfinance services to the low income and disadvantaged people in rural areas of Hanoi and the Northern provinces of Vietnam.


*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in Vietnamese while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.


K. Hoàng Thị (10102090016) là 34 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy sống ở thành phố Đông Anh - Hà nội.  K. là trưởng nhóm của nhóm vay gồm có 4 các thành viên.  Mặc dù mỗi thành viên trong nhóm nhận được từng khoản vay cá nhân, nhưng tất cả họ đều chịu trách nhiệm hoàn trả lại khoản vay của các thành viên trong nhóm của mình nếu một người nào đó trễ hạn hay không trả được nợ..  Tên chính thức của nhóm vay này là Xóm Mít (4).


Trong khi không phải chỉ có các phương thức tạo nên thu nhập, mà nguồn thu nhập chính của công việc kinh doanh chủ yếu từ sản xuất & bán các sản phẩm được chế tạo thông thường cho các doanh nghiệp và người dân trong cộng đồng địa phương.  K. thực hiện công việc kinh doanh này trong hơn 5 năm.  Từ các hoạt động này, K. kiếm được khoảng 2.000.000 VND.  Vào 2005, K. đã tham gia SEDA để có thể tiếp cận với các dịch vụ tài chính giúp cải thiện  S. hoạt và khả năng tham gia vào các hoạt động kinh doanh của cô ấy/ anh ấy.  K. đã hoàn trả hết khoản vay trước đây là 1.972.000 VND từ SEDA.  Khoản vay trước đây được sử dụng mua máy móc để mở rộng công việc kinh doanh.  Cô ấy hiện đang đề nghị một khoản vay mới là 5.014.000 VND.


Khoản vay sẽ là 4th khoản vay của người vay từ SEDA.


Về Những Người vay khác trong Nhóm:


1.  Nguyễn Thị Khơ (10102090020) là 50 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 6.322.000 VND.  Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực nông nghiệp.  Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là chăn nuôi gia súc.


2.  Nguyễn Thị S. (10102090018) là 53 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 5.886.000 VND.  Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực nông nghiệp.  Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là chăn nuôi gia súc.


3.  Nguyễn Thị N. (10102090015) là 27 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 6.578.000 VND.  Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực thực phẩm.  Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là sản xuất & buôn bán thức ăn.


Về SEDA:

Nhiệm vụ của SEDA (Trung Tâm hỗ Trợ Phát Triển các Doanh Nghiệp Nhỏ) là cung cấp các dịch vụ tài chính vi mô cho những người có thu nhập thấp và kém may mắn trong các vùng nông thôn tại Hà Nội và các tỉnh phía Bắc Việt Nam


*Lưu ý: Để phát huy tối đa hiệu quả & giảm chi phí, khoản vay này đã được thông báo bằng biểu mẫu để có thể được Kiva tự động biên dịch. .  Do việc biên dịch thủ công các danh mục rất tốn kém, nên Kiva đã tạo biểu mẫu này cho phần Field Partner (Trường Đối Tác) cho phép họ tiếp tục thông báo các khoản vay bằng  Vietnamese trong khi cung cấp thông tin có chất lượng & chính xác cho người cho vay Kiva.  ."

loans.use: To purchase machinery to expand the business

loans.name: Naida

texts.es:
La Sra. Naida C. de 32 años de edad, esta casada con el señor Juan López, tienen 2 maravillosos hijos. 

Doña Naida comenzó con este negocio aproximadamente en el año 2007.  Ellos vendieron una propiedad para adquirir un capital y emprender su propia microempresa , como si fuera poco el señor es funcionario de una entidad muy importante hace ya más de 8 años, ellos ahorraban parte del sueldo del señor para poder habilitar una ferretería, asi fue, y en la actualidad tienen muchos clientes. 

En la ferreteria atiende la señora Naida y al mismo tiempo ella cuida su casa y de esta forma logran economizar sus ingresos sin pagar empleados. La ferreteria necesita de algunas mejoras y complatar las mercaderias que hacen falta para no defraudar a los clientes y por lo mismo solicitaron el credito.
texts.en:
Mrs. Naida C. is 32 years old and is married to Mr. Juan López; they have 2 wonderful children. Mrs. Nadia started this business approximately in 2007. They sold a real state property to obtain capital and start their own small business; not only that, but Mr. López is an employee of an important organization for more than 8 years and they were saving part of his salary to setup a hardware store; they did and they currently have many customers. Naida tends the hardware store while also taking care of her home; this allows her family to save money by not hiring employees. The hardware store needs some improvements, as well as more inventory so as not to disappoint the customers. Naida and her husband are requesting the loan for this purpose.

Translated from Spanish by Carlos Morales, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy merchandise for hardware store

loans.name: Jeanne

texts.fr: L. Jeanne vit à Suru-Léré à Cotonou, capitale économique du Bénin, depuis 6 ans. C’est une veuve, ayant à sa charge cinq enfants, dont quatre sont ses propres enfants. Tous ses enfants sont scolarisés. Jeanne vit seule avec ses enfants à Suru-Léré. Seule Jeanne assure les charges de la famille, grâce au revenu que lui procure son activité. Jeanne n’a fréquenté que l’école primaire. Il y a sept ans environs que Jeanne mène comme activité, la vente de vivres (riz, haricot, farine de maïs). Jeanne vend également des détergents et des savons, ce qui lui permet de multiplier ses sources de revenus. Jeanne vend ses produits au marché d’Avotrou à Cotonou, et s’approvisionne à Dantokpa, marché international du Bénin. C’est une ancienne cliente de ALIDé, ayant déjà obtenu quatre crédits auprès de l’institution, crédits qui ont été bien remboursés. La clientèle de Jeanne s’accroît au jour le jour; mais Jeanne n’arrive pas à la satisfaire parce que les moyens financiers dont elle dispose sont faibles. Jeanne sollicite pour cette raison un cinquième crédit pour renforcer son activité.
texts.en:
L. Jeanne has been living at Suru-Léré in Cotonou, economic capital of Bénin, for six years. She is a widow raising 5 children, of whom 4 are her own children. All the children are enrolled in school. Jeanne lives by herself with her children in Suru-Léré. Jeanne is the only breadwinner for her family, using the income she earns from her business.

Jeanne was only able to go to primary school. She has been working at her business for about 7 years, selling cereals (rice, beans, maize meal). She also sells detergents and soaps, which allows her to add to her earning capacity. She sells these products at the Avotrou market in Cotonou and buys her goods in Dantokpa, the international market of Bénin. She has been a client of ALIDé for a long time, having already received from this institution 4 loans, which she reimbursed correctly. Jeanne's clientele is continually growing, but she is not able to satisfy their needs since she does not have much working capital. For this reason she is requesting a fifth loan to bolster her business.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: purchase of sacks of maize, rice, and beans, and soap for resale

loans.name: Francisco

texts.es:
El Sr. Francisco  vino a la Institución por recomendación de un cliente antiguo, el es una persona joven casado con la Sra. Francisca, con quien tiene dos hijos en edad escolar, quienes se quedan solos al cuidado de la casa y se preparan sus alimentos al volver del colegio.

El Sr. Francisco se dedica al trabajo de mecanico en el día y por la noche se dedica al transporte llevando pasajeros su ruta es por la zona sur ya que petenece al sindicato de trufis 1, junto con su familia viven en la zona de Villa Concepción por Achumani alto, la esposa trabaja todo el día de empleada del hogar por la zona de Achumani, por referencias de vecinos y del cliente que lo recomendo sabemos que es una persona responsable y muy tabajodora.

El destino del credito sera para la refaccion y ampliacion de su vivienda quiere dar mas comodidad a su familia para mejorar asi su calidad de vida.

Uno de sus deseos es poder ver a sus hijos pofesionales y el otro ver su casa terminada.

Esta agradecido con Emprender y Kiva por la confianza brindada en la otorgacion del credito.
texts.en:
Francisco came to the Institution by recommendation from a long time client. He is a young person who is married to Francisca. They have two school-age children. They take care of the house and prepare their food when they get home from school. Francisco works as a mechanic during the day, and at night he transports passengers. His route is in the southern area. He belongs to the Trufis 1 Union. He lives with his family in the Villa Concepción area in Achumani Alto. His wife works all day as a household employee in the Achumani region. The neighbors say that they recommend him as a client because they know that he is a responsible and very hard-working person. The loan is to repair and expand his house. He wants to make his family more comfortable and improve their quality of life. One of is wishes is to be able to see his children become professionals. The other is to see his house completed. He is grateful to Emprender and Kiva for the confidence shown in granting the loan.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Repair his house

loans.name: Vilma

texts.es:
Vilma, de 46 años, vive en su casa propia en compañía de su esposo Javier (53), que es taxista, y con uno de sus 2 hijos; Alexis (9), porque el mayor está casado y vive aparte. 
Desde hace un año se dedica a la venta de ropa y todo tipo de calzado, ella sabe que posee un gran poder de persuasión para convencer a sus habituales clientes –amigas y vecinas- sobre qué tipo de ropa o calzado le queda mejor y esto la llena de satisfacción, ya que obtiene muy buenas ganancias que le alcanzan para ayudar a su esposo en los gastos del hogar. 
Paralelamente, cuida de un anciano y recibe muy buena paga por ello, motivo por el cual está orgullosa de sus labores, pues durante toda su vida ha sido muy trabajadora. Para el futuro tiene planeado instalar una tienda de ropa y calzado en algún centro comercial de su ciudad para tener mayor estabilidad y aumentar sus ventas.

Este es el primer préstamo que tiene con MFP y promete ser puntual en cada una de sus cuotas, ya que está muy agradecida con todas las personas que hacen posible este crédito para que pueda salir adelante. Vilma tiene planeado invertir el dinero que solicita en la compra de mayor cantidad de mercadería en ropa y zapatos, pues tiene muchos pedidos por cumplir.
texts.en:
Vilma is 46 years old and lives in her own home with her husband Javier (age 53), who works as a taxi driver, and one of their two children, Alexis (age 9). The oldest child is married and lives separately from the rest of the immediate family.

For the past year, Vilma has been selling clothing and all types of shoes. She knows that she must utilize her persuasive skills to convince her regular customers (friends and neighbors) about which types of clothes and shoes fit best and keep them satisfied. She earns a good income that allows her to help her husband with the household expenses.

At the same time, Vilma works as an elder care provider and is compensated well for this job. She is very proud of what she has accomplished because she has worked hard all of her life. In the future, she plans to open a store at a shopping center where she sells clothing and shoes. This will provide stability to her business and help increase her sales.

This is her first loan with MFP. Vilma is very grateful to everyone who made it possible for her to receive this loan and promises to make each of her payments on time. She will use the money to purchase a large quantity of clothes and shoes so that she can fulfill her outstanding orders.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase clothing & shoes

loans.name: Annabelle

texts.en:
Annabelle R. is from the village of Poblacion 2, Clarin, Misamis Occidental. She is 32 years old. Annabelle is married and has 2 school-aged children. To make a living, Annabelle owns & operates a general store. The main source of income for the business comes from selling a variety of different products like biscuits, cooking oil, vinegar, sugar, salt, etc., in the local community. Annabelle has been engaged in her business for over 3 years and earns approximately 10,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2007, Annabelle joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Annabelle has successfully repaid a previous loan of 15,000 PHP from GDMPC. Annabelle is requesting a new loan of 10,000 PHP which will be used to invest in expanding the business. This will be the seventh loan taken out by Annabelle from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three unit offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to invest in expanding the business

loans.name: Dinusha

texts.en:
Dinusha is a 22-year-old married woman with two children, aged 4 and one-and-a-half. She lives with her family in the town of Henegama in southern Sri Lanka.

Dinusha helps her husband with his tea cultivation business on a half-acre piece of land that they own. From the income of the tea-cultivating business, Dinusha can pay her family's expenses.

Dinusha and her husband have been running this business for one year and have gained valuable experience from it. They also help out the community by providing local women with employment in picking the tea leaves.

Dinusha is seeking a 30,000 LKR loan from BRAC to help continue growth of her husband’s tea-cultivating business.

Thank you for taking the time to consider supporting this Sri Lankan loan!

loans.use: To buy agricultural materials her husband's tea-cultivation business

loans.name: Wassim

texts.en:
Wassim is a 27-year-old single man living with his family. He has had a men's clothing shop since 2007 and has eight years of experience in this occupation. He profited from his first Kiva loan and he's thankful for its results. He has been very reliable with his repayments to Ameen and has repaid on time the entire loan. 

Today, Wassim is asking for a new loan of 1,200 USD to purchase more merchandise for his business, specifically to increase his selection of new collections and to offer a bigger choice of clothes to his clients for the summer season. And he's certain that with the new loan, his business productivity and his income will increase.

loans.use: To purchase more clothing to sell

loans.name: Miriam

texts.es:
Miriam tiene 31 años, vive en su casa propia al lado de su esposo Walter (29), que es agricultor, y de sus 2 pequeños hijos.

Desde hace 5 años se dedica a la venta de frutas en el mercado mayorista de su ciudad, trabaja todos los días, durante todo el día, ya que se esfuerza por para darle lo mejor a sus hijos. Para la venta de fruta cuenta con la ayuda de su esposo, que durante los descansos de sus faenas agrícolas se da un tiempo para apoyarla. Ella está muy satisfecha con su trabajo, pues le genera buenas ganancias que le permiten ayudar con los gastos del hogar, además puede descansar durante las tardes y atender a sus hijos, sin descuidar las labores del hogar. Para más adelante tiene pensado aumentar su producción para vender en mayor cantidad y espera obtener mayores ganancias.

Este es el quinto préstamo que tiene con MFP y está muy agradecida con todas las personas que hicieron posible el crédito que le permitirá continuar trabajando. A su vez, está muy satisfecha con el trabajo de su banco comunal, ya que todos los integrantes son muy responsables en el pago de sus cuotas. Miriam tiene planeado invertir el dinero solicitado en la compra de mayor cantidad de frutas para seguir vendiendo a sus asiduos clientes.
texts.en:
Miriam, 31, lives in a house that she owns with her husband, Walter, a farmer, 29, and their 2 young children. For 5 years, Miriam has operated a business selling fruit in the city's wholesale market. She works all day, every day, doing all she can to provide a better life for her children. Her husband helps her with the business when he's not busy on the farm. She is very happy with her business because it generates a good income that allows her to contribute to the family expenses and because it allows her time in the afternoon to care for her children and the house. In the future, she would like to increase production so that she can sell more and, in turn, generate a greater income. This is Miriam's fifth MFP loan and she is very grateful to the people who provide the loans that allow her to continue to work. She is also very happy with the work of her community bank because the members are very responsible about repaying their loans. Miriam will use the loan to buy larger quantities of fruit so that she can continue selling to her loyal customers.

Translated from Spanish by Jere Wiseman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy produce for resale.

loans.name: Grace

texts.en: Grace sells drinks in Benin City, Edo state. She hopes to be a major drink distributor in the future. She is a LAPO client. She is 57 years old, married with 6 children. Her husband also works to support their home. She hopes for a loan amount of NGN 50,000 to purchase more drinks to sell. She says thanks to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more drinks to sell

loans.name: Brak

texts.en:
Brak M., 44, is married and lives with four of her children in the Takeo province. She works as a farmer, making US$3 each day, while her husband also does some farming and works as a construction worker, making about US$3 each day as well. The weather conditions have been difficult for farming in Cambodia this past year and inflation has also been out of control. These factors have created a difficult economic year for many Cambodians.

In light of these difficult times, she is asking for a loan of US$1200 to purchase more farmland on which to grow more rice. She sees this new rice field as a good economic investment and will use it to increase her income and improve her standard of living.

loans.use: To purchase farmland for rice growing

loans.name: Señor De Palomo Group

texts.es:
El Banco Comunal Señor D. Palomo, se encuentra ubicado en el departamento D. Huancavelica, su actividad principal es el Comercio.
Bertha es socia y Tesorera del Bancomunal, es casada y tiene 05 hijos, dos varones y 3 mujeres, todos mayores D. edad, quienes están estudiando en L. Universidad. Bertha se dedicaba a L. venta D. pernos en general, pero ahora gracias a que tiene mayor capital, su negocio ha mejorado y ha crecido, dedicándose a L. venta D. repuestos para motocicletas. Como producto D. sus reuniones Bertha a aprendido a ahorrar, ser solidaria y puntual, lo cual le ayuda en su negocio. Bertha requiere D. un préstamo para comprar mercadería, L. cual le generará mayores ingresos y así lograr pronto el sueño que tiene D. poder tener una tienda granD. con muchos repuestos D. motos.
texts.en:
The “Señor D. Palomo” Community Bank is located in the department of Huancavelica. The bank’s major activity is commerce. Bertha is a member and the treasurer of the bank. She is married and has five children, two boys and three girls. They are adults and are studying in the university. Bertha sells general hardware. Now, since she has more capital, she is improving her business. She is now selling motorcycle tires. As a result of the meetings with the community bank, Bertha is learning to save money and to be a punctual group member. These skills help her with her business. Bertha is asking for a loan in order to buy the type of merchandise that will generate the largest earnings. In this way she will reach her dream of having a large store with many types of motorcycle tires.

Translated from Spanish by Esther Levandoski, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: motorcycle tires

loans.name: Josefa Antonia

texts.es:
La señora Josefa Antonia G. R., tiene la edad de 56 años habita con su compañero de vida y su hijo adolecente en el barrio Laureles norte, su esposo le apoya en los gastos y las tareas del hogar, el sustento de la señora  ha sido una pequeña venta de frijoles, cocidos, refrescos y tamales.

Desde hace 3 años ha tenido esta negocio, y en algunos meses del año  ha sentido una disminución en las ventas, fue con la ayuda de su esposo quien le brindo los recursos necesarios, para dar comienzo a la compra de la materia prima de las ventas,  a futuro desean poner una pulpería con la intención de incrementar sus ventas, por ahora solicita un préstamo para la compra de laminas de zinc, con el fin de cambiar el techo de su casa, además de protegerlo de las temporadas de lluvia que en este mes afectan a las familias nicaragüenses por los fuertes chubascos.
texts.en:
Ms. Josefa Antonia G. R., age 56, lives with her husband and teenage son in the Laureles Norte neighborhood. She and her husband both contribute to the household expenses and chores. Josefa's makes her livelihood by running a small store selling beans, stews, beverages, and tamales. Josefa has had her business for 3 years, and in some months of the year has seen a decline in sales. With the help of her husband, she has been able to obtain the necessary resources to start buying the ingredients necessary to make her products. In the future they hope to open a small store in order to increase sales. However, for now Josefa is requesting a loan to purchase zinc sheets to replace the roof of her home. The new roof will protect her family during the months of the rainy season, which affects Nicaraguan families with its heavy downpours.

Translated from Spanish by Julia Kaplan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Materials to replace roof

loans.name: Roy

texts.en:
Roy M. is from the village of Sto. Niño, Tukuran, Zamboanga del Sur. He is 27 years old, married, and has three infant-aged children. To make a living, Roy owns and operates a retail store selling daily use products such as shampoo, soap and toothpaste in the local community. Roy has been engaged in his business for over five years and earns approximately 5,000 PHP per month from these activities.
In 2009, Roy joined Kiva partner, GDMPC, to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. He has successfully repaid a previous loan of 15,000 PHP from GDMPC. This loan was used to purchase additional products to sell. Roy is requesting a new loan of 7,000 PHP, which will also be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be his second from GDMPC. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve his family's general living conditions.

About GDMPC
GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three unit offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

location.town: Sto. Niño, Tukuran, Zamboanga del Sur

loans.name: Joaquin Gabriel

texts.es: El Joven Joaquín es de aquellos jóvenes  que tiene la idea de comprarse todo lo necesario antes de casarse, ya que como el lo dice, después es difícil, el es soltero pero el mas responsable dentro la casa como dijo su madre, quien le recomendó unas tres veces que el sacar crédito es una gran responsabilidad y que hay que cumplir , Joaquín se dedica al transporte como chofer desde hace ya mas de dos años y además se dedica a estudiar mecánica, el dinero del crédito lo utilizara para comprar un refrigerador para su Mama y con  el dinero que le sobre ayudara a su madre ya que ella es de la tercera edad, es muy trabajador y esta muy agradecido con Emprender y Kiva por la confianza brindada en la otorgación del crédito.
texts.en:
Joaquín is a young man who believes in the idea of acquiring everything that is needed before getting married because he claims it will be difficult afterwards. Even though he is single, his mother says he is very responsible around the house. She recommended on three occasions that he apply for a loan since it is a great responsibility that he is capable of completing.

Joaquín has been working in the transportation sector as a chauffeur for more than two years and is also studying to become a mechanic. Some of the money from this loan will be used to buy a refrigerator for his mother, while the rest of it will be set aside to help her since she is elderly. Joaquín is a hard worker and is extremely grateful to Emprender and Kiva for demonstrating their confidence in him by providing this loan.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase a refrigerator for his mother & provide her with financial support

loans.name: Mirriam Joy

texts.en:
Mirriam Joy G. is from the village of Brgy. Paniki, Bagabag, Nueva Vizcaya. She is 24 years old, married and has 1 school-aged child. Mirriam Joy owns & operates a specialized retail store where she sells personal products. She has been engaged in her business for over 5 years and earns approximately 7,000 PHP a month.

In 2007, Mirriam Joy joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 10,000 PHP from ASKI. This previous loan was used to to purchase additional products to sell. She is requesting a new loan of 14,000 PHP which will be used to purchase new items to expand her product offering. This will be the seventh loan taken out by Mirriam Joy from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated to improve the general living conditions of her family. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 29 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fishermen and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase new items to expand her product offering

loans.name: Arasa Poty Group

texts.es:
Para la formación del presente comité inició la señora Salmi Nicanora M. V. –Hugua Rey  GEA.
 Ella contactó con sus vecinas y amigas para formar el comité en la zona.
El comité se denomina ARASA POTY están en el cuarto Ciclo con 14 integrantes, es un grupo que se destaca  en el barrio por ser muy unido, solidario y responsable, las integrantes poseen un gran espíritu emprendedor, ya que están al día con las cuotas y pretenden terminar esta etapa con muy buen cumplimiento D. responsabilidad con la institución.
 Al adquirir el crédito se le abren muchas puertas para el progreso D. sus emprendimientos.

La Sra. Salmi Nicanora posee una pequeña granja en la que cría animales como gallinas, patos, vacas, para venta y producción D. leche. Así también posee cultivos para autoconsumo y consumo D. animales.
Está interesada en incrementar sus ingresos mediante la adquisición D. más animales menores como gallinas para engorD. y posterior venta. 
Igualmente desea adquirir más alimentos balanceados para una mejor producción tanto D. carne como D. leche, la cual es muy bien comercializada y genera buenos ingresos.
texts.en:
The present committee was started by Mrs. Salmi Nicanora M. V. –Hugua Rey GEA. She contacted her neighbors and friends to set up a committee in the area. The committee is called ARASA POTY and they are in their 4th cycle with 14 members. It’s a group that stands out in the neighborhood for being very unified and responsible. The members have a great entrepreneurial spirit since they are up-to-date with their repayments and intend to finish this stage with a good show of responsibility towards the Institution. Being able to access credit opens many doors for the progress of their enterprises. Mrs. Salmi Nicanora has a small farm where she raises chickens, ducks and cows for milk production and sale. She also grows crops both for her own consumption and for animal feed. She is interested in increasing her income buying more small animals like chickens to raise for subsequent sale. Similarly, she wants to acquire more nutritionally balanced feed for better meat and milk production which are good sellers and produce good income.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy nutritionally balanced animal feed.

loans.name: Santa Rosa De Tambo Group

texts.es:
El Banco Comunal Santa de Tambo inicia su segundo ciclo, las socias son del Distrito de Ayavi.
La socia Erika es casada y tiene 2 hijos de 07 y 09 años que estudian, Erika y su esposos se dedican a la producción de lácteos (quesos), Erika dirige una asociación de productores lácteos, que producen diferentes productos como quesos, mantequilla, manjar y yogurt, Erika desea fortalecer mas su asociación, el tiempo que esta en su Banco Comunal aprendió a ahorrar y con el préstamo que obtuvo mejoro su negocio, Erika solicita un préstamo para la compra de leche e implementar sus equipos.
Los sueños de Erika es educar a a sus hijos, fortalecer su asociación y tener una tienda de venta en la ciudad de Ica.
texts.en:
The Santa de Tambo communal bank is beginning its second cycle. The members are from the district of Ayavi. Erika is married and has 2 children, ages 7 and 9, who are still in school. She and her husband produce dairy products (cheeses). She is director of a dairy producers association that produces various products such as cheese, butter, manjar (sweet caramel made from condensed milk, similar to dulce de leche), and yogurt. She wants to strengthen her association. During the time that she has been a member of her communal bank, she has learned to save. With the loan, she improved her business. She is requesting a loan to purchase milk and install her equipment. Erika dreams of educating her children, strengthening her association, and having a retail store in the city of Ica.

Translated from Spanish by Eleanor Francoletti-Putz, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase milk and install her equipment.

loans.name: Zoila Maribel

texts.es: La Sra. Zoila Maribel S. Díaz de 27 años de edad vive junto a su esposo e hijo en el caserio de Aguada de Palos. Se dedica a la venta de abarrotes en su domicilio. Su esposo realiza colectivo en su auto. La Sra. Zoila requiere el crédito para incrementar su negocio. Su sueño segun nos comenta es ampliar su negocio para poder darle a su familia una mejor calidad de vida. Ella está muy agradecida por el apoyo que le podamos brindar a tráves de este financiamiento.
texts.en: Mrs. Zoila Maribel S. Díaz is 27 years old. She lives with her husband and son in the community of Aguada de Palos. She sells groceries from her home. Her husband has a transportation service with his car. Zoila needs the loan to grow her business. Her dream, she tells us, is to expand her business to be able to give her family a better quality of life. She is very grateful for any support that we can give her via this financing.   .

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.en:
This Lebanese Kiva borrower is a 38-year-old married man and the father of two children. He is the main income provider for his family. He has been running his own farm since 2006 and he also sells seeds and fertilizers. This man uses plastic tents to grow his crops. These tents allow him to better monitor product quality as well as grow his crops for more months during the year. He works independently in his business. 

Today, he is requesting a loan of $1,200 from the Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l. to purchase needed supplies and additional tents for his agricultural work. He estimates that the loan will help increase his profits by fifteen percent.

loans.use: To purchase needed supplies and additional tents for agricultural work

loans.name: Mayra Monserrate

texts.es:
En la ciudadela San Cristóbal de la ciudad de Portoviejo se reúne cada quince días el Banco Comunal Damas De Progreso.

En este Lugar encontramos a la señora Mayra ella tiene 29 años de edad, mantiene una relación de unión libre de la cual tiene dos hijos de cuatro y tres años. Su marido es comerciante.

Tiene junto con su esposo un negocio de compra y venta de arroz, su forma de venta es por quintal o por saquillos de 25, 15 y  10 libras lo cual lo hacen en el local que tienen en su casa. Trabajan todos los días desde las 7am hasta las 19h00. El arroz lo compran en una piladora en la provincia del Guayas, nos cuenta que ya llevan 6 años con este negocio y que le ha ido muy bien ya que tienen clientes que todos los meses le compran ya que deja a crédito y cobra por semanas o cada quince días.

Este crédito es para comprar arroz y aumentar su negocio. Está en el Banco Comunal hace ya tres ciclos  y le gusta porque los créditos los dan sin muchos requisitos. Sus sueños son tener una tienda con todo y una distribuidora de arroz al por mayor.
texts.en:
The Damas de Progreso community bank meets in the San Cristóbal neighborhood of Portoviejo every two weeks.

Here we find Mayra who is 29 years old.  She lives with her common-law husband with whom she has two children aged 4 and 3.  Her husband is a merchant.

She and her husband have a business where they buy and sell rice.  They sell their rice by the 100 lb or in 25, 15 and 10 pound sacks.  They carry out their business from the premises which they have in their own home.  They work every day from 7.00am to 7.00pm.  They buy the rice from a rice husking mill in the province of El Guayas.  Mayra tells us that they have been in this business for 6 years and that they have done very well in it since they have customers who buy from them every month because they leave their goods on credit and collect payments every week or every two weeks.

This loan will be used to buy rice and increase their business.  Mayra has been a member of the community bank for three loan cycles and she likes it because the loans are given without too many conditions.  Her dreams are to own a store which stocks everything and a rice wholesalers.

loans.use: To buy rice

loans.name: Stella

texts.en:
Stella N. is 16 years old and lives in the town of Zana in the Kampala West region of Uganda.  She is single and has no children. Stella has a business selling cold drinks, which she has had for 3 years.         

To help expand her business, Stella has requested a loan of 200,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda.  The loan will be used to purchase sodas and beers.  With the help of the loan from BRAC, Stella hopes to generate greater profits and pay school fees.  In the future, Stella hopes to buy a fridge. Stella is a member of BRAC’s Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program, which has helped her prospects for the future by learning music, dance, and drama.

loans.use: sodas, beers

loans.name: Vicente

texts.en:
Vicente E. is from the town of Trinidad. He is 57 years old. Vicente is married and has 6 children. To make a living, Vicente owns & operates a business venture in the agriculture sector raising livestock. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from raising pigs for fattening and sale. Vicente also tills a parcel of land where he plants and harvests rice crops. He harvests the crops to sell and to use for his own family's consumption.

Vicente joined CEVI to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and his ability to engage in business activities. Vicente has successfully repaid a previous loan from CEVI. Vicente is requesting a new loan of 6000 PHP which will be used to purchase piglets and feed. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to pay for his children's school fees.

loans.use: To purchase piglets and feed.

loans.name: Pan

texts.en:
Pan M., age 30, lives in Kompong Chhnang Province. She now makes her living by selling Khmer cake to her neighbors and in other villages. She has a life partner in her husband who is a chicken seller around his community. This couple is blessed with two children; both of them are single and still attending school.

Pan M. currently generates an income of approximately $1 per day by selling Khmer cake. In her family, selling chickens is the main revenue for the household. That is the reason why Pan M. is seeking a loan for her husband to buy extra chickens to sell.

loans.use: To buy extra chickens to sell

loans.name: Rose

texts.en:
Rose K. is 53 years old. She is married and has six grown-up children. Her business is located at a busy market in Kakamega, known as Mudete. Kakamega is the region in Kenya known for production of sugar cane and is known as the sugar belt region.
Rose sells cereals like maize to local people. Besides selling maize, she owns a posho mill for making maize flour, which she then sells to the local people. She has been in this business for eight years now and has one employee. She says that this business is profitable and the only major challenge she has is financial constraints. However, she works very hard to make sure her business does well. She is using her loan of 30,000 KES to buy more cereals to expand her business and meet the demands of her customers. In the future, she hopes to expand her business and become a supplier of cereals in the area. She describes herself as polite and ambitious.

loans.use: To purchase maize for resale

loans.name: Noemi Leticia

texts.es:
La Señora Noemí C. es socia del banco comunal Caritas Alegres, vive en el cantón Paute, este cantón es reconocido por su clima templado y la belleza de sus paisajes, su gente en su mayor parte se dedica a la agricultura siendo su mayor producción la floricultura, también se dedican a la cría de animales.

La Señora Noemí tiene 56 años, es casada y tiene 6 hijos quienes son mayores de edad,  casados e independientes. Su esposo pasa en casa, tienen casa propia la misma que aun están pagando.
 
Doña Noemí se dedica a la venta de verduras y granos, esta actividad la realiza hace 32 años, cuenta con un puesto propio en un mercado de la ciudad, trabaja de domingo a domingo.

Se encuentra en su décimo crédito que realiza en la fundación y el dinero de su crédito lo va a invertir en la compra de más verduras. Su sueño es terminar de pagar todas sus deudas.
texts.en:
Mrs. Noemí C. is a member of the Caritas Alegres (Cheerful Little Faces) communal bank.  She lives in Paute canton which is renowned for its mild climate and beautiful scenery.  Its residents are for the most part farmers the main crops being flowers; they also raise animals.

Noemí is 56 years old, married and has 6 children who are adults, married and independent.  Her husband stays home and they have their own house which they are still paying off.

Noemí sells vegetables and grains.  She has been in this line of work for 32 years.  She has a stand of her own in one of the city’s markets.  She works Sunday to Sunday.

This is the 10th loan she’s negotiated with the Fundación and she intends to use the money from the loan to buy more vegetables.  Her dream is to finish paying off all her debts.

loans.use: To buy vegetables.

loans.name: Sairambi

texts.ru: Тоирова Саирамби проживает в городе Курган-Тюбе. Ей 52 года. Замужем, имеет двоих детей. Муж занимается бизнесом. Сама Саирамби имеет высшее образование, педагог. По профессии проработала более 20 лет. Сейчас она занимается торговлей на рынке. Она в основном продает литературные книжки и тетради. Этим видом деятельности занимается 7 лет. Кредит берет для увеличения товарооборота.
texts.en: Sairambi T. lives in the town of Qurgan-Tube. She is 52 years old. Married, with two children. Her husband is an entrepreneur. Sairambi has a college degree; she is an educator. She has worked in her profession for over 20 years. At present she is a retailer, mostly selling fiction books and exercise books at the marketplace. She has been in this line of business for over seven years. She is taking out a loan in order to increase her sales volume.

loans.use: Increasing sales volume

loans.name: Alexander

texts.es:
El socio pertenece al banco comunal “HATUN RUMIYOC”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Cusco, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.

El socio es el Sr. Alexander; el tiene 28 años de edad y es soltero; El socio alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio de servicio de taxi y también brinda servicio de movilidad escolar, el socio tiene un carro y trabaja desde las 6:00 a.m hasta las 8:00 p.m, por medio de este trabajo quiere salir adelante, el socio quiere mejorar el servicio de taxi y movilidad que brinda al público en general y escolares. El  socio solicita el préstamo para el mantenimiento de su carro.

El socio está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
The member is part of Hatun Rumiyoc Communal Bank which is located in the District of Cusco, Providence of Cusco in the Department of Cusco.

The member is Mr. Alexander, he is 28 years old and single. He alternates his daily activities with his taxi service and also provides transportation for school students. Mr. Alexander has a car, works from 6:00am to 8:00pm and hopes to get ahead through his work. He wishes to improve the service he provides to costumers in general and to the students. He requests the loan for maintenance of his vehicle.

The member is very happy with the loan and commits to pay the correspondent installments.

loans.use: The member requests the loan for maintenance of his vehicle.

loans.name: Grace Mensah Akosua

texts.en:
Grace Mensah Akosua A. sells food in Kokowada near Elmina, Cape Coast. The food she sells includes rice, waakye (a traditional rice dish cooked with beans), and macaroni. 

Married with two children, she supplements what her husband earns as a farmer with her income, which is used to pay for their children’s school fees. She requires a loan to grow her business and earnings. Grace intends to use the loan to purchase more ingredients so that she can prepare more food for sale. She plans to reinvest the profits into her business for further growth.

loans.use: To grow her business and earnings

loans.name: Nuevo Amanecer Group

texts.es:
El contacto para el inicio del presente comité fue la señora Atanasia E. D. R., quien invitó y organizó a sus amigas para formar parte del programa "Comité D. Mujeres Emprendedoras".
La sra. Atanasia E. se dedica a la costura y elaboración D. sombreros D. karanday junto con su esposo, el señor Dionisio R., con quien está casada desD. hace 25 años, tienen dos hijos estudiantes.
La señora Atanasia retiró el crédito para la compra D. sus materiales D. trabajo como por ejemplo telas, hilos, gomas, tijera, Karanday, etc.
texts.en:
The person who started this existing committee is Sra. Atanasia E. D. R.. She invited her friends and organized them to form a group as part of the Committee of Women Entrepreneurs Program.

Sra. Atanasia E. engages in sewing and making hats out of “karanday” (a natural palm fiber) with her husband, Sr. Dionisio R.. They have been married for 25 years and have two children in school. Sra. Atanasia is taking this loan to buy materials for her work such as fabrics, thread, rubber, zippers, palm fiber, and other items.

loans.use: To purchase supplies such as fabrics, thread, rubber, zippers, palm fiber, and other materials.

loans.name: Yasoda

texts.en:
Yasoda N. is 26 years old, married and has one child, aged four. In 2000, she established her tailoring business. Working seven days a week and eight hours a day, she supports her family. She has already received and successfully repaid a loan from Patan BPW and has used it to buy tailoring materials for her business. Yasoda plans to uplift the economic condition of her family. She thanks you for your support.

In the Kathmandu Valley, clothing is made to order. Tailor stalls line the streets where store owners sell material and work their sewing machines. These skilled tailors make school uniforms for children as well as the traditional women's kurta surwal and men's daura surwal. With a Kiva loan, BPW borrowers are able to purchase additional material or sewing machines which will increase production and profitability.

About Patan BPW:

This loan was administered by Kiva's local partner microfinance institution, Patan Business and Professional Women (BPW). Patan BPW became Kiva's first field partner in Nepal in 2007. Patan BPW operates throughout the Kathmandu Valley, offering microcredit and business training programs to low-income women. In addition to providing economic opportunity to their clients, Patan BPW seeks to empower Nepali women within the home and community.

For more information about Patan BPW, visit our partner page and keep an eye out for new loans and borrower updates. Join our lending team: BPW Lending Team.

loans.use: To buy material for her tailoring work

loans.name: Man

texts.en:
Man P., 30, is a village man living in the Reussey Keo commune of Phnom Penh City. He sells a variety of merchandise at the mobile place. He has been running this selling business since 2005, earning an income of around $10 each day to cover the expenses of his family. His wife stays at home, managing the household. He now has four single children; all of them are students in a local school. 

Man P. would like to request a loan to buy more merchandise to sell. With the rest of the fund, he will build a new room in his house.

loans.use: to buy more merchandise to sell, and to build a new room in his house.

loans.name: Virgen De Fátima Group

texts.es:
Este Comité se formó gracias a la señora Reinalda O. O.. Ella está domiciliada en la ciudad de Independencia.
Las integrantes encantadas aceptaron conformar el Comité de Mujeres Rurales nombrando al Comité "Virgen de Fátima".
Las integrantes del comité se dedican en su mayoría al comercio ya sea de mercaderías, venta de chipa (masa típica del Paraguay a base de queso y almidón) o de artesanías. Otras se dedican a la venta de quiniela, y algunas son empleadas domésticas y limpiadoras.
Este grupo es un grupo solidario y muy trabajador, ya que  las señoras constantemente se reúnen y  hacen actividades para ayudarse entre todas en el pago de las cuotas.
Ellas ya han pasado ciclos anteriores por eso manejan este sistema de trabajo, y como se sienten muy unidas para seguir trabajando juntas solicitan otro crédito a Kiva, confiando plenamente en que los inversionistas las ayudarán.
La sra. Ofelia se dedica a la venta de artesanías, es una actividad que heredó de sus padres, ya ellos realizaban ventas de cántaros, jarrones, vasijas y todo tipo de mini-esculturas, y por eso desde joven conocía los trucos de este negocio, las clases de clientes y los posibles lugares de mayor demanda.
Fue así que lo hizo su medio de ganar el sustento para su familia y para ella misma, pero desea poder superar aún la pobreza en la que se encuentran algunos de sus familiares, por eso solicita el crédito para adquirir más artesanías para la reventa y poder ayudarlos de alguna manera en el aspecto económico.
texts.en:
This committee was formed thanks to Reinalda O. O., who lives in the city of Independencia.

These happy ladies were glad to form the committee of rural ladies, called "Virgen de Fátima” committee.

Most of these ladies have their own businesses, whether that be general merchandise, chipa (typical cheese and starch based dough in Paraguay), or crafts.  Others sell lottery, and some work as maids or cleaning women.

This is a united and hard working group and the ladies are constantly getting together and doing things to help each other with loan repayments.  They’ve completed previous cycles, so they manage this system.  Since they feel so united, they have requested another Kiva loan in order to continue working together, proving that lenders are a great help.

Ofelia sells art, something she learned from her parents who used to sell pitchers, vases, other vessels, and small sculptures.  This is why she’s known the basics of this business, the types of customers, and the areas where demand is greatest since she was young.

She has turned this into her means of supporting herself and her family, but she would like to beat the poverty that some of her family finds itself in.  She is asking for this loan to buy more art for resale which will help her financially.

loans.use: to buy art items for resale

loans.name: Maurice

texts.en:
Maurice is 55 years old.  He has been engaged in mixed farming for over 30 years.  He produces and sells tomatoes, onions, maize, eggs and dairy. He has 6 farmhands on his farm.  Maurice is married and has 6 children, all are attending school.

Maurice has requested a loan of 41,600 KES from Juhudi Kilimo to purchase and insure a dairy cow.  He says this acquisition will enable him to take care of his family, including his extended relatives. He hopes to have more than four quality dairy cows in four years time.

Maurice says his farming efforts are often wasted by rampant animal diseases and poor climatic conditions.

loans.use: to buy and insure a dairy cow

loans.name: Efua

texts.en: Efua is single. She cooks banku (corn dough and cassava dough cooked together). She serves the banku with hot pepper sauce, okra stew, and fried fish. Alongside the banku, she also sells provisions at Elmina, near Nkontrodo. Efua is going to use the loan to purchase corn, fish, okra and other items to cook for sale. With the new profits from her expanded business, Efua plans to reinvest back into her business.

loans.use: to purchase corn, fish, okra and other items to cook for sale.

loans.name: Grace

texts.en:
Grace is a 42-year-old widow with five children, three of whom are still younger than 18. This lady has been a fishmonger for the past five years in Malindi. She earns a monthly income of KES 10,000. 

Grace has borrowed Kshs 20,000 from KADET LTD in her first loan cycle. She intends to use the loan to purchase more fish for her business, to put up a wooden structure to serve as her business premises and to plant seedlings on her farm as there is now rain. She wants to use the anticipated profits to continue looking after her family as well as to help grow her business by expanding her supply and diversifying the types of fish she sells.

In the future, Grace hopes to become a well-established fish supplier in the area.

loans.use: To add more stock of fish and use some money to plant on her farm as well

loans.name: Ulfat's Group

texts.en:
Ulfat is 32 years old and a married lady. Her husband operates a grocery store where he sells daily-use household items such as sugar, salt, cooking oil, etc. He is very good in his dealings with the customers and makes good sales every day. He is also a rickshaw driver and provides transport services to his passengers. Ulfat helps him by taking care of his grocery store when he goes away for his driving business. 

She is the mother of five sons: two of them are daily wage laborers while the others stay at home. Ulfat couldn’t educate her children due to financial constraints. She has applied for a loan from Kiva partner Asasah to improve her husband’s grocery store business. With the loan, he will purchase groceries in bulk quantities that will allow him to fill his customer orders and earn better profits. Her husband has been operating this business for the past 10 years and Ulfat is confident that he will successfully be able to improve it after investing the loan in it. 

Note: In the photo, the lady with a book (called Asasah Passbook) is Ulfat.

loans.use: To buy groceries for grocery store business.

loans.name: Flora

texts.en:
This is Flora, 26, resident of Tanza,Cavite City, Philippines. She is married to Aloud. She and her husband manage their own household while operating the business. At this time, she is working hard to save for the future of her child.

Flora operates a variety store. In the Philippines, a variety store is basically a small convenience store, which retails groceries, toiletries and beverages piecemeal to the local neighborhood. It is the place to go to buy one sachet of shampoo, a PHP5-worth of cooking oil, or an egg. Flora earns by getting supplies at wholesale prices and selling by the piece. Her store is located adjacent to her house. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She earns a minimum of PHP 500 in sales every day.

To help her continue operations of her business, she is requesting a PHP 9,000 loan. She will be utilizing the loan to buy groceries, toiletries and beverages to expand her product inventory. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business. 

Flora hopes to be able to expand soon, just as she hopes to save money for the future. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week and where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: to pay for grocery products and inventory items needed in her variety store.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy 5 gallon water jugs, 1 gallon jugs of purified water, 1.5 liter bottles of purified water and 0.5 liter bottles of purified water.

loans.name: Enit

texts.es: Enith D. 65 años vive en Polo nuevo ubicado en la  zona nororiental del Departamento del Atlántico, en la cuenca hidrográfica del Río Magdalena, allí vive con su esposo,  tiene 2 hijos y se dedica a la actividad mercantil. Ella venD. mercancía variada al detalle en un punto comercial ubicado en una vía muy transitada, lo cual potencializa el volumen D. sus ventas.  Enith inició su negocio desD. el año 2006 cuando quedando desempleada y comenzó,  por iniciativa D. su hija que ya tenía como negocio, vender productos mediante guías especializadas, comprando una vitrina surtiéndola D. productos que le abastecía su hija, gradualmente fue construyendo un capital con el cual adicionó calzado ropa femenina y otros productos que pedía su doméstica clientela. En la actualidad venD. D. contado y también a crédito al detalle mediante pedidos D. sus clientes con los cuales planea la forma D. pago. Su meta más adelante es ampliar su negocio hasta convertirlo en un almacén muy reconocido en Polonuevo, por tener todo lo que sus habitantes necesitan y pueden comprar. Con su credikiva, primer financiamiento que hace a la  Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, comprará  artículos D. papelería y productos D. confección D. los cuales hay muy poca competencia en el pueblo y que harán que  su inversión sea exitosa. Su mayor desafío es el insuficiente capital D. trabajo, que gradualmente planea aumentar mediante sus credikiva futuros y su disciplina D. trabajo. Mientras esto ocurre su negocio presenta  liquidez, sus cuentas por cobrar rotan apropiadamente  para este tipo D. negocios y su nivel D. rentabilidad demuestra solvencia para responder a sus gastos.
texts.en: Enith is 65 years old and lives in Polo Nuevo, located in the northeast zone of the Department of the Atlantic, in the geological basin of the Magdalena River. She lives there with her husband and has 2 children. She is in the retail traD.. She sells a variety of merchandise on a retail basis from a sales point located on a highly traveled road, which is good for her sales volume. Enith started her business in 2006 when she became unemployed, and thanks to the initiative of her daughter who already had this kind of business, she began to sell products ordered from specialty catalogs. She bought a display case and stocked it with products provided by her daughter. Gradually she built up some capital, which she used to add shoes, women's clothing and other products in demand among her domestic customers. Currently, she sells retail on a cash basis and also on credit based on orders from her customers, with whom she works out the form of payment. Her goal for the future is to expand her business until it becomes a well-known store in Polo Nuevo, stocked with everything that the local inhabitants need and are able to buy. With her Kiva loan, her first financing with the Mario Santo Domingo Foundation, she will buy paper goods and clothing products, for which there is very little competition in the village, and which will make her investment successful. Her greatest challenge is her insufficient working capital, which she plans to gradually increase through future Kiva loans and her own working discipline. Meanwhile, her business enjoys liquidity, its accounts receivable turn over appropriately for this type of business, and her profitability level provides enough solvency to cover her expenses.

loans.use: to buy paper goods and clothing products to sell.

loans.name: Naomi

texts.en: Naomi sells provisions and polythene bags, amongst other items, in a shop in Abura. She is married and has three children. Her husband is a teacher. The loan will enable Naomi to purchase other types of polythene bags to meet the demands of her customers. She responsibly assists her spouse in paying utility bills. She anticipates saving money toward the university education of her children.

loans.use: to purchase other types of polythene bags to meet the demands of her customers.

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en:
Elizabeth is a 40-year-old married lady with four children. She operates a tailoring business in Watamu town in Malindi. She has been in this business for the past five years and earns a monthly income of KES 15,000, which she uses to take care of her family. 

Elizabeth has been loaned KES 60,000 by Kadet Limited.  This is her third loan. She intends to use the loan to buy more dress materials, since this is the season for weddings in the area. 

Elizabeth wishes to utilize the anticipated profit to continue sustaining her business and help look after her family. In the future, she hopes to own her own tailoring school and a well-stocked boutique.

loans.use: buy dress materials

loans.name: Elnur

texts.ru: Elnur jenat i imeyet odnogo rebonka. On yavlyayetsya IDP personom pereselenec iz Fuzuli goroda, seychas projivayet v Fuzuli regione vmeste so svoyey lubimoy semyoy. Elnur 34 qoda. Seychas on nujdayetsya v 2000 AZN chtobi kupit korovi dlya uvelicheniya kolichestva skota dlya pereprodaji. Uje 6 let kak Elnur zanimayetsya skotovodstvom i razvodit korov.
texts.en: Elnur is married and has one child.  He is an IDP (Internally Displaced Person) from the city of Fuzuli and now lives in the Fuzuli region together with his beloved family.  Elnur is 34 years old.  He currently needs 2000 AZN in order to buy cattle for increasing the quantity of livestock for resale.  Elnur has been involved in animal husbandry for six years and breeds cows.

loans.use: to buy cattle

loans.name: Kang

texts.en:
Mrs. Kang is a 45-year-old divorced woman who has four children: two of them are married and live independently and the other two of them are single.  She is a hardworking woman who covers her family's expenditures.

Presently she has been generating a business as a rice seller in a market near her community. From this industry she can receive just about 5 dollars each day. She currently wants to apply for a loan from HKL, a Kiva partner. The aim of this loan is to use it to purchase a cow. She hopes that this trade will help her family gain additional profit.

She is very pleased with all the kind lenders that help her family. In the future she is expecting to have a larger house.

loans.use: to purchase a cow

loans.name: Janerose

texts.en:
Janerose is a farmer in Kitale, Western Kenya.  She is 45 years old and has been in mixed farming for 20 years.  She currently employs one farmhand.  Her farm produces milk, maize, beans and vegetables. She is married, with 6 children, three of whom are still in school. She does water vending for additional income.

Janerose has made a loan request of 40,000 KES to help her purchase a donkey and a donkey cart. She says this will help boost her water vending business and supply her with water for her vegetables and dairy.  She says the additional income will help her pay for the education of her children.

She says the inadequacy of a water supply is a great limitation for farming in the area.

loans.use: To purchase a donkey and a donkey cart

loans.name: Blanca Ermel

texts.es:
La señora Blanca, tiene 43 años de edad, vive en la aldea rural de Peña Blanca con su esposo José y sus 5 hijos con edades de 27, 25,20, 18 y de 14 años. Tiene 20 años de dedicarse a la venta de mercadería de ropa de mujeres. Inicio su negocio de venta de ropa de manera ambulante. Luego la alcaldía rento un predio para ubicar varios negocios, pero hubo problemas administrativos y fueron desalojados. Luego de gestionar nuevamente, lograron que sus negocios fueran reubicados en una vía pública alrededor del parque central con el apoyo de la alcaldía, Actualmente funciona en este lugar donde ella construyo el cubículo de madera. 

Doña Blanca, es muy perseverante, ha solicitado 5 prestamos con ODEF, los cuales ha trabajado muy bien donde ya cuenta con una buena clientela. Sus ganancias han aumentado lo que le ha permitido crecer su negocio. Además ha podido pagar parte de los gastos educativos de sus hijos ya que su esposo también le apoya a través de su trabajo como motorista en una empresa de energía eléctrica. Su sueño es continuar con la educación de sus dos hijos menores y en un futuro construir su propio local en el terreno de su casa.
texts.en:
Blanca, age 43, lives in the rural village of Peña Blanca.  She lives with her husband, José, and their five children.  The children are 27, 25, 20, 18, and 14 years old.  

She has been selling women’s clothes for 20 years.  She started her business by selling clothes in an itinerant manner.  Later, the village rented a property for various businesses.  However, there were administrative problems, and they were evicted.  After negotiating once more, they managed, with help from the village, to have their businesses relocated to a public thoroughfare around the central park.  Her business currently operates there, where she has built a wooden stall.

Blanca is very perseverant.  She has requested five loans from ODEF.   They have worked very well, and she now has a good customer base.  Her income has increased, and this has allowed her business to grow.  She has also been able to pay part of the educational expenses for her children.  Her husband also supports her through his work as a driver for an electrical power company.

Her dream is to continue with the education of her two youngest children.  She also dreams of, in the future, building her own place on the land where her house is.

loans.use: to buy women's clothes to stock her inventory.

loans.name: Lenuel

texts.es: Lenuel es cliente de fundación desde hace mucho tiempo, él se dedica a la venta de mercadería en general. Es un hombre muy trabajador y se siente contento de que su edad todavía pueda trabajar en este caso Lenuel solicita el crédito para la compra de pantalones, camisas, faldas, trajes, ropa para niños, faldas entre otros. Uno de sus sueños es mejorar cada día los ingresos de su familia. Lenuel tiene cinco hijos pero ninguno depende de él.
texts.en: Lenuel is a long-standing client of Fundación Leon.  His business is selling general merchandise.  He is a very hard-working man and feels happy that he is still able to work at his age. On this occasion, Lenuel is requesting a loan to buy pants, shirts, skirts, dresses, children's clothes, etc.  One of his dreams is to gradually improve his family's income.  Lenuel has five children but none of them are dependent.

loans.use: to buy pants, shirts, skirts, dresses, children's clothes, etc.

loans.name: Nusrat's Group

texts.en:
Nusrat is married and has 3 children. All of them are enrolled in a local school and getting their education. She is a working lady and makes beautiful flower brocades which she sells for good profits. She also collects orders from different flower shops and sells to them to earn extra profits. Her brother lives with her, and he also has the same business. 

Nusrat has applied for a loan from Kiva partner Asasah for the further expansion of her business. With the loan, she will buy flowers and thread to prepare beautiful flower brocades in larger numbers, which will allow her to fulfill the orders of her clients and increase her income. 

She has been operating her business for the past 5 years and is very confident that an investment will help her to make more profit by increasing her productivity and sales.

loans.use: To buy flowers and thread for her flower brocade making and selling business.

loans.name: Ekua

texts.en: Ekua sells banku and fish at Kokoado in Elmina. She is married and has 4 children. Her husband works at the Railways. Ekua has been selling banku and fish for 15 years. She assists her husband in order to educate their children. She will use her loan to buy maize and fish in bulk. She hopes to use the new profits to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy maize and fish in bulk.

loans.name: Alexander

texts.en:
Alexander is from the village of Gulebi, West Georgia. He is 62 years old and lives with his family--his wife, Narguli, and two sons who are 26 and 27 years old. Narguli works as a nurse in a local hospital, and their sons work for a local road service company. 

Alexander manages the agricultural business of the family, which is the main source of income for them. He grows various fruits and vegetables on 1.2 family-owned hectares of land and sells harvested products to local retailers. Also, the family has two milk cows. Narguli and Alexander produce cheese and sell it locally. The total average monthly income of the family is 1000 Laris. 

Alexander requested credit for purchasing nut and persimmon tree seedlings. The demand for nuts and persimmons is always high at the local market. After a couple of years, the family will sell additional products and increase their income. They will use their increased income for purchasing additional household goods to improve family living conditions.

loans.use: to purchase nut and persimmon tree seedlings.

loans.name: Fatema

texts.en:
Fatema is a 43 years old woman (husband Mohammad is shown).  She is married and has four sons and one daughter.  

Her husband is a stone cutting and earns a low income.  Fatema wants to help her husband purchase a new stone cutting machine to improve his workshop and increase his income.  Neither has enough money to buy one.

She needs to take a loan in the amount $1,000 from FATEN.  Fatema hopes to create a better life for her family.

loans.use: to purchase new stone cutting machine.

loans.name: Virgilio

texts.en:
Virgilio is a hardworking and respectable man. He is 36 years of age and a father of three children. His wife helps him in this business. They own a small plot of land where they grow rice. They have been blessed with rich land, but it also demands a lot of attention and labor to provide a good income. For this reason, he is asking a loan amount PHP10,000 to buy fertilizers, seeds to sow and pesticides used in maintaining his plants as well as maintaining his land.

Virgilio wishes to improve their living conditions through his availed loan to secure the education and the future for his children.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers, seeds to sow and pesticides used in maintaining his plants.

loans.name: Virgen Del Rosario Piribebuy Group

texts.es:
Las mujeres del presente comité son de la Cuidad de Caacupé.Las Sras. del comité Virgen del Rosario, son personas muy trabajadoras, luchadoras y muy emprendedoras. Ellas se unieron con el objetivo de mejorar el estilo de vida de sus hijos y familiares.
