La señora Fidelina es la presidenta del grupo, ella está casada, y tiene hijos. Comenta que se dedica a la venta de ropas de todo tipo. Ella lleva ya un tiempo en esto por lo que ya tiene un poco de experiencia y gracias a eso es que ya se formó una buena clientela que siempre compran de ella. 
Ella solicita el crédito para comprar prendas, como ser remeras, camisas, pantalones, y demás tipos, con los cuales tendrá más variedad para ofrecer a sus clientes, ya que se acerca la época de navidad y año nuevo que es cuando tiene más demandas.
texts.en:
The women from this communal bank are from the city of Caacupe. The ladiies of the Virgen del Rosario communal bank are very hardworking women, determined and enterprising. They came together with the goal of improving their children's and relatives lifestyle.

Señora Fidelina is the president of the group. She is married and has children. She says that she sells all kinds of clothes. She has been doing this work for quite a while and already has some experience. Thanks to this she has been able attract a good customer base who always buy from her.

She is asking for the loan to buy items such as T-shirts, shorts, pants and other items to have more variety to offer her customers as the holiday season is approaching and New Year is when she has the most demand.

loans.use: to buy clothes for subsequent resale.

loans.name: An

texts.en: Ms. An, 33 years old, has 2 school-aged children. She is a vegetable retailer.  Everyday, she goes to the wholesale market to buy fresh vegetables such as tomatoes, potatoes, cabbages, etc. and then sells them at the local market. She started the business 1 year ago and it creates considerable income for her to manage family life and pay for school fees. Ms. An wants a loan of 8,736,000 VND to buy more fresh vegetables to meet her customers' demands.

loans.use: to buy more fresh vegetables

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy and insure a dairy cow

loans.name: Rosa Emilia

texts.es:
Doña Rosa es comerciante de compra y venta de cerdo, y de la carne de cerdo produce nacatamales, el nacatamal es un alimento a base de maíz, carne de cerdo y algunas verduras como papa, cebolla y tomate, y es muy popular en la comida de los nicaragüenses por su sabor original.
Ella es una persona trabajadora y emprendedora, a la vez una madre ejemplar por tener tres hijos, uno de ellos es especial por tener problemas psicomotores, y le pone un doble esfuerzo para atender a su familia y su negocio.
Necesita de una fuente de financiamiento para comprar cerdo y maíz para producir nacatamales
texts.en:
Rosa is a trader and she buys and sells pork and uses the meat to make nacatamales.  Nacatamales are made from corn tortillas, pork and vegetables such as potatoes, onions and tomatoes.  It is a very popular food in Nicaragua because of its unique flavor.

She is a hard-working and enterprising woman, as well as being an exemplary mother of three children.  One of her children has psychomotor retardation which means that she has to make a double effort to look after her family and her business. 

She needs a source of finance to buy pork and corn to produce her food.

loans.use: to buy pork and corn for food production.

loans.name: Silvia Alejandrina

texts.en:
I sell beauty products and milk products such as cheese and butter. I have had this business for three years and I earn enought to support my family and provide for my children. I sell to my neighbors and in general stores. I order the products in beauty magazines. I would like to make an investment in my business during the next few months because demand is quite good.

Loan Use: Purchase creams and perfumes and milk products

Me dedico a vender productos de belleza y lacteos como queso, quesillo y mantequilla. Este negocio lo tengo desde hace tres años, el que me ha generado ingresos para mantener a mis hijos y el sostenimiento familiar. Mis ventas las hago a mis vecinos, pulperias cercanas a mi casa y el producto es por encargo mediante revistas de belleza. Mi inversion la quiero hacer en estos meses ya que la demanda de ambos productos es bastante buena.

loans.use: Compra de Lacteos y productos de belleza como cremas, perfunes.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Jane would like to buy a dairy cow

loans.name: Maria Elena

texts.en:
Maria Elena is married with 3 children, ages 20, 18, and 15. Her husband is a laborer and his salary varies because there are periods when there is no work for him. For this reason, 5 years ago, Maria Elena began to look for options to bring more income into the home. A friend invited her to sell products by catalog. She began selling shoes, but later as her client base grew, she included cosmetics by catalog as well.

Maria Elena is asking for a $550 loan to buy products to have on hand, and thereby offer products directly to her clients, without having them wait for delivery. She plans to repay this loan in 6-12 months. She looks forward to your support in helping her reach her goals and grow her business.

Translated by Bianca Vargas, Kiva Volunteer.

María Elena es una mujer casada y tiene tres hijos hombres de 20, 18 y 15 años de edad respectivamente, su esposo trabaja como albañil y su sueldo es muy variable por que hay épocas en las que no hay obras y por lo tanto no tiene trabajo, por ello hace cinco años María Elena por la necesidad empezó a ver las opciones de cómo aportar en algo con la economía familiar y por invitación de una amiga empezó a vender productos por catálogo, empezó vendiendo zapatos y posteriormente también incremento su cartera de clientes y empezó a vender cosméticos de la misma forma.

María Elena solicita un préstamos de US $ 550 para comprar mercancía y tener en existencia para así poder ofrecer sus productos de una manera más rápida y tener contentos a sus clientes sin hacerlos esperar mientras llegan sus productos, ella ofrece pagar este préstamo en un tiempo de 6 a 12 meses y espera la ayuden a lograr sus metas y crecer con su negocio.

loans.use: To buy merchandise.

loans.name: Abdujalil

texts.en: Abdujalil is 37, he is married and has three children. Abdujalil has run his business reselling natural fabric for 7 years. At the beginning, he worked in local markets and now he rents a shop near the central market. In April of 2005, Abdujalil received his first loan of $100 for two months to expand his business. Step by step, participating in the Microinvest loan program he received a maximum amount of $900. With loans from Microinvest, Abdujalil has expanded his activity and assortment of products. Besides fabric, he started to sell more expensive goods, such as sweaters and jackets from Angora. The price for these kinds of goods is from $50 to $100 per item. Before Abdujalil was bringing his products from Istaravshan, which is 170 km from Isfara. Now he goes to Bishkek and Karosu in Kyrgyzstan. In the future Abdujalil is planning to go to Iran and Dubai to bring in products. In order to expand his business Abdujalil needs $1200 for 12 months.

loans.use: to expand his business

loans.name: Mahfirat

texts.en:
Mahfirat is experienced businesswomen. She has two beautiful girls. They are friendly family and help each other in their family business. Their business is to sell children clothes, which located in the wholesale market in the Kistakuz, Khujand. Mahfirat started her activity in 2002 from selling socks, handkerchief and underwear for children. Gradually she increased her working capital and expanded her assortment of goods. Her daughters are old enough and they help her to sell her goods after their lessons.
In 2005 she became a client of MicroInvest. Her first loan was $100,which she spent for purchasing the first batch of children clothes Today she sells season children clothes. She has many clients and the turnover of her goods is good.
Mahfirat has two dreams: to help her daughters to get high education and become one of them teacher of Russian languages and second doctor.

loans.use: Business expansion

loans.name: Margarita

texts.es:
Margarita belongs to the Banco Comunal Virgen de las Mercedes, and she lives in the region of San Martín in the province of Mariscal Cáceres in the district of Juanjui. Her business is located in her home because she has several hectares of land which she makes the most out of for her business. She has been dedicated to fish farming for three years now, thanks to the idea that came to her after seeing her in-laws work in this business. Since she saw that she had adequate land for this business, she decided to try it, and that is how she currently has two pools that yield between 500 and 1000 kilograms of fish every three months, depending on the season. The fish farming business is generating good income for Margarita, which allows her to support her family and a daughter that is in college.

With the recent credit that she received from Manuela Ramos of 1,800 nuevos soles ($600.00) to be paid in a term of 4 months, Margarita will buy the necessary raw supplies for fish production, 2 motors to pump water to the pools and to wash the pools every so often, a 150 meter fishing net, and food to provide a balanced diet for the fish. She will also increase the amount of fish and number of breeds.

Margarita is 39 years old, is married, and has four children that still depend on her and her husband. Her oldest daughter is at college, and her other children are still in high school. The income that this fish farming business generates is giving Margarita great satisfaction because it allows her to help her husband and family with the expenses of the home. One of Margarita's upcoming projects is to increase the number of pools to five.

Translated from Spanish by Tanya Harper, Kiva volunteer.

La señora Margarita pertenece al Banco Comunal Virgen de las Mercedes, vive en la región San Martín provincia de Mariscal Cáceres distrito de Juanjui, su negocio está ubicado en su domicilio ya que cuenta con un terreno de varias hectáreas el cual aprovecha para el negocio. Desde hace 3 años se dedica a la piscicultura, gracias a la idea que le surgió al ver como sus suegros trabajaban en este negocio, como vio que contaba con un terreno adecuado decidió probar y es así que actualmente cuenta con 02 piscinas las mismas que le rinden entre 500kg. en una temporada baja y hasta 1000kg. de pescado en una temporada alta, esto cada tres meses: El negocio de la piscicultura le esta generando buenos ingresos que le permiten apoyar a su familia y a una hija que esta en la universidad.

Con el reciente crédito recibido de Manuela Ramos de S/.1,800.00 ($ 600.00) para ser pagados un plazo de 4 meses, la señora Margarita comprará los insumos necesarios para la producción de pescados, comprará 02 motores para bombear el agua hacia las piscinas y lavar las piscinas cada cierto tiempo para incrementar los peces y la raza, una red de pesca de 150mts, y alimento balanceado para los peces.

La señora Margarita, tiene 39 años, está casada y cuenta con 04 hijos que aún dependen de ella y de su esposo, una de sus hijas la mayor esta en la universidad y los demás aun están en el colegio, el ingreso que le genera el negocio de la piscicultura le esta dando grandes satisfacciones por que le permite apoyar a su esposo y familia con los gastos del hogar. Dentro de sus proyectos más cercanos está el incrementar las piscinas en un número de 05.

loans.use: Purchase of food and supplies for the production of fish.  Purchase of machinery.

loans.name: Somina

texts.ru:
Somina M. teaches in a school. However, the salary that she receives from the school is insufficient to feed a family of 4. A year ago she decided to start a business and resell gold. She has come to MicroInvest for help because she does not have a sufficient amount of capital to use as her startup fund.

Translated from Russian by Jane Mazur, Kiva volunteer

Сомина Мухидинова работает преподавателем в школе, но оклад, который она получает в школе не достаточно прокормить семью из 4 человек. Год назад решилась заняться бизнесом и перепродавать золото. При недостатке оборотных средств она обратилась в Микроинвест .

loans.use: Jewlery sales

loans.name: Isacio

texts.es:
Mr. Isacio Pezoa is 65 years old, married and has a son. Mr. Isacio ia a door to door salesman. He owns two motorcycles that he uses to do his sales calls.

His previous experience as a salesman in a company in Coronel Oviedo gave him the impulse needed to start his first venture in 1982. With his savings he purchased his first motorcycle to start selling door to door. He purchased a second motorcycle to give himself a competitive advantage and increase his sales.

The requested loan will be used to purchase stock: medicine, underwear, etc.

He wishes to transmit to the young people of his community the values of discipline and consistency, values that he feels are missing in the new generations. Mr. Isacio has high hopes that the economic and social situation in Paraguay will improve, which is why he is investing in new business ventures.

Translated from Spanish by Henry Corral, Kiva Volunteer.

loans.use: Purchase stock: medicine, underwear, etc.

loans.name: Emilia's Group

texts.en:
Emilia, Iliana, and Mercedes have been part of the community bank “Kausahun”, which means “alive” in Quechua, for 6, 2, and 1 years respectively. In that time they have learned to be punctual, to be leaders, to manage their businesses, and to live according to their values.

Emilia is 60 years old. She is a widow and has eight children, three of whom live with her. Emilia works with her daughters selling typical foods at the Americas market. Previously, she maD. and sold bread but was able to start her new business because she had the help of her daughters. On the other hand, Iliana is only 23. She has a small grocery store in her house. She has decided to move her store to the nearby jungle region where there is greater demand. Iliana is also studying at the university. Meanwhile, Mercedes is 56 years old. She has six children, three of whom live with her. Mercedes sells various grains in the Magdalena neighborhood of Ayacucho. Before this she sold food but did not have enough sales, so she decided to start this new venture Emilia, Iliana, and Mercedes need loans of 400, 800, and 400 soles (3 soles = $1), which they will invest in buying rice, oil, potatoes, spices, sugar, vegetables, and grains.

An important part of the community bank is the interest-earning savings account each associate has. Emilia, Iliana, and Mercedes plan to use their savings to build a house, pay for their children’s school, and have an emergency fund. In order to achieve these goals, they are striving to have a larger business, be professional, and maintain stable jobs.

loans.use: Emilia, Iliana, and Mercedes need loans of 400, 800, and 400 soles (3 soles = $1), which they will invest in buying rice, oil, potatoes, spices, sugar, vegetables, and grains.

loans.name: Ben C Group

texts.en:
The group leader of this small group is Betty N.. She is currently in the business of running a bar and restaurant and is requesting a loan to purchase a fridge and more furniture. Betty is 46 years old and is married. She has 8 children ranging from age 21 to 29 and only three go to school. Each week, Betty makes approximately UGX 50000 in profits and with the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to educate her children and save the rest. Betty has taken a loan from BRAC Uganda before in order to buy a fridge and the loan was paid back on time.

Betty is joined in her small group by Rose Z., Agnes N., Justine M., and Wiran N.. Rose Z. has a business selling charcoal and operating a public pay phone and wants to purchase more airtime cards. Agnes N. is currently operating a business selling second hand clothes and wants a loan to increase capital stock. Justine M. operates a business making and selling soap and wants to boost business. Wiran N. is currently in the business of clothing sales and is requesting a loan to increase the inventory.

loans.use: To add more working capital to bar business

loans.name: Francisca's Group

texts.es:
This group is made up of 18 enterprising women who dedicate their lives to their work and family. All have different business which they run in addition to being wives, home makers and mothers. With a lot of love, they decide to work in addition to being home makers since they have to contribute to the family income as they all come from humble families.

Among the businesses these women have are the sale of groceries, fruits, vegetables, clothing, silver jewelry, fast food and recycling. They are currently in the fifth cycle of the program “group of entrepreneurial women” which has as its principal objective to foment entrepreneurialism, to assist the women in selling their products and in the investment of their capital and in saving. The members are very good at re-allotting, all of them support each other and are prompt in the payment of their fees.

They will use the proceeds of the loan to buy goods for sale, ingredients for meals and recycling supplies.

Translated from Spanish by Cindy M., Kiva Volunteer.

Este comité esta conformado por dieciocho mujeres emprendedoras que dedican sus vidas al trabajo y a la unión familiar. Todas poseen actividades distintas que realizan a la par de ser esposas, amas de casa y madres. Con mucho amor, ellas deciden trabajar además de realizar sus actividades en la casa, pues deben aportar con los ingresos de la familia ya que todas ellas provienen de familias muy humildes.

Entre las actividades que realizan citamos: venta de comestibles, frutas, verduras, ropas, joyas de plata, venta de comidas rápidas y reciclaje. Ellas se encuentra actualmente en el quinto ciclo del programa “comité de mujeres emprendedoras” que tiene como objetivo principal fomentar el emprendedurismo capacitándolas en las ventas de sus productos, en la buena inversión de sus capitales y en el ahorro. El reracionamiento de las integrantes es bastante bueno, todas se ayudan entre si y son muy puntuales en sus aportes y cuotas.

El crédito que solicitan desean destinarlo en la compra de mercaderías para la venta, ingredientes para sus comidas y insumos para reciclar.

loans.use: Purchase of silver jewelry, shirts, pants, shoes, fruits, vegetables, meat, sugar, noodles and paper and plastic for recycling.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use:
to purchase cloth for re-sale

CE FONDS LUI PERMET D'ACHETER DU TISSU POUR LE REVENDRE

loans.name: Tuy

texts.en: Tuy S. is 50 years old. She runs two complementary businesses: pig raising and rice wine making. The reason these businesses are often combined in Cambodia is because the leftover rice mash from making the wine makes excellent pig feed. Therefore, anyone who makes rice wine can also afford to raise pigs cheaply. With her combined businesses, Tuy S. earns US$3 a day. Her husband is a local fisherman who does well for himself fishing in the province's many lakes and rivers. He earns US$5 a day. Tuy S. and her husband have eight children, the oldest of whom got married just recently. Two others are also grown up and currently work at a hotel earning US$120 per month. Tuy S. is asking for a loan, which she would mostly use for her older children's daily commute to the provincial capital for work. Specifically, Tuy S. hopes to buy them a motorbike to make the commute easier and cheaper.

loans.use: Purchase of a motorbike

loans.name: Benedicto

texts.es:
Benedicto is 50 years old and he has lived as a couple for 20 years with Elba who is 47 years old. They both have 3 beautiful daughters who are between 18 and 9 years of age. The oldest has already reached her secondary studies and she traveled to Argentina to carry on with her studies, the two young ones are still in school. His daughters are his hope and his reason of living. He mentions that he worked as shoemaker in Argentina for 20 years. He managed to save a fair amount of money and he decided to return to his country in search of better future 3 years ago. With his savings he constructed his own house and he rents several rooms, also he bought a car, which he uses as taxi. He also has a cafeteria that is in charge of his partner while he is working the taxi, in which he transports all kinds of passengers. According to Benedicto, he is very happy to have returned to the Paraguay, because he is doing really well. He does not complain about the life he has had; and when he recalls that he had to leave his country when he was 25 years old because there was no work sometimes the sadness invades him, but he affirms that the sacrifice was worthwhile because today he has all the comfort needed to have a good life. This time he is requesting a loan to buy new seat cover for his taxi.

Translated from Spanish by Samantha, Kiva volunteer.

Benedicto tiene 50 años y vive en pareja hace 20 años con Elba quien ya ha cumplido los 47 años de edad. De la unión de ambos han nacido 3 bellas hijas que tienen entre 18 y 9 años de edad. La mayor de todas ya culminó sus estudios secundarios y viajó a La Argentina para continuar estudiando, las dos últimas aún van al colegio y escuela respectivamente. Sus hijas son su esperanza y su razón de vivir. Comenta que trabajó como zapatero durante 20 años en la Argentina, logró ahorrar una buena cantidad de dinero y hace 3 años decidió volver a su país en busca de mejores horizontes. Con sus ahorros construyó su casa propia y alquila varios salones de la misma, también compró un auto, el cual utiliza como taxi. Posee un copetín (comedor) que queda a cargo de su pareja mientras él hace los recorridos con su taxi, en el que transporta todo tipo de pasajeros. Según Benedicto, está muy feliz de haber vuelto al Paraguay, debido a que le va muy bien, no se queja de la vida que llevan y cuando rememora que tuvo que dejar su país con apenas 25 años cumplidos debido a que no había trabajo la tristeza lo invade a veces, pero afirma que el sacrificio valió la pena debido a que hoy día ya cuenta con todas las comodidades para el buen vivir En esta oportunidad solicita el crédito para la compra de cubiertas nuevas para su taxi.

loans.use: Buy new seat covers for his taxi.

texts.es:
Blanca tiene 43 años de edad, está casada con el Sr. Eugenio Colmán, tienen 4 hijos, todos ellos estudian aún en la escuela primaria de la ciudad.

Blanca trabaja como docente con una antigüedad de 19 años y su marido trabajaba en ventas varias hasta hace un año atrás. Blanca debido a la necesidad de mejorar la calidad de vida de sus hijos, y gracias al sacrificio de tantos años de labores educativas y con el apoyo incondicional de su esposo decidieron abrir una pequeña despensa la cual es atendida por su esposo.

Hoy en día, y después de un año de mucho esfuerzo, la pequeña despensa ha aumentado tanto en diversidad de mercaderías como también en cantidad de clientes; tanto fue su crecimiento que están vendiendo carnes, artículos de mercería, bazar y juguetería.

Pretende utilizar el crédito para adquirir mercaderías azúcar, lácteos, bebidas en general, harina, arroz, fideo, panificados, entre otros, en gran cantidad y así poder obtener un poco más de ganancias, las cuales les ayudarán en el crecimiento educativo de sus hijos.

loans.use: Compra de mercaderías como azúcar, lácteos, bebidas en general, harina, arroz, fideo, panificados, entre otros.

loans.name: Aziza

texts.en:
Aziza is 27 years old. She is married with 3 children aged 10, 7, and 3 years old. She has been a fruit and coconut seller since 2006. Every day, she works from 6am to 10pm at her business and can earn a monthly profit of about US$ 175 from her sales.

Aziza is now seeking a loan to buy more fruit and coconuts for her business.

loans.use: To buy more fruit and coconuts for her business

loans.name: Gulsara

texts.en: Gulsara A. is 26-years old, has been married for 8 years and has one child. Her husband is a driver.For the past 9 years, Gulsara has been running her own small business that sells shampoos, soaps, detergents and other items. This business is one of her greatest accomplishments. She always dreamed of owning a business and not having to depend on anyone else. Thanks to the good quality of her merchandise, she has grown her business and is now requesting a loan of 4000 Somoni ($1175 USD) that will be used to purchase more goods to meet her clients' demands. Gulsara promises to repay her loan during a 12 month period and thanks everybody who decided to support her.

loans.use: To increase stock for the store

loans.name: Astou

texts.fr: Astou D., 39 ans, mariée avec 05 enfants en charge est membre du banc villageois de Mbousnack depuis 6 ans. Elle veut renforcer son petit commerce  en achetant de l’huile et de la marchandise pour approvisionner une boutique (alimentation). Son souhait est d’augmenter son capital pour faire plus de revenus. <b> Le prêt qu’elle sollicite sera remboursé au bout de six mois en une seule échéance. <b/>
texts.en:
Astou D. is 39 and married with five dependent children. She has been a member of the Mbousnack village council for 6 years. She would like to augment her small retail business by buying some oil and merchandise to stock a small grocery store. She would like to increase her capital in order to increase her revenues. She plans to repay the loan after six months with a single payment.

Translated from French by Pamela Poole, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase oil and merchandise to stock a small grocery store

loans.name: Nancy

texts.en:
Nancy is a member of the Alelí Village Bank. She is married and has two daughters, a four-year-old and a newborn baby. She and her husband own a motorcycle taxi, which her husband drives, as well as a carpentry shop, where he works when he is not driving the taxi. They opened the workshop a year and a half ago, prior to which her husband worked for a public agency in Ayacucho. He usually works by himself, but when he receives large orders he hires workers. 

Nancy is requesting a loan of 2000 soles to buy wood for the workshop. She and her husband work mainly with tornillo (an inexpensive wood found in South America) and sometimes with oak, depending on the order. She will also use part of the money to repair the motorcycle taxi. 

Nancy has been working with FINCA for about a year. She says it has taught her to be more responsible and more of a humanist. The microloans have been a big help for her family.

loans.use: Buy wood and repair motorcycle taxi

loans.name: Brikissou

texts.fr: Née le 20/01/1975 à Kétou dont elle est originaire ,dame I. Brikissou fréquenta jusqu'en classe de 4ème où elle décida volontairement d'arrêter .Elle commença par vendre dans une cabine téléphonique des cartes de recharge .Puis peu à peu elle se mit à vendre des produits cosmétiques de tout genre auquel elle ajouta plus tard la vente des mèches .Aujourd'hui elle dispose d'une boutique pour mener son activité.C'est pour augmenter son capital qu'elle sollicite ce 1er prêt de 100000fcfa.Elle compte ainsi mieux satisfaire la demande de sa clientèle.Mariée à FADEYI Séraphin, brodeur de formation, elle a 1 enfant: Primous
texts.en:
Born on January 20, 1975 in Kétou where she comes from, Mrs. Brikissou I. went to school up to the 6th grade at which point she decided to stop her studies. She began selling rechargeable telephone cards in a telephone booth. Then, little by little, she began to sell cosmetics of all sorts, and later on also hair extensions. Today, she has a little shop for her busines. She is requesting this first loan of 100,000 F CFA to add to her working capital. She believes that will allow her to better respond to the needs of her clientele. Married to Séraphin Fadeyi, a professional embroiderer, she has one child, Primous.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: buying 5 cartons of various cosmetic products

loans.name: Robiya

texts.ru: Эшнаева Робия жительница района  Абдурахмони Джоми.Возраст 53 года, замужем ,имеет пятерых детей. Уже 6 лет занимается торговлей фруктами и овощами. Торгует на рынке района со своей торговой точки. Хочет получить кредит сроком на 12 месяцев для того, чтобы увеличить товарооборот и привести в порядок торговую точку. Установить новые прилавки . Это даст возможность расширить бизнес и увеличить доход.
texts.en:
Robiya A. lives in the Abdurahmon Jomi region. She is 53 years old, married and has five children. For the last 5 years she has been selling fruits and vegetables at her own stall at the local market. Robiya would like to take out a loan for 12 months to expand her inventory and fix up the market stall by installing new counters. This improvement will allow her to expand her business and increase profits.

Translated from Russian by Anya Lyuksyutova, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Repair of market stall

loans.name: Keo

texts.en: Mrs. Keo K. is 52 years old and lives with her niece in Battambang province, Cambodia. She is a widow who runs a small business selling fried bananas to the people in her community, earning around $3 each day. This loan will be used to help her expand her business.

loans.use: To expand her business.

loans.name: Kea

texts.en: Mrs. Kea N. is 30 years old and lives in the Kampong Cham Province with her husband and two of her young children. So far, two of their children are in school. Mrs. Kea N. is a good housewife who takes care of her children and cooks for her family. She and her husband have been married since 2005. Her husband is a blacksmith and sometimes also operates a moto-taxi business. On average, he makes around USD $6 a day to raise the family. Mrs. Kea N. would like to take out a loan to purchase blacksmith materials.

loans.use: To purchase blacksmith materials

loans.name: Le Thi

texts.vi:
Chị Lê Thị Tỏ năm nay  44 tuổi,  chồng chị đã mất , chị đang sống cùng  hai con tại thị trấn Lâm huyện Ý Yên Nam định. Chị tham gia Quỹ tình thương  từ năm 2002 và  vay vốn để đầu tư chăn nuôi lợn và làm mộc . Đến nay sau 6 năm tham gia Quỹ vay vốn làm ăn hiệu quả hiện tại gia đình chị đã có 1 xưởng  mộc chuyên  sản xuất bàn ghế và đồ dùng gia đình với thu nhập 5.500.000đ/ tháng
Vòng vốn tới chị mong muốn được vay 20.000.000đ để đầu tư mua 2 khối gỗ về phục vụ cho công việc sản xuất của gia đình.
texts.en:
Mrs. Le Thi T. is 44 years old. Her husband has died. She lives with two children in Lam commune, Y Yen district, Nam Dinh province. She has participated in TYM Funce since 2002 and borrowed money T. raise pigs and make furniture. T. date, after 6 years of participation in the Fund, with effective use of loans, her family has a furniture workshop specialized in making chairs, tables, and other home products with a monthly income of VND5,500,000.

In this loan cycle, she wishes T. borrow VND 20,000,000 T. buy 2 cubic meters of wood for the furniture making business of the family.

Translated from Vietnamese by Tu Duong, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy wood to make furniture

loans.name: Sam

texts.en: Sam S. is 35 years old and resides with her husband in the Kampong Cham province. She has one young school-aged child and has a business selling grocery items in front of a garment factory. On average, she is able to make about US$4 per day. Her husband is a moto-taxi driver and earns US$3 of profit every day. Mrs. Sam S. is asking for a loan in order to expand her grocery store by adding more items to meet the demands of her customers. (Mrs. Sam S. is pictured with her husband).

loans.use: To buy items to expand grocery store.

loans.name: Azamjon

texts.ru: Азамджон Нозими житель города Душанбе. Возраст 26 лет, женат , но детей не имеет. Работает электриком в компании "Babilon- mobail". Обратился к нам за кредитом. Деньги планирует использовать для проведения свадебного мероприятия своей семьи. Погасить кредит планирует в течение 10 месяцев.
texts.en:
Azamjon N. is a Dushanbe resident. He is 26, married, but has no children. Azamjon works as an electrician for "Babilon-mobail" company. Azamjon asks for this loan to pay for his sister's wedding ceremony. He plans to repay the loan within 10 months.

Translated from Russian by Aleksandr Zhuk, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To pay for sister's wedding

loans.name: Paschazia

texts.en: Mambo (Greetings) from Tanzania! This is 48-year-old Paschazia M. from Mwanza. She is married with four children between the ages of 12 and 22. She runs a used-car spare-parts business. She works at the business for 12 hours per day, 7 days per week and is assisted by one employee. She currently earns about $150 from her business. Paschazia is requesting a loan of $400 in order to purchase more used spare-parts to sell to her customers. In the future, she plans to expand her business. Paschazia thanks you for your support! ABOUT SELFINA: SELFINA has taken a lead role as a pioneer of micro-credit in Tanzania through micro-leasing. The organization is engaged in the economic empowerment of women in Tanzania through the provision of a leasing and leaseback microfinance facility. Customs and traditions in Tanzania make it difficult for women to own land and assets, thus they are termed non-creditworthy by financial institutions. This leads to poor financial support and poor access to basic needs and services for women with low incomes. One of the primary advantages of micro leasing is that is allows clients to use the equipment as collateral for future loans with SELFINA, thus enabling them to borrow larger sums in the future.

loans.use: To purchase more used spare-parts to sell

loans.name: Elisa

texts.en: This applicant is Mrs. Elisa F., a widow who owns her own house and lives with her two older children. The children have professional jobs with fixed salaries, which helps to diminish the family's expenses.  She is an entrepreneur, as she is the owner of a small grocery store and also runs a diner that feeds about 15 people per day.  These have been open for three years and have allowed her to earn a good income. She applied for 3,000,000 Gs over 12 months to buy flour, herbs, sugar and oil from the city of Posadas, where things are cheaper, in order to gain a larger profit from her operation.

loans.use: The purchase of basic goods for sale

loans.name: Faiz Ilahi Khadim Hussain Group

texts.en:
Suraiya baji wants a loan to buy clothes to sell.

Aneela baji wants a loan to buy sanitary supplies (taps, pipes) to sell.

Ayesha baji wants a loan to buy material (beads, colored thread and clothes) for her embroidery business.

Parveen akhtar baji wants a loan to buy groceries for her grocery shop.

My name is Faiz ilahi and I have belonged to a city named Vehari, Pakistan, for the past fifteen years. I am an uneducated lady and I don’t feel hesitation to mention it, but I know the skills of embroidering clothes. This art encourages me to start my own embroidered clothes business. I started taking order from the clothes shops and earn income. I use my income as of need.

My husband’s name is K. H. and he deals with his clothes-selling business. He buys clothes from the city Multan because, in it, the clothes prices are very low. Then he sells those clothes to the community and earns income. I am applying for a loan to increase the profit of my husband’s clothes-selling business.

loans.use: To buy clothes for her husband to sell

loans.name: Sarita

texts.es: La señora Sarita, pertenece al Banco Comunal “Siempre Unidas, Distrito de Tarapoto, Provincia San Martín, Departamento de San Martín. Es Conviviente, tiene 43 años y es madre de 02 hijos, uno de 15 y 13 años; estudiantes y que aun dependen de ella.Ante la necesidad de aportar al ingreso económico del hogar, y por la falta de trabajo, decidió emprender un pequeño  negocio de venta de abarrotes con su primer crédito de S/. 300.00 obteniendo muy buenos resultados desde un inicio por la calidad de sus productos, sus precios cómodos y la buena atención al cliente.En la actualidad continua con el mismo negocio ubicada en su propia casa, donde sus principales clientes son los vecinos de su barrio.Con este préstamo de S/. 2,200.00, comprará  más productos para surtir su negocio como arroz y azúcar en kilos, huevos en javas,  insumos para el aseo personal y limpieza del hogar, gaseosas en paquetes, golosinas  y otros productos para mantener contenta a su clientela, Hoy se siente muy feliz de la labor y servicio que brinda y agradece a Manuela Ramos, por apoyar a personas como ella que quieren trabajar y salir adelante, espera que sigan así por mucho tiempo y ayuden a muchas familias y mujeres emprendedoras.
texts.en:
Señora Sarita belongs to the communal bank, "Siempre Unidas" (Always United), which is located in the district of Tarapoto in the province of San Martín. She is 43 and is the mother of 2 children, who are 15 and 13. Her kids are students and still depend on her economically. Because of the need to provide economic income for her home and because she didn't have a job, she decided to start a small business selling groceries with her first credit of 300 PEN. She saw very good results from the start because of the quality of her products, her reasonable prices, and her good customer service. Currently she continues with the same business, which is located in her home and where her main customers are the people from her neighborhood. With this loan of 2,200 PEN, she will buy more products to supply her business like rice and sugar by the kilogram, eggs in cartons, personal and cleaning products, soft drinks, candy, and other items to keep her customers happy. Today she is very happy with the work and service that she offers, and she is thankful to Manuela Ramos for supporting people like her who want to work and to get ahead. She hopes that they continue their work for a long time and that they help many families and enterprising women.

Translated from Spanish by Tanya Harper, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: She will buy more merchandise

loans.name: Jean

texts.en: Jean L. is from the village of Cabu-an, Guinsiliban, Camiguin. She is 32 years old, is separated from her spouse, and has two infant children. Jean owns and operates a sari-sari (variety) retail store and at the same time has a food stall, selling a variety of different products and a variety of viands (tasty dishes) in the local community. She has been engaged in her businesses for over three years and earns approximately 3,000 PHP a month. In 2009, Jean joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She is requesting a loan of 5,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be her first from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business. About HSPFI: HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Faifua

texts.en:
Faifua U., a 51-year-old woman living in the town of Saipipi, is married and has six adult-aged children. To make a living, Faifua prepares and sells a variety of food products in the local community. Faifua has been engaged in this business for over a year, earning approximately 800 WST a month.

In 2008, Faifua joined SPBD to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Having fully repaid a previous loan of 1250 WST from SPBD that was used to purchase raw ingredients needed for the business, she is now requesting a new loan of 2000 WST which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. The loan will be her 3rd loan from SPBD, and she plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement the family's income.

About SPBD: SPBD's mission is to improve the quality of life of people living in poverty in the poor island nations of the South Pacific. SPBD's philosophy of lending is based on a respect for each individual's innate human ingenuity, drive and self esteem. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partners to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders."

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell.

loans.name: Shuhratdjon

texts.en:
A. Shuhratdjon is 28-years old and married with two children. Shuhratdjon has been running a pharmacy for more than five years. He sells only certified medicines. The pharmacy store is located in the center of town which allows him to have many clients and customers. Shuhratdjon is asking for a loan of 5,000 Somoni. He nature is of a very accurate person and he would like to reassure lenders that he will pay the loan in time without any violations. Your generosity could change his life.

More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. Today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., damaged an already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still lives in abject poverty.

IMON's History

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: To purchase medications

loans.name: Belmira

texts.es: La señora Belmira, pertenece al Banco Comunal “Mi Sueño”, Distrito de Juanjui, Provincia de Mariscal Cáceres. Departamento de San Martín. Es Conviviente, tiene 53 años y es madre de 03  hijos, todos ya independientes.Belmira, una mujer alegre, perseverante y capaz de realizar sus sueños esta muy orgullosa de pertenecer a Manuela Ramos. Hoy en la actualidad se dedica a venta de ropas y nos cuenta le esta yendo muy bien ya que tiene clientes que la conocen y saben de su negocio. La fortaleza y la perseverancia que le caracteriza, le ayudo a crecer como mujer independientemente y esta muy orgullosa con lo logrado.Con este préstamo de S/. 1,500.00, comprará  más productos para surtir su mercadería de ropas como: pantalones, shorts, snikers, blusas en todas las tallas y modelos, polos y vestidos para niñas. Ella manifiesta que siente mucho orgullo por ella misma, por lo que logro y lo hizo con mucho entusiasmo y optimismo.Dice: Agradezco la oportunidad que me da  Manuela Ramos  de  contar con los  préstamos que me ayudan a desarrollarme como mujer y pequeña empresaria.

loans.use: Comprará mercaderia de ropas.

loans.name: Eva

texts.en:
Eva I. is from the village of Lumbia, Cagayan De Oro City. She is married and has school-aged children. To make a living, Eva owns and operates a sari-sari (variety) retail shop. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from selling both food and daily use products in the local community. Eva has been engaged in her business for over 3 years and earns approximately 3,000 PHP a month from these activities.

In 2009, Eva joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Eva has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to to invest in expanding the business. Eva is requesting a new loan of 8000 PHP which will be used to purchase new items to expand her product offering. This loan will be the second loan taken out by Eva from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement her family's income. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase new items to expand product offering.

location.town: Lumbia, Cagayan de Oro, Misamis Oriental

loans.name: Monica's Group

texts.en: A. Monica is the leader of her lending group in Ibanda. She is 42 years old and married with 3 children that are in secondary and primary schools. Monica has a drug shop in Ibanda Main Street that she has been operating for over 7 years and being that it is strategically positioned in the town centre, she is able to attract more customers hence more profits. Monica has a dream of transforming her drug shop into a wholesale shop so that she could be able to make more sales. She needs a loan to help restock her drug shop with more medicines for malaria, and other minor illnesses to avoid shortages. She is such a determined and hard working lady.

loans.use: Restocking her drug shop with more drugs.

loans.name: Flordeliza

texts.en: Flordeliza is 39 years old, married and makes a living selling dried fish to people in her community. For a long time, this was the only source of income she had to support herself and her four children, all of whom go to school, but it was barely enough.  That's why she started to save what she could to open a small store. Now she is applying for a loan to buy more fish to sell and expand this store. Her goal is to pay her children's school fees now, and also be able to send them to college.  To make this possible, she has applied for a loan for PHP21,000, all of which will go into one of her two small businesses.

loans.use: To help expand two small businesses

loans.name: Ablavi

texts.fr: Cette femme est mariée et est mère de 02 enfants ; elle exerce comme activité la vente en détail de sacs dames et de certains produits de beauté dans le quartier de Bè Kpota à Lomé. Elle exerce ce commerce de manière ambulante et arrive à fidéliser ses clientes grâce à ses qualités de marketing et d’approche client. Elle a débuté ce commerce depuis 2002 et arrive à apporter sa contribution financière dans la gestion du foyer. Elle s’approvisionne au Grand Marché de Lomé auprès des boutiques chinoises. Elle sollicite urgemment un crédit de WAGES pour acheter des sacs de sortie de différentes catégories et certains produits de beauté.
texts.en:
This woman is married and the mother of two children. She has a retail business selling women’s bags and certain beauty products in the Bè Kpota district in Lomé. She operates by going door-to-door and manages to win the loyalty of her customers, thanks to her customer-oriented marketing skills. She started this business in 2002 and manages to do her financial share in managing the household. She stocks up at the Grand Marketplace of Lomé from Chinese shops. She’s urgently requesting a WAGES loan to buy handbags of different kinds and certain beauty products.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy women's bags and beauty products

loans.name: Diaa

texts.en: Diaa is a 39-year-old married man with one child. He has owned a phone  shop since 1999. Today, Diaa is applying for a loan of US$ 1,200 to buy additional phones and rechargeable cards to increase his sales.

loans.use: to buy additional phones and rechargeable cards

loans.name: Pouch

texts.en: Pouch S. is a 29-year-old married man who currently resides in the middle of Phnom Penh, the capital of Cambodia. He is a security guard who works in the public garden. He started his job more than a year ago. Pouch S. is blessed with two young kids who are not enrolled in school. His wife works as cleaning staff and also spends time at home to take care of the kids and do homework. This family’s living conditions are not so good because their house is surrounded by bad water that may affect their health. To solve the problem, Pouch S. requested a loan to buy dirt to cover the water that surrounds his house.

loans.use: To buy dirt to cover the water that surrounds his house.

loans.name: Julian

texts.en:
Julian A. is 35 years old and married with 3 children.

She sells shoes and bags at retail prices to her customers. She hopes to own a boutique in the future. She hopes for a loan of NGN 150,000 to purchase more shoes and bags to sell.  

She loves this business because of the personal interaction that she has with her customers. She says thanks to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more shoes and bags to sell

loans.name: Twefeeko Group, Mukono

texts.en:
Lydia N. is 24 years old. She is married with two children, a 4-year-old and a 2-year-old. She is a hardworking businesswoman. She has a canteen in Ngandu that she has been managing for one year. From the canteen, she is able to profit 70,000 UGX per week. In her canteen, Lydia sells fresh produce like tomatoes, onions, and Irish potatoes. She also sells sugar, bread, salt, cooking oil, and other items according to customer demand. This is the second time that Lydia has sought a loan from Pearl Microfinance, and she hopes to restock her canteen with more goods.

(Lydia N. appears in the photo, although her face did not come out well. There are 10 members in the group, but one member is not pictured).

loans.use: To restock her canteen with more goods like sugar, bread, salt, cooking oil, tomatoes, and other produce

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy more hardware to sell

loans.name: Susana Auxiliadora

texts.es:
La Sra. Susana tiene una pequeña ventecita de golosinas y helados en su casa de habitación que queda en el municipio del Viejo.
Además ella recibe ingresos de su salario ya que trabaja como profesora en una escuela primaria.

Ella va a utilizar este crédito para comprar cebadas, chillas, linazas, frutas, etc. Para hacer frescos y vender, 
Susana es casada tiene 3 hijos y su esposo también trabaja para llevar el sostén al hogar. 

Ella dice estar muy agradecida con CEPRODEL,  ya que le ha ayudado a engrandecer su pequeño negocio y salir adelante en su vida familiar.
texts.en:
Sra. Susana has a small candy and ice cream shop in her home, which is located in the town of El Viejo. She also receives income from her salary as an elementary school teacher. Susana is married and has three children. Her husband also works to support the family.

Susana will use her loan to buy barley, chia, flaxseed, fruit, and other ingredients for making beverages to sell. She is very grateful to CEPRODEL because the support she has received has already helped her succeed in her small business and in her family life.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase barley, chia, flaxseed, fruit, and other ingredients

loans.name: Jason

texts.en:
Jason J. is from the village of Poblacion 2, Clarin, Misamis Occidental. He is 25 years old. Jason is single. To make a living, Jason works in someone else's business venture operating transportation services. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from operating motor transport services. Jason has been engaged in his business for over 3 years and earns approximately 5000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2006, Jason joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Jason has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5000 PHP from GDMPC. Jason is requesting a new loan of 4000 PHP which will be used to repair existing engine. This will be the 16th loan taken out by Jason from GDMPC. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of his family. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three unit offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to repair existing engine

loans.name: Stella

texts.en: Stella is 44 years old, married, and has 2 children.  She has a farm where she plants cassava, yams and plantains. She is a hard-working woman who loves her farming business and wants to excel at it. She has been in this business for a long time.  Her husband is a policeman and he also supports their household. Stella needs a loan of NGN 60,000 to purchase more bags of fertilizer. She says thanks to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more bags of fertilizer

loans.name: La Buena Union Group

texts.en:
Evangelista is the coordinator of her group, La Buena Union (The Good Union), and her story is representative of her group and of Esperanza's Haitian and Dominican (many of whom recently emigrated to the DR from Haiti) clients in general. Her group is located in El Seibo, a rural area with an economy based around agriculture, where running water (none of which is potable) and electricity are unreliable. She makes her home here in a simple structure with her husband and five children.

Evangelista is excited to be seeking her eigth loan with Esperanza after having successfully repaid her previous loan and expanded her business in doing so. She plans to use this loan to invest in her bread-baking business. Specifically, she would like to purchase flour, butter, and eggs. She will use the profits generated as a result of this loan to improve her family's standard of living by purchasing school supplies for her children as well construction materials to improve her home. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: To improve her bread-baking business by purchasing flour, butter, eggs

loans.name: Ana Rogelia

texts.es: Ana Rogelia M. de 50 años de edad, reside en el departamento de Morazán, lugar en el cual vive junto a su madre, la cual se dedica a la elaboración de desayunos y almuerzos. Ana posee una venta de productos de primera necesidad como arroz, frijoles, azúcar, detergente, huevos y otros más, su negocio esta ubicado en el mercado regional de Morazán, en donde posee muchos clientes en especial las personas que trabajan en el mercado haciendo comida, ya que son los que más le compran productos como granos básicos y aceite. Su negocio es muy estable, ya que sus ventas son diarias y posee muy buenos ingresos. Es por esta razón que solicita un préstamo a través del cual pueda comprar mayor cantidad de cereales, bebidas y otros productos de primera necesidad los cuales son de mucha importancia para el hogar. El poder mejorar su negocio es vital para Ana ya que es así como ella se gana la vida.
texts.en:
Ana Rogelia M. is 50 and lives in the province of Morazán with her mother, who prepares breakfast and lunch food for a living. Ana sells staples such as rice, beans, sugar, detergent, eggs and other items, and her business is located in the regional market of Morazán where she has many clients, especially those that work in the market selling foods, who are among those that buy the most staple products from her, such as grains and cooking oil. Her business is very stable, with daily sales and good profits. For this reason she seeks a loan to buy greater quantities of stock, such as cereals, beverages and other staple products for the home. Improving her business is vital for Ana as it sustains her family.

Translated from Spanish by Matthew Cassetta, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increasing inventory of staple items for sale

loans.name: Rose

texts.en:
Rose C. is 37 years old and married to Laban Chebii who is a 47-year-old teacher. They live in Kabarnet and have four children: Kipsang (11 years old; in primary school), Dorcas (9 years old; in primary school), Dorcas (7 years old; in primary school) and Gilbert (4 years old; in pre-school).

Rose sells mitumba (used) clothes and her business is in Kabarnet Market. Her clients pay in cash and are very supportive and faithful. She started this business two years ago and earns a monthly profit of Kshs 10,000. Her husband’s salary brings in additional income.

Rose has borrowed Kshs 20,000 from KADET and will use the loan to purchase skirts, shirts, vests, jackets, and jumpers. She has never borrowed from another source before KADET. She learned about KADET through inquiring at its office.

If this loan boosts her business, Rose will use the extra profit to educate her children and expand her business. Her hope and dream is to become a very rich and famous businesswoman with her own car. She describes herself as a hardworking and God-fearing woman.

loans.use: To purchase more stock for her used-clothing business

loans.name: Anilistte

texts.en:
Anilistte E. is from the city of Tangub City. She is 39 years old, married, and has four school-aged children. To make a living, Anilistte provides sewing services to local community members. She has been engaged in her business for over six years and earns approximately $340 a month for these activities.

In 2009, Anilistte joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 15,000 PHP from GDMPC. Anilistte is requesting a new loan of 20,000 PHP which will be used to purchase materials needed to expand the services she provides. This will be her 3rd loan from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three unit offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase materials needed to expand the services she provides

loans.name: Juana

texts.es: Doña Juana tiene 48 años, vive en San Martín Jilopeque, es casa con Don Emigio y tienen 8 hijos. Doña Juana se dedica a criar barracos y a prestarlos  para raza, ella viaja a Chimaltenango a vender a sus animales, como conejos, chompipes y pollos (vende en el mercado de Chimaltenango). También se dedica al cultivo del café. Así es como Doña Juana obtiene sus ganancias y lucha para sacar adelante siempre a sus hijos junto con su esposo se han ayudado mutuamente. Juana solicita el crédito para comprar cerdos extranjeros, compra de concentrado compra de leña y abono organico para su milpa. Agradece a FAPE siempre por el apoyo que siempre da. Sueña con tener una pequeña granja.
texts.en:
48-year old Doña Juana lives in San Martín Jilopeque with her husband. They have eight children. Juana raises animals and lends them out for breeding. She travels to the market in Chimaltenango to sell her rabbits, turkeys, and chickens. She also grows coffee. These are the ways she earns her living and struggles to get ahead. Her children and husband have all helped. Juana is asking for a loan to buy a different breed of pig, animal feed, firewood, and organic fertilizer for her fields. She is grateful to Kiva partner FAPE for the help that they always provide. Her dream is to own a small farm.

Translated from Spanish by Jane Agg, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy more animals and expand her business

loans.name: Delia Sabina

texts.es:
Delia es viuda, tuvo 3 hijos de los cuales solo uno vive con ellos que trabaja como conductor de carros. Delia se dedica a la venta de cuyes que compra de los productores que le traen a su casa, anteriormente viajaba a las ferias en donde compraba los cuys, actividad que dejo de realizar por su salud. Delia vende los cuy vivos y también los prepara de acuerdo a la solicitud de sus clientes.
Delia es socia del Banco Comunal Buena Suerte y solicita un crédito de 1000 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de cuys.
Los sueños de delia son comprar un carro para que trabaje su hijo y mejorar su salud.
texts.en:
Delia is a widow and has three children, one of whom lives with her and works as a taxi driver. She sells guinea pigs that she acquires from producers and then brings home to raise. Delia previously traveled to the fairs to buy the guinea pigs, but she no longer does this because of her health. She sells live guinea pigs and also prepares them according to orders from her customers.

Delia is a member of the Communal Bank “Buena Suerte” (Good Luck). She is requesting a loan of 1000 PEN to be invested in the purchase of guinea pigs.

Delia dreams of buying a car for her son to use for work and improving her health.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase guinea pigs

loans.name: Eva

texts.en:
Eva P. is from the village of Malinao, Kalilangan, Bukidnon. She is 36 years old. Eva is married and has 1 school-aged child. Eva owns & operates a bakery. She has been engaged in her business for over 5 years and earns approximately 7,000 PHP a month.

In 2010, Eva joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She is requesting a loan of 5,000 PHP which will be used to invest in renovating the business. This will be the first loan taken out by Eva from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated to improve and expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to invest in renovating the business

loans.name: Juan Carlos

texts.es: El Señor Juan Carlos es vecino de la zona de Villa Fátima donde esta ubicada nuestra agencia, reside en la zona mas de 25 años, y espera con el tiempo construir una casa de varios pisos para sus hijos, es muy alegre y bromista, antes tenia de negocio la compra venta de vehículos pero fue victima de una estafa, pero supo sobreponerse a este acontecimiento y ahora se esta volviendo a reactivar económicamente, esta feliz por el préstamo que es un apoyo a su trabajo ya que piensa aumentar a la compra de un vehículo , piensa cancelarlo pronto y poder sacar un préstamo mayor, su esposa es un gran apoyo para el, ya que trabaja con la costura, además pronto tendrán un nuevo bebe en casa y están muy contentos por esto.
texts.en:
Juan Carlos has lived in the Villa Fátima neighborhood for more than 25 years and in time, he hopes to build a multilevel home for his children. He is a joyful and funny man. Juan Carlos used to own a business buying and selling used cars. Although he was victim to a scam, he has recovered and is slowly getting back in the business. He is really happy about the loan since it will directly support the purchase of a vehicle. He would like to pay it off soon, so that he can obtain an even bigger loan. Juan Carlos' wife supports him greatly with her work as a seamstress. They are both extremely happy that they will be parents to a new baby soon.

Translated from Spanish by Violeta Rubiani, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buying a vehicle

loans.name: Farzana's Group

texts.en:
Farzana is 35 years old and is married to N. H.. They have lived in Borewala, Pakistan, for the last four years. She is the mother of two daughters who are of 5 and 3 years old and have not yet started going to school. She has a wish to send them into school so they never have to face the financial problems which she faced.

Farzana sews clothes for her nearby clients. Her husband is a painter who paints walls, doors and windows to order and generates income. He doesn’t get regular orders and that’s why Farzana pays full-time attention to her sewing business so she makes suitable earnings to run her household finances.

Farzana has applied for a loan for the third time from Asasah, this time to improve her sewing business. She will buy an electric sewing machine which will help her to work more efficiently. She is hopeful that her business will be in a better position and that she will be able to increase her income.

In the photo, Farzana is showing one of her prepared dresses.

loans.use: To purchase an electric sewing machine for her sewing business

loans.name: Jose Romeo

texts.en:
Jose Romeo E. is from the village of Bitibut Sapang Dalaga Misamis Occidental. He is 44 years old. Jose Romeo is married and has 5 adult-aged children. To make a living, Jose Romeo owns and operates a business venture in the retail sector operating a specialized retail store. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from selling daily use products such as shampoo, soap, toothpaste, biscuits, candies, etc. in the local community. Jose Romeo has been engaged in his business for over 2 years and earns approximately 4,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2010, Jose Romeo joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Jose Romeo is requesting a loan of 10,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be the first loan taken out by Jose Romeo from GDMPC. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement his family's income.

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three units offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell.

loans.name: Adjowa

texts.fr: H. est une femme de 37 ans, elle exerce comme activité génératrice de revenu le commerce de céréales, elle y a associé plus tard le commerce de charbons. elle a une ancienneté de 3 ans dans ce commerce. elle exerce son commerce dans le marché local d'adidogomé, elle s'approvisionne à l'intérieur du pays pour gagner plus de marge bénéficiare. sa clientèle se compose de toutes personnes. elle constate une baisse de son stock et elle veut rapidement se réapprovisionner pour éviter une rupture de stock, elle sollicite de WAGES son premier crédit pour acheter 10 sacs de maïs et 10 sacs de charbons de bois.
texts.en:
Ms. H. is a 37-year old woman. She makes a living by selling cereals. In addition, she also started selling charcoal. She has three years of experience in the business. She sells at the local market of Adidogomé and stocks up in the interior part of the country in order to increaser her profit margin. Her customer base is very diverse. At present her stock is low and she would like to replenish it quickly in order to avoid running out of stock. She is seeking her first loan from WAGES in order to purchase 10 bags of corn and 10 bags of charcoal.

Translated from French by Ekaterina Sukhanova, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchasing corn and charcoal

loans.name: Sabina

texts.es:
Sabina es una madre de familia de 43 años de edad que vive junto a su familia en el distrito de Pacasmayo, capital de la provincia del mismo nombre, ubicada en la región La Libertad, a dos horas de la ciudad de Chiclayo, capital de la región Lambayeque.

Se dedica a la preparación y venta de platos de comida para lo cual posee un restaurante desde hace ocho años, ella atiende en este establecimiento a sus clientes que acuden a ese lugar porque prefieren su buen trato y la buena sazón que les suele brindar. Los ingresos que percibe de esta actividad los utiliza para apoyar a su esposo con el sostenimiento de los gastos familiares.

Sabina desea ampliar su negocio con la compra de más insumos, de modo que pueda preparar más platos de comida. Por ello ha creído conveniente solicitar a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 2000 nuevos soles.

Sabina ya ha tenido préstamos con Edpyme Alternativa anteriormente y ha demostrado puntualidad y responsabilidad al momento de asumir sus cuotas.
texts.en:
Forty-three-year-old Sabina is a mother who lives with her famly in the district of Pacasmayo, capital of the province of the same name, located in the Libertad region, two hours from Chiclayo, which is the capital of the Lambayeque region.
For the last eight years, she has prepared and sold food in her restaurant.  Her customers come to her restaurant because they prefer the good service and delicious food that she is in the habit of providing.  She uses the income from the restaurant to help her husband pay household expenses.
Sabina wishes to expand her business by purchasing more supplies so that she can prepare more food; therefore, she believes it is advisable to request a loan of 2000 nuevos soles ($725) from Edpyme Alternativa (local lending institution).
Sabina has borrowed money from Edpyme Alternativa before and has made her payments in a timely manner.

loans.use: Purchase of food to increase sales in her restaurant

loans.name: Phem

texts.en:
Phem C., age 60, lives in the province of Kompong Chhnang, which is the best territory for farming. Phem C. is a married woman who is devoted to her six children for whom she is responsible. Phem C.’s husband (pictured) is the chief of a construction team. 

Phem C. possesses a few farms that she inherited from her grandmother. She grows crops on them, and she also gets good results from her farming. Her husband often helps her to grow crops. She said that presently her toilet is getting old, and it is not comfortable for her family to use.  So Phem C. would like to request a loan from Kiva to buy construction materials for mending the old toilet.

loans.use: To buy construction materials for mending the old toilet

loans.name: Marcos Antonio

texts.es: El Señor Marcos trabaja desde hace dos años en la elaboración de ladrillo crudo, trabaja de manera independiente y su producto lo vende al que ofrece mayor precio  ya que el precio de ladrillo crudo varía según la época y el trata de buscar quien le pague el mejor precio. Su esposa le ayuda económicamente ya que ella también se dedica a elaborar colitas para matrimonio adornos para matrimonios. Tiene tres hijos quienes estudian en colegio fiscal. Solicita el crédito para comprar material par elaboración de ladrillos ya que estos incrementan su precio en época de lluvia razón por la que el desea almacenar dichos materiales, es una persona responsable y muy trabajadora, esta muy agradecido con la institución por el apoyo brindado.
texts.en:
Marcos has worked for two years making unburned bricks. He works independently and sells his bricks at wholesale price since the price of unburned brick varies by season and he tries to look for who will pay him the best price. His wife helps him financially making wedding dress trains and decorations. He has three children who are students at a public school.

Marcos is requesting the loan to purchase brick making material because they are more expensive during the rainy season and he wants to store the materials. He is a responsible and hardworking person and is very appreciative of the lending institution for the support provided.

loans.use: To purchase material for making unburned brick.

loans.name: Dorothy

texts.en:
Dorothy is forty-three years old, married with six children and living in Fort Portal, Uganda. She lives in her own permanent house and her family dream is to educate her children. Dorothy operates a retail shop besides her pasturing and has been operating it for the past ten years. Her business dream is to have her retail shop turned into wholesale. 

Dorothy intends to use this loan to purchase sugar, soap, and cooking oil for resale at her shop.

loans.use: Purchasing sugar, soap, and cooking oil for resale

loans.name: Awussu

texts.fr: Awusu a 34 ans et est marié.  Il est né à Lomé et habite quartier Kégué.  IL est couturier de profession et exerce cette activité il y a 3 ans déjà. Il s’approvisionne au marché local de Kégué  et  a un apprenti qui l’aide dans ses tâches. Le crédit demandé permettra d’acheter une machine pour mieux satisfaire les clients.
texts.en: Awusu is 34 years old and married.  He was born and lives in the Kégué neighborhood of Lomé. He has been a professional designer for the past three years. He stocks up at the local Kégué market and has an apprentice who helps him with his tasks. The loan requested will allow him to buy a machine, which will better satisfy his clients.

loans.use: To buy a machine

loans.name: Gemma

texts.en:
Gemma N. is a married woman who lives in Brgy. Daanglungsod, Oslob, Cebu. She earns her living by operating one business venture: a pig fattening business. Her husband Hipolito N., who is 49 years old, works as a tricycle (three-wheeled transport) driver to earn his living and also helps in his wife's business activities.  They have four children who are 3 to 16 years old.  

Gemma joined NWTF-Project Dungganon in 2006 because she aspired for something better for her family.  With the help of her past 7 loans from NWTF-Project Dungganon, Gemma has been incrementally lifting her family out of poverty by the sweat of her brow. Her previous loan of PHP 15,000 helped her earn a monthly profit of PHP 5,000, thus uplifting the family's standard of living.  

This time, for her 8th loan, she is borrowing PHP 15,000 which she intends to use to fund her business operations so that she can continue to save up for the future, support the family and do house repairs.  Gemma N. is a Dungganon woman who is following an honorable path towards the achievement of her dreams.  

About NWTF: 

 In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF), is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means Honorable). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress from earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed on a member of a community who has earned respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work.  Help NWTF continue its mission to help the poorest in the Philippines by clicking the link to the NWTF Kiva lending team on Kiva.org to join our team.

loans.use: additional working capital for her business

loans.name: Ghulam Fatima's Group

texts.en:
Ghulam Fatima is a baker and vendor of flatbreads, which she makes in a tandoor, a traditional clay oven. She has been engaged in this business for some time now and it is working very well for her. She has applied for a loan from Kiva partner Asasah for her breadmaking business. With the loan, she will buy wood and flour in quantities that will allow her to produce a larger quantity of bread in order to fulfill the needs of her customers on a timely basis. She is  hopeful that this investment will improve her business further. 

Ghulam and her husband, E. M., live in a three-room brick house in a residential area called Lakar Mandi in Chichawatni, a small agricultural city of Punjab Pakistan. She moved to this area when she was married. She has many household responsibilities in addition to her business and has two daughters and a son, all of whom are pursuing their education in the local school.

She is already a regular loan user of Asasah and this is her second loan application. Over the previous loan year, she has built up good credit behavior and has never missed a meeting.

loans.use: To buy wood and flour for her breadmaking business

loans.name: Shous' Group

texts.en:
Four people are forming this group loan. Mrs. Shous S., a 29-year-old married woman, was selected group leader by its members. The members of this group loan live in Ta Khmau village in Kandal province. With the loans, they hope to increase their income to improve their family living. 

Mrs. Shous S. is a seamstress in a garment factory. Her husband, Mr. Yorn Sok, is a construction foreman.  Mrs. Shous S. would like to ask for a loan to purchase construction supplies for her husband to use in his work.  With their careers, they are able to earn a small income to support their two children: one is attending a local school, and the younger one is 3 years old.

loans.use: To purchase construction supplies for her husband

loans.name: Emma

texts.en:
Emma J. is from the village of Poblacion,  Sapang Dalaga, Misamis Occidental. She is 47 years old. Emma is married and has 1 school-aged child.
