To make a living, Emma owns & operates a business making & selling food. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from making and selling breads, candies and cookies to the local community. Emma has been engaged in her business for over 2 years and earns approximately 8000 PHP a month from these activities.

In 2010, Emma joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Emma has successfully repaid a previous loan of 7000 PHP from GDMPC. This previous loan was used to purchase additional inventory & to fund working capital. 

Emma is requesting a new loan of 9000 PHP, which will be used to purchase raw ingredients needed to make products for sale. This loan will be the third loan taken out by Emma from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement her family's income. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three unit offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase raw ingredients to make food for sale

loans.name: Gloriose

texts.en:
Gloriose, 38, is married with four children, aged two to 13. For three years, Gloriose has owned a large and clean shop where she sells handicrafts, namely wedding decorations. She is a hard worker and has one employee. Her shop is open from 8am to 6pm every day.

Gloriose has requested a loan in order to expand her selection of decorations.

loans.use: To expand her selection of wedding decorations.

loans.name: Rosa Escarleth

texts.es: Rosa Escarleth tiene 30 años, su actividad económica es la venta de cosméticos. Hace más de 3 años que inicio con esta actividad, Ella siempre ha sido una mujer luchadora y emprendedora. Por lo que es la primera vez que solicita créditos y se siente muy contenta con esta oportunidad. Actualmente solicita este financiamiento con el fin de invertir en nuevos productos que sus clientes más jóvenes solicitan. Su deseo es mejorar los ingresos para su familia y proporcionarle condiciones necesarias.
texts.en:
30-year old Rosa Escarleth earns her living by selling cosmetics, a business she started three years ago. She’s always been a hardworking and enterprising person. This is the first time that she has asked for a loan and feels very happy to have an opportunity like this.

Rosa plans to use the loan to buy the new products that her younger customers are asking for. Her greatest wish is to increase her income so that she can provide her family with the necessities of life.

loans.use: to buy new products for her cosmetics business

loans.name: Rajab

texts.en:
Rajab N. is 35 years old and lives in the town of Wakiso in the Kampala central region of Uganda.  He is married and has four children.  All of his children are currently in school.  Rajab has a business of a small retail shop, which he has had for three years.         

To help expand his business, Rajab has requested a loan of 1,500,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda.  The loan will be used to purchase sugar and soap for resale.  With the help of the loan from BRAC, Rajab hopes to generate greater profits and pay school fees for his children.  In the future, Rajab hopes to expand his business.

loans.use: to purchase sugar and soap for resale.

loans.name: Maryjane

texts.en:
Maryjane C. is from the village of Kipaducan, Pangantucan, Bukidnon. She is 40 years old, married and has five school-aged children. To make a living, Maryjane buys and sells rice by the kilogram in the local community. Maryjane has been engaged in her business for over four years and earns approximately 5,000 PHP per month from these activities.
In 2009, Maryjane joined Kiva partner, HSPFI, to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 13,000 PHP from HSPFI. This loan was used to purchase additional inventory and as working capital. Maryjane is requesting a new loan of 8,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional sacks of rice to be retailed. This loan will be her fourth from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business.

About HSPFI
HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional sacks of rice for retail

loans.name: Tinh's Group

texts.en:
Tinh T. N., a 30-year-old mother of two children who are in elementary school, has run a grocery shop since receiving her first loan in 2003. Her business has developed well and now earns a profit of 4,000,000 per month, money that helps Tinh meet her family's requirements and buy some essential equipment for her house. Participating in our credit program, she has a good repayment record that qualifies her for increasingly larger loans. Tinh now wants to borrow 8,502,000 Vietnamese dong (VND) to buy more products for her shop.

Loc T. D., a 43-year-old mother of two children, is currently raising five pigs for meat. She is requesting a loan of 6,322,000 Vietnamese dong (VND) to buy food for them.

Dao T. N., 39, is raising 300 chickens for their eggs and needs a loan of 5,014,000 Vietnamese dong (VND) to buy food for them.

Phien T. N., 45, is raising six pigs for meat and needs a loan of 5.014.000 Vietnamese dong (VND) to buy food for them.

Vi T. N., a 33-year-old chicken breeder, wants to borrow 5,014,000 Vietnamese dong (VND) to buy food for them.

Chung T. T. N., a 35-year-old mother of three children, is a carpenter requesting a loan of 5,014,000 Vietnamese dong to buy a new tool set.

loans.use: to buy more products for the shop

loans.name: Ubesnceslao

texts.es:
El señor Ubenseslao O. tiene 54 años de edad, esta casado y tiene tres hijos que viven con el en su casa y le ayudan a pescar y sacar canechos. 
Este negocio es un patrimonio de familia ya desde hace mucho tiempo su familia se a dedicado a dicha actividad.
Ubenseslao sale al mar todos los dias muy temprano dependiendo las mareas, lleva su almuerzo para estar mas tiempo en el mar y asi poder sacar mas peces.
A veces pesca mas de 150 canechos machos ya que las hembras es prohibido sacarlas del mar.
Don Ubenses como se le conoce en el area es una perssona humilde de escasos recursos que sostiene a su familia de sus ingresos que recibe de la venta de los canechos y del pescado.
el credito lo utilizara para la compra de pescado seco para revender y obtener de esa manera obtener un poco mas de ingresos.
texts.en:
Mr. Ubenseslao O. is 54 years old, married, and has three children who live with him in his house and help him fish and trap crabs. This business has been in the family for a long time. Ubenseslao goes out to sea every day very early according to the tides. He takes his lunch with him so he can stay out at sea for a long time and catch more fish. Sometimes he can catch more than 150 male crabs, and the female crabs are not allowed to be removed from the sea.

Don Ubenses, as he is known in the area, is a humble person without a lot of wealth. He supports his family from the earnings he receives selling crabs and fish. He will use the loan to buy dried fish to resell and be able to earn a bit more money.

loans.use: buy fish

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.en:
This Kiva borrower is a 25-year-old single man from Lebanon. He lives with his parents and three siblings. In 2008, he started a new business working as a farmer on his own land. He cultivates all types of vegetables and he distributes his products to specific agricultural markets that he works with. There is one employee helping him in this job. He helps his father in collaboration with his brothers to provide better living conditions for the family.
Today he is requesting to borrow $1,000 from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l. to purchase agricultural spices and seeds. His aim is to increase his productivity and sales in order to get a superior income. In the future, he is planning to open a store where he will sell his goods.

loans.use: to purchase agricultural spices and seeds

loans.name: Pascual Adriel

texts.es: El señor Pascual nació en la ciudad de Paucarpata  del distrito de Cusipata y  tiene 57 años, él señor Pascual es trasportista y tiene su propio carro. Ya son 38 años que se dedica a brindar servicios de transporte y le va muy bien gracias al empeño que pone en su trabajo. Pascual y su esposa tiene  una negocio de venta de comida ósea tiene una pequeña restaurante. En esta oportunidad Pascual requiere el microcrédito para hacer mantenimiento del carro.
texts.en:
Pascual was born in the city of Paucarpata, Cusipata district.  He’s 57 years old.  He provides transportation services and has his own car.  He’s been providing transportation services for 38 years and does well thanks to the dedication he puts into his work.

Pascual and his wife have a food sales business, that is, he has a small restaurant.  On this occasion, Pascual needs the micro loan to service his car.

loans.use: to service his car.

loans.name: Domou Ndeye Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe de solidarité Domou ndéye a été créé le 31 mai 2010.Il est composé de 26 membres issus de la meme zone.Elles ont pour activité principale le petit commerce.

Madame Hafsatou est responsable du groupement;elle est âgée de 42 ans ;elle est mariée et vit avec 05 enfants.

Sa principale activé est la vente de Karité;activité à laquelle elle dispose d'une bonne expérience.

Son prêt lui permettra d'acheter de la karité en stock suffisant dans le marché pour les revendre.

Son objectif est de réfectionner sa maison, s'occuper de la nourriture et de la scolarité de ses enfants.
texts.en:
The solidarity group Domou Ndéye was created March 31, 2010. It is made up of 26 members from the same area. They are mainly involved in small sales businesses.

Madame Hafsatou is the leader of the group. She is 42 years old, married, and lives with five children. Her main business is selling shea butter, and she has good experience in this business.

Her loan will allow her to buy shea from the market in sufficient quantities to resell.

Her goal is to renovate her house and pay for her children's food and schooling.

loans.use: to buy shea butter.

loans.name: Hermelina

texts.en:
Hermelina is 44 years old and married with 3 children.

Hermelina works hard to provide for her family. She runs a Sari Sari (general) store in the Philippines and has requested a PHP 29,500 loan through NWTF to purchase additional items like shampoo, sardines, grocery items, etc. to sell.

Hermelina has borrowed and repaid 16 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the Sari Sari (General) store for 6 years and also earns an income from rice farming.

Hermelina aspires to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: To purchase additional items to sell

loans.name: Evgenia

texts.en:
Evgenia comes from village Ruisi, Khashuri District. She is 28 years old, married and lives with her husband Zaza, her 6-year-old son, her 5-year-old daughter and her parents-in-law. The main source of income for Evgenia and the whole family is farming activities. They have two milk cows and produce and sell approximately 50 kg of cheese per month. At the same time the family cultivates 2.5 hectare of land, where they grow cabbages and tomatoes. Harvested vegetables are sold to local vegetable retailers. Average monthly profit for the family is approximately 2000 Laris per month.

Evgenia requested credit for purchasing fertilizers, which will be used for fertilizing the land. Also part of the credit will be used to pay agricultural workers, who will help them in the above-mentioned process. After fertilizing, Evgenia’s family will get a high quality harvest and sell it for a good price. 

Evgenia and Zaza plan to use received income for construction of a new house for the family, as their existing house (only 2 rooms) is very old and uncomfortable, as well as too small for all family members.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers and pay agricultural workers.

loans.name: Maria Del Rosario

texts.es:
María tiene 35 años de edad. Cuenta con casa propia,  la cual está ubicada en el distrito de Catacaos, en un caserío llamado Narihuala, dicho caserío es una de las zonas rurales del distrito.

María se dedica ala venta de harina de jora, dicho negocio lo a establecido en su domicilio y la realiza desde hace 10 años y gracias al tiempo y a la calidad de su producto cuenta con clientela establecida  en  la zona donde vive. 

María esta solicitando un préstamo a  Edpyme alternativa de 800 nuevos soles para que ella pueda realizar otra actividad comercial como es la elaboración y venta de chicha, de esta manera ampliar su negocio y obtener mejores ingresos.

María  desea mejorar su calidad  de vida, con esfuerzo y trabajo. Cuenta con buenas referencias, las personas que la conocen la describen como una persona tranquila y responsable.
texts.en:
María is 35 years old and lives in her own home, in a small village called Narihuala, which is located in one of the rural areas of Catacaos district.

María sells Jora flour.  Her business is located in her home and she has been working in it for ten years.  Thanks to the length of time she has been in business and the quality of her product, she has an established customer base in her area.

María is requesting a loan for 800 Peruvian soles from Edpyme Alternativa so that she can engage in another business activity: making and selling 'chicha' (a native Peruvian drink made from maize and Jora corn).  In this way, she will expand her business and make better income.

María would like to improve her quality of life through effort and hard work.  She has good references.  People who know her describe her as a calm and responsible person.

loans.use: to buy supplies for making 'chicha' (a native Peruvian drink made from maize and Jora corn)

loans.name: San Geronimo 4 Group

texts.en:
The San Geronimo solidarity group formed in July, 2011 and is made up of Joaquin, Hector, and Jimmy. Joaquin, the group leader, lives in Choluteca, Honudras with his wife and four children.

Joaquin makes a living by raising and selling livestock, and gets up at 4 a.m. each morning to tend to his herd. He is requesting a loan of 10,000 HNL to purchase cattle. In his free time, Joaquin enjoys attending church.

loans.use: to purchase livestock

loans.name: Thu

texts.en:
Thu is 53 years old and married with five children, two sons and three daughters. Her husband is a driver. 

Thu established a stall to sell food in the local community ten years ago. She plans to get a loan partly to invest capital in her business by purchasing more food and partly to buy new furniture for the stall to better serve her customers. 

She hopes that the loan will assist her to earn more income and improve her family's living conditions.

loans.use: To buy food and furniture for the stall.

loans.name: Alma

texts.en:
Alma is 39 years old and lives in Delapaz, Liloy, Zamboanga del Norte. She is married and has 2 children.

Alma works in the fish industry and sells fish for a living. She had been doing this for 3 years. She has requested a loan for PHP 4000 to purchase 1 box of fish to sell.

Alma has been a member of PMPC since this year, 2011. In the future, she hopes to expand her business.

loans.use: buy fish to resell

loans.name: Latafat

texts.en: Latafat is 43 years old. She purchases and resells cattle with her husband. She has three children. Latafat would like to request a loan of 1,200 AZN to purchase additional calves to increase her inventory and meet customer demands. She believes this will lead to greater revenue and, ultimately, greater profit for her family. In the future, Latafat would like to reinvest the earnings generated by this loan back into her business to purchase additional cows and increase their income further.  Her monthly income from cattle breeding is 250 USD. She usually buys baby calves, raises and fattens them in 5-6 months and resells at the central bazaar for higher price. She has already demonstrated herself as a good client with a positive credit history.

loans.use: to purchase three cattle and fodder

loans.name: Estelle

texts.fr:
Estelle est une femme agé(e) de 38 ans. Elle est mariée å un revendeur. Elle a 2 enfants qui vont tous  à l’école. Le premier a 15 ans et le dernier a 12 ans.  
Estelle travaille comme revendeuse depuis 2007. Elle achète des mèches pour revendre à ses clients dont la plupart sont des femmes.  Elle travaille seule dans son commerce.
Estelle a requis son premier crédit de WAGES afin d’acheter des mèches. Elle veut réinvestir les profits supplémentaires dans son activité. 
Dans les prochaines années, Estelle voudrait agrandir son activité. Elle dit qu’avec les profits, elle prévoit d’améliorer les conditions de vie de sa famille
texts.en:
Estelle, age 38, is married to a reseller. She has two children who both attend school. The oldest is 15, the youngest is 12. Estelle has been working as a reseller since 2007. She purchases hair extensions and resells them to a mostly female clientele. She works alone in her business.

Estelle is seeking her first loan from Kiva's partner, WAGES, in order to buy hair extensions. She wants to reinvest the extra profits into her business. In the forthcoming years, she would like to expand her business. She says that with the profits, she intends to improve the standard of living of her family.

loans.use: to buy hair extensions

loans.name: Sibanga Shg Group

texts.en:
Samwel is the facilitator of Sibanga SHG group. Samwel and his group joined One Acre Fund in the year 2011 and will re-enroll in the 2012 program.

With this loan, One Acre Fund will purchase fertilizer, seeds, and other important inputs to distribute to Samwel and his group during Kenya’s next planting season in February 2012. The distribution of farming inputs is part of One Acre Fund’s integrated agriculture package, which includes training, reliable input supply (such as fertilizer and seeds), credit and insurance.

Samwel takes care of three children at home. He joined One Acre Fund in order to access fertilizer and hybrid seeds and ensure food security for his family. In the recent 2011 season, Samwel had an excellent maize yield harvesting 7 bags on 3/4 acre of land. Before joining One Ace Fund, Samwel was only able to harvest 3 bags of maize on 3/4 acre of land.

With income from maize sales, Samwel will educate his children and save for future use.

In 2012, the members of Sibanga SHG group will each plant between ½ and 1 acre of maize

Picture
In the photograph, Samwel is pictured together with his group members.

loans.use: To source farming inputs, such as seeds and fertilizer, at low prices for the 2012 planting season.

loans.name: Marcelina

texts.es:
Marcelina tiene 52 años de edad, tiene cinco hijos y vive en la ciudad de Cusco, Perú.  Marcelina se dedica a la venta de ropa, la socia Marcelina nos cuenta que viaja a la ciudad de Anta los días domingos para vender ropa. Ya son 10 años que tiene el negocio y le va muy bien,  ella en esta oportunidad requiere el préstamo para comprar  mercadería como por ejemplo chompas, pantalones, camisas y otras cosas más.
     
Marcelina pertenece al banco comunal “Unión, Fuerza y Amistad” de la Asociación Arariwa y se encuentra agradecida por la oportunidad brindada mediante este medio y así mismo se compromete a cumplir con el pago correspondiente al cronograma.
texts.en:
Marcelina is 52, and has five children. She lives in the city of Cusco, Peru.  Marcelina sells clothing.  

Marcelina tells us that she travels to the town of Anta on Sundays to sell clothing. She has had the business for ten years, and it's going very well.  On this occasion she needs the loan to buy merchandise, such as sweaters, pants, shirts, and other clothing articles. 

Marcelina belongs to the "Unión, Fuerza y Amistad" communal bank, under the Asociación Arariwa institution. She is thankful for the opportunity she has been given, and promises to make her scheduled payments on time.

loans.use: To buy sweaters, trousers, shirts and other clothing items.

loans.name: Felix

texts.es: Félix de 43 años de edad, está casado hace 19 años con Nancy. Ambos vieron nacer 7 hijos de los cuales solo viven con él 3, siendo su hija menor de 3 años. Toda ésta familia habita en una casa rústica de su propiedad. Sus padres le enseñaron las labores del campo, actividad que también sustenta a su numerosa familia. Él cuenta con terrenos agrícolas que la comunidad de Punray le otorga, en esas parcelas siembra papas de distintas variedades, arvejas, habas y verduras, tales como: zanahorias, lechugas, coles, entre otras. Considera que es más rentable sembrar arvejas y papas, por la demanda que tienen en la ciudad y para llevarlas a la ciudad de Lima para el consumo masivo. El principal problema que él señala es la baja y alza de precios. “Hay  meses en que el precio baja y simplemente se recupera el capital, pero aún así seguimos”, agrega. Mas adelante, Félix quisiera comprarse un auto para hacer servicio de transporte de su comunidad hasta la ciudad de Tarma, ya que con el tiempo sus fuerzas no serán las mismas para arar la tierra. Así mismo anhela ver a sus pequeños hijos formarse para el futuro, para ello él seguirá trabajando igual o más que ahora. Con éste serían 8 préstamos de MFP, y 8 veces que trabaja coordinadamente con su banco comunal llamado “Nueva Jerusalén”, del que se siente satisfecho por los logros e intereses en común. Con la ayuda de ustedes, él podrá comprar abonos para enriquecer sus tierras y así sembrar arvejas para ésta nueva temporada.
texts.en:
Felix is 43 years old, and has been married to Nancy for 19 years. They have 7 children of which only 3 live with them, the youngest daughter being under  3 years old. The whole family lives in a cottage of their own. 

Felix's parents taught him farm work, an activity that also supports his large family. He has agricultural land that the Punray community grants.  In the parcels he plants different varieties of potatoes, peas, beans and vegetables such as carrots, lettuce, cabbage, among others.  He considers it more profitable to plant peas and potatoes, which have demand in the city and he brings them to the city of Lima for mass consumption. 

The main problem he points out are the low and high prices. "There are months when the price falls and I only recover capital, but yet we go on," he adds. Later, Felix wanted to buy a car to establish a transport service in their community to the city of Tarma.  Over time his efforts will not be the same for plowing. Felix also longs to see his little children grow up, and for that he will continue to work even more than now. 

This loan would be his 8th loan with MFP.  It's been 8 times that he has been working closely with his ​​communal bank, "New Jerusalem," with which he is satisfied by the achievements and common interests. With your help, Felix can buy fertilizers to enrich his land and thus sow peas for this new season.

loans.use: To buy bags of fertilizer.

loans.name: Parveen's Group

texts.en:
Parveen has applied for a loan from Kiva partner Asasah for her boutique business. She runs a boutique at her home from where she sells stitched and unstitched clothes to her community clients on profits. 

She is very talented lady who keeps herself updated about the latest trends and fashions. With the loan, she will buy clothes in bulk quantity with different varieties for the expansion of her boutique business.
 
Parveen is the mother of two sons. Each is involved in different work.
  
She is hopeful that her business will be expanded further after the loan investment and her family will be able to live a better financial life as a result.

loans.use: To buy clothes for the boutique business.

loans.name: Efua

texts.en: Efua Aya sells eggs, bread, and secondhand clothes at Eguafo, which she has done for the past five years. She is married and has two children. Her husband is a driver. She is responsible for assisting her husband in caring for their children. Efua Aya will use her loan to buy eggs and secondhand clothes. She hopes to expand her business.

loans.use: buy eggs and secondhand clothes to sell.

loans.name: Sériba

texts.fr:
Né  à Tinzanadougou préfecture de Sikasso, Monsieur Sériba est marié et père de 7 enfants, il réside avec ses deux épouses et leurs enfants dans une grande famille traditionnelle élargie à Sanoubougou I, un des quartiers populaires de la ville de Sikasso ( troisième région administrative de la république du Mali).
Monsieur Sériba après avoir mené plusieurs activités sans succès,  s’est initié au domaine de vente de bétail il y a environ 9 an. Il mène cette activité au marché de bétail du nouveau marché de Médine où il vend des moutons, chèvres, etc. Il est beaucoup sollicité de sa clientèle pour la qualité de son bétail. 
Pour satisfaire sa clientèle de plus en plus croissante, il décida de rejoindre l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso avec qui il est à son deuxième prêt individuel 
 Il sollicite ainsi ce deuxième prêt individuel pour acheter 20 petits ruminants dans les localités environnantes qui sont entre autres (Bamoukou, Kléla, Koro Barrage, etc.) lui permettant de mieux satisfaire sa clientèle de plus en plus croissante.
 Avec ce prêt il envisage réaliser un bénéfice mensuel de 150 000 FCFA qui sera utilisé essentiellement pour contribuer aux dépenses familiales, payer les intérêts de son prêt et investir le reste dans son activité.
texts.en:
Born in the Tinzanadougou Prefecture of Sikasso, Mr. Sériba is married with seven children. He lives with his two wives and their children in a traditional extended family in Sanoubougou I, one of the working-class districts in the city of Sikasso (third administrative region of the Republic of Mali).

After conducting several unsuccessful activities, Mr. Sériba introduced himself to selling livestock about nine years ago. He conducts this activity in the livestock section of the new Medina market where he sells sheep, goats, etc. He is much in demand by his clients for the quality of his livestock.

To satisfy his increasing number of customers, he decided to join the Soro Yiriwaso micro-finance institution where he is on his second individual loan cycle.

He is requesting this second individual loan to buy twenty small ruminants from communities in the surrounding area (among others Bamoukou, Kléla, Koro Dam, etc..). This will enable him to better serve his growing number of customers.

He expects this loan to generate a monthly profit of 150,000 FCFA to be used primarily in dealing with family expenses and paying loan interest. The remainder will be invested in his business activity.

loans.use: Buy sheep and goats

loans.name: Ghadeer

texts.en:
Ghadeer is a 28-year-old woman from Madaba, Jordan, and a mother of two children. 

Ghadeer sells clothes from her home and is requesting a loan of 500 Jordanian Dinar (JOD) to purchase more products for trading purposes. 

Ghadeer is looking to improve her income and provide enough money to finance the education of her children. 

Due to cutural issues the woman in the photo is Ghadeer's mother.

loans.use: to purchase clothes for trading purposes

loans.name: Nena

texts.en:
To make a living, Nena sells glassware and plasticware in the public market. She has been in this type of business for 19 years. Nena patiently runs this business because this is her family's primary source of income. Most of the products she sells are wall clocks and kitchenware. Nena is 50 years of age and married with three children. Her husband is her partner in managing their business. Most of the profit she earns from the business went to the education of her children, who are in college, high school, and elementary school.
 
Nena desires the growth and expansion of her business. With the business she manages, she is able to provide for the needs of her children in pursuing their education. With regards to achieving her desires, Nena is requesting a loan of 50,000 pesos to purchase additional glassware, plasticware, and kitchenware to sell in the market. She hopes to earn a higher income and further meet her family needs.

loans.use: to purchase additional glassware, plasticware, and other kitchenware to sell in the market

loans.name: Rosario

texts.es:
Rosario, de 22 años es una joven alegre. Hace 2 años se casó con Ronald, su esposo. Con quien todavía no tienen hijos, se quieren mucho y forjan su futuro en casa de sus suegros, ubicada en la localidad de Daniel Hernández. 
 Ella tiene las ganas de salir adelante y aunque está delicada de salud, por problemas con el estómago, no se declina. Mantiene la alegría y ganas de luchar por la vida. Junto a su hermana y su esposo, trabajan en el negocio de venta de leña, donde obtiene buenas ganancias. Pues ellos mismo elaboran, comprando árboles al por mayor. El trabajo es arduo sobre todo porque, tiene que cortar muchos árboles y hasta se quedan toda la noche realizando su labor. Porque tienen que tener muchos millares de leña, para comercializarlos en la ciudad de Huancayo, donde el precio es mucho mayor. Así pueden tener más ganancia. Ahora desea comprar su casa propia, pues está juntando dinero para hacer realidad su sueño. Ella pertenece al grupo solidario “las estrellas” y este es el primer crédito con MFP, por tanto espera de su colaboración, para continuar con sus objetivos. Por otro lado promete cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas, como en anterior crédito. Además le agrada ser parte de su asociación porque  todos sus integrantes son personas responsables y muy solidarias.
Rosario de recibir su apoyo; invertirá el dinero solicitado en la compra de árboles para realizar más leña.
texts.en:
Rosario is 22 years old and a cheerful young person. She got married 2 years ago to Ronald, her husband, with whom she has as yet to have children. They love each other very much and are building a future at their in-laws house located in the town of  Daniel Hernández. 

She has the desire to get ahead and although of a delicate disposition due to stomach problems, she refuses to give up. She remains positive with a desire to fight for life. Together with her sister and husband, she works selling firewood which makes them a healthy profit. They themsleves produce the firewood, buying trees wholesale. The work is especially hard as you have to chop up a lot of trees and even stay up all night to finish the work, because they have to have many peices of firewood to sell in the city of Huancayo where the price is a lot higher and gives them a bigger profit. She now wants to buy her own house and is saving money to realize her dream. She belongs to the communal bank "Las Estrellas" and this is her first loan with MFP and so hopes to have your help to pursue her goals. On the other hand, she agrees to make her repayments as with a previous loan. In addition she likes being a part of her communal bank because all the members are responsible people and very supportive.

Rosario, on receiving your help, will invest the requested money in the purchase of trees to produce more firewood.

loans.use: to buy more trees.

loans.name: Hawawu

texts.en: Hawawu has been selling eggs and frozen chicken in Esuekyir, near Abura, for 2 years. Hawawu is married to a mason and has 3 children. Hawawu uses her income to support her husband in paying their accommodation bills. She will use her loan to purchase more eggs for sale. Hawawu plans to use the new profit to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more eggs for sale

loans.name: Anastasia

texts.en:
Anastasia is a 55-year-old widow with 3 children, all of whom are working. She owns a house with neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food for herself.

Anastasia has operated a cereals business for the past 4 years; her potential clients are her neighbors. She faces a major challenge of lacking a sufficient number of customers. She dreams of establishing a retail shop.

With the requested loan of KES 15,000, she wants to purchase more stocks of maize and cow peas for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access funds to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more stocks of maize and cow peas for resale.

loans.name: Benkadi Group

texts.fr:
Benkadi est un groupe de l’association Kotognogontala de Ouelessebougou. Il regroupe 5 femmes qui se sont connues à travers des liens de parenté et de voisinage. Elles ont une moyenne d’âge de 30 ans. Mariées avec cinq enfants, elles mènent différentes activités  telles l’achat vente de condiments et la restauration à l’image de DEBI qui est la personne arrêtée au milieu. Elles vivent dans des grandes familles traditionnelles à Ouelessebougou dans la  préfecture de Kati (Région de Koulikoro, République du Mali). 
Elles sont dans le petit commerce depuis plusieurs années et sont très sollicitées dans leurs activités. 
Dans le souci de satisfaire le besoin croissant de leur clientèle, les membres du groupe ont décidé d’intégrer le programme crédit de Soro Yiriwaso il y a deux ans. Elles sont à leur troisième prêt solidaire. 
DEBI, qui est la présidente du groupe et très connue à Ouelessebougou, excelle dans les activités de restauration. Elle compte utiliser son prêt pour acheter de condiments alimentaires de différentes sortes et d’autres ingrédients pour sa restauration.  Elle s’approvisionne à Bamako et sur place auprès des grossistes  et vend ses aliments à Ouelessebougou en détail, au comptant et à crédit, à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes.   
Elle espère sur un bénéfice mensuel de 30.000FCFA somme qui lui  permettra de rembourser le prêt et de réinvestir dans son activité.

loans.use: Achat d’ingrédients pour la restauration

loans.name: Miguel Ángel

texts.es:
Miguel de 52 años de edad, es un citadino al que la oportunidad de  convertirse en microempresario le toco la puerta y el como todo buen colombiano no la desaprovechó. Desde hace 10 años gracias a los programas gratuitos que dictaba la alcaldía de su municipio, adquirió conocimiento sobre la reparación de aparatos eléctricos, lo que le permitió montar su propio negocio y mejorar su condición económica.  
Aunque su vida hoy se encuentra mejor, cuenta que antes de aprender el oficio le tocó laborar en diferentes actividades, “Fui ayudante de construcción y gracias a este trabajo logré ahorrar el dinero para convertirme en microempresario” estas son las palabras de Miguel quien se siente feliz por la oportunidad que le dio la vida de mejorar su condición económica. Hoy se encuentra solicitando un crédito para la compra de repuestos y adecuaciones locativas de su local.
Su mayor sueño es seguir creciendo y acreditar el negocio en su localidad.

loans.use: Compra de repuestos y adecuaciones locativas

loans.name: Roberto Greforio

texts.en:
Roberto is 60 years old and is married. He and his wife they work together in her business, they have a pharmacy, they have four sons and he learned about his business since his father started this kind of business as a pioneer in his city. He learned form his father the knowledge of how to make alternative medicine with flowers and plants for more than 40 years. He knows that winter season is very frequently flu sickness, he wants to increase his inventory of alternative medicines because has a lot of demand and people prefer natural medicine because they have less secondary effects. Roberto is requesting for a loan of US$ 925 to increase his inventory and offer to pay this loan in 6 months.

**"This text has been translated from the following original business description."

Don Roberto es un hombre de 60 años está casado y junto con su esposa atienden su negocio de farmacia , ellos tienen 4 hijos y aprendió el negocio desde su padre que fue uno de los pioneros en la ciudad de Victoria en el giro. De su padre también adquirió los conocimientos de botánica, lo que le ha permitido elaborar medicinas alternativas a base de hierbas y plantas por mas de 40 años. Conocedor que la temporada de invierno es época en que surgen con mucha frecuencia las enfermedades, quiere incrementar su inventario de medicinas alternativas, ya que son muy demandadas por sus clientes debido a que tienen menores efectos secundarios en las personas y la gente las prefiere por ser naturales. Él esta solicitando un crédito por $ 925 USD para incrementar su inventario de medicina alternativa y piensa pagarlo en un término de 6-12 meses.

loans.use: To purchase raw material for natural medicine

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Pamela would like to pay school fees

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Helen would like to buy a dairy cow

loans.name: Pánfilo

texts.es:
I'm almost done building a home for my family, but I need to finish the interior. When it's done we'll have a safe place of our own. That's why I'm asking for $1200.

Translated by a Kiva volunteer.

Estoy ya casi terminado mi casa solo me esta a siendo falta los acabados D. interior, para tenerla ya terminado y así poder traerme a mi familia a viviré a un lugar seguro y propio. Solicito $1,200.00 dlls para los acabados de interior de mi casa.

loans.use: To finish a home's interior.

loans.name: Yokubjon

texts.ru:
Yokubjon Y., 25 is married and has 2 children. He has high school education. For 12 years, he has been selling a variety of baked products. Since he was little, Yokubjon Y. has helped his mother to sell. Now, she constantly supports him in business. Yokubjon Y. joined MicroInvest in the beginning of this year with a loan of $450. After receiving the funds and with the help of gradually increasing line of credit, Yokubjon Y. began to pay cash for his goods, which helps him to pay less. He also purchased a permanent trading spot. In the future, Yokubjon Y. plans to increase the assortment of goods sold. His mother is on the photo.

Translated from Russian by Aleksandr Zhuk, Kiva Volunteer.

Якубов Ёкубчон – 25лет. Женат, имеет двоих детей, образование среднее. Занимается продажей разных видов печенья, вот уже 12лет. С малых лет помогал, матери в торговле и постепенной поддержкой в этой сфере является мать - Якубова С.. Начал кредитоваться в МЗФ «Микроинвест» в начале этого года с активами на сумму 450$. После получения и шагового увеличения займа он стал приобрести товар за наличные, что позволяет ему брать их подешевле. Также приобрел постоянную торговую точку. В будущем планирует увеличить ассортимент товара. На фото его мать.

loans.use: To increase the assortment of goods sold

loans.name: Ni Made Wardani

texts.id:
Retail stall was started by Ni Made Wardani after marrying I Putu Tantra. With the capital she had at the time, her retail stall was not complete. She sold items needed for daily lives of sorrounding citizens, like: rice, selection of light food, selection of drinks, etc. With Dinari's capital help, and support, Ni Made Wardani could add more and better variation to her retail stall. Ni Made Wardani also adds writing materials needed by school children. Her income increased compared to before. Today income could reach Rp200,000 (about US$22), for a nett profit of Rp50,000 (about $5.50). Ni Made Wardani hopes business would be better so that she could fulfill family needs and pay for children's school expenses.

Translated from Bahasa Indonesia by Gwan Liong Ang, Kiva volunteer.

Usaha Warung ini sudah dimulai oleh Ni Made Wardani sejak menikah dengan I Putu Tantra. Dengan modal yang dimilikinya saat itu, belum dapat melengkapi isi dari warungnya. Barang yang dijual yaitu barang keperluan hidup sehari - hari yang sangat diperlukan oleh masyarakat sekitarnya seperti beras, aneka macam makanan ringan, aneka macam minuman dan yang lainnya. Dengan bantuan modal dan pembinaan dari Yayasan DINARI, Ni Made Wardani dapat melengakapi warung dengan variasi lebih lengkap dan lebih banyak lagi. Ni made wardani juga menyediakan peralatan alat tulis yang sangat dibutuh anak – anak sekolah. Pendapatan setiap harinya juga meningkat dibandingkan dari sebelumnya. Saat ini pendapatan setiap hari mencapai Rp. 200.000,- dengan keuntungan bersih sebesar Rp.50.000,-. Ni Made Wardani berharap usaha dapat semakin maju sehingga dapat memenuhi kebutuhan keluarganya dan dapat membiayai sekolah anak

loans.use:
To add sales item so that it would be more complete

Menambah jumlah dagangan agar lebih lengkap

loans.name: Shahnoza

texts.en: Shahnoza is one of the active clients of Microinvest.  She became client in 2003 and during her activity she has increased the volume of her goods and attracted a lot of new clients. She has good skills at selling and her clients say that she has services them quickly and politely. They like her good assortment of clothes and now she requires another loan of 900 USD to further expand her business.

loans.use: Business expansion

loans.name: Nusrat

texts.en: “I live in Lahore with my family. My husband has been running an automobile workshop for the past three years. We need a loan to purchase some new equipment. Lately we have been borrowing money from a local microfinance institution Asasah and have invested in our business. Our automobile store is in old Lahore near the shrine. With the profits, I was able to get a medical procedure done and pay for my son’s wedding. I feel certain that I will be pay off your loan as well.”

loans.use: purchase equipment for our automobile workshop

loans.name: Jero Melati

texts.id:
Jero Melati is a tenacious housewife who never feels desperate in her life. Besides her kiosk business, Jero Melati is also selling chicken in the market. Jero Melati and her husband, Gusti Ketut Widartayasa, really prioritize their 3 children's education. With her will power and hard work, Jero Melati managed to fund their children's education. 2 of the children already graduated from high school and now they are working in Denpasar. The other one is still studying in junior high school. Jero Melati has run the kiosk business for almost 15 years. Now Jero Melati really needs additional capital for the kiosk. Jero Melati gets a loan of Rp 2,500,000 from Dinari. The loan will be used to add more varieties of merchandise such as variety of soft drink, snacks and also staple merchandises. Every morning after selling local chickens in Melaya market, Jero Melati buys merchandices in the market to be re-sold. Her daily profit is Rp 25,000 to Rp 30,000. Jero Melati hopes that with the additional capital she can gain more profit and expand the business.

Translated from Indonesian by Kustini Lim, Kiva volunteer.

Jero Melati seorang ibu rumah tangga yang ulet yang tidak pernah berputus asa dalam menghadapi hidup. Selain membuka usaha warung Jero Melati juga disibukkan dengan berjualan ayam di pasar. Jero Melati dan suaminya, Gusti Ketut Widartayasa, sangat memperhatikan pendidikan 3 orang anaknya. Dengan semangat dan kerja keras Jero Melati bisa menyekolahkan anaknya . 2 anaknya sudah tamat SMU dan sekarang sudah bekerja di Denpasar. Satu lagi masih duduk di bangku SMP. Jero melati menekuni usaha warung sudah hampir 15 tahun. Dan saat ini Jero Melati benar- benar membutuhkan modal untuk usaha warungnya. Jero Melati mendapatkan pinjaman dari Dinari sebesar Rp. 2.500.000,- Modal ini digunakan untuk menambah dagangan lebih banyak lagi seperti membeli beraneka macam minuman dan makanan ringan serta kebutuhan sehari –hari. Setiap pagi setelah selesai berjualan ayam kampung di pasar Melaya Jero Melati baru membeli dagangan dipasar untuk dijual kembali. Keuntungan yang diperoleh setiap hari Rp. 25.000,- s/d Rp.30.000,-. Dan Jero Melati berharap dengan bertambahnya modal yang dipergunakan dalam usaha ini keuntungannya pun bisa meningkat dan tetap berharap usaha ini nantinya akan berkembang.

loans.use: To purchase variety of merchandise

loans.name: Mon

texts.en:
Mrs. Mon P., 52 years old, sells grilled beef from her house in front of the Kompong Tom‘s city hall in Kompong Tom province. She has seven children and her husband, Mr. Orm Ri, also sells grilled beef. They both earn about $6 a day. Her daughter, Ms. Orm Mom, sells boiled eggs to customers around her village, and another daughter, Ms. Orm Cha, works in a hotel in Siem Reap province. Her son, Mr. Orm Sarak, is a bricklayer, and the rest are students.

She needs a loan of $500 to buy a second-hand motorcycle to use for transportation related to her business. She said that this loan can improve their living standard through efficient business transportation and reduce transport fees. She thanks Kiva for their support and promises to be accurate in her loan payment.

loans.use: To buy a second-hand motorcycle to use for transportation related to her business.

loans.name: Marina

texts.es:
Marina Fernández is an entrepreneur from Linares, Nuevo León. She began selling natural products when she realised that her growing children needed money for school fees and supplies. As her husband didn’t earn sufficient money as a schoolteacher, she decided to take a job helping a woman sell these products. At the beginning she was selling small quantities of the items to people with diabetes or undergoing detoxification or fighting obesity. As a result she became very well-known and earned lots of money for her employer. At this point she decided to start her own business and accept orders from customers. Currently one of her daughters helps her with the sales.

Marina needs a loan of US$950 which she will repay within 6 months. She will use the money to buy merchandise. With your help she will continue helping her husband with household expenses.

Translated from Spanish by Jane Agg, Kiva Volunteer.

Marina Fernández es una mujer emprendedora de Linares, Nuevo León. Se inicio en la venta de productos naturistas al ver que sus hijos iban creciendo y necesitaban mas dinero para colegiaturas y gastos escolares, y con el sueldo de su esposo quien se desempeña como maestro no era suficiente, por lo que decidió ayudarle a una señora a la venta de estos productos. Inicialmente vendía sobrecitos de los productos para personas con diabetes y para desintoxicar el cuerpo y combatir la obesidad, ya que ella tenia muchos conocidos le generaba a la Sra. para quien trabajaba muy buenas ganancias, por lo que resolvió hacer pedidos directamente y vender por su cuenta. Actualmente una de sus hijas le ayuda en la cobranza.

Ella necesita un crédito por US $950 que pagara en 6 meses para comprar mercancía. Con tu ayuda Marina seguirá apoyando a su esposo con la economía familiar

loans.use: Buy merchandise

loans.name: Vicente

texts.es:
Vicente comes from a humble home in the city of Juliaca. Since childhood, he has endured many hardships and financial difficulties due to the fact that his parents had few economic options. Currently, he lives in a small dwelling next to his dear siblings. They inherited the home due to the sad death of their parents a few years ago. To try to increase his income, Vicente bought a cycle and with a great deal of physical exertion he provides transportation services to the population of Juliaca. In addition, in his free time he works as a bricklayer. Thanks to his diligence, devotion and, most of all, his immense desire to get ahead, he has in mind purchasing other tools to earn extra income.

Translated from Spanish by Mary Lynn, Kiva Volunteer.

Vicente proviene de un humilde hogar de la ciudad de Juliaca, desde niño tubo muchas privaciones y dificultades económicas, debido a que sus padres tenían muy bajos recursos económicos.Actualmente vive en un pequeño domicilio junto a sus queridos hermanos, morada que heredaron de sus padres quienes desafortunadamente fallecieron hace ya varios años.Para tratar de generar sus ingresos económicos, Vicente adquirió un triciclo y a fuerza de mucho esfuerzo físico logra brindar servicio de movilidad a la población Juliaqueña, adicionalmente a esta labor en sus horas libres trabaja como maestro albañil, gracias a su diligencia, entrega y sobre todo a sus inmensas ganas de salir adelante, tiene en mente adquirir otra herramienta de trabajo similar para generar ingresos extras.

loans.use: Purchase tools for additional work.

loans.name: Prossy Kalungi’S Group

texts.en:
Prossy K. is a 48-year-old married mother of 5 children, ranging in age from 26 to 7. She runs a school canteen at Bugolo Junior School, ½ km away from where she lives in Lugala, a rural district of Kampala. She makes items such as samosas, half-cakes (a kind of fried dough), and pancakes (small patties like banana bread) to sell to the pupils. She has operated the canteen for the past 15 years and found it to be a profitable business. Before that, she was a teacher, but the pay was too low to pay school fees for her children, food and other expenses.

With a loan, she would like to add lined exercise books, pencils and other stationery items to her canteen. If she makes enough profit, she would like to get a small shop for herself rather than at school. At school, she explains, if you retire, someone else takes over the business. Her long-range plan is to build a house in the village so that if she retires, she will have somewhere to stay. She has paid back more than 5 loans

loans.use: Add more items to sell in the canteen

loans.name: Juan Bautista

texts.es:
Juan Bautista Ríos works very hard to be able to make improvements to his home, which has been damaged by natural disasters for a long time. To be able to continue with the repairs he has reached out to Ceprodel to obtain a loan. He will use it to purchase construction materials. He hopes he can obtain the loan to continue supporting his family.

Translated from Spanish by Libertad Leal, Kiva volunteer.

El caballero Juan Bautista Ríos es una persona que se dedica a laborar arduamente con el propósito de mejorar su vivienda el cual por mucho tiempo ha sido maltratada por los fenómenos adversos.

Por esta razón ha iniciado a mejorar las condiciones de su vivienda y para continuar con la reparación ha buscado el apoyo en Ceprodel para obtener el crédito para la compra de sus materiales de construcción. Espera que su crédito le sea otorgado para así continuar con el mantenimiento de su familia.

loans.use: To purchase contraction materials

loans.name: Marcos Aurelio

texts.es:
Marcos Aurelio works for a local business as a driver and messenger. He lives in the Villa Reconciliación neighborhood. He is 43 years old and married with two children, both still minors at home. His wife takes care of the house and the children. Marcos Aurelio will use the loan to make improvements on his home. With this capital he will build a small room in the front part of his house for the use of the family. Marcos Aurelio plan is to provide his family a dignified home as a way to improve their quality of life.

Translated from Spanish by Erin Corcoran, Kiva volunteer.

Don Marcos Aurelio trabaja para una empresa como conductor mensajero. Habita en el barrio Villa Reconciliación, tiene 43 años de edad, es casado, con 2 hijos menores de edad, la esposa de Marcos Aurelio es quien se encarga del cuido de la casa y de sus hijos. El uso del préstamo de Don Marcos Aurelio es para mejora de vivienda, con el dinero construirá un pequeño cuarto en la parte delantera de su casa el cual será para uso de la familia. Los planes de Don Marcos Aurelio son poder brindarle a su familia una vivienda digna, y así mejorar el nivel de vida.

loans.use: Construction of a room in his home.

loans.name: Hidaya's Hatuna Tabu Group

texts.en:
Hidaya is married with 3 children aged 7, 4, and 3 years old. She has been a juice and bites seller since April 2008. Every day, she works at her business and can earn a monthly profit of about US$ 25 from her sales.

Hidaya is now requesting a loan to open a new business. She will share this loan with her subgroup members Sharifa and Raifat, who have businesses dealing with shop ownership and charcoal and juice sales.

loans.use: To open a new business

loans.name: Salma

texts.en:
Salma is 37 years old. She is married and has 6 children. She has run her own shop since January 2008.

Every day Salma works from 7 a.m. to 6 p.m. at her business and can earn a monthly profit of about $115 from her sales. She is requesting a loan to buy more commodities to expand her business.

loans.use: To buy more commodities to expand her business.

loans.name: Maria Esther

texts.es:
María Esther inició el negocio por la necesidad de contar con un apoyo económico extra al de su marido, ya que tiene 4 hijos: Esther de 16 años, Laura de 15 años, Roberto de 13 años, Dalila de 8 años, todos ellos estudian por lo que los gastos se incrementaban y no les alcanzaba el dinero. Ella comenzó hace 5 años vendiendo hamburguesas los fines de semana en casa de su mama, posteriormente decidió rentar un local y vender otro tipo de alimentos diario.

Ella necesita un préstamo por US $275 que pagara en 4 meses para comprar materia prima y ofrecer otra variedad de platillos a sus clientes.
texts.en:
María Esther started her business out of a necessity to provide extra economic support to her husband since they have 4 children: Esther, 16 years old, Laura, 15 years old, Roberto, 13 years old, and Dalila, who is 8 years old, all of whom are studying which is why their expenses were increasing and lacked money. Five years ago she started selling hamburgers on the weekends in her mother's house, later she decided to rent a location and sell other types of daily foods. She needs a loan of $275 that she will repay in 4 months to buy raw materials to offer a greater variety of dishes to her clients.

Translated from Spanish by Donald Allen, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase raw material for her food selling business

loans.name: Sonia

texts.en: Sonia is a member of the Firmeza Village Bank; "firmeza" means “steadiness” in Spanish.  Sonia is married, with three children. With the help of her husband and children, she runs a book store with 8 computers that have internet access. She will use her loan to purchase books, pens, greeting cards and notebooks. With the savings she has accumulated she hopes that the interest will continue to grow. Her dream is to build her own house in Ayacucho.

loans.use: Buy books, pens, greeting cards and notebooks

loans.name: Mercedes

texts.es:
Mercedes tiene 48 años de edad, es madre soltera de 4 hijos, 3 con familia y uno que vive con ella. Estudió el segundo grado de Primaria y vive en el Jr. Daniel Alcides Carrión  s/n, distrito de Juli, provincia de Chucuito, departamento de Puno.

Con el primer préstamo de S/. 300 que recibió de Manuela Ramos compró materiales para bordados en bayeta. A la edad de 20 años empezó a realizar negocio, traía productos de limpieza y los llevaba a Puno, y al mismo tiempo seguía haciendo trabajos de Artesanía, negocio al que actualmente se dedica.

Con este préstamo de S/. 300, el cual será cancelado en 4 cuotas, comprará 2 kg. de lana y 20 metros de bayeta para seguir confeccionando bordados.

Su mayor deseo es que su hijo sea profesional y al mismo tiempo abrir una Ferretería.
texts.en:
Mercedes is 48 years old, she is a single mother of 4 children. Three of them already have a family and one still lives with her. She studied until the second year of alementary and she lives in Daniel Alcides Carrión street, district of Juli, Chucuito province in the department of Puno. With the first loan of $100 that she received from Manuela Ramos she bought materials for embroideries in baize. She started doing business at age 20, she was bringing cleaning products and taking them to Puno and at the same time she kept on doing handycrafts which is business she is doing at present. With this loan of $100 which will be repaid over a period of 4 months, she will buy 2 kg of wool and 20 meters of baize to keep on making embroideries. Her biggest desire is that her son becomes a professional and at the same time, he can open a Hardware store.

Translated from Spanish by Ana Gabriela Clark, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Comprará dos kg. de lana y 20 mts. de bayeta.

loans.name: Sharbat

texts.ru: Одинаев Шарбат житель района Абдурахмони Джоми. Возрст 40 лет, женат и имеет шестерых детей. Имеет средне-техническое образование. Использует специальность в бизнесе. Работает сварщиком. Делает печки и другие изделия из металла , а так же работает с деревом. Свои изделия продает на рынке , а так же делает их на заказ.Планирует получить кредит для того, чтобы закупить материал. Погасить кредит сможет в течение 12 месяцев.Является основным кормильцем семьи , поэтому он хочет увеличить свой бизнес.
texts.en:
Sharbat O. lives in the Abdurahmon Jomi region. He is 40 years old, married and has six children. Sharbat has a technical school degree as a welder and uses his skills to support his family. He makes ovens and other equipment out of metal, and works with wood as well. Sharbat sells the ovens at the local market and also makes them to order. He wants to take out this loan to purchase raw materials and he is planning to pay it back in the next 12 months. Sharbat is the main provider for his family so he is very interested in expanding his welding business to increase profits.

Translated from Russian by Anya Lyuksyutova, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of raw materials

loans.name: Ambe Anna

texts.en:
Anna N. was married to Fuh Geofred and had four children. She is now divorced from her husband due to matrimonial problems. She is a very hard-working lady from childhood as she has proven beyond doubt in managing and taking care of the kids despite the hard and harsh nature of her husband that caused them now to be apart. Being a businesswoman, she had been working hard and taking care of the children as concerns their school needs and other necessities for them even before her divorce.

This is her fifth time requesting a loan from GHAPE. Her previous loans have been well managed and utilized. The most recent one was used for embroidering dresses and bed sheets, poultry and pig farming. Anna has confidence in this business because there is a high demand for foodstuffs and goods that are imperishable last for a long time. She promised to used the profit from the loan in educating her children and buy a plot for herself and increase the management capital.

The Grounded and Holistic Approach to People's Empowerment (GHAPE) is a non-profit NGO based in Bamenda, Cameroon. GHAPE works towards the empowerment of the poor and poverty alleviation through a highly multi-faceted approach. Every client is trained in business management, basic health, life skills, financial management, profits and losses, and family values. Clients are also required to contribute a small amount into a personal savings account; most clients save much more than the minimum requirement. GHAPE instills a sense of family and community in its clients and staff and a strong bond of trust has developed between the organization and its clients.

loans.use: buying beans, corn, and transportation

loans.name: Isagani

texts.en: Mr Isagani L., 47, a resident of Tumpagon, Cagayan de Oro City, Southern Philippines is happily maried with 5 children. The realization of his business plan for a retail store started when he got an access to credit from HSPFI Microfinance Program. His direct customers are his neighbors and neighboring villages. Isagani wants to expand his mini mart by purchasing additional products like sugarcane, rice, beverages and dairy products.

loans.use: To expand his business by purchasing another products for sale like rice, dairy products and beverages.

location.town: Tumpagon, Cagayan de Oro, Misamis Oriental

loans.name: Shabana Zafar Iqbal Group

texts.en:
Shabana baji is a thirty-nine-year-old married lady and has been a resident of Lahore, in Pakistan, for the last twenty-five years. She is married to Z. I., and he has had a carpet weaving business for the last six years. He learned this art from his father. Shabana baji is the mother of four children - two sons and two daughters. All of her children are getting an education from a school which is located near their house. Shabana baji helps her husband in his carpet weaving business. She is applying for a loan to buy materials (colored thread, tools) for weaving carpets. 

Shabana baji is the group leader of another four women from her locality. Shahnaz baji wants a loan to buy groceries for her grocery shop. Razia begum baji wants a loan to buy a molding machine. Shahnaz kosar baji wants a loan to buy electrical supplies (wires, switch boards) to sell. Safia baji wants a loan to buy a washing machine for her laundry business. 

This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

loans.use: to buy materials for carpet weaving business

loans.name: Zaila

texts.en: Zaila K. is a small businesswoman. She runs a café at Tandika ward in Dar es Salaam. She employs two workers who assist her in serving the customers. She purchases the business requirements from Kariakoo city market and the surrounding food shops. Income generated from the business is used to meet her customers' demand. She is requesting a loan of Tshs 1,000,000 to expand the business by purchasing more business items.

loans.use: To expand the business

loans.name: Irina

texts.en:
Irina is married with two children. She has two businesses selling clothing and food at the central market in Parvograd city. These two businesses are independent but run at the same time.

Irina has been in these businesses for two years. Actually, her whole family is in small business. Her husband sells trees, while her son has his own business and sells various home products. Irina's business goal is to improve her business conditions and build her own kiosk.

Irina would like to borrow 10,900 UAH to increase inventory. She would purchase more inventory and offer her clients a larger variety of goods. Irina believes this would help her to reach her business goal.

loans.use: To increase the inventory

loans.name: Ni Komang Wati

texts.en:
Ni Komang Wati - (DNR.M-0679) is a 50-year-old woman living in the town of Brawantangi - Melaya. She is married and has one school-aged child. To making a living, Ni Komang Wati owns & operates a business venture in the agriculture sector raising livestock. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from raising pigs for sale. Ni Komang Wati has been engaged in this business for over five years and earns approximately 300,000 - 400,000 Indonesian Rupiah (about US $29 - $38) a month from these activities.

In 2007, Ni Komang Wati joined DINARI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Ni Komang Wati has successfully repaid a previous loan of 1,500,000 rupiah (about US $144) from DINARI. This previous loan was used to expand the shelter for her livestock.

Ni Komang Wati is now requesting a loan of 2,600,000 IDR which will be used to purchase livestock feed & other supplies. The loan will be the fourth she has taken out from DINARI. Ni Komang Wati plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to financially support her immediate family members.

About DINARI:

The mission of DINARI is to strive for the preservation of the environment, to empower the poor, and to provide socio-economic development opportunities to small business owners.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in Bahasa while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

Ni Komang Wati - (DNR.M-0679) merupakan 50 tahun wanita. Dia (perempuan) tinggal di kota Brawantangi - Melaya. Dia (perempuan) menikah dan memiliki 1 anak usia sekolah. Untuk membiayai hidup, Ni Komang Wati memiliki & menjalankan usaha. Bisnis beroperasi di sektor pertanian. Tujuan utama bisnis tersebut adalah memelihara ternak. Meskipun bukan satu-satunya sarana untuk menghasilkan pendapatan, sumber utama penghasilan bisnis tersebut terutama berasal dari beternak babi untuk dijual. Ni Komang Wati sudah menjalankan bisnis ini selama lebih dari 5 tahun. Dari kegiatan-kegiatan ini, Ni Komang Wati menghasilkan sekitar 300,000 - 400,000 IDR sebulan.

Dalam 2007, Ni Komang Wati bergabung DINARI untuk mendapatkan akses ke layanan keuangan untuk membantu meningkatkan -nya kondisi kehidupan dan kemampuan untuk menjalankan kegiatan bisnis. Ni Komang Wati meminta pinjaman untuk pertama kalinya dari DINARI. Pinjaman sebelumnya ini digunakan untuk memperluas tempat berteduh/kandang bagi ternak peminjam. Dia (perempuan) sekarang meminta pinjaman baru sebesar 2,600,000 IDR. Pinjaman saat ini akan digunakan untuk untuk membeli pakan ternak & pasokan lain. Pinjaman ini akan menjadi 4th pinjaman yang diambil oleh peminjam dari DINARI. Ni Komang Wati berencana untuk menggunakan pendapatan tambahan yang dihasilkan dari bisnis untuk mendukung keuangan anggota keluarga langsung peminjam.

Tentang DINARI:

Misi DINARI adalah memperjuangkan kelestarian lingkungan, memberdayakan kaum miskin, dan menyediakan kesempatan pembangunan sosial ekonomi bagi pemilik usaha kecil.

*Catatan: Untuk memaksimalkan efisiensi & menurunkan biaya, pinjaman ini ditempelkan menggunakan templat sehingga dapat diterjemahkan otomatis oleh Kiva. . Mengingat bahwa terjemahan manual atas profil memakan biaya besar, Kiva menciptakan templat ini untuk Mitra Lapangan untuk memungkinkan mereka terus menempelkan pinjaman dalam Bahasa sambil memberikan informasi yang bermutu & akurat kepada para pemberi pinjaman Kiva.

loans.use: To buy feed & other supplies

loans.name: Leydi

texts.es: Leydi tiene 32 años, es madre soltera y vive con sus dos hijos y su madre. Desde hace 7 años se dedica a la venta de juguetes en todas sus variedades, de forma ambulante, y generalmente afuera de los colegios, contando con la compañía y apoyo de su madre. Lo que le gusta de su trabajo es que conoce varios lugares y muchas veces mantiene conversaciones muy entretenidas con las personas que va conociendo durante su camino. Leydi considera que la rentabilidad de su negocio de debe a que tiene ventas diarias, con las que sostiene las necesidades básicas de su familia. Para el futuro, quiere alquilar un local para su juguetería. Este es su 3er préstamo con MFP, y le gusta trabajar con su banco comunal porque entre todos se apoyan y existe mucha comunicación entre sus miembros. Con el dinero que viene solicitando comprará más juguetes de los últimos modelos para incrementar sus ventas.
texts.en:
Leydi is 32 and a single mother. She lives with her two children and her mother. For seven years she has been selling all types of toys. She is a street vendor, and she generally sells outside of schools. Her mother accompanies her and helps. What she likes about her work is that she knows lots of places, and she often has very engaging conversations with the people that she meets along the way. Leydi thinks her business is profitable because she has daily sales, which support the family’s basic needs. In the future she wants to rent a space for a toy store. This is her third loan with MFP. She likes working with her community bank because they are supportive, and there is good communication between members. The loan she is asking for is to buy more of the latest model toys to increase her sales.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increase merchandise

loans.name: Erdenezorig

texts.en:
Erdenezorig B. lives with his wife and her 3-year-old daughter in Arhangai province, one of Mongolia's central provinces. Her daughter goes to a local kindergarten.

Erdenezorig runs a small retail business in food products with his wife. He buys food products, including baked goods, soft-drinks, dairy products, etc., from the local wholesale markets and his wife sits at the rented stall and retails the products in the local food market.

Erdenezorig started his business in 2007 with small capital of 50,000 MNT ($1 = 1,450 MNT). Their business capital currently ranges from 400,000 MNT to 500,000 MNT. In the future, they aim to expand their food retail business by adding more variety of food items. Erdenezorig requests a loan to purchase more food products for his business.

loans.use: To buy more food products for his business

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Interior finishing

loans.name: Mastura

texts.ru:
MLF “MicroInvest” is one of the leading microfinance organizations, rendering credit services to the population of Tajikistan. Following step of its development, MLF “MicroInvest” sees in transformation into Microloan Deposit-taking Organization. Therefore in October, 2008 MLF “MicroInvest” together with LLC “Frontiers” have founded Limited Liability Company Microloan Deposit-taking Organization “Arvand”
      “Arvand” being assignee of “MicroInvest, continues to carry out its mission which is to improve the standard of living of the population and create new opportunities for social and economic development by providing qualitative financial-technical services to entrepreneurs of Tajikistan. 
Мастура торгует на рынке Панчшанбе  маслом разных сортов. Ей масло поставляют фирмы и поставщики. В период кредитования она расширила ассортимент своего товара и увеличила свой бизнес. Для того чтобы сохранить продукт ей необходимо приобрести холодильник витрину. Мастура очень благодарна за поддержку малого бизнеса
texts.en:
MLF “MicroInvest” is one of the leading microfinance organizations, rendering credit services to the population of Tajikistan. Following step of its development, MLF “MicroInvest” sees in transformation into Microloan Deposit-taking Organization. Therefore in October, 2008 MLF “MicroInvest” together with LLC “Frontiers” have founded Limited Liability Company Microloan Deposit-taking Organization “Arvand” “Arvand” being assignee of “MicroInvest, continues to carry out its mission which is to improve the standard of living of the population and create new opportunities for social and economic development by providing qualitative financial-technical services to entrepreneurs of Tajikistan.

Mastura sells different kinds of butter on the Panschabe market. She gets the butter from suppliers and also direct from manufacturers. During her credit history she has expanded the assortment of her merchandise and expanded her business. She needs to buy a display refrigerator so that she can keep the butter for long periods. Mastura is very thankful for the support of the small business.

Translated from Russian by Elena Fedorchuk, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy a display refrigerator

loans.name: Jhon Robert

texts.es:
Nuestro socio es el Sr. Jhon, el vive en la av. Collasuyo O-18, perteneciente  ala ciudad del Cusco.

Nuestro socio tiene 41 años de edad, es casado y tiene 2 hijos, él es docente en la comunidad de  huarocondo situado en el distrito de Anta, nuestro socio viaja todos los días muy temprano por la mañana hasta Anta que está a 1 hora de la ciudad del Cusco, y retorna todos los días a su casa en Cusco, trabaja de lunes a viernes como profesor de primaria, nuestro socio requiere el préstamo para invertir en algo personal, que él prefiere mantenerlo en secreto hasta que se concrete su sueño.

Nuestro socio agradece el apoyo brindado mediante este medio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de su deuda en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
Sr. Jhon lives on Av. Collasuyo O-18, which is in the city of Cusco. He is 41 years old, married, and a teacher in the community of Huarocondo, which is in the Anta District. Every day he leaves early in the morning because Anta is 1 hour away, and then returns to his home in Cusco. He works Monday through Friday as an elementary school teacher. He is requesting a personal loan and prefers to keep his reasons secret until his dream is realized. He appreciates the support provided through this medium and is committed to making his payments on time.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Personal use

loans.name: Magdalene

texts.en: Magdalene rears pigs. She is 52 years old and married with 4 children. She lives in Benin City, Edo State, Nigeria and has been in the business for the past 4 years. She is requesting the loan amount of N 100,000 to purchase more piglets to rear and to sell. She thanks all her Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase piglets to raise

loans.name: Emma

texts.es:
Emma tiene 50 años, es madre soltera, tiene 4 hijos, quienes ya son independientes y viven fuera de casa, en la actualidad ella vive sola en su casa propia. Desde que tenía 10 años se ha dedicado a vender frutas y verduras regionales en un puesto del mercado que está a 30 minutos de su casa. Para adquirir estos productos frescos y de buena calidad tiene que levantarse muy temprano para comprarles a los agricultores que llegan a los puertos fluviales de su ciudad. Lo que le gusta de su trabajo es que la mantiene activa y libre de los problemas económicos, además a Emma le gusta mucho vender y dar una buena atención a sus clientes. Por otro lado, le es muy rentable porque vende todos los días, durante todo el día y no tiene otros gastos más que para ella.
Este es su 7mo préstamo con MFP, aunque a veces surgen problemas con algunas personas de su grupo por falta de pago, en conjunto logran solucionarlos, por ello está contenta con su banco comunal. Con el dinero que viene solicitando comprará más frutas y verduras para incrementar sus ventas.
texts.en:
Emma is 50 years old. She is a single mother. She has for children, who are independent and live outside the house. Now she lives alone in her own house. Since she was ten years old, she has sold regional fruits and vegetables in a market in a stall at a market that is 30 minutes from her house. In order to acquire these products fresh and in good quality, she has to wake up very early in order to buy them from the farmers who arrive at the river ports in her city. What she likes about her work is that it keeps her active and free from economic problems. In addition, Emma enjoys sales and paying attention to her clients. Furthermore, it’s very profitable because she sells everyday, all day, and her only expenses are for herself. This is her seventh loan with MFP. Even though problems come up with some members of her group because they miss payments, they work together to arrive at a solution. Because of this, she is happy with her communal bank. With the money that comes in, she will buy more fruits and vegetables to increase her sales.

Translated from Spanish by Molly Trad, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increase in merchandise

loans.name: Kasifa

texts.en:
Kasifa is 27 years-old and married with three children, aged four and nine years, who attend school. She also takes care of additional family members. Kasifa lives in a rented one-roomed house with five other people. There is no electricity or piped water in the house. The family eats three meals per day.

Kasifa lives and works in semi urban area which in the outskirts of Kampala in Ndeeba Mpomba zone. She works seven days-a-week, buying tomatoes and other fruits from the market to avoid transport costs. She doesn’t pay rent but pays daily market dues of 700 UGX a day .She sells to all types of people, and has been in this business for six years, and with MCDT for seven. This is her fourteenth loan working with the same group mates. She wants to use this loan to buy more tomatoes, cabbages, and carrots. Kasifa aspires to see her business grow bigger so that she can start buying directly from farmers.

loans.use: to buy more tomatoes, cabbages, and carrots

loans.name: Emiamor

texts.en:
Emiamor R. is 32 years of age, married to Peter R.,who is a tricycle driver and also a farmer. They have three children; Jed Bryan-10 years of age, grade 5 student, John Lester- 6 years old, and their youngest is Kaye Terine- 3 years of age, a preschooler. They are residing harmoniously at San Pablo, Alicia, a rural area, approximately 12 kilometers away from the national highway, she illustrates also their area as peaceful baranggay, and most of the people live there are very industrious. One of their sources of income is farming.
Emiamor manages a hog raising business and her net income in hog raising is PHP 2,000.00 every three months, she wants to avail a loan amount of PHP 12,000.00 to purchase some hog feeds. Aside from hog raising, she is also busy in selling Avon cosmetics products.She believes that patience is one character that we must develop in order to have a productive life.

loans.use: Additional capital to buy hog feeds

loans.name: Asenath

texts.en:
Asenath O. is a married woman and the mother of 2 girls and 2 boys. She is the sole owner of a construction supply business, which is commonly called a "hardware" in Kenya. During the post-election skirmishes, Asenath lost her building to a fire started by demonstrators. Since then she has applied for one loan from Kiva, and that loan, she says, has helped her back to her feet.

Asenath is a strong-willed woman, and she has used part of the initial loan to restart building and renovations. Her construction supply business is doing well she says, but she would like to get it back to the heights where it was two years ago. Asenath would like a loan of Kshs. 90,000.

loans.use: To restock contruction supplies at her hardware business

loans.name: Seng

texts.en:
Seng S., 53, is married with three school-aged children. He resides in Battambong Province, Cambodia, with his wife and children. To make a living, he operates his motorbike as a taxi driver everywhere in the town, earning an income of $5 per day. The family is assisted mainly by his wife, who is engaged in a business of selling sugar cane juice, earning collectively an income of $8 per day as a primary source of income for the family to help cover the household expenses.
