Mr. S. and his family members are seeking to improve their standard of living. Therefore, he is asking for a loan of $800 to purchase a new motorbike to improve his current business. His old motorbike is unreliable and is often in need of repair, so he has decided that he wants to replace it.

loans.use: Buy a new motorbike

loans.name: Imelda

texts.es: Imelda tiene 74 años de edad, no es el primer financiamiento que ha solicitado, por lo que se preocupo por recoger el dinero para realizar el pago de las cuotas. La actividad económica es la venta de ropa usada. Hace más de 3 años que se dedica a este negocio, con su propio esfuerzo y con los financiamientos ha logrado invertir en lo necesario de su negocio para obtener más clientes y nuevos productos. Ella solicita este financiamiento para capital de trabajo para la compra de pantalones, ciertas camisas y algunos vestidos ya que se acercan temporadas festivas y tiene ciertos clientes que le solicitan este tipo de ropa porque no tienen el suficiente dinero para ofrecer más, esta es una ventaja que ella tiene pues les ofrece a sus clientes lo que necesita. Esta señora tiene muchos sueños y siempre piensa es su negocio y tener un lugar para ofrecer sus productos.
texts.en:
Imelda, 74, has sold second-hand clothing for the past 3 years. Thanks to her own efforts and financing she has succeeded in investing enough to get more customers and new products. She requests this financing to buy pants, certains shirts and some dresses since the Christmas holidays are approaching and she has customers who are asking for this type of clothing because they have limited resources themselves and can't afford higher prices. This is an edge she has because she offers her customers what they need. She has many dreams and always is thinking about her business and in having a place from which to offer her products. This isn't the first loan she has requested so she made the effort to pick up the money to start repaying.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital.

loans.name: Nassiba

texts.en: Nassiba is a 60-year-old widow. She has been working in tailoring and sewing for the past 23 years. After the death of her husband, she became the only provider for her only child. Today Nassiba is asking to borrow $1,000 to buy a new sewing machine and tools needed for her business.

loans.use: To buy a new sewing machine and tools

loans.name: Dora Josefa

texts.es:
En el Mercado Ivan Montenegro, la señora Dora Josefa A. se ha dedicado desde hace siete años a la venta de ropa de todo tipo tanto para damas, caballeros y niños la que es comercializada en su establecimiento propio.

Anteriormente ella vendía la ropa ambulantemente en las calles del Mercado pero gracias a sus grandes esfuerzos, ahora vende en su establecimiento. El crédito lo está solicitando para la compra de la ropa para continuar ofreciéndola a sus clientes y así mejorar sus condiciones de vida.
texts.en:
In the Ivan Montenegro market, Dora Josefa A. has sold clothing for seven years. She sells all types of clothing for women, men, and children in her own establishment. Previously, Dora sold her products on foot in the streets of the market, but now, thanks to her hard efforts, she has her own stall. With this loan, she will buy more clothing to continue to satisfy the needs of her clients, as well as improve her quality of life.

Translated from Spanish by jeffrey hersk, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy clothing to sell

loans.name: Amy

texts.fr: Amy D. est une femme  de 34 ans qui s’active dans le commerce de jus de fruits locaux qu’elle prépare elle même. Les revenus générés lui permettent de participer à l’amélioration des conditions de vie, de santé et de scolarité de sa famille.
texts.en:
Amy D. is a woman of 34 who sells fruit juice made out of local fruit that she prepares herself. Her income allows her to participate in improving living conditions for her family, as well as seeing to their health concerns and school expenses.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: preparation and sale of local fruit juice

loans.name: Gembom Theresia

texts.en:
Theresia is a widow with five children, and she lives in Nkwen, a quarter in Bamenda, Cameroon. She will invest her loan in the cultivation of crops like yams, cassava, and vegetables, and in the selling of drinks. This is Theresia's second loan; she has been a member since 2008. This loan will help to increase cultivation on her existing farms and improve the farming method to enable her to have better yields and also expand her business. She will also be able to purchase improved seedlings for better results. She plans to use the manure of pigs and fowl for crop cultivation.

With the profits from this loan, Theresia will construct a house for herself and children. She will also pay her children’s school fees and ensure that they are well prepared for school. She would like to purchase more seedlings. Her training in business management that she received from GHAPE will help her to invest this loan in the most efficient and productive manner.

The Grounded and Holistic Approach to People's Empowerment (GHAPE) is a non-profit NGO based in Bamenda, Cameroon. GHAPE works towards the empowerment of the poor and poverty alleviation through a highly multifaceted approach. Every client is trained in business management, basic health, life skills, financial management, profits and losses, and family values. Clients are also required to contribute a small amount into a personal savings account; most clients save much more than the minimum requirement. GHAPE instills a sense of family and community within its clients and staff.

loans.use: To clear cultivable land and increase farm size

loans.name: Flor Civilina

texts.es:
Flor Civilina Guaman C., tiene 25 años, vive en unión libre, y  tiene dos hijos.  Vive en el cantón de San Miguel en la provincia de Bolívar.

La socia es miembro de la ventanilla rural Calzado Solidario, es un recinto que se encuentra a quince minutos del Cantón San Miguel en la vía a la costa.  Son 19 socios en total, los cuales la mayoría se dedican a la agricultura y la crianza de animales menores.

Trabaja en la agricultura para incrementar la economía de la familia.  Los cultivos que más sobresalen son el maíz, papas y en pocas cantidades siembra legumbres.  Vende los productos en la feria de San Miguel y vende en el mercado mayorista de la ciudad de Quito.

La cultura principal es el carnaval que se celebra todos los años en febrero y  la fiesta del patrón San Miguel además aprovecha esta fiesta para reunirse con la familia.

La socia solicita el crédito para comprar terrenos para sembrar en tierras propias y obtener ingresos para ayudar a la familia sobre todo a los hijos en la educación.  Su meta es tener una buena actividad económica para la familia.  Los desafíos que enfrenta son los problemas climáticos y las enfermedades que afectan a los cultivos.
texts.en:
Flor Civilina Guaman C., age 25, lives in a common law relationship and has two children. She lives in the canton of San Miguel in Bolívar province.

Flor is a member of the Calzado Solidario communal bank, which is located 15 minutes from the San Miguel canton on the road to the coast. This has 19 members in all, most of who are engaged in agriculture and the raising of small animals.

She works in agriculture in order to increase the finances of her family. The crops that do best are corn and potatoes. She also plants a small quantity of vegetables. She sells her products in the San Miguel market and in the city of Quito’s wholesale market.

The principal cultural event of the area is the Carnival, which is celebrated every year in February. She also enjoys the festival of the patron saint San Miguel for a reunion with her family.

Flor is applying for a loan in order to buy land so that she can plant crops on her own fields and obtain income to help her family and, above all, help with the education of her children. Her goal is to have a good business for her family. The challenges she faces are climate problems and sicknesses that affect her crops.

Translated from Spanish by Richard Brown, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of land.

loans.name: Batsaihan

texts.en:
Batsaihan is 46 years old and lives with his wife and their four children in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. He and his family live together in a house on their own plot of land. His wife is unemployed, but she sells spare parts from their yard.

Batsaihan has been operating a spare car parts trading business at the ”Uguumur” trading center since 2005. In addition, he keeps the largest spare parts in his yard, where his wife sells them.

Batsaihan has increased his working capital previously using a loan from XacBank. He has been planning to expand his business and to rent a counter at a new location. He was able to purchase a 20-ton container with his business profits. By doing this, he was able to sell spare parts at “Uguumur” trading center. He has great business experience that he gained over the years.

Batsaihan is a very hardworking and responsible person. He is focused on the future and says, “I would like to purchase a house for my oldest son.” Batsaihan is requesting a 2,000,000 tugrug loan to purchase a used truck with a trailer to sell it as spare parts for a profit.

loans.use: To purchase a used truck with a trailer for spare parts

loans.name: Sariyamou Group

texts.fr:
Les membres du groupe Sariyamou sont essentiellement des femmes mariées  ayant en moyenne  38 ans, 5 enfants et vivant la plupart dans des familles monogames à Sanoubougou II un des quartiers de la ville de Sikasso, 3ème région administrative du Mali. 
Elles collaborent avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso afin de satisfaire le besoin de leur clientèle et sont à leur  premier prêt.
Elles font la vente de  bois de chauffe, de l’encens, des tubercules, de la restauration et  des articles  divers de boutique.
Avec leur nouveau prêt, elles comptent acheter, 1chargement de camionnette en bois de chauffe,  10kg de guénni, 3 types de parfums, 20 bouteilles  vides pour l’encens, 8 sacs de 100kg de tubercules, 1sac de 100kg de riz, 5 paquets de condiments pour la restauration et 5 colis de divers articles d’étalage. 
Elles s’approvisionnent au marché de Sikasso ville et les villages avoisinants.
Elles vendent au marché de Sanoubougou, dans les autres quartiers de la ville de Sikasso et à domicile. Elles vendent au comptant à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes.
Elles envisagent réaliser chacune un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 25.250 FCFA dont une partie sera utilisée pour l’épargne et les besoins de la famille, l’autre partie sera investie dans les activités.
texts.en:
The members of the Sariyamou group are for the most part married, and on average are 38 years old with five children, living in monogamous families in the Sanoubougou II neighborhood of Sikasso, in the third administrative region of the Republic of Mali. They collaborate with the Soro Yiriwaso MFI to satisfy their customers’ needs and are requesting a first group loan. They retail firewood, incense, root tubers, food preparations and various store items. With their new loan they will buy: one pickup load of firewood, 10 kilos of guéni (root used to make incense), 3 different types of perfume, 20 empty incense containers, eight 100-kilo bags of root tubers, five packages of condiments for food preparations, and five packages of various store display items. They get their supplies from the Sikasso market and in neighboring villages. They sell their products in the Sanoubougou market, in the other neighborhoods of Sikasso, and they also do home delivery. They sell for cash to a customer base of both men and women. They hope to reach average monthly earnings of 25,250 FCFA each, of which part will be devoted to savings and family needs, and the remainder reinvested in the business activities.

Translated from French by René McConnell, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy various products

loans.name: Chelsea Group

texts.en:
This is a group of small-scale businesspeople in Makeni, a city in northern Sierra Leone. They named their group 'Chelsea' (named after their favorite English football team). They have come to SMT, a partner of Kiva in Sierra Leone, to seek a loan of SLL 800,000 in order to expand their businesses. 

The leader of the group is Gibo Akim K.. Gibo who was born in Makeni is a 33-year-old. He is married and has two children – one in secondary school and the other is not of school-going age. Gibo has been selling soft drinks for countless years now. With the help of this loan, he will buy more crates of soft drinks to sell.

loans.use: Buy crates of soft drinks to sell

loans.name: Chourn

texts.en:
Chourn Sokhy, 26, is married and resides with his wife in Takeo Province, Cambodia, an area known for pre-Angkorean temples. He sells mobile phones for an income of about $3 per day. His wife provides hairdressing and clothing services for wedding parties, earning an income of $3 per day to help cover the family expenses.  

Sokhy is requesting a loan of $1,200 to purchase more mobile phones for resale. In the future, he would like to use any additional profit to expand his business. This is his first loan from CREDIT, a long-standing Kiva partner in Cambodia.

loans.use: Buy mobile phones for resale

loans.name: Anna Kamanthe

texts.en:
Anna is a 39-year-old business lady who is widowed and has one child, 8 years old. She has an embroidery shop where she makes curtains and seat covers to sell to her clients in Tassia, Nairobi. Anna’s business gives her a monthly profit of 40,000 Kenyan shillings.

Anna was introduced to KADET by an existing group and wants to use her loan to buy raw materials (lace, embroidery thread, etc.) for her business.

Anna wants to grow her business and open a branch in Tassia where she intends to use her profits to buy a piece of land and a car. She is hardworking and independent.

loans.use: To buy materials for her embroidery shop

loans.name: Rosalinda

texts.en:
Rosalinda M. is from the town of Banga. She is 35 years old, is married, and has two infant children.

Rosalinda owns and operates a business planting and harvesting rice for sale. She has been engaged in her business for over nine years already.

In August 2009, Rosalinda joined CEVI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan from CEVI.

Rosalinda is requesting a new loan of 10,000 PHP which will be used to purchase fertilizer such as manure. This loan will be her fifth from CEVI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement her family's income.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizer such as manure

loans.name: Maïmouna

texts.fr: Maïmouna B. est une femme de 35 ans, elle est mariée et mère de 09 enfants en charge et tutrice de 02 filles. Elle est membre du Banc Villageois de SINTHIANG COUNDARA depuis le 22 janvier 2003 et a 14 fois de suite reçu de crédit. Elle a toujours remboursé sans difficulté. Elle fait une activité d'embouche ovine, elle achète des chèvres et des mouton qu'elle engraisse pendant au mois 4 mois pour les vendre dans les marchés hebdomadaires de sa localité. A côté de cette activité elle vend sur une table de fortune le petit déjeuné au bord de la route nationale. Son objectif est de participer à la prise en charge de sa famille, par exemple la nourriture, la santé et la scolarité des enfants tout en renforçant le niveau de ses épargne.
texts.en:
Maïmouna B. is a 35-year-old woman who is married and the mother of nine children to support, and she is the guardian of two girls.  She has been a member of Banc Villageois of SINTHIANG COUNDARA since January 22, 2003 and has had fourteen consecutive loans without ever any difficulty repaying.  Maïmouna's work involves fattening sheep.  She buys goats and sheep and fattens them for at least four months and then sells them at the weekly markets in her town.  Aside from this business, she has a makeshift table where she sells breakfast along the Route Nationale.  Her goal is to help support her family in terms of, for example, food, health care, and schooling for the children while she bolsters her savings at the same time. 

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Strengthening her business fattening sheep

loans.name: Rosa Petrona

texts.es:
La Señora. Rosa B. es socia del banco comunal 10 de Agosto, vive en la parroquia del Valle la misma que es reconocida por su belleza natural, su gente se dedica a la agricultura y también a la ganadería.

La Señora Rosa tiene 29 años de edad, es casada Y fruto de su unión conyugal ha concebido 2 hijos quienes tienen  9 y 7 años de edad y se encuentran estudiando en una escuela de la localidad, su esposo trabaja como albañil actividad que le ha ayudado a crecer económicamente en el hogar, gracias al trabajo conyugal han logrado construir su casa propia.

Nuestra socia se dedica a la limpieza de una casa hace un año, trabaja de lunes a viernes pero solo medio día ya que el resto del tiempo se dedica a sus hijos, también se dedica a la cría de pollos hace 4 años, la misma que le ayuda  a mejora la economía de su hogar.

Es nuestra socia hace 7 años y ha sido su hermana quien la incentivo a que realice los créditos en la Fundación Espoir, beneficiándole para comenzar con su negocio de pollos.  Su nuevo crédito lo va a invertir en la compra de más pollos y también para comprar unos repuestos para su automóvil. Su meta es de tener una tienda en su casa.
texts.en:
Sra. Rosa B. is a member of the community bank “10 de Agosto”. She lives in the valley area known for its natural beauty where people work in agriculture and with livestock. Sra. Rosa is 29 years old, married with two children who are 9 and 7 years old and study at the local school. Her husband works as a bricklayer which has helped their economic growth at home. Thanks to their combined efforts they have successfully constructed their own home. For the past year, our member has worked as a housecleaner at one home, working half days Monday through Friday. The rest of the day she focuses on her children and breeding chickens (for the past four years) which helps improve the finances of her household. Seven years ago, her sister encouraged her to get a loan from Fundación Espoir helping her to start her chicken business. With her new loan, she will invest in the purchase of many chickens and some automobile parts for her car. Her goal is to have a store in her home.

Translated from Spanish by Susanna Sabahi, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy chickens and automotive parts

loans.name: Mary Jane

texts.en:
Mary Jane A. is from the village of Malinao, Kalilangan, Bukidnon. She is 41 years old, married and has 10 school-aged children. Mary Jane owns & operates a beauty salon, offering hairdressing and beauty services, in particular pedicures and manicures. She has been engaged in her business for over 10 years and earns approximately 5,500 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2010, Mary Jane joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. Mary Jane is requesting a loan of 5,000 PHP which will be used to purchase materials needed to provide service. This will be the 1st loan taken out by Mary Jane from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated to improve and expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase materials needed to provide service

loans.name: Miguela

texts.en:
Miguela L. is from the village of Tipolohon, Claveria, Misamis Oriental.  She is 59 years old, married and has four adult-aged children. To make a living, Miguela plants and harvests corn for sale. She has been in business for over 20 years and earns approximately 7000 PHP a month.

In 2010, Miguela joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She is requesting a new loan of 4000 PHP to purchase fertilizers. Miguela plans to use the additional revenue generated to improve her business. 

-------------------------------------
About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

loans.use: Purchase fertilizers such as manure.

loans.name: Viola

texts.en: Viola J.  is currently in the business of selling various items in the shop such as bags of sugar, salt, biscuits etc and is requesting a loan to stock bags of rice and beans to sell. Viola is 39 years old and is married. Her husband is a business man. She has 2 children and her children go to school. With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to extend the floor of her shop by building another floor.

loans.use: Stock bags of rice and beans to sell.

loans.name: Loren

texts.en:
Loren R. is from Carmen Annex, Ozamiz City. She is 30 years old and is married with two infant children. Loren owns and operates a general store, selling a variety of different products such as milk, vinegar, canned goods, etc., in the local community. She has been engaged in her business for over two years and earns approximately 10,000 PHP a month. In 2010, Loren joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from GDMPC. Loren is requesting a new loan of 10,000 PHP which will be used to invest in expanding her business. This loan will be her second from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. About GDMPC: GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three unit offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolk and small-business entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To invest in expanding her business

loans.name: Maria Luz

texts.es:
Maria es soltera y vive en la casa de su mama, Maria tiene un puesto en el mercado del Cementerio en donde vende especerías que ella misma prepara, además Maria tiene una juguetería en un local alquilado ubicado en el centro de la ciudad, negocio que inicio hace 2 meses y le esta yendo bien.
Maria es socia del Banco Comunal Las Golondrinas y solicita un préstamo de 2500 soles para la compra de juguetes.
Los sueños de Maria es mejorar sus negocios y surtir con mas productos.
texts.en:
Maria is single and lives at home with her mother. She has a stand at the Cementerio Market where she sells spices that she prepares herself. Maria also manages a toy store from a rented location in the central part of the city. She started this business two months ago and it is doing well.

Maria is a member of the Communal Bank “Las Golondrinas” (The Swallows) and needs a loan of 2500 PEN to buy toys. Her dreams are to improve her businesses and be stocked with more products.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase toys to sell

loans.name: Virgen Del Pilar Group

texts.es:
El Comité de Mujeres de nombre Virgen del Pilar se conformó en fecha 27 de diciembre del 2.008, con mucho esfuerzo ya  se encuentran en el 5º ciclo, en forma conjunta y solidaria dentro del programa.
Además del trabajo independiente de cada una, también desarrollan actividades en forma conjunta  para recaudar fondos con el fin de contar con un capital dentro del grupo, a la vez se ayudan mutuamente para llegar a los objetivos que es la de trabajar para apoyar económicamente  a sus familias en especial.
Una de la integrantes es Sra. Flavia R.  quien se dedica a la venta de ropas, nos comenta que mediante el  crédito  pudo mejorar bastante su actividad y su administración; su nivel de vida e ingreso económico. 
Ella  nos comenta que mediante este negocio la economía de la familia mejoró bastante ya que actualmente posee además del ingreso de su marido quien es chofer, con  el ingreso de su negocio.
Solicita el préstamo para la compra de remeras, camisas, pantalones, blusas y otros.
texts.en:
The Virgen del Pilar Women’s Committee was formed on December 27, 2008, and with much effort they find themselves in their fifth cycle together, working within the support of the Fundación Paraguaya program.

In addition to the independent work of each member, the group also develops collaborative fundraising activities with the goal of collecting financial capital within the group.  At the same time, they help each other to reach their objectives – in particular, to work to support their families financially.

One of the group’s members is Mrs. Flavia R., who sells clothing for a living.  She tells us that through the group’s credit, she was able to significantly improve her operation and administration, as well as her income and quality of life.

She tells us that through this business, her family’s economic situation has improved substantially, as they have been able to add her income to that of her husband, who is a driver.

Flavia is applying for this loan to buy T-shirts, shirts, pants, blouses, and other clothing items.

loans.use: Purchase of T-shirts, shirts, pants, blouses, and other clothing items for retail sale

loans.name: Finesse Group

texts.fr:
Les femmes du groupe Finesse sont toutes  mariées et ont une moyenne d’âge de 33 ans et 5  enfants. Les femmes du groupe Finesse vivent dans des grandes familles traditionnelles dans la ville de San (région de Ségou, république du Mali). Elles se sont connues à travers des liens de voisinage et de parenté. 
Elles exercent les activités de restauration et la vente de condiments alimentaires, d’habits et divers articles. Ces activités sont très rentables  pour ces femmes du groupe. 
Kotimi T., est une vendeuse de condiments alimentaires à son domicile qui compte utiliser son prêt pour acheter, 2 sacs de sel de cuisine, 1 carton de cube maggi, 1 carton de concentrée  de tomate, 2kg de poivre, des oignons  et de l’ail. 
Elle compte réaliser un bénéfice mensuel de 18500FCFA tandis que les autres membres comptent réaliser chacune un bénéfice mensuel de 17500 FCFA, somme qui leur permettra de rembourser le prêt, de venir en aide aux conjoints et réinvestir dans l’entreprise.
texts.en: The women of the Finesse group are all married and are, on average, 33 years old with 5 children. They live in large traditional families in the city of San (Ségou region, republic of Mali). They know one another through ties of community and kinship.  They operate food preparation businesses and sell condiments, clothing and miscellaneous items. These businesses are very profitable for the women's group.  Kotimi T. sells food condiments from her home and intends to use her loan to buy 2 bags of cooking salt, 1 carton of maggi cubes, 1 carton of tomato paste, and 2kg of pepper, onions and garlic.  She expects to make a monthly profit of 18,500 CFA while other members expect to make a monthly profit of 17,500 CFA francs each, a sum that will enable them to repay the loan, help their husbands and reinvest in the business.

loans.use: To buy food condiments

loans.name: Nila Genny

texts.es:
El Banco Comunal María Auxiliadora se reúne en La parroquia Sequita, pertenece a Montecristi prospero cantón manabita, lleno de gente trabajadora dedicada y orgullosa de sus raíces, La Sequita es una parroquia donde sus habitantes son gente honesta que solo saben trabajar y dedicarse a sus familias.

La señora Nila es socia fundadora del Banco Comunal y le gusta por las facilidades que da el Banco para realizar los pagos  y por los beneficios adicionales que brinda la institución. Tiene 43 años de edad, está casada y tiene  tres hijos ya todos son mayares de edad, dos de ellos viven aun con ella y uno de sus hijos sufre de ataques de epilepsia. Su marido trabaja en Guayaquil.

Se dedica al comercio, vende ropa de todo tipo, recorre con sus productos los mismos que entrega casi todos bajo pedidos que le realizan sus clientes con anticipación, trabaja cuatro días a la semana, deja a crédito y cobra cada quince días o los fines de semana de acuerdo a como lo deseen sus clientes, su mercadería la compra en Guayaquil, aprovecha los viajes de su esposo para ir a comprar por lo general los fines de mes.

Este crédito es para ir a comprar su mercadería a Guayaquil ya que tiene algunos pedidos. Sus sueños son ver que su hijo se recupere de su enfermedad y seguir trabajando.
texts.en:
The communal bank María Auxiliadora meets in the Sequita parish, which belongs to the prosperous Montecristi canton, full of dedicated, hard-working people who are proud of their roots.  Sequita is a parish whose inhabitants are honest people that only know to work and to be dedicated their families.  

Señora Nila is a founding associate of the Communal Bank and she likes the facilities that the Bank offers to make payments and the fringe benefits that the institution offers.  She is 43 years of age, married and has three children who are already grown.  Two of them still live with her and one of her children suffers from attacks of epilepsy.  Her husband works in Guayaquil.  

She is dedicated to commerce.  She sells clothes of all types.  She travels through the area with her products, which she delivers mostly to fill orders eagerly anticipated by her clients. She works four days per week, accepting credit and charging every fifteen days or weekend according to the preference of her clients.  She purchases her merchandise in Guayaquil, taking advantage of the trips her husband makes to go and buy - generally at the end of the month.  

This loan will be used to buy merchandise in Guayaquil since she has some orders.  Her dreams are to see her son recover from his illness and to continue working.

loans.use: To buy clothing for women, men and children.

loans.name: Divina Rigor's Group

texts.en:
Divina R. is from the village of Brgy. Paniki, Bagabag, Nueva Vizcaya. She is 40 years old. Divina is the group leader of a 5-member group loan offered by ASKI. While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they are all collectively responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults.

Divina is married and has three school-aged children. To make a living, Divina owns & operates a business venture in the agriculture sector raising livestock. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from raising chickens to produce eggs for sale. Divina has been engaged in her business for over 8 years and earns approximately 7,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2008, Divina joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Divina has successfully repaid a previous loan of 15,000 PHP from ASKI. This previous loan was used to purchase breeding livestock. Divina is requesting a new loan of 18,000 PHP which will be used to purchase livestock feed & other supplies. This will be the 4th loan taken out by Divina from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to financially support immediate members of her family. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 38 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly of farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase livestock feed & other supplies

loans.name: Vagif

texts.en: Vagif M. is a 58-year-old beekeeper who makes honey in the small village of Imishli city. He engaged in this business in 2003 because his pension  was not enough  to  cover  his family's needs.  He is married and has five children, all of them are helping him and are learning this business to continue it.  Vagif has applied for a loan to buy 3 beehives.

loans.use: To purchase 3 beehives

loans.name: Kayitesi

texts.fr: Kayitesi  B. a 47 ans, elle est célibataire, et elle a 1 enfant qui a 16ans, qui va à l’école.  Elle va utiliser son prêt pour acheter les matériels pour la construction et 2 lavabos, payement des impôts, et pour acheter les peintures.  Sa stratégie pour la croissance et d’acheter de bon matériel, et rembourser ce crédit à temps envie de solliciter une autre, et s’augmenter son affaire.  Elle voudrait bâtir beaucoup de maisons, avoir les locataires, et réaliser de l’argent en s’autofinançant elle-même.  Elle voudrait aussi le bien-être de sa famille.
texts.en:
Kayitesi B. is 47 years old. She is single, and has a 16-year-old child who attends school. 

She plans to use her loan to buy construction materials, two sinks and some paint, and to pay her taxes. 

Her growth strategy is to acquire good materials and repay the loan on time to be able to seek another and expand her business. 

She wants to build many houses, have tenants, and make money by self-financing her activities. She also wishes to ensure her family’s well-being.

loans.use: Purchasing construction materials, two sinks, and paint; paying taxes

loans.name: Efua

texts.en:
Efua A. sells kenkey and sandals at Abura. Kenkey is a dumpling-like Ghanaian food usually made from fermented maize (or sometimes, cassava) that is formed into dough, cooked, and served with vegetable stew or soup.

Efua is married and has six dependents. Her husband is a farmer. She has had her business for five years and assists her husband financially in providing for the well-being of their family. She plans to use the money from this loan to acquire morel sandals to meet the demands of her customers. If Efua makes additional profit as a result, she says she'll reinvest it in her business.

loans.use: to acquire more sandals for sale

loans.name: Sat's Group

texts.en:
In Kampong Svay village, Kandal province, there are 13 members of a village bank loan. Mr. Sat L. is 52 years old and the village bank president. He was selected by the group members. The members of this village bank loan hope to increase their income to improve the family living conditions with these loans. 

Mr. Sat L. and his wife, Mrs. Chheng Leang Eng, are fishermen in the local village. They earn a little income to support their family. Currently, their business does not have enough fishing supplies for fishing. So in order to support this business, Mr. Sat L. would like to ask for a loan to buy fishing supplies for fishing.

This spouse is working hard to support his six children. Three of the children attend a local school and the others are too young to study or work.

loans.use: To buy fishing supplies

loans.name: Zainab

texts.en: This is 30-year-old Zainab. She is married and has 4 children. In 2008, Zainab established her used clothing business because she wanted her own source of income. Working six days a week and nine hours a day, she earns about Le 2,909,000 every month from her business. She would like a loan in the amount of Le 3,000,000 in order to buy additional used clothing. In the future, Zainab plans to import clothing from other countries. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: To purchase more used clothing

loans.name: Justina

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “LA ÑUSTA”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Calca, perteneciente a la provincia de Calca y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Damiana; ella tiene 25 años de edad y es conviviente y tiene 1hijo; La socia alterna sus actividades diarias con el trabajo de cocinera en un restaurant en el distrito de Calca, ella trabaja desde las 7:00 a.m hasta las 8:00 p.m, por medio de este trabajo la socia saca adelante a sus hijos, la socia quiere seguir mejorando en su trabajo. La socia solicita el préstamo para comprar útiles escolares para sus hijos.

 La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
Damiana, 25, is a member of the “LA ÑUSTA” (“Princess”) communal bank located in Calca district which belongs to Calca province, Cusco department.

She has a live-in partner and a son.  She alternates her daily chores with working as a cook in a restaurant in Calca district.  She works from 7am until 8pm.  Through this work she is able to support her children.  She wants to continue improving in her work.  She is asking for the loan to buy school supplies for her children.

She is happy with the loan and commits to repay the installments.

loans.use: To buy school supplies for her children.

loans.name: Mujeres Del Sol Group

texts.es: La Sra. Amelia  es conviviente, tiene 2 hijos en edad escolar  y  tiene 27 años D. edad,  actualmente es socia  en la alcancía comunal “Mujeres del Sol” grupo  conformado por 14  socios que se dedican a diversas actividades D. comercio. Amelia trabaja en una bodega donD. venD. abarrotes, dulces, gaseosas, y lo inauguró hace 10 días, este trabajo surge a raíz D. que su primer hijo entra al colegio por primera vez  y es así su deseo D. brindarle lo mejor  a sus hijos  y su deseo D. superación D. Amelia no tiene limites, Su sueño D. Amelia es tener una bodega más granD. y  vender al por mayor pero lo mas importante es ver a sus dos hijos profesionales,  este es el primer préstamo que Edaprospo le otorga, y gracias a ello puso su negocio. Sabemos que Amelia cumplirá sus metas con mucho trabajo y esfuerzo y que los préstamos D. Edaprospo le ayudaran.
texts.en: Amelia is 27 years old, has a live-in partner, and has two school-aged children.  She is currently a member of the Mujeres del Sol Communal Bank, which consists of 14 people who work in different areas of business.  Amelia works at a grocery store that she opened 10 days ago where she sells groceries, candy, and soda.  She began this work because her first son is starting high school and she wants to proviD. her children with the best.  Amelia has an unending desire to get ahead in life and her dream is to have a larger grocery store and sell at wholesale.  However, her most important dream is to see her two children be professionals.  This is the first loan that EDAPROSPO is granting to her and thanks to this loan, she started her business.  We know that Amelia will meet her goals with a lot of work and effort, and that the loans from EDAPROSPO will help her.

loans.use: To purchase merchandise

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase sacks of organic fertilizer.

loans.name: Fe

texts.en:
Fe is 62 years old and single. Fe works very hard to provide for her family.

Fe runs a business buying & selling coconut/copra in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 19,000 loan through NWTF to purchase coconuts and charcoal.

Fe has been in this business for 11 years and sells a variety of items such as charcoal and coconut. 

In the future, Fe would like to make house repairs.

loans.use: to purchase coconuts and charcoal

loans.name: Jane

texts.en:
Jane O. is 52 years old, married to Alex O. Kawuor, and they have been blessed with seven children. She runs a retail shop in Kiembeni, Mombasa and has been in this business for the last twenty years. 

This marks her third loan from KADET, and she plans to purchase rice, flour, cooking oil, sugar, tea leaves and margarine for her shop. 

The anticipated profits will be directed to the repayment of the loan. Jane’s dream  for her business  is to expand to a wholesale shop.

loans.use: to purchase rice, flour, cooking oil, sugar, tea leaves and margarine for her shop.

loans.name: Marcos Antonio

texts.es: Marcos tiene 34 años de edad. Es casado y tiene un hijo. Vive junto a su  familia en casa propia en el centro del caserío de San Luis, que pertenece al distrito de La Victoria. Este lugar es  rural y sus pobladores se dedican a la agricultura, crianza de animales, labores agrícolas. Marcos se dedica a trabajar como peón en la agricultura. Tiene más de 5 años de experiencia en este oficio. Actualmente, su casa se encuentra en un estado deteriorado y desea hacerla unos arreglos. Por ello, ha creido conveniente solicitar un préstamo de 1000 nuevos soles a Edpyme Alternativa. Con esta inversión, podrá reforzar su casa y mejor proteger a su familiar. Les agradece a los prestamistas de Kiva por el apoyo brindado en mejorar la calidad de vida de su familia.
texts.en: Marcos is 34 years old. He is married and has one child. He lives with his family in his own house in the center of the San Luis hamlet, located in the La Victoria district. This is a rural area, whose inhabitants engage in agriculture, animals breeding and agricultural works. Marcos is a farm hand with a 5-year experience in this field. As his house is currently in a dilapidated state and he wants to have some repair works done, he has taught it convenient to as Edpyme Alternativa for a loan of 1000 PEN. Thanks to this loan he will be able to reinforce his house and to better protect his family. He is thankful to Kiva lenders for their support in helping him improving his family’s standard of living.

loans.use: To have some repair works done to his house in order to reinforce it to better protect his family.

loans.name: Norbey De Jesus

texts.es:
Norbey de Jesús es un joven que vive en el municipio de Sonsón Antioquia,  desde muy pequeño se ha dedicado a transportar todo tipo de materiales en un vehículo que él mismo adecuó con una plataforma que carga el material y que a su vez es arrastrado por su caballo, su carreta como es tradicionalmente conocida es su única fuente de ingresos, pues la falta de oportunidades laborales en el que vive lo obligó a ser independiente y conocer la ley del rebusque. En su carreta Norbey transporta materiales, acarreos y diferentes tipos de carga para lo que lo contratan. 

 

Durante todos estos años Norbey ha trabajado con el mismo caballo, por lo que siente la necesidad de comprar otro equino más joven que le ayude a agilizar sus recorridos, no solo por mejorar el servicio si no también por la salud de su antiguo caballo. Pero los ingresos que se generan no son suficientes para la inversión, por lo cual Norbey necesita de un préstamo que le permita la compra el caballo. Su mayor sueño es llegar a tener una casa propia por lo que trabajará día a día hasta lograr su mas grande anhelo.
texts.en:
Norbey de Jesús is a young man who lives in the municipality of Sonsón Antioquia. From a very young age he has been engaged in transporting all types of materials in a horse-drawn vehicle adapted for carrying cargo. His cart is traditionally designed and is his only source of income, for he lacks other employment opportunities where he lives, and it allows him to be independent and to get by. On his cart, Norbey transports freight and different types of cargo.

For years, Norbay has worked with the same horse. That’s why he now feels the need to buy another, younger horse to help him speed up his journeys. This will not only improve the service he gives. It will also benefit the health of his old horse.

Since Norbay’s income is not sufficient to make this investment he needs a loan that will permit the purchase of a horse. His biggest dream is to have his own house.. That’s why he will work every day until he achieves his greatest desire.

loans.use: to purchase a horse for speeding up his transport service.

loans.name: Amautas Cerro Kantica Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “AMAUTAS CERRO KANTICA” iniciará su primer ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Panamericana, está compuesta por nueve integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva encabezada por la señora Virginia. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos tenemos: sahumerios, macramé de mantas, y venta de comida.
 
La señora Virginia,  indica que es la primera vez que integra Pro Mujer  y que ingreso por invitación de las promotoras. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de sahumerio que aprendió de su familia, desde hace cuatro años atrás.
 
El crédito que ahora sacará es para aumentar su mercadería de sahumerios (compra de inicencios, copal, dulces, etc.), este material lo compra de la cuidad de El Alto, de la Ceja, de la calle Corazón de Jesús (calle comercial de la ciudad de El Alto) y los venderá en su negocio que esta ubicado, camino a Laja. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para apoyar en lo posible a su familia, pues ella es soltera y tiene dos hijos.
texts.en:
The “AMAUTAS CERRO KANTICA” communal bank will start its first cycle in Pro Mujer as part of the Panamericana Center.  It has nine members and is led by a governing board headed by Virginia.  The members are involved in a variety of businesses.  Among them are: sahumerios (aromatic herbals and incense), macramé weaving and food sales.

Virginia indicates that this is the first time she’s joined Pro Mujer and that she did so thanks to an invitation from one of the promoters.  She currently has a “sahumerio” (aromatic herbs and incense) business that she learned from her family; she’s had it for the last four years.

The loan she’ll take out now is to increase her sahumerio merchandise (she will buy incense, copal, sweets, etc.)  She will buy these supplies in the city of El Alto’s La Ceja area, on Corazón de Jesús Street (a commercial street in El Alto) and will sell them in her store which is located on the road to Laja.  This way of working allows her to generate income to support her family in every possible say because she’s single and has two children.

loans.use: to buy aromatics.

loans.name: Yawa Angéle

texts.fr: Agée de 35ans, Yawa est vendeuse des condiments (tomates, piments, oignons) dans une boutique dans son quartier. Elle est mariée à un peintre auto et ils ont 01 enfant.  Elle est à son deuxième crédit et ce montant lui permettra à acheter des condiments qu’elle achète au Grand marché de Lomé. Son activité a démarré en 2004 et elle veut assurer un avenir meilleur à son enfant. Elle a d’autres ambitions ajoutées une activité complémentaire à la première.
texts.en:
Yawa is 35 years old. She is married to an automobile painter with whom she has one child. She sells condiments (tomatoes, peppers, onions) in a neighborhood shop. 

This is her second loan, which she will use to stock up on condiments at the Grand market of Lomé. 

She launched this activity in 2004, and she wants to ensure a better future for her child. She also plans to complement her current activity with a secondary occupation.

loans.use: to buy condiments such as tomatoes, peppers and onions for resale

loans.name: Senzokwethu 2 Group

texts.en:
Ntokozo is 31, single, and has two children who are two and five years old. Her five-year-old attends school. She runs a retail business in Kwa Zulu Natal of Empangeni in South Africa. In the photo she is pictured raising her hand. 

She has been in this business for two years selling perfume, airtime and bath towels. She also receives income from the government's child support grant. 

She requested this loan through WDB and Kiva to buy perfumes and airtime. She says that the main challenges to her business are customers who buy on credit and fail to pay on time. Ntokozo adds that the extra income from this loan will help her improve her life and her family because now she can put food on the table. 

In her comment she thanks WDB and Kiva for lending her money as she is unemployed.

loans.use: To buy perfumes and airtime

loans.name: Peter

texts.en:
Peter is a 36-year-old businessman and is married to Nancy, who is a housewife. They are blessed with two children ages ten and twelve. For the past ten years, Peter has been a goat farmer. He earns a monthly income of 15,000 KES which he uses to support his family.

Peter has successfully repaid a previous loan with KADET. He is requesting a second loan to purchase a heifer and increase his income. He plans to use the anticipated profit from his loan to start a mechanic shop. His hopes and dreams are to own a car bazaar which will improve his family’s living standards and allow him to educate his children.

loans.use: to purchase a heifer

loans.name: Rutty Janeth

texts.es:
La señora Rutty, es socia del banco comunal Manos Maravillosas del Distrito De Calleria, Departamento De Ucayali, tiene 28 años de edad, està casada y tiene tres hijos menores de edad.  Su primer préstamo  de trescientos nuevos soles, le sirvió para iniciar su negocio
Trabaja desde hace varios años con los préstamos de Manuela Ramos, se dedica a la preparación de cáncamos (clavos doblados para amarrar fierros), negocio que lo realiza con su esposo y también están generando trabajo para otra persona, tienen un ayudante. Tienen un local alquilado ya que no cuentan con espacio en su casa.

Con su nuevo préstamo de S/ 1,500.00 nuevos soles comprarà 20 varillas de fierro 1/8, 50 kilos de fierro de segunda, 2 sacos de carbón, que necesita para quemar el fierro, 4 guantes, 1 mandil, 1 prensa, 1 sierra. 
Les va bien, la mejor forma que encontraron para trabajar juntos fue de esta manera, vieron que era factible que Rutty consiga el capital y su esposo la mano de obra.  Están muy agradecidos por los prèstamos que Manuela Ramos les ha dado, gracias a ello pueden continuar con el negocio.
texts.en:
Sra. Rutty is a member of the Communal Bank “Manos Maravillosas” (Wonderful Hands) which is in the District of Calleria, Department of Ucayali. She is 28 years old, married, and has three young children. Her first loan of 300 PEN was used to start her business.

Rutty has worked with the loans from Manuela Ramos for several years. She manufactures eyebolts (galvanized screws used for fastening metal braces). Rutty and her husband have the help of an assistant and together they perform work for another individual. They work from a rented location since there is not enough space at her house.

With her new loan of 1500 PEN, Rutty will by 20 rods of 1/8 iron, 50 kilos of scrap iron, 2 sacks of coal for heating the iron, 4 pairs of gloves, an apron, a metal press, and a saw.

Rutty and her husband have done very well. Their best work is performed when they collaborate with each other. They saw that it was possible for Rutty to secure capital and combine it with her husband’s labor. They are very grateful for the loans from Manuela Ramos because the funding has allowed them to continue their business.

loans.use: to purchase iron rods, scrap iron, sacks of coal, gloves, an apron, a metal press, and a saw.

loans.name: Susan

texts.en:
Susan   lives in Uganda.  She is single and has three children, one of whom is in school.  Susan has a business selling charcoal.  She has been in this business for 10 years, and she works seven days out of every week.  

Susan sells her products from home, wholesale.   She has requested a loan of 500,000 Ugandan Shillings from MCDT SACCO, which she will use to buy more bags of charcoal. She also generates additional income through   brick laying.

The main business challenges for Susan include seasonality and defaulters.  Her goals and aspirations for her business are to start selling wholesale only.    Susan lives in a home that she rents; she doesn't have access to electricity or piped water.  Her major monthly expenses include   food, rent and school fees.

loans.use: To buy more bags of charcoal.

loans.name: Rosalina Del Carmen

texts.es:
Rosalina, es madre soltera, tiene una hija de 8 años de edad, ella se dedica a la venta de comida y tortillas, el negocio lo heredo de su madre, lo atiende de 5:00am a 2:00pm, está instalado frente a la terminal de buses.
Ella necesita un préstamo para la compra de maíz, leña, azúcar y otros materiales para preparar meriendas y las tortillas, será una gran ayuda para Rosalina el obtener este préstamo, pues su negocio estará dotado de mercadería.
La principal aspiración es reparar el puesto de venta, ampliarlo y mejorar la infraestructura, para darle mejor vistosidad y mayor llamamiento para los clientes, también en su vida personal le gustaría contribuir al desarrollo de su hija, en los estudios.
texts.en:
Rosalina is a single mother; she has an 8-year-old daughter.  She sells food and tortillas.  She inherited the business from her mother.  She’s open for business from 5am until 2pm and it’s located across from the bus terminal.

She needs a loan to buy corn, firewood, sugar and other supplies to prepare the meals and the tortillas.  It will be of great help for Rosalina to get this loan because her business will be stocked with merchandise.

Her main goal is to repair her sales stand, to enlarge it and improve its infrastructure to make it more eye-catching for customers.  In her personal life, she’d like to contribute to her daughter’s development, in her schooling.

loans.use: to buy corn, firewood and sugar.

loans.name: Nescil

texts.en:
Nescil is 23 years old, single and has one infant child to care for. She lives in Aurora, Zamboanga del Sur, Philippines. She is running a small piggery at home to make a living. This started five years ago and continues until the present time. She usually raises a cross-breed type of pig and sells them when they have grown enough. While not the only source of income, Nescil gets PHP 10,910 a month. 

Earlier this year, Nescil joined GDMPC. She is requesting a loan of PHP 10,000 to purchase additional piglets to raise and feeding supplies for a good build-up. Firmly bodied animals catch the attention and could be a good sign of increased sales. Nescil hopes to sell them all at a high price and obtain more piglets to raise in the future to improve the general living conditions of the family.

loans.use: To purchase additional piglets and feeding supplies.

loans.name: Batuli

texts.en:
Batuli is a 66 year old married lady, with seven children. She sells charcoal in the Kisumu Ndogo area in Malindi, and has been in the business for the past five years now. She earns a monthly income of Kshs.5,000 and usually uses the money to assist her husband in taking care of their family.

Batuli has been loaned Kshs.20,000 by KADET LTD and this serves as her first loan cycle. She intends to use her loan to purchase additional sacks of charcoal to sell, as well as to put up a strong wooden structure for her business, with a view of being able to serve her ever growing customers in the area (since no one else conducts the same kind of business in the area). 

The client wishes to use the anticipated profit from her business to continue helping look after her family as well as to help grow her business by opening a water selling point in the area.

loans.use: To purchase more charcoal to sell

loans.name: Janepher

texts.en:
Janepher is 28 years old and married to Andrew, who is a policeman. They have three children. She operates a retail shop and a mobile phone-based money transfer business (called M-PESA) in Kitengela town. 

She has been in this business for the last four years. This is her first loan from  KADET Ltd. She plans to add more stock to the shop like sugar, washing detergent, salt with KES 20,000 of the loan and buy float for the M-PESA business worth KES 10,000. 

The anticipated profits will be used to open another branch at Kitengela. She desires to open a wholesale store in the near future.

loans.use: to buy sugar, washing detergent and salt worth KES 20,000 and to add float for the M-PESA business for KES 10,000.

loans.name: Wakulima Group

texts.en:
Nancy is the facilitator of the Wakulima group. Nancy and her group joined One Acre Fund in the year 2011 and will re-enroll in the 2012 program.

With this loan, One Acre Fund will purchase fertilizer, seeds, and other important inputs to distribute to Nancy and her group during Kenya’s next planting season in February 2012. The distribution of farming inputs is part of One Acre Fund’s integrated agriculture package, which includes training, reliable input supply (such as fertilizer and seeds), credit and insurance.

Nancy takes care of four children at home. She joined One Acre Fund in order to access fertilizer and hybrid seeds and ensure food security for her family. In the recent 2011 season, Nancy had a very good maize yield harvesting 8 bags on half an acre of land. Before joining One Acre Fund, Nancy was only able to harvest 3 bags of maize on ½ an acre of land.

With income from maize sales, Nancy will educate her children and ensure food security for her family.

In 2012, the members of Wakulima group will each plant maize on plots of between ½ and 1 acre of land.

In the photograph, Nancy is pictured with her group members.

loans.use: To source farming inputs, such as seeds and fertilizer, at low prices for the 2012 planting season.

loans.name: Mayra Lucia

texts.es:
L. señora Mayra es socia del banco comunal Las Triunfadoras del Distrito Calleria, Departamento de Ucayali, tiene 25 años de edad, está casada y tiene una hija.
Son tres años que viene trabajando con los prestamos de ManueL. Ramos, tiene una panadería, cuenta con un horno casero que puede cocinar hasta 40 latas de pan, tiene 2 personas trabajando con elL., uno para hacer los panes y L. otra persona, que es su esposo, es el que se encarga, junto con elL., a repartir los panes a las bodegas de las zonas.
Con su nuevo préstamo de  S/. 1,500.00 nuevos soles comprará: 5 sacos de harina, 5 casilleros de huevos, 1 lata de manteca, 2 kilos de levadura, 1 kilo de frutas confitadas, ½ saco de azúcar.
Para las fiestas de fin de año invertirá en insumos para hacer los riquísimos panetones, también hacen biscochos.  Debido a que elaboran pocos productos terminan rápido y les queda tiempo para atender a su hija. Están trabajando para dar un futuro mejor a los hijos que vayan a tener..
texts.en:
Mayra is a member of the Communal Bank, "Las Triunfadoras (The Winners)" of Calleria District, Department of Ucayali.  She is 25 years old, married and has one daughter.

For three years she has been working with ManueL. Ramos loans.  Mayra has a bakery, where she has a home oven that can cook up to 40 pans of bread.  She has 2 people working with her, one to make the bread and the other person, which is her husband, is the one responsible for distributing the bread to stores in the area.

With this new loan 1,500 nuevos soles, Mayra will buy: 5 bags of flour, 5 cartons of eggs, 1 can of butter, 2 kilos of yeast, 1 kilo of candied fruit, ½ sack of sugar.

For the holidays at the end of the year Mayra will invest in ingredients for the delicious panettones.  She also makes biscuits.  Because she only makes a few products, they are produced quickly and leaves her time to care for her daughter. They are working to provide a better future for the children that they will have.

loans.use: to purchase flour, eggs, and butter.

loans.name: Nancy

texts.en:
Nancy is in the process of starting her employment agency business that seeks to diversify the workforce. After she was laid off from her job at a hedge fund, she had accumulated enough savings to take some time off to decide which path to take next. She has a passion for helping youth minorities find their way in the workforce and sees that there is a huge opportunity to help qualified minorities find employment by helping them with their search. Since Nancy doesn’t have a second job, she has plenty of time to work on getting her business off the ground.

Nancy will use this loan from Accion USA to develop her business website. She is currently searching for graphic designers who can meet her needs.

loans.use: to pay for the development of her website.

loans.name: Abdoul Aziz

texts.fr: Monsieur Abdoul Aziz est un tailleur de profession qui gère un atelier de couture au marché de la localité ou il vit.il encadre deux jeunes employés dans le domaine de son activité.il a une expérience de de plus de 5 ans dans son activité et grâce a ses revenus il parvient a satisfaire ses besoins sociaux.il est membre de l'un des guichets de l'U-IMCEC et sollicite un crédit de 400000 prévu pour l'achat d'une nouvelle machine a coudre et des tissus qui lui permettront de confectionner des  habits prêt a porter destinés a la vente en vue de satisfaire la demande de la clientèle. Le développement de son activité lui donne l'opportunité de d'embaucher de jeunes garçons et de créer de nouveaux emplois.
texts.en:
Mr Abdoul Aziz is a tailor based at a local market where he manages his workshop assisted by two employees. For over five years he has been exercising a trade where he is able to answer social needs.

With this loan he wants to buy a new sewing machine and buy fabrics to enhance his ready-to-wear collection and meet the demands of his customers. All previous loans were granted by IMCEC where he has established his trustworthiness.

His market experience provides him with the opportunity to hire young people of his age.

loans.use: achat de machine a coudre et de tissus pour confectionner des habits pret a porter  a vendre

loans.name: Akaki

texts.en:
Akaki is a 48-year-old farmer from the village of Ukaneti, in the Imereti region of West Georgia. He lives with his big family: his wife Lile, his 23-year-old son, his daughter-in-law, his 3-year-old granddaughter, and his retired parents. All of the adult family members are involved in farming, which is their main source of income. In particular, the family grows vegetables on a family-owned, 0.2-hectare plot of agricultural land. They also have a greenhouse, which is in use year-round. From October–May, the greenhouse is used to grow greens, and in the summer months to grow tomatoes and cucumbers. Akaki sells the harvest himself, on the local open market. The family's total average monthly income is 800 Georgian laris (GEL), including the pensions of Akaki’s parents.

Akaki requested a loan to purchase fertilizers for the greenhouse. After fertilizing the land, he can count on a larger and better harvest during the coming year, which will enhance the family's income. Akaki plans to reinvest the increased income in the family farm in order to make it more profitable and sustainable.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers for his greenhouse

loans.name: Celine

texts.fr:
Mme CELINE est mariée et mère de 04 enfants. Le plus âgé a 25ans et le moins âgé a 07ans. Les 04 vont à l’école et elle à 06 personnes à sa charge.

Elle fabrique et vend du savon liquide depuis 05ans. Mme s’approvisionne au marché de paglayiri et au grand marché en ville. Ses clients sont les femmes et hommes dans les services,voisins et amis.

Elle veut s’acheter 04kg de soude caustique, 15kg de sel colorant et ¼ de parfum.

Avec  ses bénéfices, elle épargne et prend soin de ses enfants. Elle ambitionne ouvrir une grande boutique et aider à la scolarité de ses enfants.
texts.en:
Céline is married and a mother of four.  Her oldest child is 25 and her youngest is seven.  All four children attend school and she has six people total in her care.

For five years, she has been making and selling liquid soap.  She gets her supplies at the Paglayiri market and at the large market in town.  Her clients are women and men in the services sector, neighbors and friends.

She would like to purchase 4 kg of caustic soda, 15 kg of dye salts and ¼ of perfume.

She uses her profits to build savings and care for her children.  It is her goal to open a large boutique and help pay for her children’s education.

loans.use: to purchase 4 kg of caustic soda, 15 kg of dye salts and 1/4 of perfume

loans.name: Janet

texts.en:
Janet works hard to support her family. Janet is married and has a nipa (palm tree leaves) weaving business in the Philippines.

Janet requested a PHP 12000 loan through NWTF to purchase more stocks of nipa to weave.

Janet has been in this business for 9 years now.

In the future, Janet would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: To purchase more stocks of nipa to weave

loans.name: Julie

texts.en:
Julie is 34 years old. He is married and blessed with four children. He has been engaged in the farming business in their village for his family's living. His wife helps him in farming and takes a lot of care of their children. He keeps on working hard in his business to gain enough funds for the education of his children.  To acquire a higher income, he is requesting a loan of P15,000 to buy seeds, fertilizers and insecticides to use to develop his business.
He is very lucky to have an agricultural business that serves as their livelihood. He hopes, as he goes on and loves his work,  that he can meet his family's needs.

loans.use: to buy seeds, fertilizers and insecticides use to develop his business

loans.name: Adrian De Los Angeles

texts.es:
Adrian es un hombre de 20 años de edad y vive con su familia, en una comunidad de la zona Sur de Costa Rica, ubicada en Concepción de Pilas, Puntarenas. La economía local está basada en actividades agropecuarias, donde destaca la siembra de tubérculos, café, maíz, frijoles y ganadería.
Adrian está solicitando un préstamo de ₡400.000 (cuatrocientos mil colones), para darle mantenimiento a su siembra por medio de abono y fungicidas para proteger sus cultivos de semillas de frijol, ya que es una alternativa fiable y sostenible. Con estos abonos, Adrian aumentara la capacidad que posee el suelo de absorber los distintos elementos nutritivos y con los fungicidas que utilizara gracias a este préstamo también evitara que aparezcan hongos en sus plantaciones, para que al ingerirlos sus clientes no corran peligro de adquirir alguna enfermedad. 
Y así brindara productos de calidad a sus clientes, alcanzara la meta de venta que se ha propuesto para cada mes. Y además dará a abasto con todas sus obligaciones y pagos para así sacar adelante a su numerosa familia.
Adrian es socio de la Empresa de Crédito Comunal denla Danta S.A, una de las 150 empresas de crédito comunal de Costa Rica.
texts.en:
Adrian is a 20-year-old man living with his family in a community in the south of Costa Rica located in Concepción de Pilas, Puntarenas.  The local economy is based on animal husbandry activities where tuber, coffee, corn and bean farming and livestock raising predominate.

Adrian has requested a ₡400.000 (four-hundred thousand colones) loan to provide crop maintenance via manure and fungicides to protect his bean seeds since they are as sustainable, reliable alternative.  With the manure, Adrian will increase his soil’s capacity to absorb various nutrients and with the fungicide he’ll use thanks to this loan he will prevent fungus from arising in his plants so that when customers ingest them they will be safe from acquiring any illness and thus provide quality products to his customers and reach his monthly sales target.  Besides, he will meet all his obligations and payments to move his large family forward.

Adrian is a member of the Danta S.A. communal bank, one of 150 communal credit firms in Costa Rica.

loans.use: to buy manure and fungicide.

loans.name: Ilenia

texts.es: Ilenia, de 33 años, es una mujer muy contenta, cordial y trabajadora, vive en su casa propia junto a su pareja Máximo de 40 años y sus 04 hijos, a quienes desea brindar una mejor calidad de vida. Todos los días Ilenia abre desde muy tempranas hora su fuente de soda y comienza a atender a sus primero consumidores. Su fuente de soda es muy concurrida en la ciudad de Kimbiri, ya que la atención que les brinda a sus consumidores es de mucho agrado par ellos. Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es dar buena atención al cliente, así aprovecha para que puedan venir mas consumidores. Lleva 03 años realizando esta actividad y considera que lo más difícil es tener que permanecer todo el día en su tienda. Para el futuro, espera juntar más dinero para adquirir más frutas donde pueda brindar a sus consumidores  deliciosos jugos, ensalada de frutas, queques, entre otros. Este será su primer crédito con MFP, sabe que tiene que cumplir con los pagos de todas sus cuotas a tiempo. En su banco comunal es una socia muy alegre y solidaria. Con los 1,000 nuevos soles, podrá comprar más frutas e incrementar utensilios que le hacen falta en su fuente de soda.
texts.en:
33-year-old Ilenia is a very happy, friendly and hard-working woman who lives in her own home together with her partner, 40-year-old Máximo, and her four children, who she would like to provide with a better quality of life.  Every day, Ilenia opens her diner very early in the morning and starts serving her first customers.  Her diner, which is located in the town of Kimbiri, is very busy as she provides her customers with a good service that pleases them.  What she most enjoys about her work is providing good customer service.  She does this in order to attract more customers.  She has been in this business for three years and she considers the most difficult part of her work to be having to stay in her diner all day.  In the future, she hopes to put together some more money so that she can acquire more fruit and offer her customers delicious juices, fruit salads, cakes, etc.

This will be Ilenia's first loan from MFP.  She knows that she must make all her repayments on time.  She is a very cheerful and supportive member of her community bank.  Ilenia will use the 1,000 soles to buy more fruit and utensils that she needs for her diner.

loans.use: to buy more fruit and utensils

loans.name: Guillermina

texts.en:
I have my business in teh center of the National University of Honduras. This is why I need to invest in new office materials. Everyday, students are requesting works and copies and buying pencils and other supplies nescessary for their studies. My business provides enough for me to feed and educate my thwo children. Now, I want to start selling ice cream to have better profits and finish constructing my house.

Loan Use: Purchase of bond paper, pencils, fine cardboard, clips, stickers, rough draft booklets and others.

Tengo mi negocio ubicado dentro de la Universidad Nacional de nuestro pais, por lo que necesito invertir capital fresco en materiales de oficina, ya que diariamente estan pidiendo trabajos, copias, compran lapices, y otros materiales necesarios para sus estudios. Mi negocio me genera lo suficiente para poder darle a mis 2 hijos estudios y alimentacion. Ahora quiero poner un puesto de helados para tener mayores ganancias y finalizar de construir mi casa.

loans.use: Compra de papel bond, lapices, cartulina, sobres, clips, stickers, borradores y otros.

loans.name: Comfort

texts.en: Maa Comfort lives in Abokobi, Accra, Ghana in a very remote community. She is 42 years old with 5 children. She sells "kenkey" (a local meal from maize) and fried fish to people in her community.  The demand for her food is very high, but she does not have the capital she needs to produce the food in a quantity that will grow her business. She is seeking a loan of $700.00 to enable her serve more food to meet her customer demand

loans.use: working capital

loans.name: Nou

texts.en: Nou C. is 28 years old and lives with his wife in Phnom Penh, Cambodia.  C. washes motorcycles in the village and can make about $1.50 per day. His wife sells duck eggs and generates about $10.00 in revenue per day. The couple hopes to use this loan to purchase a stand at the local market where they will sell duck eggs. They hope that by selling eggs at the market they will be able to increase their sales. In the future, the couple would like to build a concrete house.

loans.use: To purchase a stand to sell duck eggs at the local market

loans.name: Rosita

texts.es:
Rosita N. was born on January 2nd, 1962 in Tejar Chimaltenango. She is 44 years old and has two girls who she has raised on her own since her husband walked out 10 years ago. She has worked hard to raise the girls, lately selling clothing and taking in laundry and ironing. Unfortunately, her washer and dryer are broken and she needs a loan to repair or replace them. Rosita needs a loan of 5,000 Guatemalan Quetzals to outfit her clothing business and buy a larger washing machine. Owning a clothing store is her greatest desire.

Translated by a Kiva volunteer.

Rosita N. nació el 2 de enero de 1,962 en el municipio del Tejar Chimaltenango, tiene 44 años de edad tiene dos hijas y vive sola, ya que el esposo que tenía, las abandonó y no saben nada de él, desde hace diez años ha trabajado duro para salir adelante, Rosita y sus 2 hijas, actualmente se dedica a la venta de ropa americana, lava, plancha ropas, pero su lavadora y secadora están descompuestas y para repararlos necesita una cantidad grande y así poder seguir lavando ropa de las personas, Rosita necesita Q.5,000.00 para poder surtir su venta de ropa americana y poder comprar una lavadora más grande de lo que tiene, su mayor deseo es tener un almacén de ropa.

loans.use: Clothing sales and laundry.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Buy merchandise and materials to make accessories

loans.name: Stella

texts.en:
Stella is 33 years old and married with six children and two orphaned dependents. She has a tailoring business on one of the paths in her village of Nsambya. Her workmanship is very good and she has a good eye for design.  She is very organized and with a good head for business. She has had this business for one year and this is her first loan.
 
With her loan, she will buy more material and embroidery. She smiles when asked what her dreams are for the future. She quickly replies that she plans to open a workshop, hire seamstresses and expand her business. With her spirit, she will surely succeed.

loans.use: To purchase more material and embroidery for her tailoring business

loans.name: Behram

texts.en: Behram I. owns and operates an auto parts store in the northeasterly Azerbaijani town of Devechi. He is currently living in Devechi with his wife and three children. Behram has already successfully repaid one prior loan with Norwegian Microcredit, proving that he is a customer that can be trusted. He is currently looking for funding in the amount of $700 so that he can finish the repairs he has begun in his shop.

loans.use: To finish repairing his shop

loans.name: Juana

texts.es:
Juana is a single mother and can't count on any support from the children's father. At the suggestion of a few friends, she began to sell clothing, shoes and other items by catalog to generate an income while still being able to care for her children. She takes extra care with them to help make up for their father's absence.

However, she had a lot of household costs which took away the profits of her business, causing a deficit. She is requesting a loan, to be repaid in 4 months, to be able to purchase the items her customers are requesting and offer them new products as well. With your help, Juana will be able to build her business and provide for a better future for her children.

Juana es una madre de familia que no cuenta con el apoyo del padre de sus hijos para poder obtener dinero para pagar los gastos de sus hijos. Es por eso que con la ayuda de unas amigas le recomendaron que vendiera ropa de vencería, zapatos y otros artículos por catálogo para poder obtener ingresos, pero sin descuidar a sus hijos, que necesitan tanto de ella para poder sobrellevar la ausencia de un padre de familia.

Sin embargo actualmente tuvo muchos gastos, por lo tanto la administración de su negocio sufrió un déficit. Es por eso que Juana está solicitando un crédito de US $300 que está dispuesta a pagarlos en un plazo de 4 meses, y con este dinero Juana podrá comprar mercancía que le están solicitando y así poder tener productos nuevos que ofrecerle a sus clientes. Con tu ayuda Juana podrá sacar adelante su negocio además de poder ayudarle a sus hijos a salir adelante y en un futuro poder estudiar una carrera universitaria.

Translated by Kiva volunteer, Emily Charnes

loans.use: TO PURCHASE MERCHANDISE TO GROW HER CATALOG BUSINESS, BETTER MEET THE DEMANDS OF HER CUSTOMERS AND IMPROVE THE QUALITY OF LIFE FOR HER CHILDREN.

loans.name: Korn

texts.en: Mrs. Korn M., age 30, works with her husband as a "middle man", purchasing rubber from the grower and reselling it for a profit, making collectively around $7/day of income. They have four children. Two are too young to attend school and two are students. She would like to request this loan of $1000 in order to purchase more rubber to expand her inventory and to repair their house.

loans.use: Korn would like to purchase more rubber to expand her inventory and to repair her house.

loans.name: Maria

texts.en:
Maria is 39 years old and is married with 2 children, ages 17 and 15. Maria started her tailoring business in 2005. Every day she works from 8.30 am to 6.30 pm at her business.

In the past, Maria took 2 loans from BRAC Tanzania to expand her business, and successfully repaid the loans. She now requests a loan to buy more supplies for her business.

loans.use: To purchase more supplies for her tailoring business

loans.name: Maria Guadalupe

texts.es:
Maria Guadalupe sells clothing. When she started this activity, her husband was unemployed, and she had to pay for the tuition of her three children, who were in high school. She needed more income since their home's expenses were high. The situation hasn't changed much since her whole family still lives in her home, and her children are still in school. Currently, they are 21-, 20-, and 19-years-old. Her 21-year-old daughter helps her buy and sell merchandise, and her husband also joined the business.

Now she needs a credit of $675, which she will repay in 6 months, to purchase merchandise and to continue doing this work. With your support, she will be able to make her business prosper.

Translated from Spanish by Tanya Harper, Kiva volunteer

Maria Guadalupe se dedica a la venta de ropa cuando inicio con esta actividad su esposo estaba desempleado y tenia que pagar la cuotas de las escuelas de sus tres hijos quienes cursaban la preparatoria. Ella ocupaba más ingresos ya que los gastos de la casa eran altos y la situación no ha cambiado mucho ya que aun vive toda la familia en su casa y ellos continúan estudiando.
