Actualmente ellos tienen 21, 20 y 19 años. Su hija de 21 años le ayuda con la compra y venta de mercancía, y también su marido se incorporó al negocio.

Ahora ella necesita un crédito por US $675 que pagara en 6 meses para comprar mercancía y continuar dedicándose a esto. Con tu apoyo ella podrá hacer prosperar su negocio.

loans.use: To purchase merchandise

loans.name: Yankafissa Group

texts.en:
The Yankafissa Group has been growing vegetables and cassava. Due to lack of sufficient farm inputs, the members could not produce enough to sell. The members are, therefore, requesting a loan of Le.2,000,000 ($700 USD) to hire labourers, to increase the size of the farm, and to purchase rice seed and fertilizer.

The members of the group need to increase their crop yields so that they can begin to profit from their farming practices. In order to do this, they need a loan that they can use to purchase inputs and labourers.

loans.use: To hire labourers, to increase the size of the farm, and to purchase rice seed and fertilizer.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase one PlayStation, two televisions, and five chairs.

loans.name: Pablo

texts.es:
Pablo is 57 years old and he married Martiniana, who is 48 years old a long time ago. They both have raised two children who still live with them. Both Pablo and his wife were working as civil servants until they retired and decided to open a business selling all kinds of electrical appliances. They both feel the desire to keep on working. Pablo mentions that they went through many difficult moments because his wife fell ill and had to continue several long and costly treatments. Nowadays they have overcome the above-mentioned problem and they thanks God for it. His dream is to consolidate in his business branch and to constitute an important business of selling of electrical appliances in his area. This time they need a loan to buy of more electrical appliances because he has a high demand of his goods.

Translated from Spanish by Samantha, Kiva volunteer.

Pablo tiene 57 años de edad y está casado hace bastante tiempo con Martiniana que tiene 48 años. Ambos han criado a dos hijos que aún viven con la pareja. Tanto Pablo como su esposa trabajaban como funcionarios públicos hasta que se jubilaron y decidieron abrir un negocio de venta de electrodomésticos de todo tipo. Ambos se sienten con ganas de seguir trabajando. Pablo comenta que pasaron por muchos momentos difíciles debido a que su esposa enfermó y tuvo que seguir varios tratamientos largos y costosos. Hoy días tienen superado dicho problema y dan gracias a Dios por haberlo logrado. Su sueño es afianzarse en el ramo y constituir un negocio importante de ventas de electrodomésticos de la zona. En esta oportunidad necesitan de un préstamo para compra de más electrodomésticos debido a que tiene bastante demanda de sus mercaderías.

loans.use: Buy appliances like blenders, tvs, etc.

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary, a married woman with six children between the ages of 35 and 50, became a banana seller in 1990. Working daily from 8 a.m. to 5 p.m., she can earn a monthly profit of about $35 from her sales.

Mary now hopes for a loan to buy more  bananas for her business.

loans.use: To purchase more bananas for her business.

loans.name: Djabrayil

texts.en: In the photo, you can see Djabrayil's sister. Djabrayil lives in Khachmaz region. He was born in 1960. This man is married and has 3 children.  Together with his sister, Djabrayil has been in the orchard business for 6 years. Now they need a loan of US$ 1200 to buy fertilizer, pesticides, and seedlings to improve their orchard.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer, pesticides. and seedlings

loans.name: Sanavvar

texts.en:
Sanavvar R. is 51 years old. She is married and the mother of 2 sons. Her elder son is 23 and the younger is 15. Sanavvar 's husband is a watchman and his income is very low; that is why she decided to start her own business so that she could help him cover their living expenses.

Sanawar is selling children’s clothing in the local market of Istaravshan city. She is trying to have a wide range of goods so as to able to meet the requirements of her customers and to satisfy the needs of customers with different levels of income.

Today Sanavvar is requesting 3400 Somoni (1000 USD) with the purpose of purchasing additional merchandise to increase her range of goods. She promises to repay the loan within 6 months. Sanavvar is counting on your help. Be an important part of the growth of Sanavvar’s business.

loans.use: Purchasing new clothing for children for re-sale

loans.name: Alex

texts.en:
Alex K. is married and has 2 children. He has received a junior high education. He is responsible for paying utility bills and other family expenses.

Alex sells used clothing at Bronibima near Elmina. He has been selling used clothing since 2005, and his wife also sells clothing.

Alex will use this loan to increase his capital to buy used clothing in larger quantities for resale. He hopes to invest the new profits into the business to increase sales, which will in turn increase his income.

loans.use: To buy used clothing in larger quantities for resale

loans.name: Alicia

texts.en: Alicia is a member of the Violeta Village Bank. She is a single mother of two and has her own business selling popcorn. With her loan, she will purchase corn, butter and sugar.  Alicia is saving to ensure her children remain in school to become professionals. She would also like to improve her business and purchase a small cart to sell popcorn.

loans.use: Buy corn, butter and sugar to make popcorn

loans.name: Heidy Thalia

texts.es:
La señora Camila pertenece al Banco Comunal “Loreto”, ubicado en el Jr. Comandante Suárez Nº 344, distrito de Callería, provincia de Coronel Portillo, departamento de Ucayali. Tiene 28 años de edad, es madre de un hijo menor de edad, es casada y su esposo es independiente en su trabajo. Con el primer préstamo que recibió de Manuela Ramos de S/. 300 decide invertir en la venta de abarrotes. Tiene 2 años trabajando con el banco comunal.

En la actualidad cuenta con una bodega en casa, la cual le brinda buenas ganancias que le permite pagar su préstamo puntualmente. 

Con este préstamo de S/ 2,000, el cual será pagado en 5 meses, comprará 1 saco de arroz, 1 saco de azúcar, 2 cajas de leche, menestras, 2 paquetes de aceites, etc.

Camila se siente contenta porque su negocio ha crecido y la estabilidad económica de su familia ha mejorado.

loans.use: Comprará 6 moldes de dulces, 2 sacos de aguajes, 6 paquetes de gaseosas, etc.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To buy basic supplies for arts and crafts

loans.name: Marisol

texts.es:
La Señora Marisol V. tiene la edad de 40 años, su estado civil es casada, Doña Marisol tiene 2 hijos con las siguientes edades 1 varón de 17 años de edad y cursa el 5 año de secundaria y una mujer de 4 años de edad y cursa el 3 nivel de preescolar, su compañero de vida labora en la venta de electrodoméstico, sus propósitos son de aumentar su mercadería ya que así lograra  mejorar su negocio por lo que sus clientes tendrán una variedad para escoger productos, sus sueños son de sacar adelante a sus hijos para que tengan un futuro prometedor ya que es importante para Doña Marisol que sus hijos sean unos profesionales, sus deseos son de aumentar el negocio para convertirlo en una tienda donde tendrá mas espacio para recibir a sus clientes y podrá mostrar su mercadería.

La actividad económica a la que se dedica es la venta de mercadería en general como: ropa interior, camisas, pantalones, shorts y sandalias, el tiempo que tiene de poseer su negocio es de 4 años, Doña Marisol inicio por cuenta propia ya que tenia que hacerse responsabilizarse por los gastos de su casa razón que la impulsa a buscar la manera de trabajar por lo que decide comprar ropa en general pero inicio con poco como: ropa interior, pantalones y camisas y decide visitar a sus vecinos y amigos por lo que además de poseer esta humilde profesión labora como enfermera  en un hospital por lo que no tenia los suficientes ingresos y ha trabajado fuertemente para lograr sus objetivos y para darle a sus hijos lo que ellos necesitan y hasta los momentos ha logrado mantener ambos trabajos a pesar del poco tiempo que tiene ya que los deseos de superación son muy fuertes aunque es algo que solo se logra con sacrificios como lo ha logrado Doña Marisol, el financiamiento es para capital de trabajo ya que esta destinado para la compra de mas mercadería por lo que tiene que recurrir a los diferentes departamentos como: Managua, Chinandega  en busca de mercadería mas favorable.
texts.en:
Marisol V. is 40 years old and single. She has two children: a son, 17, who is in his 5th year of secondary school, and a daughter, 4, who is in the 3rd year of preschool. Her partner sells electrical appliances. She wants to increase her inventory so she can improve business and provide a selection of products for her customers to choose from. Her dream is to give her children a good start so they can have a promising future; it is very important to Marisol that her children be professionals. She wants to grow her business and open a store where she'll have more space for her clientele and her merchandise. She's been in business for 4 years, selling everyday products like undergarments, shirts, pants, shorts and sandals. Marisol went into her own business because she needed take responsibility for the household expenses. She searched for the right kind of work and settled on selling clothing in general, but decided to start small by visiting friends and neighbors with items like undergarments, pants, and shirts. In addition to this humble profession, Marisol works in a hospital as a nurse. She has not had sufficient income, and has worked hard to achieve her goals so she can give her children what they need. Thus far she has succeeded in keeping up both careers, despite how little time she has. She has a strong desire to overcome, although she has done so only through great sacrifice. Marisol is seeking a loan for working capital, to buy inventory; she needs to search for better merchandise in different areas such as Managua and Chinandega.

Translated from Spanish by Jill Heske, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Evelyn

texts.en:
Evelyn T. is a rice farmer. She and her husband till the the 3.5 hectares of land that they own in order to support their family. She has 7 children, all of whom are studying. She wants them to finish their schooling so that they can find better jobs in the future. Aside from farming, Evelyn wants to have a piggery. She wants to raise pigs because they are constantly in demand. 

She is asking a loan from CEVI. She will use the loan to buy fertilizers in her farm. Some of the loan will also be used to buy piglets for her future piggery. Additionally, she is interested in looking for some other line of business that could augment their income. 

CEVI supports Evelyn in her business. They give all their clients credit assistance, training and insurance coverage.

loans.use: Purchasing fertilizer and piglets

loans.name: Magreth

texts.en:
Mambo (greetings) from Tanzania! This is 58-year-old Magreth J. T.. She is a widow with six children. She has been running a clothing business since 2007. She sells clothes of different types. She works at the business for 12 hours per day, seven days per week, and is assisted by one employee. Magreth currently earns about $100 a month from her business. She is requesting a loan in order to purchase stock in bulk. In the future, she plans to increase the quantity and range of the stock. Magreth thanks you for your support!

SELFINA has taken a lead role as a pioneer of micro-credit in Tanzania through micro-leasing. The organization is engaged in the economic empowerment of women in Tanzania through the provision of a leasing and leaseback microfinance facility.

Customs and traditions in Tanzania make it difficult for women to own land and assets, thus they are termed non-creditworthy by financial institutions. This leads to poor financial support and poor access to basic needs and services for women with low incomes. One of the primary advantages of micro-leasing is that is allows clients to use the equipment as collateral for future loans with SELFINA, thus enabling them to borrow larger sums in the future.

loans.use: To purchase stock in bulk for her business

loans.name: Tagoimurod

texts.ru: Холов Тагоймурод проживает в районе Варзоб. Возраст 57 лет, женат и имеет пятерых детей. Работает водителем . Имеет  грузовую автомашину , которую использует  в качестве перевоза  грузов , а так же крупно и мелко рогатого скота. Кроме этого занимается животноводством. Имеет хозяйство , где разводит коз. Кредит планирует получить для того, чтобы увеличить поголовье скота. Это даст возможность развивать бизнес , а  так же займет делом членов его семьи.
texts.en:
Tagoimurod H. lives in the Varzob area. He is 57 years old, is married and has five children. He works as a driver. He owns a truck which he uses to transport freight and small and large livestock. In addition he raises livestock. He has a plot where he raises goats. Tagoimurod plans to take out a loan in order to increase his livestock headcount. This will allow him to grow his business and will also give work to members of his family.

Translated from Russian by Sabina Holzman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase goats

loans.name: Victoria

texts.en: Victoria M. A. is 46 years old and married with 3 children. She sells provisions and drinks. She is requesting the loan amount of N100,000 to purchase more provisions and drinks. She says thanks to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more provisions and drinks to sell

loans.name: Rose Anyango

texts.en:
Rose Anyango Wanga, is a 43-year-old married mother of seven children. Her husband is sick and currently does not work. Her first born child is 23 and her youngest is 8. The oldest child has completed Standard 8 while the rest are still in school. She lives and works in Dunga, a small fishing village located about 5 kms outside Kisumu. She makes mats out of reeds she finds in Lake Victoria and sells them for between 50 and 100 KSH in the Kibuye market, Kisumu’s largest open air market. She plans to use the loan for transportation, as she thinks it will be less competitive in other markets.

Rose recently joined the K-MET volunteer Community Health Worker (CHW) group in Kisumu, Kenya. As a CHW member she will be trained by K-MET and will begin visiting members of her community who are sick with a variety of illness. Her work will include distributing Nutriflour (a vitamin enriched flour produced by K-MET) to malnourished patients, providing reproductive health education, referring patients to local clinics and hospitals, and providing basic health care.

loans.use: Transportation for selling reed mats in other markets

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase more clothing and offer more variety to her customers

loans.name: Mahsuda

texts.en:
Mahsuda T. is a loving wife and caring mother. She is 28 years old and lives with her family in the city of Istaravshan. Since she was 18 years old, Mahsuda helped her father with animal husbandry. Since her marriage, she continued working in the field but independently. She has one cow and two sheep that she feeds at home. Well-fed livestock brings good profit for Mahsuda. Mahsuda’s brother is a baker and makes flat bread. She helps her brother by selling the flat bread at a market. Mahsuda is requesting a loan in the sum of 1200 somoni for livestock feeding.

Translated from Russian by Anna Sorokina-Hailey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Livestock feeding

loans.name: Jorge

texts.es: Jorge tiene 56 años, vive con su esposa y el menor de sus hijos en su casa propia. Desde su niñez ha estado muy ligado a las tareas agrícolas y ganaderas y desde hace más de 5 años se dedica a la crianza y venta de animales de ganado vacuno, actividad que realiza en compañía de su esposa, quien es la que siempre vela por la buena salud de sus animales, pues de ello depende la cotización para una venta. Para mantener saludable a su ganado los lleva desde muy temprano a lugares donde abundan pastos frescos y un sol radiante, estas zonas son muy distantes de su casa, como a una hora caminando. Después de varios meses de crianza selecciona a aquellos animales que ha de vender en la feria ganadera, con cuya ganancia puede sostener, durante un tiempo prudencial, los gastos familiares. La ganadería es muy rentable para Jorge porque tiene menos riesgos de pérdida que en la agricultura y pagan un buen precio por cada animal que vende, por esta razón quiere aumentar la cantidad de animales que tiene. Esta es la tercera vez que tiene un préstamo con MFP y nota que trabajar con su banco comunal es un buen respaldo cuando lo necesita. Con el dinero que solista comprará varios becerros para criarlos y venderlos cuando sean grandes.
texts.en:
Jorge is 56 years old and lives in a home he owns with his wife and youngest child. Since his childhood he has been very connected to agicultural work and especially to live-stock farming. For the past five years he has made a living by raising and selling beef cattle. He works with his wife who always looks out for the health of the animals. The health of the animals is important when it comes to pricing and selling the animals. To keep the cattle healthly Jorge takes them out early in the morning to graze where there are abundant and fresh fields and where it is sunny. These areas are very far from his house and take about an hour to walk to. After raising the cattle for various months Jorge selects the animals that he will sell at the livestock market. The money that he makes from selling the animals allow him to provide for his family. Livestock farming is very profitable for Jorge and has less risks than growing crops. He is paid a nice sum for each animal. Because of this Jorge needs to increase the number of animals that he has. This is the third time that he is requesting a loan through MFP. He says that working with his communal bank is a great support for him. With the money that he is requesting he will buy various calves to raise and to sell when they are grown.

Translated from Spanish by San Roque School, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase calves to sell.

loans.name: Vicenta

texts.en:
Vicenta C. is from the village of Barandiaz, Pangantucan, Bukidnon. She is 61 years old. Vicenta is married and has 6 adult children. To make a living, Vicenta owns and operates a specialized retail business. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from selling through peddling "bulad" or dried fish in the local community. Vicenta has been engaged in her business for over 5 years and earns approximately 1,200 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Vicenta joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Vicenta is requesting a loan of 4,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This will be the 1st loan taken out by Vicenta from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business and pay her weekly obligation to HSPFI.

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and reaches out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Chansok

texts.en:
Mrs. Chansok S. is a villager in Svay Chuor village in Kandal province. She and her husband, Mr. Chi Chhun Long, are farmers who own a piece of land on which they grow vegetables.

In this, they face an obstacle because they do not have enough money to grow vegetables in their field. Thus, Mrs. Chansok S. needs a loan to buy cabbage seed, fertilizer, and pesticides to kill insects on the field.

Mrs. Chansok S. is 37 years old and the mother of four children who are enrolled in the local school. Her husband is shown on the right of the photo.

loans.use: To buy cabbage seed, fertilizer, and pesticides

loans.name: Tongni

texts.fr: Ce monsieur est un technicien, faute de moyens pour ouvrir son atelier, il s’est lancé dans le commerce de détail de pièces de machine d'imprimerie, il fait son commerce de façon ambulante. Il demande à WAGES un crédit pour augmenter son stock de pièces détachées.  Il est marié et père d’un enfant, c’est avec cette activité qu’il subvient aux charges de sa famille.
texts.en:
This gentleman is a technician.  Lacking the means to open his own workshop, he got started in retail commerce selling printing machine parts.  He operates his business door-to-door.  He's asking WAGES for a loan to increase his stock of parts.  He is married and the father of one child.  With this business, he provides for his family.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy printng machine parts

loans.name: Luz

texts.en: Luz C. is from the village of Mambajao, Camiguin Province. She is 30 years old, is married, and has six school-aged children. Luz owns and operates a business making and selling food, selling snacks and other delicacies in the local community. She has been engaged in her business for over a year and earns approximately 4,000 PHP a month. In 2009, Luz joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She is requesting a loan of 4,000 PHP which will be used to purchase raw ingredients needed to make products for sale. This will be the first loan from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business. About HSPFI: HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase ingredients needed to make products for sale

loans.name: Aballo

texts.en:
Aballo C. is currently in the business of selling beer at home  and is requesting a loan to purchase more crates of beer to sell.  Aballo is 35 years old and is Married with a husband that is a security guard. She has 2 children and her children go to school.  With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to pay school fees for her children.

 BRAC's holistic approach to poverty alleviation and empowerment of the poor encompasses a range of core programs in economic and social development, health, education , and human rights and legal services which are delivered through an extensive network of village organizations. BRAC has become one of the world's largest NGOs as a measured by the scale and diversity of its interventions.  In 2007, BRAC started operations in Southern Sudan. The microfinance program, which is targeted towards returning war refugees, has already formed 418 village organizations with more than 14,000 women members.

loans.use: purchase more crates of beer to sell

loans.name: Jane

texts.en: Jane is 53 year married with eight children aged between 8 and 37 years. Three of her children go to school .She resides and rents a two roomed house where she stays with seven people  Jane takes care of additional family members. The family has access to electricity and no piped water.  Jane works in semi urban area which in the outskirts of Kampala.  She owns a stall selling honey in Owino market and buys her honey from suppliers who get it from villages .  She pays transport costs to and from home. She is faced with the challenge of increasing prices of honey in Uganda.  She pay rent for her business premises at 50000/= per month and daily market dues of 300/=. Jane sells to all categories of people both on retail and whole sale and works six days a week .  She has been in this honey business for three years and with MCDT for five years servicing her tenth loan, working with the same group mates. She wants to use this loan to buy more jerrycans of honey  .  She is aspiring of seeing her business grow bigger and owning an established business and a deport for Honey suppliers

loans.use: To buy more jerrycans of Honey

loans.name: Saimudin

texts.ru: Рахимов Саймудин проживает в районе Хамадони. Возраст 42 года. Женат, имеет 8 детей. Саймудин более 19 лет проработал по специальности "педагогом". Теперь он более 6 лет занимается торговлей. Он имеет собственный магазин, в котором торгует продуктами питания и хозяйственными товарами. Кредит просит для увеличения товараоборота.
texts.en:
Saimudin R. lives in the Hamadoni district. He is 42 years old, married and has 8 children. Saimudin spent over 19 years working as a teacher. Currently, he has been involved in retail sales for over 6 years. He owns a store where he sells food products and household goods. He is requesting a loan in order to increase goods turnover.

Translated from Russian by Anna Sorokina-Hailey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increasing goods turnover

loans.name: Kalomp Group

texts.en:
Above are members of the Kalomp group.  They are small scale entrepreneurs who want a loan of Le 1,500,000 to enable them to improve their businesses. This is the first loan these entrepreneurs will be accessing from SMT/Kiva. With the help of this loan, they will be able to expand their businesses, sales will improve and so will their sales-to-profit-margin. With a larger profit at their disposal, they will be able to better look after themselves and their children.  

Zainab B. (left) is the leader of this group.  Zainab was born in Makeni city in northern Sierra Leone. She is now 35 and married to a carpenter. They have four children. All of Zainab’s children attend primary school. Zainab owns a small shop where she sells items like cold drinks, sardines, peak-milks, biscuits and breads. She has been a businesswoman for more than ten years now. Zainab will use her loan to buy more drinks, sardines, peak-milks and biscuits to add to her shop.

loans.use: To purchase additional inventory items for her shop

loans.name: José Noel

texts.es:
El señor José Noel Z. se dedica a la actividad de taller de mecánica atendido en su casa de habitación en un local amplio en el departamento de Chinandega donde es visitado por varios clientes que llegan para que el señor Z. les repare su vehículo.  Es importante destacar que él también vende repuestos y aceites. 
El crédito lo está solicitando para llevar a cabo la compra de los repuestos y los aceites para utilizarlos en la reparación de los vehículos y también para ofrecerlos a sus clientes. Está esperando que el crédito sea aprobado para así mejorar sus condiciones en el negocio.
texts.en:
José Noel Z. is an auto mechanic and runs a vehicle repair shop in his yard at home. He lives in Chinandega department where many customers come to him for their vehicle repair needs. It's important to note that he also sells vehicle replacement parts and lubricants. The financing he is requesting is to buy vehicle replacement parts and lubricants which he needs for his repair work and to sell directly to customers. He hopes that the loan will be approved so that he can improve the state of his business.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy vehicle replacement parts and lubricants.

loans.name: Violette

texts.en:
Violette is 32 years old and is married with three children aged between 4 and 17 years. She also takes care of one dependent from another family. She lives in the Nyarugenge district in Kigali, the capital city of Rwanda.

Violette has been in the retail shop business for the past three years and employs one person in this business as a helper. The hours of her business are from 7 a.m. to 8 p.m. every day except Sunday.

Violette is requesting her first loan from Kiva lenders Via Vision Finance Company in order to purchase additional items like cosmetic products. With this expansion, she believes she will earn more profits that will allow her to save money for building a secure future for her family and be able to continue paying school fees for her children.

loans.use: To purchase more cosmetics products for sale

loans.name: Lidia Maruja

texts.es:
Lidia es socia del Banco Comunal Minka.
Lidia tiene 32 años es soltera y vive en la casa de sus abuelos, Lidia tiene un bar en un local alquilado, actividad que realiza todos los días con la ayuda eventual de su hermana.
Lidia necesita un préstamo de 800 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de cerveza y gaseosa.
Los sueños de Lidia son tener sucursales, surtir con mas productos su negocio y tener una bodega.
texts.en:
Lidia is a member of the Minka Community Bank. She is 32 years old, is unmarried, and lives with her grandparents. Lidia has a bar in a rented location, and runs it every day with her sister's help.

Lidia needs a loan of 800 soles that will be invested to purchase beer and soft drinks.

Lidia dreams of opening branches (of her bar), offering more products through her business, and having a small shop.

Translated from Spanish by David Kaisel, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase beer and soft drinks

loans.name: Mohamad

texts.en:
Mohamad is a 39-year-old widower with two children. He supports his two children after the passing of their mother and he manages his time and work to be always by their side.

Mohamad has been working as a fisherman for the past twenty years. Today, he is requesting $1,000 to change his boat motor and perform maintenance on it.

loans.use: To change his boat motor and perform maintenance on it

loans.name: Juan Jose

texts.es: Juan José tiene 43 años, el tiene 3 hijos a su cargo el espíritu emprendedor de este hombre es maravilloso pues es muy humilde, pero muy feliz  con su humilde trabajo. El se dedica a ofrecer los servicios de electricista automotriz, hace mas de 15 años que se dedica a este negocio ya que siempre le ha gustado trabajar y sacar adelante a sus hijos ya que el no tuvo la oportunidad de estudiar, pues con el paso del tiempo ha obtenido nuevos clientes y además mejorar su negocio. El financiamiento que solicita es para la compra de materia prima por lo no tiene ciertas herramientas. El sueña con mejorar su vivienda y dejárselas a sus hijos.
texts.en:
Juan José is 43 years old and has three dependent children. He is a humble man who possesses an entrepreneurial spirit and works happily at his job. For over 15 years, Juan José has been providing automotive electrical services and has enjoyed this type of work. His children have been able to get ahead even though he did not have the opportunity to attend school. Over time, Juan José has been able to obtain new customers and improve his business.

This loan will be used to purchase tools that he currently does not have. His dream is to make improvements to his home, which he plans to leave to his children.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase tools for his work

loans.name: Faapepele

texts.en:
Faapepele L. is 25 and married with 2 children.  She owns a business venture, selling fabric handicrafts to tourists and local community members.  Faapepele has 2 years of experience in this business.  Faapepele needs a loan of WST $1500 to purchase raw materials to make additional handicrafts.  She plans to use the earnings from her business (estimated to be 500 talas or US $208 per week) to improve/expand the business.

In 2009, Faapepele joined SPBD.  This is her 2nd loan with SPBD. SPBD's loans are Faapepele's only access to capital because she was never able to qualify for a loan with traditional banks.

The following social metrics for Faapepele L. are provided by SPBD*:
Overall Social Metric Score:                1.6 out of 3
Level of Education:                         1.7 out of 3
Level of total Household Income:            1.5 out of 3
Quality of Household Assets:                2.3 out of 3

*SPBD measures the living conditions of each of its borrowers to track her loan progress.  The overall social metric score, provided by SPBD, is based upon a number of factors, such as the condition of the house/household assets, health, education, income level, and family reputation.  A higher number represents a higher score.  For example, a ""3 out of 3"" on education would mean that the borrower has graduated from university; a ""2 out of 3"" = secondary/high-school, and a ""1 out of 3"" would mean that the borrower is uneducated.  

For more information on this score, please see SPBD's partner page at: http://partners.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=15"

About  SPBD 
In 2000, Greg Casagrande founded SPBD and since then, it has expanded from the main island of Upolu in Samoa to Savaii, as well as Tonga.  SPBD's philosophy of lending is based upon the Grameen Bank lending method.  

Please join SPBD's lending team on KIVA to receive on-the-spot updates on SPBD: http://www.kiva.org/community/viewTeam?team_id=8375

loans.use: to purchase raw materials to make additional handicrafts

loans.name: Nyoka

texts.en:
Nyoka A. is currently in the business of selling beans, rice, phoso, etc. in a restaurant and is requesting a loan to purchase a fridge and stock crates of soda and boxes of water to sell in the restaurant.  Nyoka is 32 years old and is married to a policeman. She has four children and her children go to school.  With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to build a house for her family settlement.

 BRAC's holistic approach to poverty alleviation and empowerment of the poor encompasses a range of core programs in economic and social development, health, education, human rights, and legal services, which are delivered through an extensive network of village organizations. BRAC has become one of the world's largest NGOs as measured by the scale and diversity of its interventions.  In 2007, BRAC started operations in Southern Sudan. The microfinance program, which is targeted towards returning war refugees, has already formed 418 village organizations with more than 14,000 women members.

loans.use: To purchase a fridge, soda and water to sell

loans.name: Alina

texts.es:
La señora Alina tiene 42 años está casada con el señor Silverio y tienen 4 hijos D. (12, 9,4 y 3) años, son una familia D. escasos recursos económicos ya que actualmente no tienen casa. Viven en la casa D. sus padres donD. solo tienen 2 habitaciones para toda la familia.

Su principal actividad es la producción D. la leche cruda actualmente solamente cuenta con 4 cabezas D. ganado lechero debido a que está empezando con dicha actividad. El esposo trabaja en el servicio D. la construcción, son muy responsables y dedicados a su trabajo ya que ambos trabajan duro con la meta D. tener una casa propia.

El préstamo será destinado para la compra D. una cabeza D. ganado lechero, y D. esta manera incrementara la cantidad producida e incrementara el nivel D. ingresos.

Entre sus sueños y metas esta tener una casa propia con habitaciones para cada uno D. sus hijos y D. esta manera poder estar mas cómodas toda la familia, también su meta es crecer en cuanto a la producción D. leche y que 4 hijos puedan tener una carrera profesional.
texts.en:
Alina is 42 years old and has 4 children, aged 12, 9, 4 and 3 with her husband Silverio. They are a family with few economic resources, and they currently do not have a home of their own. They live in her parents' house, which only has 2 bedrooms for the entire family. Alina's main work is producing raw milk. She currently has only 4 milk cows, since she is just starting out with this activity. Her husband works in construction. They are very responsible and dedicated to their work; both are working hard with the goal of obtaining a house of their own. The loan will be used to buy another milk cow, thus increasing the amount of milk produced and raising their income level. Among their goals and dreams are having a house of the their own with rooms for each of their children, thus allowing the family to be more comfortable. Other goals are expanding their milk production and seeing their 4 children pursue professional careers.

Translated from Spanish by Patricia Linderman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buying a dairy cow

loans.name: Fe Y Accion 3 Group

texts.en:
Ana, 37, is a borrower who lives in Hato Mayor, Dominican Republic. She is the coordinator for her group, Fe y Accion (Faith and Action), and her story is representative of those in her group and other Dominican and Haitian borrowers at Esperanza International.

Ana and her husband live in a simple home in Hato Mayor, a small rural town in the agricultural east of the Dominican Republic. Life in rural areas of the Dominican Republic can be rough, with no potable running water, frequent power outages (if one has power to begin with), and inadequate access to healthcare, among other dangers. Despite these difficulties, Ana runs a successful business selling clothing to her community. With this loan, she will buy clothing to sell at a small markup.

This is Ana’s sixth loan with Esperanza International. With her access to capital, she hopes to continue the growth of her business. Her profits have so far led to partial construction of her home and other improvements. Ana looks forward to continuing the growth of income so she can finish her house, save, and invest in other areas to make a better life for herself and her husband.

Esperanza International seeks to free children and their families from poverty through initiatives that generate income, education and health, restoring self-worth and dignity to those who have lost hope. We have over 8,500 active associates in eleven offices in the Dominican Republic and Haiti. Thank you for lending to Ana and the Fe y Accion group!

loans.use: Clothing for resale

loans.name: Hoh

texts.en:
Hoh, age 47, works as a technician in a private company called Koshelik LLC. He earns 200,000 to 250,000 tugrugs monthly. He also used to trade products at a market called Yoshagash in Russia. Currently, his wife operates a clothing trading business at a local market called Tirlik. She has been operating her business since 1990, and has gained much experience over the years as a trader. Her daily revenue is between 40,000 and 60,000 tugrugs. Hoh supports his wife's business as well as his own work. 

Hoh and his wife have four children. The family lives in an apartment in Bayn-Ulgii province, Mongolia. Their two oldest daughters, ages 20 and 23, are university students in Turkey, and the two youngest children attend a local secondary school. The family has been living together in their current home for 22 years. With their combined earnings, they have been managing to pay their two daughters' university fees. 

Hoh is a very hardworking person and his family is the most important thing to him. He says, “I am working hard to pay my two daughters' university fees in order to provide a good education for them.” Hoh is requesting a 2,500,000 tugrug loan in order to purchase more clothing from Ereen and Taikeshken, two Chinese border towns, to sell at his wife's business.

loans.use: To purchase clothing inventory for sale at market

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Buying grocery items

loans.name: Savin

texts.en:
Mrs. Savin P. and her husband, Mr. Yoin Meas, live on an Island of the Mekong River about fifteen kilometers from Phnom Penh. They were married in 1997 and have three children: two sons and one daughter. Two of the children are in school and one is still young.

Savin has been a silk weaver for more than nine years. Besides weaving, she also started a new business selling finished silk fabric. She buys some of the finished silk fabric from the weavers in her village and transports it to sell in other provinces far away from her house.

Savin hopes to expand her new business so that she will be able to earn much more income to better support her family. So she is requesting a loan of $200 to purchase additional finished silk fabrics to sell.

loans.use: To purchase additional finished silk fabrics to sell

loans.name: Ruben

texts.es: Rubén G. L. es una persona muy trabajadora, desde hace 7 años se dedica al transporte publico, en el que tiene un camión donde traslada a la gente a su lugar destinado. En este momento; el esta pidiendo el apoyo para poder arreglar su camión ya que se le descompuso del motor lo cual requiere capital para poder repararlo. El comenta que esta es su fuente de ingresos para el sustento de su familia el es padre de al cual quiere brindar a sus hijos una mejora calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Rubén G. L. is a hardworking individual who has been providing transportation services for seven years. He has a bus that he uses to transport people to their destination. At the moment, he is requesting assistance so that he can repair his bus. The engine is broken and he needs capital in order to fix it. Rubén says this business is the source of income by which he supports his family. He is a father who wants to provide his children a better quality of life.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Pay for bus repairs

loans.name: Maria Magdalena

texts.es:
María tiene 26 años de edad, es soltera, y vive junto a sus padres y hermanos en el caserío Punto Cuatro, una zona rural perteneciente al distrito agrícola de Mochumí, la zona pertenece a la provincia de Lambayeque y se encuentra ubicada a cuarenta minutos de la ciudad de Chiclayo.

Desde hace más dos años tiene instalada en su casa una pequeña bodega donde ofrece productos de primera necesidad y abarrotes a sus clientes. Este negocio le provee los ingresos suficientes para solventar sus gastos personales y ayudar a su familia que solo percibe ingresos de la agricultura

El negocio es de mucha ayuda a su comunidad ya que les provee los artículos que necesitan diariamente, el sector donde viven está alejado de la ciudad de Mochumí y para abastecerse usualmente tienen que viajar hasta el mercado de la ciudad.

María desea ampliar su negocio con la zompra de mas productos de primeranecesidad y abarrotes de modo que pueda ampliar sus ventas y percibir mas ganancias que le permitan salir adelante y seguir apoyando a sus padres, por ello ha solicitado a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 1500 nuevos soles.

María es una joven bastante trabajadora y responsable. Anteriormente ya ha trabajado con el fondo Kiva y gracias a su ayuda pudo ampliar un poco mas su negocio, con lo cual sus ventas y clientes aumentaron
texts.en:
María is 26 years old, single, and lives with her parents and siblings in the hamlet of Punto Cuatro, a rural area that is part of the agricultural district of Mochumí, which in turn is in Lambayeque province. Her town is located 40 minutes from the city of Chiclayo. For more than two years she has had a small store in her house where she offers basic necessaries and groceries to her customers. This business gives her enough income to cover her personal expenses and help her family, which only sees income from farming. Her business is a big help to her community, since it provides them with things they need day-to-day. The area in which they live is far from the city of Mochumí, and usually to get the basics they have to travel to the market in the city. María wants to increase her business with the purchase of more necessaries and groceries so she can increase her sales and income, allowing her to improve her life and continue helping her parents. For this purpose, she has asked Edpyme Alternativa for a loan of 1,500 nuevos soles. María is a hard-working and responsible young woman. In the past she has already worked with Kiva and thanks to its help she was able to grow her business, allowing her to increase her sales and clientele.

Translated from Spanish by Zach Powell, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of necessaries and groceries to grow a store in her home

location.town: Anexo La Piedra - Caserío Punto Cuatro - Mochumí -

loans.name: Norma

texts.en:
50-year-old Norma C. and her husband Clemente’s 11 children have their own family now. However, being a mother who sees the poor situation of her children and grandchildren, she is motivated to be as productive as she can to augment the lives of her loved ones. Clemente is a farmer who plants rice and vegetables on a small parcel of land they own. Norma is a support that strengthens her husband’s livelihood, being the one who sells their products, and a help with their financial needs. Norma also has her own business venture with the support of her husband. Through the loans she received since she joined ASHI in 2007, she has been able to purchase coconut fruit from the landowners of a coconut land. She pays in advance and they are the ones to harvest the fruit when it is mature. With it, Norma and her husband have able to make “copra” which they sell in large volume to a middleman who transports and does wholesaling to a manufacturer of coconut oil in the neighboring province. As the amount of loans she requests and receives through ASHI increases, the coconut land she has able to invest on also expands, thus making the volume of her sales grow bigger and bigger.

Norma really enjoyed the business she does and her family enjoys the profit it makes. Because of this, the woman really wishes that her business would become sustainable and profitable in the future so she can employ her family members and improve their lives. With this vision, she and her husband agreed to request a much larger loan through ASHI. Since both are working so hard to grow their business and maintain a very good performance in ASHI in terms of payments and attendance at weekly center meetings, they believe that they are qualified to be trusted with the amount they are requesting.

loans.use: To purchase a larger volume of coconut

loans.name: Elvira

texts.en: Elvira T.'s main source of income comes from raising pigs for sale. She is 44 years old, married and has one school-age child. They are from the village of Poblacion, Damulog, Bukidnon. Elvira has been in her business for over five years and earns approximately 8,500 Philippine pesos (PHP) a month. In 2007, Elvira joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living conditions and enable her to engage in business activities. Elvira has successfully repaid a previous loan from HSPFI which was used to to purchase livestock to raise and sell. Elvira is requesting a new loan of 12,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional animals. This will be her 14th loan from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue to improve and expand her business. About HSPFI: HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao. Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional animals

loans.name: Florita

texts.en:
Florita D. is from the town of Rizal West, San Isidro. She is 57 years old. Florita is married and has 5 adult children. To make a living, Florita owns & operates a general store. The main source of income for the business comes primarily from selling a variety of different products in the local community. Florita has been engaged in her business for over 5 years and earns approximately 3200 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2006, Florita joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Florita has successfully repaid a previous loan of 10,000 PHP from ASKI. This previous loan was used to purchase additional products to sell. Florita is requesting a new loan of 12,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This will be the 10th loan taken out by Florita from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 29 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly of farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Mendsaihan

texts.en:
Mendsaihan M. is 35 years old and lives with his wife and three children in  the Bayanhongor province of Mongolia. His oldest daughter attends a local secondary school, his middle son is in kindergarten, and his youngest son a one-year old baby. Their household's standard is normal. His wife, Odgerel, helps in her husband's business. 

In 2004, after moving from the countryside, Mendsaihan and Odgerel bought and started to run a grocery shop with a working capital of 9,500,000 Mongolian Tugrik (MNT). Since then they have built a stable business operation. 

Mendsaihan is a very hard-working person and is very focused on growing his business. He says, "I plan to expand my grocery shop into a big supermarket." He is requesting a 2,500,000 MNT loan to purchase more grocery products for his shop.

loans.use: To purchase more grocery products to sell.

loans.name: Helen Yessenia

texts.es:
la sra. Helen Yessenia C. tiene 32 años de edad, vive en el Barrio el Pantanal, El Triunfo Choluteca.
Helen se dedica a la crianza y venta de cerdos. ahora necesita comprar varios cerdos pequeños para engorde ya que se aproxima la navidad y es cuando mas se vende la carne de cerdo ya sea por libras o los cerdos enteros.
Helen es madre de 3 hijos los cuales los tiene en la escuela, su esposo se fue para E.E.U.U. en busca de trabajo.  Lo que mensualmente le manda en remesas lo utiliza para remodelar su casa.
Helen y su esposo trabajan muy duro para sacar adelante a su familia.
el credito lo utilizara para comprar cerdos.
texts.en:
Helen Yessenia C. is 32 years old and lives in the El Pantanal, El Triunfo neighborhood of Choluteca. Helen raises and sells hogs and needs to buy several piglets to fatten them up for the Christmas holidays, when pork is in greatest demand, either by the pound or as whole hogs. She is the mother of three children, who attend school. Her husband is working in the United States and she uses the money he sends her monthly to make improvements to their home. Helen and her husband work very hard to move their family ahead. She will use the money from this loan to buy hogs.

Translated from Spanish by Hugo Reyes, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Hogs

loans.name: An

texts.en:
Mrs. An N. is 47 years old, and her husband, Mr. Vanny Sang, is 45 years old (pictured here together). They have been married since 1986 and have six children, three sons and three daughters. All of the daughters are garment factory workers, one son is a fisherman and the other two attend school.  They are living along National Road Number One about seventeen kilometers from Phnom Penh City. 

Mrs. An N. was hired by her villagers to farm to earn fees for supporting her family. Then her husband got sick and stays at home. Now An hopes to launch her own farming business, but she does not have the necessary capital. 

She is applying for her first loan of $1,000 to use as working capital.

loans.use: To start a farming business.

loans.name: Ilgar

texts.ru:
Ilgar M. 27 let. On jenat i imeyet 2 detey doch kotoroy 6 let ona idet v shkolu i sin kotoromu 4 qoda on idet v detskiy sadik. Ilgar yavlyayetsya IDP personom on pereselenec iz Fuzuli goroqa i seychas projivayet v Fuzuli region ,paselok Mahmudlu  vmeste s semyoy.

Ilgar uje 5 let kak zanimayestay etim biznessom skotovodstva. Etomu biznessu on nauchilsya u svoyeqo otca. Seychas On nujdayetsya v 2000 AZN chtobi kupit korovi dlya razvitiya svoyeqo biznessa.
texts.en:
Ilgar M. is 27 years old.  He is married and has 2 children: a 6-year-old daughter, who goes to school, and a 4-year-old son, who goes to kindergarten.  Ilgar is an IDP (Internally Displaced Person).  He is a refugee from the city of Fuzuli and now lives in the Fuzuli region, in Mahmudlu village, together with his family.

Ilgar has been involved in the animal husbandry business for 5 years.  He learned this business from his father.  Currently, he needs 2000 AZN in order to buy cattle and develop his business.

loans.use: Purchase of cattle

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To build the back portion of her house

loans.name: Haydee

texts.en:
Haydee E. is 54-years old, married and supports her family by operating two business ventures: fishing and being a caretaker of a fishpond businesse.  She lives in Purok Banagan, Brgy. Tomongtong, EB Magalona, Negros Occidental.  She has been a member of NWTF-Project Dungganon since 2006 and has improved her living conditions with the help of her loans from NWTF and through her own efforts.  By working hard in her fishing and fish vending businesses, she is gradually making her family more economically stable.  She now earns an average monthly income of PHP 9,000.  

Haydee is now borrowing PHP 20,000 so that she could purchase a new engine for her pump boat.  This will be her 8th loan from NWTF-Project Dungganon.  Her previous loan of PHP 14,000, which she paid off well within its term was just another step in her journey toward economic freedom. Haydee aspires to improve her family's living conditions and ensure their future well-being by following the Dungganon way. 

About NWTF: 

In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF), is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means Honorable). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress from earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed to a member of a community who has earned the respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work. Help NWTF continue its mission to help the poorest in the Philippines by clicking  the link to the   NWTF Kiva lending team  on Kiva.org to join our team.

loans.use: To purchase a new engine for the pump boat.

loans.name: Cesar

texts.en:
Cesar is 31 years old and is married with one child who is 2 years old.  He runs a supermarket in Rwamagana district in Rwanda.  Cesar is a self-employed businessman selling a variety of goods as his photo indicates. Among those goods, are included bread, juice, water and cooking oil. His shop is open from 5 am to 9 pm every day.

Cesar has requested a Kiva loan via Vision Finance Company in order to expand his business by purchasing a large quantity of juice, bread and water, etc., as they are highly in demand.  With this large quantity he will also start a wholesale business. In doing so, Cesar hopes to earn more profits, which will allow him to renovate his supermarket and continue paying school fees for his one relative as well as building a secure future for his own child.

loans.use: To purchase more stock such as juice, bread, and water.

loans.name: Abdukarim

texts.en:
R. Abdukarim is 44 years old, married and has four children. He makes a living by selling cattle and providing transportation services. As a rule, he buys young cattle in the central market, feeds them and than resells them for a higher price in a local market. Because he has been in this business for five years, he knows a lot about which animals to choose, the best ways to breed them and how to care for them. His work requires him to get up early every morning in order to feed his animals and look after them, but it also allows him to generate an ample and stable income for his large family. Abdukarim knows that the price of cattle is low now but believes it will increase in the future, which is why he has applied for this loan, for $3,000, to enlarge his herd. He and his family deeply appreciate the trust and support given to them by Kiva lenders.             

More about Tajikistan and IMON International
Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. A civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History
Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: To expand his business by buying cattle.

loans.name: Duong's Group

texts.en:
This group of borrowers consists of five low-income people who live together in Siem Reap Province. Duong R., 62, has been selected as a leader of the group. Duong R. is a married woman and the mother of seven children. Five of them are married and work at different occupations. Duong R. lives with her 61-year-old husband. They have been fishermen since 2000, earning approximately US$6.00 per day to use for daily expenses for their family. The family living conditions are not good because their house is old and falling down. Because of this problem, Duong R. is looking for a loan to repair her old house. 

There are four-member group who will jointly repay the Kiva loan. 
Mrs. S., 37, is a clothes seller who is asking for a loan to sustain her business growth. Mr. S., 27, is a fisherman who is requesting a loan to buy more fishing tools. Mrs. C. has a job as a fish catcher. She needs a loan to buy nets for her fishing business.
Mr. K. is a vegetable seller who is asking for a loan to buy more vegetables for selling.

loans.use: To repair her old house.

loans.name: Yoeung

texts.en:
Mr. Yoeung P. is 49 years old, and he is a villager who lives in Tuol Sala village in Kandal province. He and his wife, Mrs. Chroeng Phal, are farmers who own a plot of land which they use to cultivate rice for their family living. Mr. Yoeung P. would like to ask for a loan to buy fertilizers, rice seeds, gasoline, and to pay for hire laborers to plow his farm. Aside from farming, Mr. Yoeung P.  also earns his living though fishing, where he earns a small income to support his family. 

This couple has five children; three of whom are seamstresses in the garment factory and the others attend the local school. His wife is in the picture with him.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer, rice seeds, gasoline, and to pay for hire laborers to plow his farm.

loans.name: Ziganya Group

texts.fr:
Sarah U. est une commerçante âgée de 41 ans qui habite la  commune de Rugombo de la Province de Cibitoke a l’Ouest du Burundi. Elle fait le commerce des oignons qu’elle achète au Marche de Rugombo pour ensuite les fournir aux clients du Marche Central de la Ville de Bujumbura. Elle a fait ses études jusqu’au niveau de l’école primaire en 4e année. Elle est mère de 6 enfants qui étudient tous. Elle  arrive au 6e cycle dans le crédit Communautaire avec Turame. 

Elle demande le crédit Kiva pour  accroitre son capital  en achetant de grandes quantités des oignons à revendre à ses clients et ainsi pouvoir accroitre ses économies. Elle espère qu’avec les économies réalisées avec ce credit, elle  sera à mesure de subvenir aux besoins familiaux et acheter une parcelle pour construire sa maison.

Elle est membre  du groupe  Communautaire« Ziganya».
texts.en:
Sarah U. is a 41-year old trader, who lives in the municipality of Rugombo, which lies in the province of Cibitoke in the west of Burundi. She trades in onions which she buys at the market in Rugombo and then provides to her customers at the central market in the town of Bujumbura. She attended primary school up until 4th grade. She is mother to six children who are all studying. She is on her sixth community loan with Turame.

She is requesting the Kiva loan in order to increase her capital, by buying large quantities of onions to resell to her customers and thereby increase her savings. She hopes that the savings she makes from this loan will enable her to provide for her family's needs and buy a piece of land to build a house on.

She is a member of the "Ziganya" community group.

loans.use: To increase her capital by buying large quantities of onions to sell to her customers

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Purchase composts & fertilizers

loans.name: Reina Isabel

texts.es:
la señora Reina Isabel C. tiene 53 años de edad, esta casada y vive en la aldea Puerto la Brea de la ciudad de Nacaome.
Reina tiene su negocio de costura, tiene varios años de dedicarse a este tipo de servicios el cual a sido  satisfactorio, porque de esta manera ha salido adelante con sus hijos e hijas.
el credito lo utilizara para la compra de materiales para la fabricacion de sus prendas de vestir y tambien para la compra de repuestos para su maquina de costurar.
la señora Reina es muy popular y reconocida en su comunidad ya que es una mujer luchadora y honesta.
la señora Reina tiene como anhelo terminar de construir su casa de habitacion.
tiene muchos clientes ya que este servicio de costura es escaso en esta comunidad.
texts.en:
Mrs. Reina Isabel C. is 53 years old, married, and she live in the community of Puerto la Brea in the city of Nacaome. 

Reina has a tailoring business. She has various years providing this type of service and it has been successful. She has been able to support her sons and daughters. 

The loan will be used to purchase materials to make items of clothing and to purchase spare parts for her sewing machine. 

Reina is very popular and well known in her community because she is a determined and honest woman. 

Reina's goal is to finish building her house. She has many clients because sewing services are uncommon in the community.

loans.use: To purchase materials and spare parts for sewing machines.

loans.name: Zoraida

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal” SEÑOR DE LOS MILAGROS DE CHIMPAHUAYLLA”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de San Jerónimo,  perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Zoraida; la socia tiene 27 años de edad, conviviente y tiene 2 hijos; la socia se dedica  al negocio de compra y venta de leña y carrizo ella vende por arrobas a sus clientes que le solicitan a la vez la socia tiene su tienda de abarrotes  el cual ella vende productos de primera necesidad como arroz, azúcar y leche, la socia es una persona bien alegre y con muchas ganas de querer seguir adelante por su familia.

La socia solicita el préstamo para la compra de más productos como carrizo y leña y  para aumentar la mercaderia para su tienda de abarrotes.

La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
Sra. Zoraida is a member of the Communal Bank “Señor de Los Milagros de Chimpahuaylla” which is located in the District of San Jeronimo, Province and Department of Cusco.

She is 27 years old, in a common law marriage, and has two children. Zoraida has a business buying and selling firewood and reeds. She sells in bundles by weight according to how much her customers order. Zoraida also has a grocery store where she sells basic necessities such as rice, sugar, and milk. She is a cheerful person who wants to succeed on behalf of her family. The loan she is requesting will be used to buy reeds, firewood, and more merchandise for her grocery store.

Zoraida is happy with the loan and promises to complete her payments.

loans.use: To purchase merchandise for her grocery store as well as firewood and reeds.

loans.name: Sor

texts.en:
Sor S. is a 32-year-old woman who was divorced from her husband a few years ago. She lives with her three children in the province of Kompong Tom, and the children are enrolled in the local school.

Sor sells boiled corn in the market place. She usually generates an income of about 2.5 USD a day to help support the family in its expenses.

Sor is applying for a loan to buy more corn to boil for resale. Sor hopes this loan will help her earn additional profits so as to raise her family’s standard of living. She dreams of building a bigger house and having all of her children finish high school.

loans.use: To buy more corn to boil for resale

loans.name: Aean

texts.en:
Mrs. Aean, age 54, is a white wine maker and a farmer. She owns a 10-hectare plot of land where she grows rice. She sells part of the rice she harvests and with the rest of the rice she supports her family. She is a widow with six children, two of whom are farmers and one of whom is employed in an organization. The youngest are studying in the local public school. 
  
She is currently encountering problems because her field contains infertile soil and it has a lot of insects. To improve her production of rice, Mrs. Aean is applying for a loan in order to buy fertilizer and pesticide.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and pesticide for use in her rice field

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to make more tables and chairs for her restaurant and to invest in buying her own real estate.

loans.name: Por Venir Group

texts.es: El banco D. emprendimiento "POR VENIR" se encuentra en su séptimo ciclo, el cual esta conformado por personas responsables y trabajadoras, este Banco D. Emprendimiento esta representado por las siguientes socias: Presidenta es la señora Beneranda quien convive con su pareja, tiene 4 hijos pequeños que se encuentran en edad escolar, su actividad económica es la D. pintor juntamente con su pareja y como actividad secundaria es la D. empleada D. limpieza, ya que cuando no tienen contratos para pintar casas la Sra. realiza limpieza en casas e instituciones, con el dinero del credito comprara pintura por cantidad y materiales y herramientas para el pintado D. casas es una persona muy trabajadora ya que junto a su esposo mantienen a su familia unida, su deseo es el D. poder comprar su casita para así brindar mayor comodidad a su familia, esta agradecida con la institución por el apoyo brindado.
texts.en:
The entrepreneurial bank "POR VENIR" is in its seventh cycle; its members are hardworking and responsible people. Beneranda is the president of the bank; she lives with her partner and has four school age children. Beneranda and her husband's main economic activity is painting houses. In addition, when they do not have a house-painting project, she also gets temporary work cleaning homes and offices.

Beneranda will use the loan to purchase paint in quantity as well as other materials and tools necessary for house-painting work. She is a very hardworking person; together with her husband they keep a very close family. Her wish is to buy a house so that she could bring a greater level of comfort to her family. She is very grateful for all the help that is provided.

loans.use: to purchase paint in quantity; to purchase materials and tools for painting houses

loans.name: Juan Enrique

texts.es:
Juan es padre de familia de 34 años, tiene casa propia donde vive con su esposa e hijos la cula cuenta con los servicio de agua y luz  en  el caserío de Punto Nueve, zona rural del departamento de Lambayeque.  Los pobladores de esta zona se dedican a la agricultura y ganadería.

Juan  labora manejando su mototaxi (transporte que se utiliza para movilizarse en distancias cortas, con un cupo máximo de 3 personas) desde hace 5 años aproximadamente, está actividad lo realiza en su mismo distrito, pero también tiene unas tierras de cultivo, al tener su mototaxi puede ir a ver sus tierras más seguido.  Ambas actividades le permite tener más ingresos para cubrir sus gastos familiares. 

El crédito que ha solicitado a Edpyme Alternativa es de 500 nuevos soles y su destino será para la  compra de fertilizantes para preparar y mejorar sus tierras y pueda tener una mejor producción.  Juan es una persona muy trabajadora y responsable que lo único que quiere es salir adelante  y como todo padre quiere darle a su familia las comodidades que se merecen.
texts.en:
Juan, 34, is a father.  He owns his house where he lives with his wife and children.  The house has water and electricity and is located in Punto Nuevo, a rural part of Lambayeque Department.  Residents here are farmers and raise livestock.

Juan has been working driving his mototaxi (mode of transportation used for short distances able to carry a maximum of three passengers) for about five years.  He carries out this work in his own district.  However, he also has farmland and having a mototaxi makes it possible for him to visit his fields more often.  Both activities allow him to have more income to cover family expenses.

The loan he asked Edpyme Alternativa for is for 500 new soles that he’ll use to buy fertilizer to prepare the soil and improve his land to have a better crop yield. 

Juan is a very hard working, responsible person.  All he wants is to get ahead and, like all fathers, provide his family with the comfort they deserve.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer.

loans.name: Dalberto Bayron

texts.es:
Dalberto Bayron tiene 22 años, Es soltero vive con la madre y un hermano, vive en el Cantón Ventanas Provincia de los Ríos. 

Los miembros de la V.R.C. LA UNION se encuentra ubicada en el Recinto Aguas Frías de Medellín, perteneciente al Cantón Ventanas, esta ventanilla se dedica labores agrícolas de ciclo corto siembra de maíz, arroz, frejol gandul.

Dalberto se dedica a la agricultura la siembra de maíz y frejol, las compras las realiza en Ventanas y las vende en las ferias de todos los días en especial  la de los domingos.

Solicita el crédito para la compra de semillas, fertilizantes y abonos.  Con el apoyo del crédito le ayudaría económicamente para suplir sus necesidades. Enfrentar desafíos es la competencia y la variación del clima. Su sueño es ccomprar una casa

Le gusta trabajar.
texts.en:
Dalberto Bayron is 22 years old.  He’s single living with his mother and brother in Vantanas Canton, Los Ríos Province.

The “La Unión” (Unity) communal bank is located in Aguas Frías de Medellín which belongs to Ventanas Canton.  The members of this communal bank are short cycle corn, rice and pigeon pea farmers.

Dalberto farms corn and beans.  His purchases are done in Ventanas and his sales at daily farmers markets, especially Sunday’s.

He is asking for a loan to buy seeds, fertilizer and manure.  Support from the loan will help him economically to meet his needs.  The challenges he faces are competition and weather variations.  

His dream is to buy a house.  He likes to work.

loans.use: to buy seeds, fertilizer and manure.

loans.name: Rodel

texts.en:
This is Rodel , 41, a resident of Silang, Cavite, Philippines. He is married to Rosanna, a housewife and mother to their children. He, together with his wife, manages their household while operating the business. At this time, he is working hard to continually provide income for their everyday expenses.

Rodel operates a variety store. In the Philippines, a variety store is basically a small convenience store, which retails groceries, toiletries and beverages to the local neighborhood. Aside from the store, he has a small videoke machine at home. A videoke is a combined term for video karaoke. 

Rodel earns his income by purchasing supplies at wholesale prices and selling by the piece in his store; having his videoke machines for rent; and putting up a small area of his house as a small videoke area where people can hang out and sing. His regular customers are his neighbors and the local community. He earns a minimum of 268 PHP in sales every day.

To help him continue operations of his business, he is requesting a 27,000 PHP loan. He will be utilizing the loan to buy groceries, toiletries and beverages to expand his product inventory, and for maintenance of his videoke machines. He expects a boost in his business income as he expands his business. 

Rodel hopes to be able to expand soon, just as he hopes to support his children's schooling up to college level. He faithfully meets up with his co-fellowship* members to share stories of his work every week and where he can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God he studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: to pay for grocery products and inventory items needed in his variety store

loans.name: George

texts.en:
George is 46 years old, married to Caroline and has two children. He has been running his carpentry business for the past thirteen years. He earns a monthly income of about 10,000 KES which he uses to take care of his family.

George has been loaned 40,000 KES by KADET LTD. This is his second loan from KADET. He intends to use the entire loan to purchase more timber for his business.

George plans to use his anticipated profits to expand his business and educate his children.

loans.use: to purchase more timber for his business.

loans.name: Amigas Por Siempre (Portoviejo) Group

texts.es:
En  la ciudadela Municipal de la ciudad de Portoviejo se reúnen  cada quince días los socios  del Banco Comunal Amigos Por Siempre. Los mismos que se dedican a diversas actividades tales como comercio en general, servicios, entre otras cosas. Ellos unieron sus esfuerzos para poder acceder a los beneficios que presta la Fundación Espoir, este es su primer ciclo en el Banco Comunal  y esperan cumplir muy bien para seguir adelante en la institución.

Aquí conocimos a la señora Angela, tiene 33 años  de edad, es madre soltera de dos hijos de años de 14 y 1 año de edad, el mayor estudia en colegio. Tiene casa propia en la cual vive junto a sus hijos. Estudio párvulo en la Universidad Técnica De Manabí.

Ella trabaja en un Centro infantil,  allí les dedica el mejor de los cuidados a los pequeños que llegan hasta esta institución mientras las madres se desplazan hasta sus respectivos trabajos, pero además de esto ella también se dedica a la venta de productos Avon (productos de belleza, cosméticos, perfumería y accesorios para damas) y ropa interior. Trabaja los fines de semana en las ventas ya que de lunes a viernes trabaja en la guardería, deja sus productos a crédito y cobra cada semana. Tiene dos años que se dedica a esta actividad y le va muy bien.

Este crédito es para comprar perfumes, cremas, cosméticos y ropa interior. Este es el primer  ciclo en el Banco Comunal y le gusta porque los créditos son fáciles de hacer.
 
Su sueño es tener una boutique.
texts.en:
The members of the “Amigos Por Siempre” communal bank meet every two weeks in the Portoviejo citadel.  They’re involved in different activities, such as general business, services, among other things.  They joined efforts in order to be able take advantage of the benefits offered by Fundación Espoir.  This will be the communal bank’s first cycle and they hope to finish it well and continue ahead with the institution.

Here we meet Angela.  She’s 33 years old and is the single mother of two children, ages 14 and 1.  The oldest attends school.  She has her own home, where she and her children live.  She studied young at the De Manabí Technical University.

She works at the children’s center and provides the best care to the little ones who arrive here, while their mothers go to their respective jobs.  Besides this, she also sells Avon products (beauty products, cosmetics, perfumes, and women’s accessories) and undergarments.  She works her sales on the weekends because she works at the daycare center Monday through Friday.  She sells her products on credit and makes weekly collections.  She’s been doing this for two years and things are going well for her.

She will use the money from this loan to buy perfumes, creams, cosmetics, and undergarments.  This will be her first cycle with the communal bank and she likes it because the loans are easy to obtain.

Someday she hopes to have her own boutique.

loans.use: to buy cosmetics and undergarments for resale.

loans.name: Cristina

texts.es:
Las reunión del banco comunal “Patrón Santiago De Santiago” son cada treinta en la ciudad de Cusco y ahi conocimos a la socia Cristina y nos cuenta:

“Nací en la ciudad del Cusco, tengo 37 años edad, soy casada y tengo dos hijos y vivó en la misma ciudad donde nací y donde desarrollo mi actividad económico que es la venta de mochilas”. 

Cristina tiene un pequeño puesto de venta de mochilas en el centro comercial “Paraíso”.  Ya son dos años que se dedica a este negocio y le va muy bien gracias al empeño que pone en su trabajo. En esta oportunidad Cristina requiere el préstamo para comprar mercadería como por ejemplo mochilas, maletines, cartucheras, bolsos y otras cosas más. Su sueño de la socia abrir un tienda donde pueda vender exclusivamente mochilas de marca.
texts.en:
The "Patron Santiago de Santiago" communal bank holds its meetings every thirty days in Cusco city. It is here that we meet the member named Cristina, and she tells us:
