"I was born in Cusco city. I am 37, married, have two children, and live in the same city in which I was born. It is here that I run my business, which is selling backpacks."

Cristina has a small backpack stall in the "Paraiso" shopping centre. She has had this business for two years and it is going very well for her thanks to the hard work that she puts into her work. At the moment, Cristina requires a loan for the purchase of merchandise, for example backpacks, briefcases, cases, bags, and other items. Her dream is to open a store where she can sell brand-name backpacks exclusively.

loans.use: to purchase merchandise, for example backpacks, briefcases, cases, bags, and other items.

loans.name: Kabingo Womens Group

texts.en: Damazo is a 29-year-old married man with three children. He lives in his own semi-permanent house in Kamwenge, Uganda. His family's goal is to buy a motor vehicle in the next six years. He operates a retail shop and he has been in business for eight years now. The major constraint he encounters is the delayed debt settlements. His dream is to own a wholesale shop. Damazo needs the loan to buy boxes of washing soap to sell. Out of the 19  members in his group, only 17 took the loan; the other two guarantee them according to the group policy.

loans.use: To buy boxes of washing soap to sell

loans.name: Rahimakhon

texts.ru:
Рахимахон 46 лет, замужем и имеет четверых детей, двое их которых – школьники.  Начав свой бизнес  в сельском хозяйстве  более 10 лет назад практически с нуля,  Рахимахон добилась хороших результатов. На сегодняшний день в ее хозяйстве восемь голов овец и возделанная земля с картошкой, кукурузой и подсолнечником.  Ежемесячный доход от продажи такой продукции составляет в среднем 6,000 сом (KGS), что является хорошей поддержкой для семьи, где муж получает только пенсию по инвалидности. 
Рахимахон обратилась в компанию «Бай Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом  сумме 80,000 сом для покупки скота.  Доходы от деятельности она планирует вложить в расширение и реконструкцию сарая для животных. 
ЗАО МФК "Бай-Тушум и Партнеры" предоставляет кредиты по линии Кива для социально-уязвимых слоев населения. ЗАО МФК "Бай-Тушум и Партнеры" является одной из лидирующих Микрофинансовых организаций Кыргызстана. "Бай-Тушум и Партнеры" – это надежный финансовый партнер, осуществляющий вклад в развитие экономики Кыргызской Республики путем предоставления доступных микрофинансовых услуг в сельской местности и городах, способствующих созданию рабочих мест и отвечающий интересам своих клиентов и инвесторов.
texts.en: Rahimakhon is 46 years old, married and has four children, two of whom are school students.  Having started her agricultural business over ten years ago with practically nothing, Rahimakhon achieved good results.  Today, she has eight heads of sheep and cultivated land with potatoes, corn and sunflowers in her household.  Her monthly income from the sale of these products amounts to an average of 6,000 som (KGS), which provides a good support for the family, where the husband receives only a disability pension.  Rahimakhon went to the "Bai Tushum and Partners" to obtain a loan in the sum of 80,000 som for the purchase of livestock.  She plans to invest the resulting income into business expansion and repairs for the animal shed.

loans.use: to purchase livestock

loans.name: Gaby

texts.es: La señora Gaby trabaja como comerciante de productos alimenticios, también trabaja como empleada en una confitería - salon de té de la ciudad de La Paz. El crédito lo requiere para la compra de mercadería como ser arroz fideo, azúcar, por quintales (es decir al por mayor) para obtener utilidad al momento de vender. Vive en casa de sus padres la cual queda ubicada en la zona de Munaypata ubicada en la ciudad de La Paz, es divorciada y tiene un hijo. Es la primera vez que obtiene un crédito en IMPRO.
texts.en:
Sra. Gaby works as a merchant who sells food products.  She is also an employee of a candy shop/tea salon in La Paz.  The loan she is requesting will be used to buy merchandise such as rice, noodles, and sugar in bulk so that she can obtain profits from her sales.  Gaby lives at the home of her parents in the District of Munaypata in the city of La Paz.  She is divorced and has one child.

This is the first time she has obtained a loan from IMPRO.

loans.use: to buy rice, noodles, and sugar in bulk.

loans.name: Moussa

texts.fr:
Né il y’a 33 ans à N’Golo-Diassa situé à environ 6 km de la ville de Sikasso, Monsieur Moussa est marié et père de deux garçons, il réside avec sa femme et leurs enfants dans une grande famille traditionnelle élargie dans son village natal.
Monsieur Moussa est un mécanicien de profession depuis plus de huit ans, qui dispose également dans le souci de faciliter à ses clients de s’acquérir de pièces d’occasions d’origines et de qualités, un magasin d’achat-vente de pièces détachées (des bielles, arbre à came, pistons, jantes, carters, vilebrequins, culasses etc). Il est beaucoup sollicité de sa clientèle pour la qualité de ses produits. 
Pour satisfaire sa clientèle de plus en plus croissante, il décida de rejoindre l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso il y a maintenant deux années Il  est à son cinquième prêt individuel et tous les quatre prêts précédents ont été remboursés correctement.
Il compte acheter avec ce cinquième  prêt, un  véhicule casse pour en extraire un grand lot de pièces détachées. Les marchandises (pièces)  qui sont issues  du démontage sur place de véhicules casses, sont revendues dans son magasin au sein de son garage, en détail et généralement au comptant.
Il envisage réaliser avec ce prêt un bénéfice mensuel de 125 000 FCFA qui sera utilisé essentiellement pour contribuer aux dépenses familiales, payer les intérêts de son prêt et investir le reste dans son activité.
texts.en:
Mr. Moussa, age 33, was born in N'Golo-Diassa, which is located about 6 km from the city of Sikasso. Married with two sons, he lives with his wife and their children in a large, extended traditional family in his hometown.

An auto mechanic by trade, Mr. Moussa has been practicing this activity for over eight years. He also buys and sells quality genuine spare parts and runs a shop where his customers can purchase used parts such as connecting rods, camshafts, pistons, rims, crankshafts, cylinder heads, etc. He is in high demand due quality of his merchandise.

To meet the needs of a growing customer base, he decided to join the microfinance institution Soro Yiriwaso two years ago. This is his fifth individual cycle, and all four previous loans were repaid properly. 

With this fifth loan, he plans to buy a scrap vehicle in order to extract a large number of spare parts. The parts obtained from scrap vehicles dismantled on site are sold in the shop he runs from his garage, at retail, usually for cash.

He expects to earn a monthly profit of 125,000 FCFA, which he will use primarily to help with the family expenses and pay the interest on the loan. Any remainder will be reinvested in his business.

loans.use: to buy scrap cars and sell the spare parts

loans.name: Edilma Maria

texts.es: Edilma D. 56 años D. edad, es madre D. 3 hijos vive en la ciudad D. Cartagena, donD. se dedica a la actividad D. comerciante, ella venD. productos alimenticios como dulces y mercancía variada por encargo, que distribuye cliente a cliente en el barrio donD. habita y en los alrededores D. este;  Antes D. iniciar su vida comercial fue empleada del servicio doméstico y poco a poco ahorró hasta lograr tener su primer capital e independizarse mediante este negocio. Sus ventas son a crédito y sus compras las hace D. contado; hoy se prepara para comprar más volumen D. mercancías, pues debe  atender el último trimestre del año,  que son épocas D. buenas ventas. Esto es lo que justamente hará con su credikiva, primer financiamiento que hace a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, comprará productos D. dulcería para surtir su chaza y cosméticos, accesorios etc. Su meta más adelante es tener su propia casa y adecuar allí un local bien construido. Esta es la razón por la cual su visión D. negocio no es otra que crecer.
texts.en:
56-year-old Edilma is a mother of three children.  She lives in the city of Cartagena where she works as a saleswoman.  She sells food products such as sweet treats and also sells a range of merchandise to order.  She distributes her merchandise customer to customer in her neighborhood and surrounding areas.  Before she started her life as a saleswoman, Edilma worked as a maid.  She gradually saved up until she'd gathered together her first lot of capital and then started working for herself in this business.  She makes her sales on credit and buys with cash.  She is preparing to buy a larger volume of merchandise as she needs to have enough stock to deal with the final quarter of the year which is a period when she makes good sales.  

Edilma will use her Kiva loan, which is the first loan she has received from Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, to buy sweet treats with which to stock her street stall, and also to buy cosmetics and accessories.  Her goal for the future is to own her own home and to set up a well-constructed sales location there.  This is why her vision for her business is simply to grow it.

loans.use: to buy sweet treats to stock her street stall, and to buy cosmetics and accessories

loans.name: Kelly

texts.es: Kelly tiene 46 años, es una mujer alegre y entusiasta, es docente de profesión, actualmente lo ejerce, pero además se dedica en la venta de perfumería. Es separada, vive en su propia casa con sus padres, sus dos hermanos, tiene un hijo que es mayor de edad y de vez en cuando la visita. Es así que el negocio de venta de cosméticos lo realiza por medio de catálogos y los ofrece amistades y familiares, dejándoles a crédito la mercadería. Y al cabo de 15 días realiza la cobranza. Tiene 3 años y hasta el momento lo ha realizado sola, perole agrada por que así puede generarse un ingreso extra, además que le permite tener tiempo para dedicarse a otra cosa. Ahora tiene muchos pedidos de sus clientes y por ello tiene planes de crecer  y abrir un local de venta de perfumería y cosméticos. Este será su cuarto crédito con MFP, por tanto espera el apoyo de cada uno de ustedes para continuar invistiendo en su negocio. Con el crédito solicitado, comprará más perfumes de diversas presentaciones a un menor precio y piensa comprar más cosméticos para cumplir con la demanda de sus clientes.
texts.en:
Kelly is 46 years old.  She is a cheerful and enthusiastic woman.  She is a teacher by profession and currently works in this job.  However, she also sells perfumes.  Kelly is separated and lives in her own home together with her parents and her two siblings.  She has one grown-up son who visits her occasionally.

Kelly makes her cosmetics sales through catalogs.  She sells to friends and family members, leaving her merchandise with them on credit.  She collects payment two weeks later.  Kelly has had her business for three years and, up to now, she has carried out her work on her own.  However, she enjoys it because it allows her to make extra income and allows her to have time to spend on other things.  She currently has many orders from her customers and, for that reason, she has plans to grow her business and open a sales location where she can sell perfumes and cosmetics.

This will be Kelly's fourth loan from MFP and she hopes to receive your support so that she can continue investing in her business.  She will use the loan she has requested to buy different styles of perfume at a lower price.  She also plans to buy more cosmetics to meet her customer demand.

loans.use: to buy perfumes and cosmetics

loans.name: Duo Guadalupe Group

texts.es:
DUO GUADALUPE
El grupo está integrado por dos señoras  quienes son Tiburcia  necesita otro crédito para invertir en sus ventas de helados y Frutas Con el credito quiere compra frutas  para elavorar elados donde vive porque en el  mes de septiembre ellos celebran  su Feria Patronal de su Aldea de Vista hermosa  ella  tiene ubicado  su negocio  en el cetro de donde realizan todas las actividades alusivas a la  feria y ella quiere aprovechar invirtiendo en mas  frutas para así mismo poder generar más ingresos en la misma  su deseo es seguir  vendiendo  y así poder  ser una ayuda para su esposo en los gastos cotidianos y sacar adelante a sus hijos, la señora Jesús necesita el crédito igualmente para poder invertir  en la venta de  frutas que tiene ubicada  en la ciudad capital   y así mismo poder surtir  en sus frutas de temporada  su deseo de ella seguir superando para sacar adelante a sus hijos que aun tiene estudiando. Las señoras agradecen a fape por el gran apoyo y ayuda que les ha brindado.
texts.en:
The group Duo Guadalupe is composed of two women, Tiburcia and Jesús. 

Tiburcia needs another loan to invest in her business selling ice cream and fruit. She wants to use the funds to buy fruit to make ice cream. She lives in Aldea Vista Hermosa and they celebrate their village's patron saint's day in September. Her business is located in the village center where they hold all the festival activities. She wants to take advantage of this and buy more fruit, in order to generate higher income. 

Tiburcia's goal is to continue in sales so that she can help her husband with daily expenses and give her children a good start in life. 

Jesús, the second woman in the group, also needs the loan to invest in her business selling fruit, which is located in the city capital. The funds will allow her to stock seasonal fruits. 

Jesús' goal is continue succeeding, so that her children, who are still in school, will get a good start in life. 

Both women are appreciative to FAPE for the great support and assistance which has been offered to them.

loans.use: to buy fruit at wholesale to make fruit ice cream.

location.town: Aldea Vista Hermosa, San Pedro Sacatepequez

loans.name: Maria

texts.es: La Sra. María vive en la zona del plan 3000 en casa propia junto a sus hijos, ella es promotora de cosméticos desde hace 2 años, ya  saco un crédito  anterior que fue  para aumentar su capital de trabajo. Este nuevo crédito es para la compra de material de construcción para terminar de construir un cuarto. La Sra. María ha aumentado su numero de clientes y de esa forma le ha generado mas ingresos con lo cual esta terminando de construir su casa y cuenta con el apoyo de sus hijos, ella ha tenido un buen comportamiento de pago. La Sra. María es muy proactiva, busca la forma de vender sus productos y es una persona que tiene una actitud positiva con las personas.
texts.en: María lives in the "Plan 3000" neighborhood in her own house, together with her children. She has sold cosmetics for the past two years. She has taken out a previous loan, for the purpose of increasing her working capital. This new loan is to buy construction materials to finish building a room in her house. María has expanded her customer base and thus has generated more income, which she is using to finish constructing her house. She has the support of her children, and she has had an excellent payment record. María is very proactive, always looking for ways to sell her products, and she is someone who always has a positive attitude with other people.

loans.use: to buy construction materials.

loans.name: Regina

texts.en:
Regina, aged 48, lives in Masindi, Uganda. She is single mother of two children. She is a civil servant and also runs a hotel. She desires to educate her children, build a permanent house, and save for a wedding. The problems for her business are price fluctuations and seasonal weather.

Regina wants a loan to buy construction materials for building.

loans.use: to buy construction materials for building.

loans.name: Akua

texts.en: Akua sells secondhand clothes at Watreso near Abura. She has been selling secondhand clothing for eight years. Akua is married to a driver and has six dependants. She uses her income to assist her husband in providing for their family. She will use her loan to purchase more clothes for resale. With the new profit, Akua plans to acquire a shop to sell her clothes.

loans.use: purchase more clothes for resale.

loans.name: Rocyll

texts.en:
Rocyll is 35 years old and married with two children.

Rocyll works hard to provide for her family. She runs a sari-sari store in the Philippines and has requested a PHP 13,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more stock to sell in her sari-sari store.

Rocyll has borrowed and paid back seven loans from NWTF previously. She has been running the sari-sari store for seven years and also earns an income from frozen foods and farming rice.

Rocyll aspires to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more stock to sell in her sari-sari store.

loans.name: Rita

texts.en:
This is Rita, 32, resident of Tanza, Cavite City, Philippines. Her husband is Reynaldo, a driver, and they have three children. She, her husband, and their children, manage their own household while operating a business. At this time, she is working hard to continually provide income for her family's everyday expenses.

Rita operates a variety store. In the Philippines, a variety store is basically a small convenience store that sells groceries, toiletries, and beverages piecemeal to the local neighborhood. The variety store is the place to go to buy one small container of shampoo, five PHP-worth of cooking oil, or a single egg. She earns money by getting supplies at wholesale prices and selling items individually. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She earns a minimum of 350 Philippine Pesos (PHP) in sales every day.

To help her continue to operate her business, she is requesting an 8,000 PHP loan. She will use the loan to buy groceries, toiletries, beverages, and other products needed in her business. She expects a boost in her income as she expands her business. 

Rita hopes her business grows in the coming years and dreams that, through all her hard work on her business, she will be able to give her children a high-quality education. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship* members every week, where she can share stories of her work and also draw strength and inspiration from studying the Word of God.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: to buy stock for her variety store.

loans.name: Maria Raquel

texts.es:
Maria Raquel  vive en Ica ,ciudad caracterizada actualmente por el incremento de inversión, no solo en la agroexporaciones, es decir en los fundos, si no también, en la apertura de nuevos centros comerciales que brindan muchos puestos de trabajo a pobladores iqueños;  como bien se sabe el Perú se caracteriza por tener las comidas más deliciosas del mundo y uno de los platillos que más le agrada es “Carapulcra con Sopa Seca”  Maria Raquel estudió hasta quinto grado de primaria y l hubiera gustado estudiar para ser profesora, tienen 4 hijos todos ellos han terminado de estudiar en nivel superior.	

"Maria Raquel se dedica al Venta de Comida junto a la ayuda de su pareja; ofrece diversos platillos de la exquisita comida peruana, aproximadamente  se dedica a u negocio 3 horas diarias, y se animo gracias a la iniciativa de una de sus amigas.  En un día Maria Raquel puede atender diariamente un promedio de 45 clientes y esto le permite ganar aproximadamente un promedio de S/. 250 diarios y en un buen día puede ganar S/. 300,  lo que le ayuda en algunos gastos adicionales del hogar, ella cree que su negocio tiene éxito debido lo rico que prepara los platillos  y por la amabilidad en el trato a los clientes. 

Maria  agradece  mucho a los prestatarios Kiva ya que con el apoyo brindado Maria va  remodelar  y comprar  más utensilios para su cocina. Esta mejora podrá ayudarla a realizar su trabajo de manera mas cómoda y con mejores utensilios para la preparación de los platillos y así poder en algunos meses Tener más clientela y con los ingresos juntar el dinero para poder cumplir uno de sus más grandes sueños: “Tener un restaurante propio”.
texts.en:
Maria Raquel lives in Ica, a city currently characterized by increased investment, not only in exports of agricultural products, that is to say financing these, but also in the opening of new retail centers that provide many jobs to people living in Ica.  As is well known, Perú is noted for having some of the most delicious food in the world, and one of the most pleasing dishes is Carapulcra con Sopa Seca (a spicy potato-based stew served with green noodles).

Maria Raquel went to school as far as fifth grade of primary, and would have liked to study to be a teacher. They have four children, all of whom have completed post-secondary studies.

Maria Raquel sells food with the help of her partner. She offers various dishes of exquisite Peruvian food. She works at her business approximately three hours daily, and was encouraged because of the initiative of one of her friends. 

In a day, Maria Raquel can serve an average of 45 customers, and this allows her to earn, on average, approximately 250 soles per day; on a good day she can earn 300 soles. This helps her meet a few additional household expenses. She thinks her business is succesful because of how delicious her dishes are, and the friendly way she serves her customers.  

Maria really appreciates the Kiva lenders, since with the support she has been provided, Maria is going to renovate and buy more utensils for her kitchen. 

This improvement will help her carry out her work more comfortably, and with better utensils for preparing dishes. This way she will be able to have more customers in a few months, and with the income, raise money to fulfil one of her greatest dreams, "To have my own restaurant."

loans.use: To buy cooking utensils, and improve her kitchen.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase hardware supplies.

loans.name: Joseph

texts.en:
Joseph is 34 years old, married, and has four children. He lives with his family in Litein where he is a farmer. His farm produces milk, potatoes, and maize for the local market. His farm is run with the help of two farmhands.

Joseph has requested a loan of 30,000 KES from Juhudi Kilimo to buy a dairy cow. He says the increased dairy income will help him build a modern zero grazing unit, improve on the quality of his cows for better income, and meet family needs.

He states that limited financial resources, poor weather, and animal diseases remain the major challenges.

loans.use: To buy a dairy cow

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Jasyline wants to buy materials for making bead ornaments in large quantity.

loans.name: Martha

texts.en: Martha operates a "chop bar" in her community. She sells meals the locals enjoy. A loan of $700.00 will enable her to buy the supplies necessary to cook and sell more foods and expand her trade.

loans.use: working capital

loans.name: Yea

texts.en: Y. Y. is 29 years old and lives with his wife and two young children in Phnom Penh, Cambodia.  He is an electrician and can make about $10.00 per day.  His wife stays at home in order to watch their two young children.  The family hopes to use this loan to purchase wood in order to repair their house--specifically to protect it from leaking during the rainy season.  Additionally, Y. Y. wants to purchase electrical tools for his business.  In the future, Y. Y. would like to open his own electrical shop.  It is the couple's dream to one day build a concrete house for the family.  Eventually, they hope they will have enough money to send their children to university.

loans.use: To purchase wood to repair the family's house and to purchase electrical tools for his business

loans.name: Murod

texts.en: Y. Murod is 69 years old. His wife died and he has 1 child. For 20 years, he has been in the trading system. He has a small store where he has been selling cooling drinks, beer, cigarettes and other small stuff. The uniqueness of his business is that he trades night and day, he is always in his shop and sometimes even sleeps there. His shop is located on the highway and many people stop to buy water and to have a rest. His trade goes well and now he wants to purchase drinks. He asks for $1200 for 12 months.

loans.use: To purchase drinks

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy more tomatoes.

loans.name: Mercy

texts.en: Mercy Ogieriakhi is a 40 years old, divorced mother with 8 children.  She lives in Benin City and sells food and drinks.  She is requesting a loan of $325 to enable her to buy more drinks and foodstuff for re-sale.  She always goes to the village to buy foodstuff and sells it in the city.  She has been in this business since 1987 and is a dedicated LAPO client.

loans.use: To buy more drinks & foodstuff

loans.name: Yusif

texts.en: Yusif M. (his employee is pictured) owns and operates a small office supply store that also offers printing services. His business and his home are located in the northeasterly Azerbaijani town of Devechi. This will be the fifth time that Yusif has received credit from Norwegian Microcredit, which shows that he is one of our most valued customers. He is currently looking for funding so that he can expand the quantity and variety of his inventory.

loans.use: To expand the quantity and variety of his inventory

loans.name: Samwel

texts.en:
Samwel Yohane, age 30, is married with 1 child (almost 2 years-old). Samwel owns a fruit and vegetable stand, which he opened 7 years ago. Working from 7am-4pm daily, he earns about $136 a month from this business.

Samwel has successfully taken out 3 previous loans from Tujijenge Tanzania to increase the business' stock. He now hopes for a new loan to buy more stock of fruits and vegetables.

Samwel is a member of group Jitegemee (Swahili for “self-relient”), which totals 30 members. These members keep each other accountable in paying back their loans.

loans.use: To increase the stock in his fruit and vegetable stand

loans.name: Nabisaru V (A) Group

texts.en:
Milly is 45 years old and married with six children. She has a broiler poultry business. Milly wants to use the extra business profit to buy a plot of land. Alice has a stationery shop and wants to increase stock with the loan. Juliet has a retail shop where she mainly sells household items. Robinah has a commercial bicycle and intends to buy another one with the loan, while Eva sells silver fish.

This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

loans.use: To purchase more broiler chicks

loans.name: Tatyana

texts.en:
Tatyana is a divorced mother of two daughters, ages 23 and 28, who supports herself with a little clothing and accessories business. She started her business selling at the market about eleven years ago at a time when she needed work. She currently has an attractively arranged kiosk at the busy central market in Zhidachev in western Ukraine. Tatyana is a dedicated, hard-working entrepreneur. Other than to pay off some bills and continue to support herself, her goals include being able to see her daughters get established in life.

Tatyana has requested a short term loan of $500 to purchase a new inventory of accessories for her business. We are happy for this opportunity to assist Tatyana as she works to provide for herself and her family.

loans.use: Purchase inventory

loans.name: Elvisa

texts.en: Elvisa is a 25-year-old, married woman from the village of Bašigovci. Her husband is a construction worker and he earns 600 BAM per month on average. They generate additional income by working in the agriculture industry. In fact, her husband works the fields with his own tractor and is able to earn approximately 350 BAM per month via this activity. Elvisa is seeking this loan in the amount of 1,500 BAM to purchase a new rotary cultivator. In general, Elvisa and her husband believe that this rotary cultivator will help them perform agricultural tasks in a better and more efficient manner, which will allow them to earn more money and improve their standard of living.

loans.use: To purchase a new rotary cultivator.

loans.name: Angelica Virginia

texts.en:
Angelita Virginia G. M. has a general store in the village of Salpo, high in the sierras of La Libertad Region.  Her store in located next to the high school, so she has a great location and many loyal customers.  She sells the students  their favorite treats.  

Angelita is 57-years old, married with 5 children.  Two of her children are studying at Universities so she is happy to have an income to help them out.  Nothing would make Angelita happier than to see her children finish school and become professionals.

A member of the community bank, Virgen de Las Mercedes, Angelita is requesting a loan of $1,100 to repay over 6 months.  She will use the loan to restock her store with sodas, candy, rice, and more.

loans.use: To restock general store with sodas, candy, rice, and more.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase natural medicines for her small business.

loans.name: Mercedes

texts.es:
Mercedes has been dedicated to sewing for 20 years. She used to sew uniforms for a company. She then started to sew clothing that she gave to her friends, who would sell it at markets.

Currently, her neighbors and her husband's co-workers order clothing from her. Mercedes has three sewing machines, and her daughter helps her with her work.

The loans that she has requested have served her to have her sewing machine repaired and to purchase fabric.

Mercedes would like to keep making clothing, but she would also like to start a business with her daughter. She has thought about starting a detergent store or a restaurant in her house.

Translated from Spanish by Tanya Harper, Kiva volunteer

Mercedes se dedica a la costura desde hace 20 años. Antes cosía los uniformes de una empresa. Luego empezó a coser ropa y se los daba a sus amigas, quienes lo vendían en los mercados.

En la actualidad, sus vecinos y los compañeros de trabajo de su esposo le hacen pedidos de ropa. Mercedes cuenta con tres máquinas de costura. Su hija le ayuda con los trabajos de costura.

Los préstamos que ha solicitado le han servido para mandar a reparar su máquina remalladora y para comprar telas.

A Mercedes le gustaría seguir confeccionando ropa, pero también quisiera poner un negocio con su hija. Ha pensado poner una tienda de detergentes o un restaurante en su casa.

loans.use: To have her sewing machine repaired and to purchase fabric

loans.name: Maria's Fadhili Group

texts.en:
Maria, a 23-year-old married woman with three children aged six, four, and one, owns a small general store which she started in 2007. Working everyday from 6 a.m. to 9 p.m., she can earn a monthly profit of about $90 from her sales.

Maria now hopes for a loan to buy more commodities for her business. She will share this loan with her subgroup members, who have businesses selling bananas and millet respectively

loans.use: To buy more commodities to increase her inventory

loans.name: Sindulfo

texts.es:
Señor Sindulfo is 43 years old and married to Señora Celsa. They have lived in their own home for many years. Their family was one of the many that were relocated when the reservoir of the Yacyretá binational dam affected their location and they were provided a new home in another area of the city.

Sindulfo is dedicated to traveling sales of various merchandise, such as clothes, typical weavings of Paraguay, sheets, covers and blankets. He purchases the majority of his merchandise in a very popular business district of Encarnación that is called the "Zona Baja". In this place is found the majority of the commerce where one can buy all kinds of articles at a good price. Then Sindulfo travels through the neighborhoods and adjoining cities selling his merchandise, traveling through with his motorcycle.

He has been able to progress and to move his family ahead thanks to his efforts and sacrifice. The loans have always also been a great help. He wants to be able to acquire a new loan to buy blankets and winter coats, which are in great demand among his clients at this time.

Translated from Spanish by B, Kiva Volunteer.

El señor Sindulfo tiene 43 años y está casado con la señora Celsa. Ellos viven en una casa propia desde hace muchos años. Su familia fue una de las tantas que fueron reubicadas por ser afectadas por el embalse de la represa binacional Yacyretá, quien les proveyó de un nuevo hogar en otra zona de la ciudad.

Sindulfo se dedica a la venta ambulante de mercaderías varias como ropas, tejidos típicos del Paraguay, sábanas, frazadas y mantas. Las compras de la mayoría de sus mercaderías los hace en una zona comercial muy popular de Encarnación a las que ellos llaman “Zona Baja”. En este lugar se encuentran la mayoría de los comercios y donde uno puede comprar todo tipo de artículos a buen precio. Luego Sindulfo recorre los barrios y ciudades aledañas vendiendo sus mercaderías recorriendo con su motocicleta.

El ha podido progresar y sacar a su familia adelante gracias a su esfuerzo y sacrificio. Los créditos también han sido siempre de gran ayuda por lo que él desea poder adquirir uno nuevo para comprar frazadas y abrigos de inviernos pues son los de mayor pedido en esta época por sus clientes.

loans.use: To buy merchandise such as coats and blankets for resale.

loans.name: Sat

texts.en:
Mrs. Sat S., 49, is a widowed grocery seller. She has been selling since 2001 in front of her house, earning approximately US$ 3.50 per day. She has five children, one of whom is married. Her son, Mr. Veasna Phat is a motorcycle taxi driver, and her daughter, Miss Soksin Khon, a gas and diesel seller. They all live in Tropang Resiey Commune, Kampong Thom Province.

Sat is requesting a loan of US$ 700 to decorate her house to attract more customers, using any remainder to purchase grocery inventory to sell. Sat's daughter is pictured because Sat was not available.

loans.use: To decorate her house to attract more customers and purchase grocery inventory

loans.name: Rosario

texts.es:
Rosario es socia del Banco Comunal El Roble. Rosario es soltera y tiene 1 hija de 34 años.
Rosario tiene su negocio de venta de plásticos, empezó hace 3 años vendiendo con una amiga. Ahora ella vende afuera del mercado, desde que recibe los préstamos tiene un capital para su negocio. 
Rosario necesita un préstamo de 400 soles, dinero que será invertido en la compra de su mercadería (plásticos, bolsas).   
Rosario sueña con poder construir su casa.
texts.en:
Rosario is a member of the community banking group - El Roble. Rosario is single and has one daughter who's 34 years old. Rosario's business is selling plastic containers - she started the business 3 years ago with a friend. Now she sells outside of the market. Since she's been receiving loans, she has the capital for her business. Rosario needs a loan of 400 soles, money that will be invested in the purchase of more merchandise (plastic containers and purses/bags). Rosario dream of being able to build her own home.

Translated from Spanish by Kimberly Baker, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Rosario needs a loan of 400 soles, money that will be invested in the purchase of more merchandise (plastic containers and purses/bags).

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Melchora

texts.es: Melchora tiene 40 años, vive con su esposo y su hijo D. 12 años. Es una prospera vendedora D. verduras, muy alegre y rápidamente atienD. a sus clientes para poder vender mayor cantidad en el día, sobre todo en las mañanas, cuando son horas D. gran estrés por la cantidad D. personas que viene al mercado, pero Melchora ya tiene práctica, debido a su enorme experiencia por los 12 años D.  vender este tipo D. productos. Su negocio es rentable porque compra al por mayor y prepara cada porción, en el caso D. los condimentos, en menores cantidades, luego al vender gana mucho. Este es su primer crédito con MFP. La cantidad que solicita la invertirá en la compra D. más verduras y condimentos  secos para satisfacer los pedidos D. sus clientes.
texts.en:
Melchora is 40 years old and lives with her husband and her 12-year old child. She is a prosperous vegetable seller, very happy and attentive to her clients in order maximize her daily sales; it can be especially stressful in the mornings due to the number of people who come to the market. But Melchora is experienced, having spent the past 12 years selling this type of product. Her business in profitable because she buys in bulk and creates portions, in the case of condiments, in smaller quantities, on which she can make a profit when she resells them. This is her first loan with MFP. She will use the loan to buy more vegetables and dry condiments in order to satisfy her clients' demand.

Translated from Spanish by Laure Kwon, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To increase the products she sells

loans.name: Lucia

texts.en:
Lucia J. is currently in the business of making alcohol and is requesting a loan to expand her business. Lucia is 28 years old and is widowed. She has one child, who is in school. With the profits from her loan, she hopes to expand her business. 

BRAC's holistic approach to poverty alleviation and empowerment of the poor encompasses a range of core programs in economic and social development; health; education; and human rights and legal services which are delivered through an extensive network of village organizations. BRAC has become one of the world's largest NGOs as measured by the scale and diversity of its interventions.  In 2007, BRAC started operations in southern Sudan. The microfinance program, which is targeted towards returning war refugees, has already formed 418 village organizations with more than 14,000 women members.

loans.use: Expand her business

loans.name: Ana Francisca

texts.es:
Ana Francisca García vive en el departamento de Soyapango, en la zona central del país. Desde hace ya varios años atrás, Ana Francisca es madre soltera y vive con su hija la cual es empleada en un hospital de la capital. A pesar de contar solo con un nivel de educación primario, Ana ha mantenido a su hija, montando su propio negocio en casa, una tienda de productos de primera necesidad.
Ana solicita un préstamo para comprar nuevos insumos y poder renovar su mercadería, a fin de 
impulsar el crecimiento de su negocio y la calidad de vida de su familia.
texts.en:
Ana Francisca García lives in the Soyapango area, in the central zone of the country. For many years, Ana Francisca has been a single mother living with her daughter, who is an employee of a hospital in the capital.

Although she only has completed a primary level of education, Ana has supported her daughter and launched her own business at home, a store for everyday products.

Ana seeks this loan to buy new ingredients and to be able to renew her merchandise, to drive growth in her business and the quality of life of her family.

Translated from Spanish by Michelle Harrison, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Resources for her store

loans.name: Narzullo

texts.en:
Narzullo A. applied first to the MicroInvest loan programme in 2009 but he recommends himself already as a reliable client. He was born in 1981 in the B. Gafurov region of Tajikistan. Narzullo is married and has 2 children. He has no special education but he is a hard-working young man. He is as an odd-job worker but the general family income comes from their livestock business. He is experienced in livestock so he started the livestock business when he was still very young and helped his father to take care of domestic animals.

Narzullo has one cow and 4 rams. He dreams of having a big farm and a good flock. He is ready to work hard to ensure a good future for his family and to realize his dreams. Now Narzullo is applying to KIVA with the request for a business development loan of 1600 STJ for purchasing one milk cow. He thanks KIVA for its support and wishes all the best to all lenders.

loans.use: purchasing one milk cow

loans.name: Pham Thi

texts.vi: Chị Phạm Thị K., 53 tuổi. Gia đình chị có 6 người con trong đó có 3 con đang đi học.  . Chị tham gia Quỹ từ năm 2003, với việc làm ăn có hiệu quả, thu nhập của gia đình đã được cải thiện đáng kể, đã giúp anh chị có điều kiện nuôi con cái ăn học tốt hơn. Thu nhập bình quân hiện nay của gia đình chị gồm có dệt chiếu 25000/ngày, chồng làm công nhân lương  2000 000/tháng, ngoài ra gia đình còn có thêm sự hỗ trợ của các con.. Vòng vốn tới anh chị muốn vay thêm 8.000.000 để mua thêm lợn về nuôi.
texts.en:
Mrs. Phạm Thị K., is 53 years old. She has six children, three of which are still in school. She became a member of the TYM Fund in 2003, and thanks to the effective use of her loans the family’s income has increased significantly since then. This has allowed Mrs. K. and her husband to better provide for their children’s lives and education. Currently, the income of the family consists of an average of 25,000 VND (1.50 USD) per day from weaving straw mats and her husband’s monthly earnings as a laborer of 2,000,000 VND (119 USD). In addition, they receive some support from their grown children. In the next round of lending, she and her husband hope to borrow 8,000,000 VND (475 USD) to buy pigs to raise.

Translated from Vietnamese by Robert Sides, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Raising pigs

loans.name: Battsagaan

texts.en: Battsagaan G. lives with his family in Arhangay province, one of Mongolia's central provinces. Battsagaan has three teenage children who go to the local high school. In 2003, Battsagaan and his wife started their own business as wholesale meat vendors. They visit herders in the countryside with their truck and purchase livestock at a discount when they can. Once they bring the livestock home, they slaughter them and prepare them for sale. Once the meat is ready for the market, they sell it to wholesale middlemen from their town and Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. In the future, they would like to create their own channel to bring livestock to the town without visiting each herder in the countryside. They request a loan to purchase livestock from herders.

loans.use: To purchase livestock from herders

loans.name: Elena

texts.en:
Elena is the mother of two children. She is currently head of the family because her husband has gone abroad for several years, so she has to care for her children. Elena lives in the town of Cahul.

On the territory where she lives she has a garden with an area of 10 hectares (about 25 acres), enough to work in agriculture: namely to grow fruit and vegetables. Victoria wants to grow vegetables and fruit all year around. For this she needs to build three greenhouses. The harvest she will collect, Elena will sell at the wholesale market for the district.

Elena is a loyal customer of Microinvest since she asked for two other loans last year. Now she requires a loan of 30,000 lei to buy building materials needed for construction of the greenhouses. In the future Victoria plans to deal with plant breeding, but only after she has finished the greenhouse construction.

loans.use: To buy building materials for her greenhouses

loans.name: Elsa Del Carmen

texts.es: Elsa del Carmen O. vive en Cuscatancingo departamento de San Salvador, Elsa es madre soltera de dos hijos ya mayores de edad que le ayudan económicamente, tiene una hija en Estados Unidos que le ayuda con 200$ y también Elsa cuenta con el apoyo económico de su hijo;  pero  Elsa siempre ha sido una mujer muy trabajadora que lucho por sacar a su familia adelante ella sola hace muchos años y piensa que aun no es momento de detenerse,  y para de trabajar;  es por ello que ya, hace 5 años empezó con la comercialización de perfumes , cremas de cuerpo, cosméticos entre otros tiendo éxito en su ventas  Elsa solicita un crédito para comprar más variedad de productos.
texts.en:
Elsa del Carmen O. lives in Cuscatancingo, in the department of San Salvador. She is a single mother with two grown-up children who help her out financially. Her daughter, who lives in the United States, helps her out with $200.00. She also gets financial support from her son. However, Elsa has always been a very hardworking woman who struggled to help her family get ahead on her own for many years, and she is not thinking about stopping now. For this reason, she started selling perfume, body lotions, and other cosmetics 5 years ago, and she has had success in sales. Elsa is requesting a loan in order to purchase a wider selection of products.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase beauty products

loans.name: Arlene

texts.en:
"Our last harvest has given us plenty of food for our family. Now, we are busy preparing the land for our next planting. Our farm is the only thing that sustains our family. We dream to buy another farm and be able to send our children to college", says Arlene A., 38-year-old mother of three children.

She would like to ask for a loan of PHP 10,000. She will use the loan to purchase herbicides, fertilizers, and insecticides. The loan will really help her achieve a better harvest and increased income for the whole family.

CEVI helps small business grow. It provides financial services as well as training and insurance coverage as well.

loans.use: To purchase herbicides, fertilizers, and insecticides for farming.

loans.name: Leonor Paulo

texts.pt:
Leonor Paulo M. de 41 anos nasceu no distrito de Manjacaze, província de Gaza, estudou até sétima. Casada e mãe de cinco filhos com idades compreendidas entre 22 – 10 anos de idade, para além do marido e filhos vive com um neto.

Leonor saiu de Manjacaze com os pais para cidade de Maputo quando era criança, tendo se formado como professora primária, ela trabalha 8hrs por dia e tem como salário mensal 6,300.00MT e vive na casa própria, embora ainda em obras.

A situação de acomodação na família não é das melhores, os cinco filhos compartilham dois quartos, sendo desafio construir mais dois quartos para proporcionar mínimas condições aos filhos.
 
Com o empréstimo de 15,000.00MT, pretende comprar cimento e outros materiais de construção para dar seguimento com os trabalhos de construção e no futuro sonha terminar com as obras e mobilar a residência.
texts.en:
Leonor Paulo M., 41 years old, was born in the district of Manjacaze, Gaza province. She studied until seventh grade. She is married and has five children aged 10 to 22 years, and lives with a grandchild as well as her husband and children. When she was a child, Leonor left Manjacaze with her parents for Maputo city. She graduated as an elementary school teacher. She works eight hours a day and earns a monthly salary of 6,300 MT. She lives in her own house, although it is still under construction. Accommodations for her family are not the best. The five children share two rooms, and they feel the need to build two more rooms to allow minimal living conditions for them. With the loan of 15,000 MT, she plans to buy cement and other construction materials to allow for the continuation of construction work on her house. In the future, she dreams of finishing construction and furnishing her home.

Translated from Portuguese by Heidi Petersen, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy construction materials to build family home.

loans.name: Juvy Mar

texts.en:
Juvy Mar R. is married to Lyndon and is residing in Tamil, Jose Dalman, Zamboanga del Norte. They have three children: one attending college and the others attending secondary school. Her husband is a gardener of vegetables and fruits while R. manages their sari-sari (variety) store. Their customers are their neighbors and passers-by.

As of now R.’s sari-sari store is improved because of the help of Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative. She is able to obtain loans as additional capital for her business and she enjoys, also, the other benefits like the insurance for her whole family and savings deposits.

loans.use: To use as additional capital for her sari-sari store

location.town: Liloy-Tamil, Jose Dalman Zamboanga del Norte

loans.name: Zablon Nandwa

texts.en:
Zablon M. is a 45year old businessman who is married with three children.  He owns a plot of land on which he has built rental houses for low-income earners.  From this, he gets a monthly profit of about 10,000 Kenyan shillings ($125 U.S.).  He wishes to use this loan to add more rental houses.

Zablon has never borrowed from another microfinance institution other than KADET. This will be his third loan from KADET, where he has been faithful in repaying all his earlier loans. He hopes to buy more land in the future and build even more rental houses.


About KADET:
The Kenya Agency for the Development of Enterprise and Technology (KADET) is committed to economically empowering its clients by providing financial services to rural communities in order to relieve suffering and improve living conditions within those communities.

loans.use: To build more rental houses.

loans.name: Sonim

texts.en:
Mrs. Sonim S., 29 (pictured with her husband), and her husband, Mr. Socheat Yum, 28, live in a suburb of Phnom Penh, about 20 kilometers away. They were married in 2001 and have three young daughters.
 
Sonim has been a garment factory worker for 10 years. Her husband has been a teacher for five years. His motorbike is old and he wants to replace it with a new one, so Sonim is applying for her first loan of $1,000 to make the replacement.

loans.use: To purchase a motorbike to replace the old one.

loans.name: Christy

texts.en: Christy is 34 years old and married. She sells phone rechangable card and accessories. She has been in the business since 2004. She hopes for the loan amount of N100,000 to purchase more phone rechangable card and  accessories to sell. She say thank you to all KIVA lenders

loans.use: To purchase more phone accessories to sell

loans.name: Tita

texts.en:
Tita is a mother full of hopes and dreams for her children.  She aims to give her two children a complete education for them to become successful in the future.  She is now 41 years old and very determined to work hard for her family while she is still strong and capable of doing a business.  She is married to Noel and they live in the village of Arcon Tumauini, Isabela. Their children are: Christine and Clifford Darryl, they are both in the high school level.  

Tita sells ice candy flavored buko (coconut) in their village.  She can produce 800 -1,000 pieces of ice candy and sell it for PHP5.00 each. With her business, she can also help other residents by helping her to sell her products and they can earn PHP1.00 for every piece ice candy that they can sell.  She hopes to produce more ice candy to increase daily income of PHP500 and able to provide the educational needs of their children. By having additional capital, she believes that her business will further expand and will be more profitable. That is why she is requesting to avail a loan amounting to PHP5, 000 from KIVA lenders.

loans.use: Additional Capital

loans.name: Barikissou

texts.fr: Barikissou est mariée et mère de quatre enfants tous scolarisés. Barikissou vit avec sa famille et supporte avec son mari les charges de la famille. Barikissou vend des glacières, ustensiles de cuisine, bassines et sacs de sortie pour femme. C’est au Nigeria, État voisin du Bénin que Barikissou va faire ses achats et revient au Bénin pour les livrer à ses clients qui ont fait la demande. C’est depuis huit ans que Barikissou est dans cette activité et elle a déjà eu deux prêts d’ALIDé pour cette activité. Dans l’optique de mieux développer son activité, Barikissou sollicite encore un troisième crédit d’ALIDé.
texts.en:
Barikissou is married and the mother of four children, all in school. Barikissou lives with her family, she and her husband provide for the family expenses. Barikissou sells ice coolers, kitchen utensils, basins and women purses.

Barikissou makes her purchases in Nigeria, a neighboring state of Bénin. She makes deliveries to customers who request it . Barikissou has been in this business for eight years, she has already received two loans from Alidé for this activity. In order to better develop her business, she is asking for a third loan from Alidé.


Translated from French by Véronique Fourment, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: purchase of ice coolers, shoes and purses

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase additional cloth in bulk.

loans.name: Guluzar

texts.en: Guluzar was born in 1956 and is the mother of six children. She lives in Fuzuli region. 20 years ago she started a dairy business. She now needs a loan of 2000 AZN to buy two cows to improve her dairy business.

loans.use: to buy two cows

loans.name: Mohira

texts.ru: Мохира Курбонова проживает в районе Руми. Возраст 40 лет. Замужем, имеет 6 детей. Муж работает в местной налоговой инспекции. Сама Мохира более 15 лет занимается торговлей на рынке. Она в основном торгует одеждой. Кредит просит для увеличения товараоборота, закупа нового ассортимента.
texts.en:
Mohira K. lives in the Rumy region. She's forty years old, married and has six children. Her husband works in the local tax office. For the past fifteen years Mohira has sold clothes on the market. She is asking for a loan in order to buy new products and increase her goods turnover.

Translated from Russian by Alex Kostrubsky, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To increase goods turnover

loans.name: Aïssatou Demba

texts.fr: Aïssatou Demba D., est une femme de 33 ans, elle est mariée et mère de 3 enfants. Elle est membre du banc Villageois de BIDIANKOTO depuis deux ans et demi. Elle développe un petit commerce en vendant sur table divers produits tels que du riz, de l'huile, du thé, du sucre etc. Avec ses bénéfices elle participe à l'amélioration des conditions de vie de sa famille en prenant en charge la santé de ses enfants.
texts.en:
Aïssatou Demba D., a 33-year-old wife and mother of 3, has been a member of Village Bank of BIDIANKOTO for 2 1/2 years. She has a small business selling miscellaneous products from a small table, including rice, oil, tea, and sugar. With her income, she helps improve her family's circumstances by paying for her children's health care.

Translated from French by Linda Koza, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increase her ability to self-finance

loans.name: Jamal

texts.en:
JamA. is a 32-year-old man who lives in Beirut, the capitA. of Lebanon. JamA. has been installing aluminum since 2002. He installs on doors, windows, and kitchen, etc… JamA. is speciA. in his work because he is known for his good work and quality of work. His clients are his friends and neighbors.

He requested a loan from A. Majmoua in order to do some maintenance work on his van. This van allows him to transport his merchandise to his clients. JamA. has been a microcredit client for six years now and has always repaid on time.

When JamA. first started his business, he passed through some financiA. issues in order to purchase the required tools. He decided on doing his business because he wanted to have independent work, and he had experience in aluminum installation. In the future, he plans to keep on improving his business.

loans.use: to do some maintenance work on his van

loans.name: Gladys Olanda

texts.es:
Gladys M. de 49 años de edad, vive en una zona periurbana ubicada en Paraíso de Guayaquil, su casa es de caña no cuenta con servicios básicos, esta separada de su esposo con el  tiene 3 hijos uno de 29 años, 24 años y 23 años todos están trabajan.

Gladys comenzó hace 3 años atrás con el servicio de costura para poderse ayudar con sus gastos, ahora ella no tiene horario de trabajo por lo que trabaja en su casa sola, una de las dificultades de su trabajo es la competencia que hay en su sector. 

Con el préstamo quiere comprar ladrillos, cemento para arreglar mejor su casa, en el futuro quiere arreglar mejor su vivienda para poder tener espacio para su negocio.
texts.en:
Gladys M. is 49 years old and lives in the semi-urban district of Paraíso in Guayaquil. Her house is made of reeds and does not receive basic services. Gladys is separated from her husband and has three children (ages 29, 24, and 23) who are working.

She started providing sewing services three years ago in order to help with her expenses. Gladys does not have a set work schedule because she works alone at home. One of the difficulties she faces is the amount of competition in this line of work.

With this loan, Gladys will buy bricks and cement for remodeling her house. In the future, she wants to make additional improvements to her home so that she can have a better space for her business.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase bricks & cement for remodeling her house

loans.name: Jeremías Azarias

texts.es: Jeremías Azarías T. P. de 35 años de edad, reside en Cojutepeque, departamento de Cuscatlán. Vive junto a su grupo familiar el cual esta conformado por su esposa y sus dos hijos de 6 y 16 años de edad, los cuales se dedican a estudiar. Desde hace 10 años que Jeremías posee  una panadería, en la que junto a su esposa se dedican a elaborar el pan que posteriormente Jeremías sale a vender de manera ambulante por las calles de Cojutepeque, así mismo su esposa se encarga de atender las ventas por unidad o al por mayor que se hacen en la panadería. Jeremías solicita un préstamo a través del cual pueda comprar harina, manteca, levadura y otro horno para poder hacer más pan. Tanto para él como para su esposa contar con la panadería es una gran bendición debido a que es a través de esta como obtienen el dinero para pagar todos los gastos del hogar y de su familia.
texts.en:
Jeremías Azarías T. P. is 35 years old, and lives in Cojutepeque, in the Cuscatlán region of El Salvador. He lives together with his family, including his wife and his two sons, ages 6 and 16, both of whom are enrolled in school. For 10 years Jeremías has owned a bakery, in which, together with his wife, he bakes the same bread that, in years past, he went out on foot to sell in the streets of Cojutepeque. Now, his wife manages the bakery's sales, both of individual units and of wholesale orders. Jeremías requests a loan through which he would be able to purchase flour, lard, yeast, and another oven so that he may produce greater quantities of bread. For his wife as much as for himself, Jeremías looks to his bakery as a great blessing for his family, as it provides them with a means to earn the money they need to pay for all the expenses of their home and family.

Translated from Spanish by Kevin Lenhart, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Compra de harina, manteca, levadura y un horno.

location.town: Cojutepeque en el departamento de Cuscatlán

loans.name: Flor Imelda

texts.es: Imelda tiene 27 anos y vive con su esposo y su hijo de 8 meses, son originarios de Sumpango Sacatepequez, ellos son propietarios de una tienda de ropa tipica, asi como tambien de un bus que transporta a personas dentro de la misma comunidad, todos los dias Imelda confecciona blusas tipicas para venderlas en su negocio, ella desea contribuir con su familia para tener una mejor calidad de vida, esta es la primera vez que adquiere un prestamo para lo que se compromete a ser puntual en sus pagos, el dinero que ahora solicita sera invertido en la compra de mas blusas a si como tambien se dedicara a vender sueteres que le serviran para surtir mas su negocio.
texts.en:
Imelda, 27, lives with her husband and her 8-month-old son in Sumpango Sacatepequez. They own a store where they sell typical clothing as well as a bus that provides transportation for people within the same community. Imelda manufactures typical blouses every day to sell in her store. She hopes to contribute to seeing that her family has a better quality of life. This is her first loan and she pledges to be punctual with her payments. The money she is asking for will be used to buy more blouses and she will also sell sweaters that will serve to better stock her store.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy stock merchandise for her store.

loans.name: Vitolio

texts.en:
Vitolio M. is 26 and married with 2 children (ages 1 and 3).  She owns a business venture, selling food products in the local community.  Vitolio has many years of experience in this business.  Vitolio needs a loan of WST $1500 to purchase additional products to sell.  She plans to use the earnings from her business (estimated to be 600 talas or US $250 per week) to improve/expand the business.

In 2009, Vitolio joined SPBD.  This is her 2nd loan with SPBD. SPBD's loans are Vitolio's only access to capital because she was never able to qualify for a loan with traditional banks.

The following social metrics for Vitolio M. are provided by SPBD*:
Overall Social Metric Score:                1.87 out of 3
Level of Education:                         2 out of 3
Level of total Household Income:            2 out of 3
Quality of Household Assets:                2 out of 3

*SPBD measures the living conditions of each of its borrowers to track her loan progress. The overall social metric score, provided by SPBD, is based upon a number of factors, such as the condition of the house/household assets, health, education, income level, and family reputation. A higher number represents a higher score. For example, a ""3 out of 3"" on education would mean that the borrower has graduated from university; a ""2 out of 3"" = secondary/high-school, and a ""1 out of 3"" would mean that the borrower is uneducated.

For more information on this score, please see SPBD's partner page at: http://partners.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=15

About SPBD
In 2000, Greg Casagrande founded SPBD and since then, it has expanded from the main island of Upolu in Samoa to Savaii, as well as Tonga. SPBD's philosophy of lending is based upon the Grameen Bank lending method.

Please join SPBD's lending team on KIVA to receive on-the-spot updates on SPBD: http://www.kiva.org/community/viewTeam?team_id=8375

loans.use: to purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Yusabia

texts.en:
Yusabia O., 37, is married and has two children aged 10 and 5. Her business is located at AA-Njenga, Nairobi. She has been running a printing, photocopying and typesetting business. She says that this business is profitable and the only major challenge she has is accessing funds for expansion. She works very hard to keep her business doing well. 

She is using her loan of Kes 50,000 to buy a printer and a photocopier to expand her business. In the future she hopes to open her own computer training school. She is a very hardworking lady.

loans.use: to buy a printer and photocopier

loans.name: Ama

texts.en: Ama B., who received junior high education, sells secondhand clothes in Elmina.  A married mother of  four children, Ama helps her husband, a trader, by paying school fees and other expenses that may arise. Her loan will be used to buy bales of secondhand clothes for sale, and she hopes to use the new profits from her business to save to build a house.

loans.use: To buy bales of secondhand clothes for sale.

loans.name: Akoeba

texts.fr:
Cette  dame exerce comme activité génératrice de revenu la vente de tissus pour la confection de pantalon et chemise, elle expose ses marchandises au bord de la route, ainsi elle attire plus le regard des passants. Elle s’approvisionne au marché local d’adawlato, faisant face en ce moment à une baisse de son stock de marchandises, elle sollicite de WAGES un crédit pour l’achat d’une demi-balle de tissu pantalon et d’un quart de balle de tissu chemise.
Elle est mariée et mère d’un enfant.
texts.en:
This lady generates income by reselling clothing fabric for shirts and pants. She offers her wares from the roadside, to attract more attention. She gets her supplies from the Adawlato market. As she is currently confronted with a reduced stock of supplies, she is requesting a loan from WAGES to buy half a bale of cloth for pants and one fourth bale of cloth for shirts. She is married and the mother of one child.

Translated from French by René McConnell, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy cloth

loans.name: Yev

texts.en: Yev S., 62, is a widow who lives in Phnom Penh City, Cambodia. She sells groceries from home for an income of about USD 10 per day. S. is requesting a loan of USD 1000 to purchase more groceries to stock her store. In the future, she would like to use any additional profit to expand her business. This is her first loan from CREDIT, a long-standing Kiva partner in Cambodia.

loans.use: buy more groceries

loans.name: Khamisa

texts.en:
Khamisa S. is currently in the business of selling charcoal and bread out of her home and is requesting a loan to stock more bags of charcoal to sell.  Khamisa is 35 years old and is married to a husband who is a policeman. She has 4 children and her children go to school.  With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to open up a restaurant.

 BRAC's holistic approach to poverty alleviation and empowerment of the poor encompasses a range of core programs in economic and social development, health, education, and human rights and legal services which are delivered through an extensive network of village organizations. BRAC has become one of the world's largest NGOs as a measured by the scale and diversity of its interventions.  

In 2007, BRAC started operations in Southern Sudan. The microfinance program, which is targeted towards returning war refugees, has already formed 418 village organizations with more than 14,000 women members.

loans.use: Stock more bags of charcoal to sell

loans.name: Balitwegomba Women's Group, Jinja

texts.en:
Ten years ago, 30-year-old M. Juliet was like any other naïve business upstart. Being in two minds did not help either, as she was on the one hand being dissuaded from trying her hand at any other business, whilst her close consorts were constantly prevailing upon her to start a retail shop.

With huge reserves of courage and conviction in tow, Juliet, in the midst of all this, made up her mind to start a retail shop in Buwenge, Jinja. She decided to dispense with the soft drink business she had all along banked on as her main source of livelihood.

Juliet’s hard work ethic spawned an unprecedented growth in her business profits. As her niche grew, so did the profits accruing to her business. In a week, she reveals her business generates 500,000 Ugandan shillings. With this income, this married lady has gotten into a steady stride in terms of fully providing for all her four children. Juliet has also been eking out supplementary profits from her poultry and commercial motorcycle businesses.

With this loan, Juliet wants to rejuvenate her retail shop with more merchandise like sugar, soap, bags of rice, etc.

loans.use: To purchase more retail items for her store like sugar, salt, rice and soap

loans.name: Alberto

texts.es:
Nuestro socio es ÉL Sr.Alberto;   él es natural de Sicuani,  tiene 55 años de edad, el socio es casado, El socio realiza como principal actividad la pasamanería, venta de (candados, romanas, tijeras, balanzas,) pero también él se dedica a otras actividades porque nuestro socio es todo un personaje, él está metido en todos los negocios que le generen dinero y lo mantengan ocupado, este socio peculiar los meses de enero, febrero y agosto prepara sahumerios, el en estas fechas los vende para las diferentes actividades religiosas de la zona; Él socio también es fotógrafo en ocasiones, él trabaja con el municipio de Huancarani chico en los diferentes eventos, ferias, desfiles, aniversarios y otros y se dedica a filmar, y sacar fotografías para luego venderlos; Nuestro socio solicita el préstamo para comprar mercadería para la pasamanería.

El socio agradece y valora el apoyo brindado mediante este medio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de su deuda en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
Our member is Alberto. He is a native of Sicuani, 55 years old and married. He main activity is making decorations and selling items like padlocks, scissors and scales, but he also does other activities because he is an important person. He is involved in all of the businesses that make money for him and keep him busy. During the months of January, February and August this member makes insense, which he sells during those months for different religious activities in the region. He is also sometimes a photographer. He works for the municipality of Huancarani at different events: fairs, parades, anniversaries and others, which he films and takes photos that are later sold. He is requesting the loan to buy supplies for making decorations. This member is grateful for and appreciates the support given to him and is committed to fulfil the repayment of his debt within the established timeframe.

Translated from Spanish by Molly Puglisi, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy supplies for making handicrafts.

loans.name: Betty Consuelo

texts.es:
Betty es una madre D. familia D. 55 años D. edad que vive junto al ultimo D. sus tres hijos, es viuda y tiene dos hijos ya independizados. ResiD. en el distrito D. Chepén, un distrito agrícola situado en la provincia del mismo nommbre, ubicado en la región La Libertad, a una hora D. distancia D. la ciudad D. Chiclayo, capital D. la región Lambayeque.

Se dedica desD. hace mas D. diez años a la venta D. carne D. pollo en un puesto ubicado en el interior del mercado D. su distrito, ella trabaja diariamente para atender la demanda D. sus clientes y para sacar adelante a su familia. Debido al tiempo que lleva trabajando en el rubro se ha hecho muy conocida y tiene un grupo D. clientes fijos.

Betty desea ampliar su negocio con la compra D. mas carne D. pollo para venderla a sus clientes y D. esa manera aumentar sus ventas. Por ello ha solicitado por primera vez a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito D. 2000 nuevos soles que le ayuden a lograr su objetivo.

Ella es una mujer luchadora, ha sabido salir adelante a pesar D. haberse quedado sola. Sus vecinos y compañeros D. trabajo le tienen mucha confianza y respeto.
texts.en:
Betty is 55 years old and a mother of three children. Betty is widowed and lives with her oldest child. Her other children are now independent. She lives in the district of Chepen, an agricultural area in the region of La Libertad, an hour away from the city of Chiclayo. For more than 10 years Betty has worked selling chickens from a stand insiD. the central market of the district. She works every day to meet the demands of her customers and help her family's quality of life. Thanks to the many years she's been working in this place, she has become well known and has a steady group of customers.

Betty would like to grow her business by purchasing more chickens and increasing her sales, so she is requesting a loan for the first time from Edpyme Alternative to help her reach her goal. Betty is a fighter, and she learned how to get by and take care of her family after being left on her own. Her neighbors and co workers have a lot of confidence and respect for Betty.

Translated from Spanish by Emily Charnes, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: She will use the loan to purchase more chickens to continue growing her business

loans.name: Kang

texts.en: Mrs. Kang A. is a 40-year-old married woman and local villager living in a medium-sized home with family members in Kompong Cham Province. She owns a piece of farmland that she inherited many years ago from her grandparents. She and her husband use this land to grow different kinds of crops, including potatoes and rice. Growing crops is an annual action with which she has had great success. Kang A. doesn’t have capital to use on her field during this coming rainy season. So she is applying for a loan in order to buy fertilizer and seeds to begin growing.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer and seeds

loans.name: Eva

texts.en:
Eva L. is from the village of New Visayas, Don Carlos, Bukidnon. She is 38 years old and married.  Eva owns and operates a sari-sari (variety) retail shop, selling both food and daily use products in the local community.  Eva has been engaged in business for over three years and earns approximately 8500 PHP a month.

In 2009, Eva joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities.  She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 8000 PHP from HSPFI to purchase additional inventory.  Eva is requesting a new loan of 11000 PHP to renovate her business. This loan will be her third from HSPFI.  Eva plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve her business. 

-----------------------------------------------------
About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

loans.use: Invest in renovating the business

loans.name: Liloba Plus Group

texts.en:
Liloba Plus is a group of 15 owners of small businesses chaired by Maguy Y.. Its members are jointly liable for loans granted by Kiva to grow their businesses.

Maguy Y. sells smoked fish. She has been in business since 1987. She has acquired solid experience selling smoked fish. Since she joined one of Hope’s groups called “Liloba Plus” meaning “Word” in English, her business has been significantly reinforced through seven loans she has received from MFI HOPE DRC and repaid them properly. 

Through her sales, Maguy makes about US$ 100 per week. She plans to use the next loan to purchase some more bags of smoked fish and sell them at a profit in order to increase her income. She dreams one day of opening a food shop. Maguy is 58 years old, married and a mother of six children between the ages of 22 and 35; only two of them attend school. The rest of the children are independent. In spite of her age, Maguy likes selling because it gives her the opportunity to make contact with many different people, and once they become permanent customers she is able to offer them quality products at a better price.

loans.use: purchasing some more bags of smoked fish to resell at a profit

loans.name: Crescencia

texts.en:
Crescencia S. is from the town of Trinidad. She is 71 years old and married. To make a living, Crescencia owns & operates a business venture in the agriculture sector raising livestock. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from raising pigs for fattening and sale. Crescencia also raises chickens, and she also makes vinegar out of coconuts. She sells her vinegar at her small sari-sari store.

Crescencia joined CEVI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Crescencia has successfully repaid a previous loan  from CEVI. Crescencia is requesting a new loan of 10,000 PHP which will be used to purchase baby livestock to raise & sell in future. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family.

loans.use: to purchase baby livestock to raise & sell in future

loans.name: Lazaro Eddy

texts.es: El señor Lázaro Eddy posee un negocio, que es la venta de fajas de cuero de manera ambulante y sus alrededores. Por lo que no es la primera vez que solicita financiamiento pues ha sido de gran ayuda para su negocio y la familia las compras las realiza a diferentes proveedores los cuales le ofrecen el producto más favorable. el está solicitando un nuevo financiamiento para invertirlo en su negocio ya que le están ofreciendo unas fajas a precios más favorables por lo que siempre está buscando la forma de mejorar su negocio, para proporcionarle a su familia los ingresos necesarios.
texts.en:
Lázaro Eddy works as a street vendor selling leather belts locally. This is not Lázaro Eddy's first loan; loan proceeds have already been a great help to him and his family, allowing him to make purchases from providers offering the best product. He is requesting a new loan to make additional improvements in his business so that he can provide his family with necessary income.

Translated from Spanish by Kara Gibson, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital.

loans.name: Bùi Thị Thường's Group

texts.en:
Bùi Thị T. is a 40-year-old married woman who has two school-aged children. She lives in the town of huyện Yên Phong - tỉnh B. Ninh. Bùi is the group leader of a four-member group loan offered by SEDA. The official name of this borrowing group is Cụm Nguyệt Cầu 1 - nhóm 03 (Nhóm 03). While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they all are responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults.

Bùi raises cattle to sell. She has been in business for over nine years and earns approximately 2,800,000 VND a month.

In 2008 Bùi joined SEDA to gain access to its financial services. She successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,152,000 VND from SEDA that was used to purchase livestock feed and other supplies. She is now requesting a new loan, her third from SEDA, of 7,392,000 VND that will be used to invest in expanding the business. Bùi plans to use the additional revenue generated to further expand her business.

About the other borrowers in the group:

1. Kiều Thị Huề is a 64-year-old woman who is requesting a 7,392,000 VND loan to support her business raising livestock. 2. Nguyễn Thị L. is a 53-year-old woman who is requesting a 7,392,000 VND loan to support her specialized retail store. 3. Lê Thị B. is a 57-year-old woman who is requesting a 7,392,000 VND loan to support her service-based business.

About SEDA:

The mission of SEDA (Center of Small Enterprise Development Assistance) is to provide microfinance services to low income and disadvantaged people in rural areas of Hanoi and the northern provinces of Vietnam.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that one-on-one translations of entrepreneur profiles are costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow it to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders. **************************************************************** T. Bùi Thị (20209040001) là 40 tuổi nữ. Cô ấy sống ở thành phố huyện Yên Phong - tỉnh B. Ninh. T. là trưởng nhóm của nhóm vay gồm có 4 các thành viên. Mặc dù mỗi thành viên trong nhóm nhận được từng khoản vay cá nhân, nhưng tất cả họ đều chịu trách nhiệm hoàn trả lại khoản vay của các thành viên trong nhóm của mình nếu một người nào đó trễ hạn hay không trả được nợ.. Tên chính thức của nhóm vay này là Cụm Nguyệt Cầu 1 - nhóm 03 (Nhóm 03). Trong khi không phải chỉ có các phương thức tạo nên thu nhập, mà nguồn thu nhập chính của công việc kinh doanh chủ yếu từ chăn nuôi gia súc để bán. T. thực hiện công việc kinh doanh này trong hơn 9 năm. Từ các hoạt động này, T. kiếm được khoảng 2.800.000 VND.
