Vào 2008, T. đã tham gia SEDA để có thể tiếp cận với các dịch vụ tài chính giúp cải thiện sinh hoạt và khả năng tham gia vào các hoạt động kinh doanh của cô ấy/ anh ấy. T. đã hoàn trả hết khoản vay trước đây là 5.152.000 VND từ SEDA. Khoản vay trước đây được sử dụng mua thức ăn gia súc & các loại cung cấp khác. Cô ấy hiện đang đề nghị một khoản vay mới là 7.392.000 VND. Khoản vay sẽ là 3rd khoản vay của người vay từ SEDA. Về Những Người vay khác trong Nhóm: 1. Kiều Thị Huề (0) là 64 tuổi nữ. Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 7.392.000 VND. Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực nông nghiệp. Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là chăn nuôi gia súc. 2. Nguyễn Thị L. (0) là 53 tuổi nữ. Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 7.392.000 VND. Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực bán lẻ. Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là kinh doanh cửa hiệu bán lẻ chuyên dụng. 3. Lê Thị B. (0) là 57 tuổi nữ. Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 7.392.000 VND. Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực dịch vụ. Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là vận hành công việc kinh doanh trên cơ sở dịch vụ. Về SEDA: Nhiệm vụ của SEDA (Trung Tâm hỗ Trợ Phát Triển các Doanh Nghiệp Nhỏ) là cung cấp các dịch vụ tài chính vi mô cho những người có thu nhập thấp và kém may mắn trong các vùng nông thôn tại Hà Nội và các tỉnh phía B. Việt Nam *Lưu ý: Để phát huy tối đa hiệu quả & giảm chi phí, khoản vay này đã được thông báo bằng biểu mẫu để có thể được Kiva tự động biên dịch. . Do việc biên dịch thủ công các danh mục rất tốn kém, nên Kiva đã tạo biểu mẫu này cho phần Field Partner (Trường Đối Tác) cho phép họ tiếp tục thông báo các khoản vay bằng Vietnamese trong khi cung cấp thông tin có chất lượng & chính xác cho người cho vay Kiva.

loans.use: To invest in expanding her cattle business

loans.name: Julita

texts.en:
Julita B. is from the village of Miaray, Dangcagan, Bukidnon. She is 49 years old, married, and has six adult children. To make a living, Julita owns and operates a sari-sari (variety) retail shop. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from selling both food and daily use products in the local community. Julita has been engaged in her business for over 16 years and earns approximately 9,000 PHP a month.

In 2006, Julita joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Julita has successfully repaid a previous loan of 12,000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to to expand the business. Julita is requesting a new loan of 15,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional inventory and for working capital. This loan will be the 11th loan taken out by Julita from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional inventory and for working capital

loans.name: Melessa Regis

texts.es:
Melessa es socia del Banco Comunal “Mujeres Clavelinas”, ubicado en el distrito de Ilave, provincia de El Collao, Departamento de Puno, tiene18 años de edad, de estado civil soltera y sin hijos, tiene  grado de instrucción de secundaria completa.
Melessa  va empezar a trabajar con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos, La señorita solicitará un primer préstamo de de S/ 500.00 nuevo soles, dinero que le servirá para empezar y tener su propio negocio de compra y venta de animales menores (cerdo).
 Su sueño es lograr que crezca su negocio.
Lo que le gusta del Banco Comunal es que tiene funcionamiento en su comunidad.
texts.en:
Melessa is a member of the “Mujeres Clavelinas” community bank which is in Ilave district, in El Collao province, in the department of Puno.  She is 18 years old, single and doesn't have any children.  She has completed her secondary education.

Melessa began working with Movimiento Manuela Ramos.  She is requesting her first loan of 500 nuevos soles to set up and have her own business buying and selling young animals (pigs).

Her dream is to succeed in growing her business.

What she likes about her community bank is that it works in her community.

loans.use: To invest in her business of buying and selling young animals (pigs)

loans.name: Elvira

texts.en:
Elvira C. is from the village of Talon, Gingoog City. She is 48 years old, married, and has four school-aged children. To make a living, Elvira owns and operates a sari-sari (variety) retail shop. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from buying and selling daily use products, such as shampoo, soap, toothpaste, canned goods, and instant noodles, in the local community. She is also buying and selling electronic loads from several networks like SMART and GLOBE. Elvira has been engaged in her business for over 10 years and earns approximately 3,000 PHP a month.

In 2008, Elvira joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Elvira has successfully repaid a previous loan of 11,000 PHP from HSPFI.  The previous loan was used to to purchase additional products to buy and sell. Elvira is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional inventory and acquire working capital. This loan will be Elvira's second loan from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional inventory and acquire working capital

loans.name: Fouzia's Group

texts.en:
Fouzia is a resident of Kamoki, Pakistan, famous for its rice production. She has been living there with her family in a two-room brick house for over five years. Fouzia is a supportive lady. She supports her husband financially by sewing clothes. She sews clothes for her nearby area clients and gets good by completing the sewing orders on time. The earned income helps her to pay the utilities expenses. 

She is the mother of a son and two daughters. Her daughters also help in her business by sewing clothes. Her son is 15 years old and works in a factory for a low income. Fouzia couldn’t educate them due to limited financial resources. 

She has applied for a loan from Kiva partner Asasah for her husband who will use the loan to purchase a buffalo. He is involved in a profession of selling animals. He buys young animals, raises them and then sells then for a good profit. She is hopeful that her husband’s business will grow further by investing the loan money into it and it will result in better financial conditions for her family. She is a new loan user of Asasah and hopes it will be a profitable experience for her. 

Note: In the photo, the lady with a book (called Asasah Passbook) is Fouzia.

loans.use: To buy a buffalo for her husband's animal sales business

loans.name: Antony

texts.en:
Antony, age 29, is married to Rhoda and together they have one child who is two years. He owns and runs a retail shop where he sells foodstuffs  like cooking oil, flour, etc. Antony was introduced to Kadet by a friend who was already a member. Antony has been running this business for three years. With this loan, he intends to buy more stock for his shop. 

He hopes to be a self-reliant businessman and support his family better.

loans.use: to buy cereals, flour, maize, detergent, and other products for the shop.

loans.name: Seab

texts.en:
Selling pieces of wood is the most important part of 26 year old Seab S.’s daily work. Her husband can earn a profit by driving a boat to pick up people who need to cross the river. Seab S. and her husband support their two children who are studying in public school. This family can make an average income of $8 per day for spending on the whole family.

Currently, Seab S. wishes to expand her sales business, but she lacks the funds to make it possible. So, she would like a loan to purchase additional pieces of wood to sell in order to make extra revenue.

loans.use: To purchase additional pieces of wood for selling.

loans.name: Marina

texts.en:
Marina O. is from the village of Dalig Viejo. She is 61 years old. Marina is married and has two adult-aged children. To make a living, she owns and operates a tailoring business, providing both general alteration and tailoring services to local community members. Marina has been engaged in her business for over thirty-three years and earns approximately $80 a month for these activities.

In 2008, Marina joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 20,000 PHP from ASKI. This previous loan was used to purchase additional tailoring equipment such as needles and thread. 

Marina is requesting a new loan of 10,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional fabrics and sewing materials. This will be her 7th loan from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated to improve her business. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful micro-finance institutions in the Philippines. It has 38 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional fabrics and sewing materials

loans.name: Nancy Sianoi

texts.en:
Nancy has practiced farming in Naivasha for the last four years.  She is 53 years old, married to Joseph K. and they have two children.

She was introduced to KADET LTD by her friend and this will be her third loan.  She paid for all her previous loans well and in good time.  She plans to use the loan amount to prepare the land and buy seed and fertilizer in readiness for planting.

In the future, she plans to buy her own farming equipment and save on having to rent.

loans.use: To prepare land and buy seed and fertilizer in readiness for planting.

loans.name: Jose Martin

texts.es:
Don José, de 43 años de edad, reside en San Rafael Oriente, departamento de San Miguel, se dedica a la venta de ropa y medicina, vive con su esposa y 4 hijos de 10, 8, 6 y 4 años de edad, solamente él trabaja para sostener la familia. El negocio lo inicio hace varios años, unos amigos comerciantes le ayudaron para que entrara al negocio, no tiene un horario fijo y actualmente necesita un préstamo para invertir en ropa y medicinas para vender.
La compra le permitirá incrementar la mercadería y satisfacer la demanda de los clientes, logrando crecer como vendedor y en futuro lograr su meta de ser mayorista y ofrecer a su esposa y sus hijos un futuro diferente.
texts.en:
José, 43, lives in San Rafael Orient, San Miguel department.  He sells clothes and medicine.  He lives with his wife and four children who are 10, 8, 6 and 4 years of age.  He’s the only one who works to support the family.

He started the business several years ago.  Some merchant friends helped him get into the business.  He does not have a fixed work schedule and needs a loan to invest in clothes and medicine to sell.

The purchase will allow him to increase merchandise and meet customer demand leading to growth as a salesman and in the future be able to reach his goal of becoming a wholesaler and offering his wife and children a different future.

loans.use: To buy clothes and medicine.

location.town: San Rafael de Oriente, San Miguel

loans.name: Maribel

texts.es: Maribel, de 29 años es una mujer amable y cariñosa. Vive en su casa propia en compañía de su esposo Omar de 35 años y sus dos hijos. Maribel trabaja en un colegio particular, en el cargo de auxiliar del colegio cerca de su casa. Por lo tanto, es la encargada de la formación y la disciplina de los alumnos de ese colegio en épocas escolares. Le gusta su trabajo, a pesar de que los alumnos son inquietos y rebeldes, ama su labor, ya que con este ingreso ayuda a su esposo que es panadero, a cubrir los gastos de su hogar y la educación de sus hijos, además que poco a poco puede terminar de construir su casa. En adelante desea acondicionar un local e instalar su propia panadería, donde pueda trabajar su esposo y mejorar la calidad de vida de toda su familia. Este es el segundo crédito que tiene con MFP, donde es una asidua  trabajadora mujer, por ello dice “que con confíen en ella y estén seguros que pagará todas sus cuotas puntualmente”. Por ello con el crédito que solicita, comprará cemento y arena, para mandar a construir las columnas de la pared de su casa, y con el resto pagará la mano de obra de su albañil.
texts.en:
Maribel, 29 years old, is a friendly and affectionate woman.  She lives in her own home in the company of her husband Omar, 35, and their two children.  Maribel works in a special school, under the charge of the assistant administrator of the school close to her home.  As such, she is in charge of the formation and discipline of the students during the school year.  She likes her work. In spite of the restless and rebellious students, she loves her job because with her income she can help her husband, a baker, to cover the costs of living and educating their children, in addition to finishing the construction of their house, little by little.   

In the future she would like to add a space for a store and have her own bakery, where her husband can work and improve the quality of life of the whole family.  This is her second loan with MFP, where she is a hardworking woman, for which reason they say "that the trust her and are sure that she make all of her payments punctually".  With the loan that she has requested, she will buy cement and sand, in order to construct columns on the wall of her house, and with the rest she will pay the mason for his labor.

loans.use: To buy cement and sand, and to hire a mason

loans.name: Clara

texts.es:
Clara Maria R. P., vive en  Cartagena, ciudad ubicada en el departamento de Bolívar, allí tiene un negocio de servicios  de internet, telecomunicaciones  y dulcería en general;  Clara es una mujer muy dedicada a su vida familiar que siempre ha logrado apoyar a sus  3 hijos que ahora están en  las edades de 20 a 26 años. cona llamadas locales, nacionales e internacionales y finalmente adicionó el internet, como una herramienta para que todos en su comunidad estuvieran comunicados, mientras ella recibía un ingreso por ofrecer servicios necesaioros a sus clientes. Clara es una mujer que reconoce el gran apoyo institucional por eso expresa que “gracias al apoyo de la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, nuestro negocio ha crecido brindándole un mejor servicio a sus clientes.” Su sueño es convertirlo en un centro de comunicaciones muy competitivo que cada día este actualizado con  los avances tecnológicos y es que esto es justamente lo que ella llama un gran desafío.
Su credikiva que es su tercer financiamiento con la Fundación lo invertirá en tres partes: con la primera   comprará equipos de computo, con la segunda  invertirá en el arreglo de los equipos en mal estado  y con la tercera parte del crédito hará mantenimiento locativo, para  continuar ofreciendo un servicio de excelencia en su comunidad.
texts.en:
Clara Maria R. P. lives in Cartagena, a city located in the departament of Bolíva. She has a business there offering internet service, telecommunications and general sweets. Clara is a woman who is very dedicated to her family life. She has always been able to support her 3 children who are 20 and 26 years old. She offered local, national and international calls, and then finally she added internet as tools for everyone in her community to stay in touch, while she received income for offering these necessary services to her customers. Clara is a woman who acknowledges the great institutional support she has received and for that she says "thanks to the support from the Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, our business has grown, offering a better service to the customers." Her dream is to convert it into a very competitive communication center that is always up to date with technological advances and that it just what she calls a big challenge. 

Her Kiva loan, which is her third loan from the Fundación, will be invested in three things:  first, she will buy computers. Second, she will invest in repairing the computers that are in porr condition and third, she will invest in maintenance of the locale, in order to keep offering an excellent service in hr community.

loans.use: to invest in three things. First she will buy computers. Second, she will invest in repairs, and third, she will do maintenance on the locale.

loans.name: Lanh's Group

texts.en:
There are five people who formed a group loan. Mrs. Lanh was born in 1968 and is the group leader. She was selected to be the group leader by the other members. The members of this group will use their money to help support their different purposes. 

Lanh's husband is a wedding chef who is able to earn a small income to support his family. He also earns a living as a motorcycle taxi driver. This couple has five children: two are wedding chefs who support their father carriers and the others three are students and also help their parents businesses. 

Mrs. Lanh earns her living by selling baby shell. Because her house is getting old for those living in it, Mrs. Lanh wants to fix it up. Thus, Lanh would like to ask for a loan to add to her savings for fixing her house up for better family living.

loans.use: To fix her house up for better family living.

loans.name: Bassima

texts.en:
Bassima is a 41-year-old married woman, living in Saida with her husband and three children. Bassima owns a shop where she has sold gifts and souvenirs in addition to decorating lamps, since 2009. 

Bassima is a hard worker. She used to be a tutor, but her courage and strong will to improve herself led her to start her own business. She started saving a small capital to open her shop, and in fact she made it. 

Bassima is requesting a loan from Al Majmoua in order to add new products to increase her income and expand her collections of products such as silver and crystals and starting to sell bed sheets and blankets.

Bassima wants to expand her shop and to introduce new products continuously to her customers. She helps her husband in raising their children and providing them secure and healthy living with the necessary education they must get. She hopes to see her kids reach high levels.

loans.use: To increase her collection through adding silver, crystals and blankets.

loans.name: Gina

texts.en:
Gina is 31 years old and is married with one child. Her child is 1 year and 11 months old. 

Gina is a farmer working in Sto. Niño, South Cotabato. She has been growing rice for six years. She earns about 6,000 PHP per month doing this farming.

This loan will be used to purchase fertilizers and other farm inputs. In the future, Gina hopes to put up another business.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers and other farm inputs

loans.name: Sulaina

texts.en:
Sulaina N. lives in the Kisaasi neighborhood in the city of Kampala, Uganda.  She is married and has five children, all of whom are in school.  She also takes care of additional family members (sisters). Sulaina has a beauty salon business. She has been in this business for over ten years, and she works six days out of every week. She also generates additional income through selling Bitengi (African attire). She sells her products in the shop, by means of retail.    

Sulaina has requested a loan of 1,000,000 UGX from MCDT SACCO, which she will use to buy boxes of cream relaxers, braids, and weaves.  

The main business challenges for Sulaina include the rainy season and transportation. Her goals and aspirations for her business are to see her business grow big and to own a bridal salon. She lives in a home that she owns where she has access to electricity but not to piped water.  Her major monthly expenses include food and school fees.

loans.use: to buy boxes of cream relaxers, weaves, and braids.

loans.name: Narsiza

texts.es:
Narsiza tiene 49 años de edad, está casada y vive en una comunidad rural con muchos deseos de desarrollo, ubicada en el distrito de Túcume en Lambayeque. 

Narsiza se dedica desde hace 8 años a la crianza y venta de aves de corral (patos, pavos y gallinas) en su domicilio. Los pobladores de su zona se han convertido en clientela ya establecida para Narsiza. Ellos saben de la buena crianza que Narsiza les da a sus animales es por eso que la prefieren a ella antes que a otros.

Narsiza solicita un préstamo a Edpyme Alternativa de 1000 nuevos soles que destinará en la compra de más aves, de alimento balanceado para estas y de mejoras en el corral donde las cría.

Narsiza es una mujer trabajadora y responsable, es un cliente antiguo para nuestra entidad que canceló adecuadamente sus pagos.
texts.en:
Narsiza is 49 years of age, married and lives in a developing rural community located in the district of Túcume in Lambayeque. 

Narsiza has raised and sold poultry such as ducks, turkeys and chickens in her home for the last eight years. Her community have become an established customer base for Narsiza, as they know that she treats her animals well and this is why they prefer to buy from her than anyone else. 

Narsiza is requesting a loan of 1000 nuevos soles from Edpyme Alternativa which she will use to purchase more birds, provide them with a balanced diet and improve their pen.

Narsiza is hardworking, responsible, and a long standing client with Edpyme Alternative who has paid for her previous loan installments in full.

loans.use: to purchase birds, provide them with a balanced diet and improve their pen.

loans.name: Doris Gabriela

texts.es:
Doris GAbriela tiene 20 años, vive en Union Libre, vive con la compañera y los hijos, vive en el Cantón Ventanas Provincia de los Ríos. 

Los miembros de la V.R.C. LA UNION se encuentra ubicada en el Recinto Aguas Frías de Medellín, perteneciente al Cantón Ventanas, esta ventanilla se dedica labores agrícolas de ciclo corto siembra de maíz, arroz, frejol gandul.

Doris se dedica a la agricultura la siembra de maíz y arroz, las compras las realiza en Ventanas y las vende en las ferias de todos los días en especial  la de los domingos.

Solicita el crédito para la compra de semillas, fertilizantes y abonos.  Con el apoyo del crédito le ayudaría económicamente para suplir sus necesidades. Enfrentar desafíos es la competencia y la variación del clima. Su sueño es seguir adelante.

Le gusta salir los domingos con la familia.
texts.en:
Doris Gabriela is 20 years old.  She is in a relationship and lives her partner and children in Ventanas Canton, Los Ríos Province.

The “La Unión” (Unity) communal bank is located in Aguas Frías de Medellín which belongs to Ventanas Canton.  The members of this communal bank are short cycle corn, rice and pigeon pea farmers.

Doris is a corn and rice farmer.  She does her purchases in Ventanas and sells at daily farmers markets, especially Sunday’s.

She is asking for the loan to buy seeds, fertilizer and manure.  Support from the loan will help her economically to meet her needs.  The challenges she faces are competition and weather variations.

Her dream is to continue making progress.  She enjoys going out Sundays with her family.

loans.use: to buy seeds, fertilizer and manure.

loans.name: Ruel

texts.en:
Ruel is 33 years old and lives in the Philippines. He is married with one child. He has a shop that sells ready-to-wear clothing from NATASHA & AVON. He has had this business for three years. He requested a loan of PHP 14,000 to buy T-shirts & blouses from NATASHA & AVON.

Ruel has been a member of HSPFI since 2010. In the future, Ruel hopes to improve his business.

loans.use: to buy T-shirts & blouses from NATASHA & AVON.

loans.name: Yeghishe

texts.en: Yeghishe keeps livestock and cultivates land. Yeghishe would like to start growing cabbage, as it is in great demand. Cabbage farming requires much work, so Yeghishe plans to hire workers to help. With the requested loan he plans to purchase cabbage seeds and pay the salaries of the workers. Yeghishe will increase his income and improve his family’s living conditions. He lives with his wife, who is a school teacher.

loans.use: to purchase cabbage seeds and pay workers' salaries

loans.name: Josefa Alegria

texts.es:
En el sector conocido como el Guabito de  la ciudad de Portoviejo, capital de Manabí conocida desde hace muchos años  como la ciudad de los reales tamarindos, se reúnen cada quince días  las socias del Banco Comunal Amor Y Felicidad.

En este lugar conocimos a la señora Josefa, tiene 50 años de edad, está divorciada pero de esa relación tienen  dos hijos los mismos que ya son mayores de edad pero aún viven en su casa. Ella es licenciada en enfermería y trabaja en el IESS (Instituto Ecuatoriano de Bienestar Social).

Además de trabajar de enfermera también se dedica al comercio, ella vende productos  Yanbal (productos de belleza, cosméticos, perfumería y accesorios para damas). Trabaja todos los días tanto en su  trabajo como en sus ventas, nos cuenta que una vez que ella sale de su trabajo se va a visitar a sus clientes y también  vende en su lugar de trabajo. Deja sus productos a crédito y cobra cada quince días. Lleva  4 años que se dedica a esta actividad y le ha ido  muy bien, nos dice que le encantan las ventas y además gana un dinero extra.

Este crédito es para comprar perfumes, cremas, cosméticos y bisutería.  Este es el quinto ciclo en el banco comunal y le gusta por las facilidades que brinda la institución.
 
Su sueño  seguir adelante en su trabajo y en su negocio.
texts.en:
In the sector known as Guabito in the city of Portoviejo, the members of the Communal Bank “Amor Y Felicidad” (Love and Happiness) meet every 15 days. Portoviejo, the capital of Manabí, has been known for many years as the city of “Los Reales Tamarindos”.

It is in this place that one can meet Sra. Josefa. She is 50 years old, divorced, and has two grown children who still live with her at home. Josefa is a licensed nurse and works for IESS (Ecuadorian Institute of Social Welfare).

In addition to her job as a nurse, Josefa also works as a merchant. She sells products made by Yanbal (beauty products, cosmetics, perfumes, and women’s accessories). Josefa works every day, both at her job and in her sales business. She says that as soon as she leaves for work, she visits with her customers and also sells products where she works as a nurse. Josefa offers her products on credit and collects payment every 15 days. She has been in business for four years and has done very well. Josefa says that she enjoys selling and earning extra money.

This loan will be used to buy perfumes, crèmes, cosmetics, and accessories. She is receiving her fifth loan from the Communal Bank and enjoys the services provided by Fundación ESPOIR. Her dream is to move forward in her job and in her business.

loans.use: to purchase perfumes, crèmes, cosmetics, and accessories.

loans.name: José Roque

texts.es:
En santo Domingo de los Tsáchilas en el cantón Santo Domingo encontramos a José, un hombre de 56 años quien se dedica al rencauche de zapatas de vehículos. José está separado de su esposa y vive con sus dos hijos. Su hija menor tiene quince años y está cursando la secundaria mientras que Jonathan un joven de 28 años con capacidades especiales no trabaja. José es el único que lleva el sustento al hogar, dice que no recibe ayuda económica de nadie. En su tiempo él comparte con sus dos hijos.

José nos cuenta que a pesar de que su jornada de trabajo es larga nada se le hace difícil porque le gusta lo que hace y por ello entrega a sus clientes un trabajo de calidad.

Hace muchos años José trabajaba como operario aprendiz, pero desde hace quince años se independizó y puso su propio taller de reparación. Hoy en día necesita renovar algunas de sus máquinas, lo cual facilitaría su trabajo y para ello contactó a Fernando quien es asesor de Fundación Alternativa para poder sacar un crédito y así mejorar su negocio.

El sueño de José es poder tener su casa propia, y en un futuro cercano su carro propio. Todo esto para ver a sus hijos gozar de una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
We find José in Santo Domingo de los Tsáchilas in the Santo Domingo canton.  He is 56 years old, and he repairs brake shoes.  José is separated from his wife, and he lives with his two children.  His youngest child is 15 years old, and she is in high school.  Jonathan, age 28, has special needs and does not work.  José is the only one who supports his household.  He says that he does not receive financial support from anyone.  He shares his time with his two children.

José tells us that in spite of his long work day, nothing is difficult for him because he likes what he does.  Therefore, he delivers quality work to his customers.

A long time ago José worked as an apprentice operator.  However, he became independent 15 years ago, and he established his own repair shop.

He now needs to refurbish some of his machines.  This will facilitate his work.  In order to do so he contacted Fundación Alternativa’s adviser to be able to get a loan and improve his business.

Jose’s dream is to be able to have his own house.  He also dreams of having his own car in the near future.  All of this is to see his children enjoy a better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy machinery for his business.

loans.name: Nakato

texts.en: Nakato  lives in  Uganda. She is married with four children, and all of them go to school. She doesn’t take care of additional family members. She owns a banana stall at the market. She works seven days a week. She has been in business for many years. She has requested a loan of UGX 40,0000 from MCDT SACCO to buy more bunches of bananas. Her aspirations and goals are to educate her children through university, and also to build rental rooms. Her major business challenges are transportation and seasonality. She lives in her own house, and her family has access to piped water and electricity. Her major expenses include school fees and food.

loans.use: To buy more bananas

loans.name: Alberta

texts.en:
Alberta is 54 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is widowed with three children. 

Alberta has a retail shop that sells canned goods, snacks & beverages. She has had this business for five years. She requested a loan for PHP 5,000 to buy canned goods, snacks & beverages.
 
Alberta is a new member of HSPFI.  In the future, Alberta hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, snacks & beverages

loans.name: Santo Domingo Group

texts.es:
L a señora Karla  yesenia es casada  con el señor  Aricel  y con quien  procreo dos hijos que a un están a su responsabilidad, el  grupo se llama santo domingo  y se integra de tres señoras.

      Ella  es ama de casa y es la primera vez que solicita un préstamo  en fundación realidad, y es para invertirlo en la compra de ingredientes para la elaboración de tacos en donde lleva practicando  tres meses  y le está resultando.

      Su inspiración por esta actividad comenzó  ya que  quiere apoyar a su esposo con los ingresos de la casa y tiene dos hijos que desean  darle lo más necesario.

       Lo que más desea es que con esta pequeña  actividad pueda ir incrementando más  sus ingresos para  solventar gastos pequeños de la casa.
  
     Las dos integrantes más que  conforman el grupo san la señora  Araley  quien invierte el préstamo en la compra de  ingredientes para la elaboración de  dulces de nuégado y por otro lado la señora Yolanda en la elaboración de tacos.
texts.en:
Karla Yesenia is married to Aricel, and they have 2 children for which they are responsible. This group is called "Santo Domingo", and it is made up of 3 women.

She is a housewife, and this is the first time that she has applied for a loan from Fundación Realidad.  The loan is needed to buy ingredients for making tacos.  She has been doing this work for 3 months, and it's going well.  Her inspiration for this business is her desire to support her husband by bringing in more family income. They want to provide their 2 children with the necessities.

What she most wants is to gradually increase her income, through her small business, in order to cover her household expenses.  The 2 other members of the group are Araley, who is using the loan to buy ingredients for making nuegados (fried yucca dumplings), and Yolanda, who is using it to make tacos.

loans.use: To buy ingredients for making tacos.

loans.name: Djumagul

texts.ru: Джумагуль  48 лет, вдова, воспитывает дочь – школьницу. Джумагуль начала свой бизнес в 1991 году, использовав свой стартовый капитал в сумме 5,000 сом (KGS)на покупку коровы.  На сегодняшний день, Джумагуль  зарабатывает около 7,000 сом (KGS) в месяц с продажи мясных и молочных продуктов.  Для дальнейшего развития своего бизнеса, Джумагуль запросила кредит в компании «Бай – Тушум и Партнеры»  в сумме 55,000 сом (KGS) на покупку скота.  Доходы от кредита Джумагуль планирует вложить в обучение ее дочери.
texts.en: Djumagul is 48 years old, widowed and is raising a teenage daughter. Djumagul started her business in 1991, using 5000 som (KGS) as starting capital to purchase her first cow. Currently, Djumagul makes 7000 som (KGS) a month from meat and dairy sales. To further expand her business and purchase more cattle, Djumagul is asking for a loan of 55,000 som (KGS) from the "Bai-Tushum and partners". Profits from this loan Djumagul is planning to spend on her daughter's education.

loans.use: to purchase cattle

loans.name: Jose Alfi

texts.es: José Alfi, tiene la edad 59 de años, está soltero y vive solo actualmente. El con el crédito va compra los insumos para la asistencia de tomate. El cuenta con la siembra del cultivo ya establecida y necesita hacerle unas pequeñas  mejoras o aplicaciones de abonos por lo cual necesita compra estos insumos y así tenerlo en las mejores condiciones de cosecha. El quiere obtener de su plantación el máximo de cosecha tanto en calidad como cantidad apta para la venta al mercado local. El quiere generar la mayor de las ganancias para salir adelante con el crédito y ganancias para mejorar su calidad económica cada día. Es el primer  préstamo que  recibido de FUDECOSUR. El  no había tenido antes otros préstamos en bancos estatales, pero FUDECOSUR le ha brindado el préstamo con mayores facilidades y la tasa de intereses mucho más baja.
texts.en:
José Alfi is 59 years old.  He is single and currently lives alone.  He will use his loan to buy supplies with which to care for his tomato plants.  His crops are already established and he needs to make some small improvements and apply some fertilizers.  For this reason, he needs to buy supplies and ensure his crops are in the best condition possible.  He would like to obtain the best harvest he can from his fields both in terms of quality and quantity so that he can sell his tomatoes in the local market.  He would like to make as much profit as possible so that he can move forward with his loan and improve his financial situation.

This is the first loan that José Alfi has received from FUDECOSUR.  He has not received previous loans from state banks but FUDECOSUR offered him this loan with better terms and a much lower interest rate.

loans.use: to buy supplies for his tomato plants

loans.name: Porfirio

texts.es:
Porfirio nació en la ciudad de Cusco (Perú), tiene 51 años de edad y es casado fruto de esta unión tiene dos hijos. Actualmente, Porfirio vive en la misma ciudad donde nació. Porfirio trabaja en construcción civil y tiene un negocio familiar que consiste en venta de productos de primera necesidad. Ya son dos años que se dedica a este negocio y le va muy bien gracias al empeño que pone en su trabajo. En esta oportunidad Porfirio requiere el préstamo para compra mercadería como por ejemplo arroz, azúcar y muchas cosas más. 

El socio es una persona responsable y trabajadora que por esas cualidades sus compañeras le invitaron a participar del banco comunal la “Chaska Ñawi” de la Asociación Arariwa.
texts.en:
Porfirio was born in the city of Cusco (in Peru) and is 51 years old. He is married and has two children. Today, Porfirio lives in the same town where he was born. Porfirio works in civil construction and has a family business that sells foodstuffs. It's been two years already that he's been working in this business, and it is going very well thanks to the effort he puts into his work. 

At this time, Porfirio is requesting the loan to purchase merchandise such as rice, sugar and much more. The member is a responsible and hard-working man, and it is for these qualities that his colleagues invited him to join the "Chaska Nawi" community bank of the Arariwa Association.

loans.use: to buy merchandise, for example rice, sugar, and much more.

loans.name: Medi Flavia

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “VIRGEN ESTRELLA DE OROPESA”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Cusco, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Medi Flavia; ella tiene 37 años de edad y es casada y tiene 2 hijos; La socia alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio de panadería, ella alquila un horno donde elabora diferentes tipos de panes y luego lo vende en la plaza de Oropesa, la socia trabaja desde las 8:00 a.m hasta las 5:00 p.m, por medio de este trabajo la socia saca adelante a sus hijos, la socia quiere ampliar el negocio de panadería. La socia solicita el préstamo para comprar insumos como harina, leña, manteca y aceite para preparar pan.

 La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
Sra. Medi Flavia is a member of the Communal Bank “Virgen Estrella de Oropesa” which is located in the District, Province, and Department of Cusco.

She is 37 years old, married, and has two children. Medi Flavia divides her time between her daily activities and her bakery business. She rents an oven for making different types of bread and then sells her products at the plaza in Oropesa. Medi Flavia works from 8am to 5pm. Through her work she is able to help her children move forward. Medi Flavia wants to expand her bakery, so she is requesting a loan to buy supplies such as flour, firewood, butter, and oil for preparing bread.

She is happy with the loan and promises to complete her payments.

loans.use: to buy flour, firewood, butter, and oil.

loans.name: Manuela

texts.es: Manuela, de 33 años, es una mujer muy amable, buena y sobre todo responsable. Es madre soltera de una hija de 13 años, vive en casa de su tía a quien ayuda en los gastos que se generan en el hogar. EL trabajo de Manuela consiste en la venta de lencería, tiene muchas amigas en el centro en donde labora, y es ahí en donde ella puede colocar las prendas exclusivas de diseños únicos y de calidad excelente, es por eso que sus clientes siempre le solicitan dicha mercadería. Lleva  ya más de tres años en este negocio y hasta el momento lo ha hecho sola. Tiene dos lugares en donde vende, en su casa y en el colegio en donde labora como docente. Lo que le gusta de su trabajo es que le da tiempo para poder realizar ambos trabajos, además está contenta por que le va bien, ya que genera buenas ganancias. Sin embargo hay clientes que demoran en pagarle. Anhela tener una tienda de venta de rooa. Este será el sexto crédito con la institución MFP, esta contenta con el grupo al que pertenece, espera poder seguir siendo la socia responsable y puntual como lo ha sido hasta ahora. Agradece mucho por la oportunidad que le dan de poder tener mayor capital de trabajo y espera seguir trabajando juntos por mucho más tiempo. Con el monto solicitado, comprará mercadería de lencería para así seguir ofreciendo lo mejor a sus fieles clientes.
texts.en: Manuela, 33, is a woman who is very friendly, kind, and above all, responsible. She a single mother with a 13 year-old daughter.  She lives in her aunt's house, and she helps her with the household expenses.  Manuela has a business selling lingerie.  She has a lot of friends in the center where she works, and she sells a lot of her garments there.  She has exclusive garments of unique designs and excellent quality, which is why her customers always seek out her merchandise.  She has been working in this business for more than 3 years, and up until now she has done it alone.  She has 2 places where she sells: in her house and in the school where she works as a teacher.  What she likes about her work is that it gives her the time to carry out both jobs.  Also, she is very pleased because it is going very well and the business is generating good earnings.  However, she has some customers who are late with their payments.  Her desire is to have her own clothing store.  This will be her 6th loan with MFP, and she is content with her communal bank.  She hopes to be able to continue being a responsible member who is punctual with her payments, as she has been up until now.  She is grateful for the opportunity that that is being provided to her to have more working capital in her business, and she hopes to continue to work with Microfinanzas Prisma for a long time.  With the sum requested, she will buy more lingerie merchandise, so that she can continue to offer the best to her loyal customers.

loans.use: to buy more lingerie to sell

loans.name: Vuqar

texts.en: Vuqar KH. is 39 years old and has been engaged in the cattle breeding business and milk sales. He is an IDP (internally displaced person). He is married and has two daughters. He has more than 10 years of experience in this field. His wife actively helps him run the business.  His monthly income is 250 AZN. Vuqar is successful because the product he sells is very popular and in the high demand. People in Azerbaijan use milk and meat in everyday cuisine. He would like to expand his business and for this purpose he has applied for a 1000 AZN loan. He will use the loan to purchase one milking cow and one calf.

loans.use: to purchase cattle.

loans.name: David

texts.en:
David is a 58-year-old farmer from the village Kumisi, East Georgia. He is married and lives with his family: wife Evgenia, 2 sons (28 and 22 years old), daughter-in-law and 2 grandchildren.

The main source of the income for the family is agriculture. They own 4 milk cows and 8 calves. The family sells milk, yogurt and cheese in Tbilisi (the capital city of Georgia). The family also sells besom which they make. the total average monthly family income is 1000 Laris.

David requested credit to build a house roof. The family has constructed a new house which needs a roof. When it is finished, David’s elder son (married) will move into it with his family. They will have more space and better living conditions for the children and the whole family.

loans.use: to build a roof
